review_body: If I could give 0 stars, I would. Staff completely unhelpful. Booked this room as the hotel boasts having air conditioning in all rooms. Got a room that is over 85 degrees inside for me, my husband and 2 kids (one who is asthmatic). The temperature outside is over 95 degrees so opening a window is not an option. Told the staff the issue upon check in at 3:30 and said they would send someone. Got back to room at 11:30 pm, no one came by and when we went back down, only option was to wait till the next day to see if anything became available but no promises could be made in respect. We had to beg for a fan which they finally gave us begrudgingly and did nothing to cool it down and was extremely loud! While I am not French, I do understand quite a bit and had to hear them ridicule me as I walked away for being American! Ridiculous and completely blown away that a hotel treats guests this way.

There were many restaurants and shops nearby.

review_body: We booked the hotel for the last night of our France vacation. We arrived early from the champagne region and this is what went on:10am - we were told that the hotel was overbooked and that they had rooms available, offered a room at a different hotel. Mind you, we were early there so they could’ve given un any room. We declined, spoke to the manager Marian, she said they would give us a room but we would have to wait4pm, came back to the hotel, checked in and they put us in a room on the 7th floor (alleged upgrade) you could see vacuums, water extractors, construction materias everywhere and not a single soul on site.9:30pm my husband took a shower and there was an overflow, water everywhere (we realized that all the equipment we had seen earlier was due to something similar) 9:30-10p back and forth with front desk “we can have someone check it out in the morning” “we are going to open another room so you can shower there for 30min-1hr” “you can’t use that other room due to sanitary issues” just like we suspected, our room was part of the problem. 10:15pm after bickering, once again they offered another hotel and at this time we had no choice. At this time, there were other guests trying to check in but no rooms were available. Rude taxi driver and we got to the other hotel and checked in past 10:45pm. I was able to take a shower there. To sum this up, this hotel is a scam, they have no respect, they exposed my family to God knows what in a dirty, sewer water infested room and floor and treated us like garbage. Accor hotels, don’t bother apologizing here and twisting my story around, there is no way you can make this up to me because I am never ever booking a room with you. Refund me for my stay. Please I beg of you, don’t book it, it’s a fraud. See photos

review_body: Me and my SO stayed here for 4 nights. It’s a great atmosphere, modern and young. The only negatives would be room having no air conditioning, which in the colder seasons can be remedied with opening the window- and the extra fees that totaled to about 180 euro’s.The food was astounding. The Halle burger is possibly the best burger I’ve ever had, and on multiple occasions my SO got the side of mash potatoes. I believe every night they have a dj come in to do some live mixing over their stereo (which in my opinion adds to the atmosphere.) We saw men in business meetings, families old and young, and couples like us- they can take care of everyone.The staff was good too- I would come back to this hotel just for the bartender Abdool, he remembered our orders, and took care of anything we needed with a smile. TLDR: Clean, nice atmosphere, good staff, good food. I wish I knew what kind of chips they had at the bar so I can get a bag or two.

review_body: The room was small (whey you come with three suitcases and two carry on as you are traveling from North America to ski resort and you are doing a stop over in Paris), but we didn't mind it at all as we spent the least time in the hotel. The beds are very comfy and we loved that the spare sofa bad is separated in two separate single beds - great for kids to sleep and not argue and those were a real beds too. Room was maintained very clean and staff is friendly. We were lucky that our room was ready when we arrived around 12, and at checkout we could leave our baggage in secured lockers. Really nice feature that they have, have not seen it in other hotels. Location is great, very close to train, metro or bus and easy to get to every major attraction. There is a supermarket within 3 min walk and a huge shopping center within 5 min walk.

review_body: After 3 weeks travelling Europe this is my first review with anything negative to say. The hotel is in a great location and the room we had was a good size for 4 of us and very clean. Bathroom was great. Loved the shower. Negatives Why disposable cups for coffee? If you provide an espresso machine you can supply proper cups Gym was closed which was disappointing But the biggest problem was the aircon. With 4 of us in a small room we woke up sweating the first night. Was stifling. Adjusted the second night and same result. Spoke to reception who advised my husband the air conditioning doesn’t work during winter. Why? You still need fresh air and should be able to control the temperature in your room. Beds were great but no one had a good nights sleep as it was hot and stuffy

review_body: Booked the hotel for two nights without breakfast. On second night, while requesting the front desk to assist in booking a taxi for the next morning, I casually asked if breakfast was actually included in my hotel booking. To my surprise I was told breakfast was included, even though I asked her to check again. Thinking that since breakfast was already included (and we had already missed the first breakfast), my family proceeded to consume the breakfast the next morning. I used the fast checkout service. Imagine my surprise to find that in the subsequent bill sent to me by email, I was charged for 2 sets of breakfast even though 1) we were told the booking had included breakfast 2) we had only consume one.I had written to the email address: H5060@accor.com to dispute the charges, but I had not received any response after 2 weeks.

review_body: I, together with my entire family, have had the worst experience ever at NOVOTEL PARIS CENTRE GARE MONTPARNASSE.1) FRONT DESK MANAGER WAS EXTREMELY RUDE, His name is Fabrice, in fact he was extremely insolent, I question how Accor HR did their work on him before engaging his service.2) I had called the front desk to ask about the sofa bed, Fabrice just cut short the line and said "Yes, a staff will be there" without listening much to the issue and hung up the phone.3) Upon Checking out, Fabrice insinuated that my wife and I were trying to short change the hotel for 2 beers. He even threw the invoice across to me over the small table which he could have just passed it to me by hand.4) An additional note: At Check out, he asked for my room card, and I told him I had left it on the table in the room. He told me to go get it. I have NEVER ONCE been asked to retrieve a room card. I am an ACCOR GOLD and my Business partner holds a Platinum Level, and I checked with him and he said leaving room cards are NEVER an issue.5) His attitude is UNBECOMING of a representative staff of ACCOR and for this, I expect actions to be taken and I want an update, even from C level personnels.6) House Keeping Staff - Pretends to act like they don't understand or speak english. Trust me, they all do. I requested for an additional towel, and he said to me" I don't speak english" in ENGLISH.Should anyone wish to stay at this location, please do not spoil the potential ACCOR experience by getting served by Fabrice, look for Karima who is and was VERY ATTENTIVE.ONCE AGAIN, if there are other options for travellers to stay at other locations, please do so, and avoid this location due to bad front desk staff and house keeping staff.

review_body: This is the third time to this Novotel in Paris , I love the location, the service , the clean rooms and the ambience at the hotel .This time it was better that usual.I have my flights 7:30 pm on today Sunday .I need to have a late check out . I asked the desk person to extend my check out and I was willing to pay more to star in the room until 4 pm.The front desk agent told me that in Sundays they have two late check outs one at 3 pm and other at 5 pm . I couldn’t believe it!!I was so please and Happy , I have the chance to walk the city one more time with my family, I have two rooms and enjoy the last few our in Paris !I also noticed the breakfast crew working so hard to accommodate everyone in the morning , we can make our own eggs any way we wish , I Love the family ambience of this hotel , they have a nice bar opens at night and a DJ that give a different touch to the hotel !You really feel home at the Novotel !I will be back again!Thank you for make me feel at home !!

review_body: All in all a nice hotel. Everywhere was immaculately clean and staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was perfect and the children particularly loved making their own eggs then amusing themselves with the photo booth (excellent touch!). The bar/lobby on an evening had a lovely feel and we sat there and nursed our weary feet from the days walking, with some nice drinks and tunes played by the DJ! Location is about 35 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower but a 5 minute walk to the Metro, we did both and had no issues. A nice safe feeling area. There are only a few niggles, nothing too important, but for me travelling with children that I would consider. First is that the room size was okay...if we'd been there for more than 3 nights it would probably have become an issue as we had to squeeze past each other (our children are 10 and 8) and once the childrens beds were made, there was minimal space. The water in the shower really was not hot (and I like a hot shower)...luke warm we all agreed. And lastly is the lack of mattress protector which for me personally I find a little unhygienic in a hotel, but maybe that is just my thoughts! However all in all a good hotel which I would recommend for a stay in Paris.

review_body: Stayed here, family of four (2 older teenagers) for 3 nights, two rooms neighbouring.Very good location, an easy 10 minute stroll from Pasteur metro, pleasant area. Our rooms were very comfortable, great walk in shower, memory foam mattress and lots of good quality pillows. Our rooms were sparkly clean on arrival and each day on return from our explorations of Paris. We considered the buffet breakfast to be delicious although more than we might usually pay. Each morning the queues for breakfast snaked through the small reception/bar area so on our last morning we got up early(7.45) and avoided this!
hotelName:

Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for five nights during the Ryder Cup. The hotel location is good, right near Gare Montparnasse, and if you're up to it you can walk to the Eiffel Tower. (This is not a stroll, though. It's a serious walk.) The Metro is also not far away, so you have a number of transportation options.In general, the hotel was fine. The room was adequate in size though not spacious. We were here during a very busy event, and perhaps some of the strain showed. The reception area seemed poorly designed, particularly when more than a couple of people needed attention (checking in, checking out, checking on something). The staff, while friendly enough and eager to help (our check-in clerk was excellent), didn't seem to know how to manage a crowd that exceeded the number of individual stations. Other little things suggested that maybe the hotel was not at its finest during our stay. For example, our key cards would not work on our second day. When we went to the desk to have them recharged, we were soon joined by a long queue of people with the same issue. And our next-to-last day there, our room was not serviced at all. It's not as if they skipped the room entirely. The window was opened, so someone had clearly been in the room, but not a bit of housekeeping had been done. This isn't a crisis--we can sleep in an unmade bed and reuse towels--but it's still not what one expects from a good hotel.The breakfast was plentiful--basically an English breakfast with some other options. I don't know if that is their usual breakfast or was put on specially for the large number of visitors from the UK. In any event, there was enough of it for a tasty, hearty start to the morning. So while there are no major things to complain about, the kinds of little things mentioned here add up to a review of "average"--better than some we have stayed at in Paris, not as nice as others.

review_body: Loved this hotel. Stayed here four nights with my husband. Room was spacious and clean. Staff very friendly. Wonderful breakfast and amenities. We arrived very early from the US, and though our room was not ready, they allowed us to “freshen up” in the restroom and store our luggage. Would stay here again.

review_body: 4-Star hotel with helpful staff, great breakfast and good rooms. We had a pair of adjoining superior rooms which was perfect for our family of 4 - with minibar included in the price. Each room has a queen plus a convertible couch so each could sleep 3 at a pinch, better if the 3rd person is small though!If you haven’t thought of Montparnasse it’s actually not a bad place to stay...walk to the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, Montparnasse Tower and the Catacombs; museum of modern art plus lots of theatres, cinemas, shops and of course food - cafes and bakeries everywhere. Just opposite the hotel is a great little cafe that became our local - you need to wait for a table at lunchtime but it’s worth it. The hotel restaurant - Halle Quatre - is pretty good too and the shopping in the area surrounding the Montparnasse Tower is worth the 15-minute walk.

review_body: As 4* hotels go I’ve stayed in better, cleanliness was good, whilst I appreciate that tea and coffe is left free complimentary of the hotel, our room only had herbal tea and when I asked house keeping for ordinary tea they just handed me more herbal tea!We had breakfast included in our stay, the weather was beautiful and we sat outside to eat, the pastries were good, the fruit was mediocre at best and I would not recommend the cooked breakfast at all, during breakfast a man was walking around blowing up balloons and making all sorts of balloon creatures, as it was the school holidays I thought this was a nice touch for families with young children.Staff spoke very little English so as my husband and I only ge5 away with a little high school french, the language barrier was difficult at times although when queuing for breakfast I overheard the member staff speak in at least 5 different languages including English, very impressed!Not sure I would stay at this hotel again

review_body: The hotel staff was very good and helpful, the bartenders was great as well, they were very friendly and remembered me. Not much to see in the area but we really didn't hang out in the area so much so that was okay.

review_body: We stayed here for one night on our way to Eurocamp in Brittany. The hotel is approx 10 minute walk from Montparnasse train station and there’s a metro station approx 5 minute walk away which made it easy for us to visit the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is modern and clean. I’d say it’s a 4 star hotel and I would have given it 4 stars however when we returned to our room in the evening after a day of sightseeing I went to make myself a cup of tea. To my surprise the cups provided in the bedroom were tiny paper cups.(photo provided) I called reception to ask for a proper cup and was passed through to the bar. I was told by a very rude man that he was busy serving food & drink & I could come to the bar to get one myself. I told the man I wouldn’t be going down to the bar at 10.30 at night as I had children in the room with me. Reluctantly he sent someone up with 2 cups. This is not the standard I expect from Novotel.

review_body: Check in was easy, we requested 3 rooms to be on the same level which they accommodated for us. Rooms were clean. Breakfast was very good, a lot of selection. Around the corner to train station. Good location in terms of restaurants being around 5-10 mins walk. Very happy that we chose this hotel.
hotelName:
0    Novotel Paris Centre Gare Montparnasse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What an amazing suite for two travel-weary adults and their two lively offspring! The boys were delighted with the partition which meant we all got some much needed space from each other. Walking distance to Eiffel Tower and some lovely little restaurants off the tourist track. Amazing breakfast- so much choice! Pancakes, waffles, pastries, bacon, eggs, cereal, fruit, scones plus lovely deli meats and cheeses. A truly terrific hotel and my children's favourite of the 4 hotels we stayed in during our French holiday.
hotelName:
0    Novotel Paris Centre Gare Montparnasse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked an executive room for a family of 3 and although the room met our expectations, the service and responsiveness of the staff dissapointed us and made this an overall average experience. Breakfast was ok in terms of quality and choices although very crowded throughout our stay.
hotelName:
0    Novotel Paris Centre Gare Montparnasse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really loved our stay at Les3Chambers, even through the Paris heat wave. The room was delightfully decorated, clean, large and spacious with an updated en-suite bathroom. Bed was extremely comfortable. We had a fan that managed to keep us cool enough at night to get a good sleep. Breakfast is awesome with fresh French pastries, baguette, home made jams, yogurt, fruit salad, hand pressed fruit juice and coffee. The location is perfect - Cadet Metro station within metres, plenty of eating options, bars and market stores around. Access to the building was secure and there was an elevator. The host was very welcoming, friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Loved the personalized tourist map that Laurent had prepared. Felt very much at home in this Parisian delight.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are very pleased to have discovered this gem in Paris and it has everything to recommend staying here. The rooms and house are decorated, maintained and cleaned to a very high standard. The location is perfect, walking distance to many of the must sees in Paris and also close to the metro and many great restaurants. Laurent is a very welcoming host and goes the extra step to make sure we had a pleasant stay not only in his home, but also Paris. He prepared a gorgeous breakfast each morning using high quality, homemade products, suggested the best walking routes to see some of the highlights of the area and recommended some excellent restaurants to eat in. We had a wonderful visit.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a treat we have enjoyed, Eurostar to Paris and a 2 night stay in a beautiful Parisian apartment. Les3chambres is ideally situated, just 11 minutes from Gare du Nord. Our room was stylish, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was ample with homemade cakes & jams. A perfect to stay if you want to immerse yourself in Parisian life - we loved it!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I recently spent a few days at Les 3 Chambers while on vacation in Europe. Les 3 Chambers was by far our favorite place that we stayed during our travels. This place is perfect if you are looking for a quiet and leisurely stay in Paris. The B&B is a great location in relation to public transit and there are plenty of nearby restaurants and bars to visit within walking distance as well. Laurent was a very gracious host and made us a very fresh breakfast every morning with homemade pastries, jams and fruits from his family’s orchards. The place is beautiful, clean and extremely comfortable. Would definitely recommend!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 days at Les3chambres and had a fantastic stay.The room and bathroom were very clean and nicely decorated.The breakfast was overwelming and Laurent is an excellent host.They even arranged a glutten free breakfast for my wife.We wil surely return!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at Les 3 Chambers, it’s a wonderful B&B! Laurent is a fantastic host and his apartment is very clean, comfortable and safe. You can tell he puts his heart and souls into making his guests feel welcome. He also gives great advice on local attractions and restaurants.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We couldn't have found a better place to stay in all of Paris. The location was very good: near to Gare du Nord, Metro. Laurent, the host, had charm and flair which was apparent in the décor - vintage and modern combined. The breakfasts were scrumptious with fresh home-made jams, pots of fruit with mint, great coffee and tea with beautiful classical music hardly audible in the background. What impressed most was the décor in our bedroom/en-suite and the ambience of the Nicolai Maharadjah diffuser. Bed and pillows was large and comfortable. Attention to the tiniest detail made this a very memorable stay.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We simply go back and enjoy ourselves again!  The B&B is a fantastic location with an exellent and warm host. We focused our selfves visiting Mont Martre and Les Marias. Thanks to the tips and trics from our host Laurent ;). By the way... don't forget the breakfast, sssssplendid
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I enjoyed four nights at Les3chambres and it was the perfect place for us. The apartment is very comfortable and beautifully appointed and Laurent is a thoughtful and attentive host. We particularly enjoyed the delicious breakfasts with homemade cakes, fresh pastries and fruit. The apartment was in a great location for exploring Paris - we loved walking though all the covered passages nearby with their quirky, arty shops and cafes. Thank you, Laurent, for helping to make our stay in Paris so enjoyable and memorable.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here about five or so years ago during a five day trip with my twin sister and we still talk about it all the time. What is it about the place that's so special, you ask? Well, I'll tell you:1) The rooms are so beautifully and eclectically decorated and are so comfortable and cozy you forget you're renting a room. Ok, actually that's not entirely true--I think les3chambres may be more comfortable than my own home. Also the bathrooms are wonderful--they even have towel warmers!2) The breakfasts. When we were there, Laurent painstakingly prepared us breakfast every morning. Perhaps the best coffee I've ever had--I still judge coffee against it. Definitely the best croissants and bread I've ever had--Laurent gets it fresh everyday. When we got back to the States we immediately went out for coffee and croissants because we missed them so much from Laurent and, well, were sorely disappointed in the quality. Maybe it's better this way--saves me from myself. Then Laurent prepares some special treat everyday. I believe we had an apricot tart one day and other yummy baked goods the others. The yogurt is amazing, the granola, the fresh fruit, the little details like the honey Laurent had gotten in Greece... It goes on.3) The location. You're far enough from the hustle and bustle to feel relaxed and like you're on vacation, but close enough to walk to most of the attractions you'd want to see. We loved this area.4) The hosts. Laurent and Bernard were wonderful hosts and constantly available to provide recommendations, call and make us dinner reservations, arrange a car to the airport etc. It felt more like we were with family than in a b&b. Laurent suggested things we never would have known about--for example, a fireworks show right out of the city that was timed to popular music and special for that time of year. It was incredible and we were so glad we went. He also suggested (and booked) nearby restaurants like Albion and Richer which were very local feeling and WONDERFUL. In sum: I was inspired to write this review sitting in a coffee shop in San Francisco... With a subpar coffee and croissant that made me miss les3chambres yet again five years later. It really was a perfect stay.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Les3chambres was simply amazing. We had incredibly clear instructions of how to get to and find this beautiful house and Laurent couldn’t have been more helpful. The rooms and decor were high quality, quirky and full of references and stories. As a host, Laurent was fully attentive, thoughtful but not imposing. The guide he gave us with maps and recommendations was like gold dust. We are in incredible restaurants which were off the beaten track and all very different. I had never been to Paris and staying at Les3chambres made it such a special experience. I’d recommend anyone to stay here. Thank you Laurent.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time in Paris and in Laurents apartment. Very nice place with a fantastic breakfast. Laurent is very welcoming and a fantastic host. I have stayed with him before and will certainly come back.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Les 3 Chambres is unique. Yummy French breakfasts lovingly prepared by the charming Laurent. Beautiful interiors and colours. Divine smelling Aesop hand wash and shower gel in the bathroom. A most luxurious 4 night stay in Paris. Superb restaurant recommendations and suggested walks in your Paris guide. Thank you Laurent. We didn’t want to leave. You have created a very special B&B. Victoria & Toby
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Laurent helped make our first trip to Paris a wonderful experience. I cannot say enough about how pleasant our stay was. The breakfast is truly a pleasure. Would definitely stay again when in Paris. The room was beautiful and Laurent goes out of his way to help his guests.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a long weekend with Laurent in Paris over the Valentine’s Day weekend. From the moment of our arrival Laurent was extremely welcoming and couldn’t have been any more attentive. Amazing apartment in the heart of the city with a delicious, freshly hand made breakfast every morning. Room was spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated. Very highly recommended!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our host was really welcoming and knowledgeable about the area, giving us some really useful information about places to visit and eat out. Les 3 chambres is well located within easy walking distance of all the major tourist attractions. The property itself was beautiful, decorated in a distinctive style and the breakfast was not only delicious but clearly a labour of love. The room itself showed real thought about what guests need; the bed was extremely comfortable, the shower was easy to operate and excellent. Highly recommended - would definitely come back!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first trip to Paris, and staying at Les3chambres made the experience even more special. The Apartment was a beautiful and comfortable space full of lovely Parisian treasures. Breakfast was an experience not just a meal, fresh fruits, breads and pastries, served daily with joy and pride by our host Laurent . We were provided a map of the city with a list of Laurent's restaurants suggestions along with places to visit beyond the normal tourist spots and were never disappointed by his suggestions. We fell in love with Paris and Les3chambres !
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Laurent’s apartment for a long weekend in January as part of my Birthday celebrations. Les3Chambres had been recommended to us by close friends so we knew what to expect. The apartment is on the 3rd floor and when you step through the large security door into Laurent’s home you know you’ve chosen the right place to stay. Our room was stylishly decorated, with a very comfortable bed, beautiful bed linen and a clean and modern en suite. There is a safe in the room and a coffee machine. In the morning guests gather for breakfast in the dining room/library. This room is so welcoming and Laurent lays the breakfast table beautifully, Flowers, napkins, pretty lights etc add to the ambiance of the room. We enjoyed meeting the other guests in the mornings and chatting about places to go or restaurants we had visited whilst enjoying fruit, yogurt, homemade preserves with croissants and other lovely breakfast selections. Laurent was always very helpful and really cares that you are having a good time in Paris whilst advising you how to stay safe. We enjoyed his walks on the map and also his restaurant recommendations. Thank You for a wonderful stay and we hope to return again in the future. Sue & Wesley
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hidden gem in Paris has the service and discretion of a boutique hotel, and yet you are warmly welcomed in a spacious Parisian home by delightful hosts. Decor and atmosphere are magnificent and whimsical at once, with masterly displayed books, family heirlooms and curiosities. All rooms have Cole & Sons wallpapers (secure that Fornasetti room with view on a secret courtyard while you can), personal bathrooms and everything is super clean and well kept. The location is excellent to grab a bite round the corner or reach by foot all of Paris’ hot spots, from Pigalle and Monmartre to the Louvre through an endless network of covered galleries. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from our third visit to Les3Chambres, having visited previously in 2016 and 2014. Laurent is helpful with making dinner reservations and always has excellent suggestions for great nontourisry local restaurants. His map was updated since our last visit and now includes a Marais walk.The breakfasts never disappoint with excellent bakery and coffee and it’s great to explore the various artwork and collections in the torquoise library lounge. The in room Nespresso maker and tea kettle are appreciated and the pods and teabags are refreshed daily. We’ll be sure to return for the comfortable bed with high quality bedding.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The BNB is impressive to say the least - lavishly decorated, exquisitely warm and inviting. The host is very welcoming, and offers information and background on the apartment and the city. He does everything himself, and it shows - in a good way. The room itself was big, quiet and private. It has a coffee maker, water, a closet for your coats, a TV, a safe, private bathroom and toilet (with the most amazing hand soap and shampoo) and probably stuff I forget to list right now. The bed itself is just amazing. My very stressed out partner was able to have a GREAT night's sleep, and me too. I really need to know the brand of the bed and mattress. (Upon making this review, the host contacted me by e-mail in order to inform me of the brand and model.) Upon waking up, we were served with a great breakfast, including home-made jam, juice, croissants and coffee. Thanks to the host's friendliness, graciousness, and tips we were able to enjoy Paris even during a weekend that saw violent protests once more. The host had expert advice on which areas to avoid, and as a result we have not witnessed any violence or protests. This is definitely a property which we will revisit in the future. I already recommended it to one of my friends.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved every moment of our stay. The cleanliness, comfort and design of our room. The central location. A welcoming host that cares about your needs with genuine concern. The breakfast is superb with attention to detail in a beautiful displayed room of antiques and colour. Great ambiance. We will be back.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed at Laurent's beautiful home for a long weekend break. Everything about Les3Chambres made for a memorable time - from the wonderful ambiance to Laurent who is an amazing host who goes the extra mile to deliver exemplary customer service. A truly exceptional place and fully deserving of its rating. Ideally situated for easy access to all the sights with the breakfasts being a particular highlight.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent 5 wonderful nights at Les3chambres in early October 2018 and we could not have been happier. Upon our arrival we were greeted very warmly by the owner Laurent. Les3chambres is the apartment where Laurent lives and shares the three guest rooms as part of the B&B. We stayed in La2Chambre 2 which was beautiful, spacious and quiet. We were blown away each morning by Laurent's delicious traditional French breakfasts which include amazing baguettes and croissants fresh from the patisserie, fresh homemade baked cakes, homemade jams, fresh fruit, juice and coffee. Laurent pays attention to the little things in this B&B that make it stand above the rest such as his special map of Paris that highlights the various neighborhood, tourist stops and places to eat. We highly recommend Les3chambres and will certainly plan to stay here once again when we return to Paris.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my third stay in les3chambres (should I say more), and the only thing that changed was that every time I stayed in one of the three different rooms. All are of the same level of quality and amenities, they are just different in colours and size. French breakfast delicious as always with fresh products, like "les financiers" as my favourite this time. Many restaurants and things to do in the vicinity and from metro stop Cadet at a 2-minute walk you can reach the rest of Paris. Thanks again for a lovely stay Laurent!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at Les3Chambres B&B for 3 days and it was our favourite accommodation in Paris. The rooms were clean and comfortable, with nice touches like bottled water and Aesop shampoo and body wash. The details were thoughtful – We were provided with a map of the surrounding area with restaurant recommendations and walking guides. Les3Chambres is well within walking distance to major attractions and must-see neighbourhoods like Montmartre. The breakfast was a highlight too – From the fresh croissants to the homemade sweets. Laurent was a wonderful to chat with, and we can't wait to visit again soon!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Les3chambres was a perfect contribution to our short stay in Paris! We loved the creative and splendid interior and enjoyed the conversations with our kind host, the ravenous breakfast and the good beds. We'll recommend this B&B to all our friends!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying three nights at Laurent's Les3Chambres.Wonderful time in the beautiful surroundings of this lovely B&B. No detail is spared, from a delicious homemade breakfast, the beautifully decorated apartment, to any and all advice from a gracious host. The apartment is well situated within walking distance to all major attractions. We fell in love with Montmartre, which is only a 10 minute walk. Easy taxi ride from CDG, and within walking distance to CDG. Wish we had more time in beautiful Paris, but hopefully we will be back at Les3Chambres real soon. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We couldn't have dreamt of a better place to stay a night in Paris. Laurent's care and attention comes out in every single aspect of the B&B, from the home-made jam at breakfast to the delicately perfumed luxury hand-gel. The room is incredibly well decorated, quiet and comfortable. The flat is very well-located, only a short walk away from Gare du Nord. I strongly recommend staying in Les3chambres.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Les3chambres is a beautiful, immaculate. comfortable B&B in the 9th arrondissement of Paris. It's location makes it very easy to get to all the top tourist sights, plus Laurent's map of special Paris walks, which highlights museums, restaurants and coffee houses along that walk, is an invaluable resource. You'll be grateful to go on those walks after the fabulous breakfast Laurent prepares. Laurent is the most wonderful, gracious host one could hope for. We are already planning our trip back to stay at les3chambres. We have found our Parisian home.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Laurent is a wonderful host with a beautiful apartment. The rooms were immaculate and comfortable. And then there's his delicious breakfast! We had a great experience here as a couple. He also provided his own special made map with some of his favorite places.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 5 days at the end of our 15-day vacation in France at Les3chambres and it was such a wonderful treat! Laurent’s apartment is an elegant, welcoming retreat and he is a gracious and thoughtful host. We stayed in Chambre #1 and had plenty of room (especially by Paris standards!) Bed was comfortable, bathroom was luxurious, and breakfasts were delicious, with fresh croissants, baguettes, homemade jams, a special cake every day, fresh fruit, yogurt and homemade granola, and fresh-squeezed juice. Laurent made sure we were introduced to the other guests at breakfast and was always available to answer questions or give suggestions for where to go and what to see. He even provides a customized map that shows 3 great walks you can do from the apartment, his favorite restaurants, cafes, and bakeries, and other attractions. We particularly liked the “covered walkways” walk. One last luxury in Paris-an elevator! I had unexpected knee trouble during our visit and it was helpful to be able to use the elevator up and down the three flights of stairs! We’d definitely recommend Les3chambres if you’re in Paris. Merci, Laurent!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Les 3 Chambres is an absolutely wonderful family home with the most helpful host we could possible have asked for, Laurent.The B&B is well situated for all the main sights of Paris and only 15 minutes from Gare du Nord. The post office building is on a quiet street and we had no problem finding it with Laurent's instructions. The apartment itself is breathtaking pretty and very well decorated. Laurent took great pride in showing us around his home and our room, number two. The large bed was very comfortable and was dressed with pristine white linens both nights of our stay. There was a great selection of Damman teas and the room was full of really thoughtful touches. The en-suite was immaculate and equipped with a great rainforest shower and hand selected toiletries.Laurent clearly enjoys his work and was more than happy to give us tips and off the beaten path recommendations for us to enjoy over the course of the weekend. He had even produced his own map with a couple of great walking tours.Breakfast at Laurent's was an amazing hand made French breakfast, with croissants, fresh bread, fruit salad, home made granola, home made cakes and all the trimmings; we couldn't have asked for better. The freshly brewed coffee in the morning was a treat.It was all of the little touches that made our stay an absolute pleasure and we will be sure to stay here again next time we come to Paris. Merci Laurent!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love at first sight is how you would describe our first visit to Laurent’s beautiful flat in Paris. So a return visit was a must when we decided to come back to France. We have traveled a lot in the last four years but we have yet to find a more charming and knowledgeable host, not to mention his excellent cooking skills. The flat is a testimony to his great taste and all three rooms offer a unique feel for the city. We chose the second for the view of the street - full of city’s sights and sounds (which disappear with the closing of your window!). Laurent’s breakfast is legendary as is his knowledge of the city so be sure to work with him on your itinerary and dining choices. When you leave your heart is heavy and you wish you had more time to stay - a true testament to to Les3chambres.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found Laurent warm, friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. He made my nephew and l most welcome in his beautiful home. Providing us with a sumptuous breakfast, maps to get around, good suggestions on where to eat and what to see and do.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As an owner of a bed and breakfast in Maui, I can wholeheartedly say that Les 3 Chambres is one of the most beautiful and welcoming properties I've ever had the pleasure of staying at. Laurent has created an oasis of luxury and exceptional hospitality in the heart of Paris. He is an incredible host who has thought of everything guests would want and need and he is a lovely gentleman. Read others' reviews about the delicious home-made breakfasts and gorgeous decor. They're all true. The best review I can possibly give to Laurent and Les 3 Chambres is this - don't stay anywhere else in Paris. This is an experience you don't want to miss and one that you will remember for a lifetime. Thank you again, Laurent. I look forward to my next stay.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second stay at Laurent’s bed and breakfast and a next one, number 3 is already booked for November... do I need to say more? Everything was just perfect again, and thanks for the fan in our room, without even asking for it, to deal with the hot weather outside! I will forward the compliments on het waffles to my mom! ;-)
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can wholeheartedly recommend a stay at Les 3 Chambers with Laurent. The apartment is beautifully decorated and our bedroom was sumptuous. Beautiful linens and the bed was incredibly comfortable. Laurent is so thoughtful and provided us with a map of walks around Paris that he had created which was brilliant, we took the covered passages of Paris walk - we probably would never have found them without the map. Breakfast is served in the gorgeous dining room and is a real feast - freshly brewed coffee, croissants and baguettes from the local bakery, home made jams made with fruits from Laurent’s grandmother’s garden, and fresh baked apricot cake. The location of the apartment was perfect - within 20-30 mins you can walk to Montmatre, Marais or down to the Seine. I hope if you chose to stay at Les 3 Chambres you enjoy it as much as we did, we hope to return soon and enjoy Laurent’s hospitality again.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great host, great food, great map / tourist advice, great room, great time! Thanks so much for all the help and advice, care and attention, warm and friendly welocome into your home and BnB we had the best time we could have hoped for!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For my husband and me, every moment of our 6 days at Les3chambres was just perfect. Our room: elegant, most comfortable and extremely functional. Breakfast: scrumptious, finest ingredients, presented with finesse. Location: charming district, quiet street, close to metro and great restaurants for dinner, an easy walk through covered passages to the Louvre. Laurent, owner and host: charming, kind, responsive, helpful and decent.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and i chose Les3chambres because from the photos you could see that it was individual, original and light years away from a corporate hotel. What we found exceeded our expectations in every way ! The bedroom and bathroom were akin to a five star hotel but with the bonus of beautiful antiques and personal touches. The breakfasts were exceptional with home made cakes and jams and even homemade granola ! Laurent is a charming and generous host who gave us excellent recommendations for walking tours, restaurants and shops. I cannot praise this place enough. From now on it is our 'home' in Paris !
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Congrats, you've found it! If you are reading this, consider yourself lucky. Les3chambers is like a secret mini 5-star hotel that only a select few would know... and now you know too. Laurent is your host extraordinaire, private chef, and personal concierge to Paris. He custom built the entire floor of this 19th-century apartment to specifically be a B&B. It's small and cozy but has everything you need - as well as books, maps, and power adapters. The rooms are modern and fresh, the beds are comfy, and breakfast is expertly prepared by Laurent himself. It's a great quiet location between Gare du Nord and Montmartre. I'll let you in on another secret - he could easily charge a lot more for these rooms. Do not hesitate, book it!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We took a chance on places to stay when booking our visit to Paris and Les3chambres did not disappoint! Our host, Laurent, was most gracious, and our room was warm, cozy and complete with the best amenities, including usb charging station and plug in converter. In room coffee and tea and luxurious shower soap/shampoo complete with a hair dryer made us feel so pampered. We started our day with a delicious breakfast complete with fresh croissants, pastries, homemade jams, fruit, yogurt with granola, juice and coffee or tea. Laurent’s home is beautiful and we felt right at home. He was so helpful in answering our questions and provided us with a map of the city complete with suggestions for dining and places to see. We cannot say enough about our stay. It was exceptional!! If we could, we would give it 10 stars, but trip advisor only has up to 5. Our stay was too short, but this just means we will have to visit again and Les3chambres will be our place to stay!!!!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Due to an expansion of our stay here in Paris we stayed at both The Parister and Les3chambres during our Paris stay, so we got to have both the small hotel and the B&B experience during our visit. Staying at both gave us the opportunity to clearly see the advantages of staying in Laurent's home while enjoying Paris.DININGOnce you get to know the neighborhood you will find that there are very good food options of every type within just an easy walk. It is easy to use apps to find good food options that abound, but with Laurent you have the advantage of having first-hand knowledge of the restaurants, wait times and environment and specialties so that you can make an informed choice. We liked both of the restaurants that we tried from his recommendations (Richer and 52) with 52 having some unexpectedly delicious appetizers.Of course, the nice thing is that you start your day with Laurent's breakfast (so long as you don't have pressing plans that prevent dining from 8-9:30am as we did a few times). It is a beautiful and relaxing way to start the day, and gives you a chance to quiz Laurent on feedback on plans for the day as well as enjoying whatever fresh jams and baked goods he has prepared for the day. Also, if other guests are there for breakfast it makes for a nice opportunity to meet fellow travelers and glean knowledge from them on other opportunities to see and do in Paris and around the world.Laurent will guide you to the absolute best French places, as he is quite the Francophile, but if you want to venture to other cuisines we can highly recommend Muqam for Chinese a very short walk away, and also Le Papacionu for pizza. Make sure on any weekend night to make reservations in advance! Those are also handy on weekdays, but without reservations on weekends you may find yourself with very few options.TRANSPORTThe Cadet station is just around the corner, super simple point to hop the local train and get anywhere in Paris quickly. Gars Nord and Est are also an easy ten minute walk away, and those offer quick access to regional and international destinations. We were there for over a week so we bought a week pass and could easily hop on and off the trains with abandon. Of course walking around Paris is a joy, and Laurent's maps and counsel offer good options for how to explore on foot. Cycling, buses, Uber, taxis also abound. Once you get familiar Paris is very easy to get around and nothing seems very far away.THE ROOMParis is like many cities that are also major tourist destinations (New York City, Florence, etc) in that you can expect small rooms as the norm. The key is to maximize what you have to work with. Our room and bathroom may have been small, but everything we needed was there and the amenities are well thought out. A nice shower with good quality soaps and shampoos, provided USB outlets and a spare converter plug as well as a coffee maker, a small closet space for hanging clothes and big windows for fresh air or natural light. We just had to organize our luggage better and once we did we never missed the big space, we just loved the space we had!I am sure we will come to Paris again because we just love it, and if so staying with Laurent would be our first choice. So do yourself a favor and stay there, but don't book it when Jacque and I want to return!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were excited to arrive at Les3chambres because of the beautiful images we’d seen and the outstanding reviews we’d read. To add our own now is such a pleasure but where to start? Maybe the joy of experiencing Laurent’s beautiful home with its sumptuous furnishings, collection and interesting objets d’arts. Room 2 was perfectly quiet, the bed so soft and comfy, the decorations, linen and toiletries highest quality, like the tea and coffee served at the Parisien breakfast which includes beautifully prepared fruit, homemade granola, bread, croissants and each day, a homemade cake or tart and preserves. Over breakfast, Laurent’s friendly advice on where to go, where to eat and to thereby experience Paris like a local because the area is off the tourist track and residential, yet very central to the different parts of Paris by foot or metro if you prefer. To stay on the Left Bank again was a temptation I’m glad we resisted because now Les3chambres in the 9th feels a bit like home and next time there will be no choice to make. We’ll be back to discover more of this lovely area with your guidance. Merci Laurent. A bientot!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My fiancée and I spent this year’s Easter vacation at the les3chambres and had one of our best hotel experiences so far which means a lot, since we are both travelling and staying in hotels quite a lot for work. We also usually never write reviews on TripAdvisor but we were so amazed by Laurent’s wonderful place that we decided to do so this time. So here come the top 3 reasons why you should spend your next stay in Paris at the les3chambres:1) Most beautiful apartment and room we have stayed in so far – with an incredible amount of attention to detailAs soon as you enter Laurent’s apartment you will be overwhelmed by the incredibly tasteful interior of his entire flat. Every room possesses unique décor and so much attention to detail – I especially liked the very tasteful photographs in our room and the high-quality soap (brand Aesoap) in our room. At no point, we had the feeling of staying in a hotel or common B&B, it was rather like “coming home” after a long day of sightseeing in Paris. And by the way, the term “Bed&Breakfast” really falls short to describe Laurent’s place – les3chambres is so much more!2) You will feel like at home in ParisLes3chambres offers the perfect mix between privacy and interaction with an authentic Parisian host. We really enjoyed the breakfasts where Laurent would spend a lot of time helping us to plan our daily sightseeing route and giving tips on amazing restaurants, wine bars and special museum offers. And of course, his amazing breakfast needs to be mentioned here – again with so much attention to detail and high-quality ingredients. In a normal hotel you will never get someone who lets you in on the secret of the Parisian way of living and culture. 3) Ideal location for sightseeing and fine dining in ParisLaurent’s apartment is situated between the 9th and 10th ARR. which is really the ideal location in Paris: All sights can be reached within max. 30 minutes by foot and if you follow the little map Laurent prepared for all his guests you will discover a lot of hidden gems on the way. The area is also full of hip restaurants and authentic Parisian cafes and restaurants – and again, Laurent is very helpful in finding the perfect restaurant for you if you ask him.Summing up, we can absolutely recommend les3chambres and will definitely come back – hopefully sooner than later!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing and unique luxury bed and breakfast ideally located in Paris. Laurent the host is extremely friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful and the homemade breakfast out of this world. The apartment is exquisitely decorated. A home away from home and a true gem in Paris.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a find. This is a truly lovely place to stay - all the facilities of a boutique hotel but with the personality of staying in Laurent's lovely home. Others have commented on his lovely breakfast and home baking - which is fabulous. And his advice and guidance of where to go in Paris is very very welcome. We intend to travel to paris more frequently to explore in greater detail and shall be using Laurent's apartment as our base.When you book with Laurent he suggests you use Eelway if you want to travel in Paris luggage free. This is an excellent service. We left our bag with them at Gare du Nord and spent the day in Paris - to find our bag safely delivered to the apartment. Similarly on the return trip they collected our bag from the apartment and we met them at Gare du Nord. We even managed to change our meeting time via the chat facility during the course of the Sunday. Its not a cheap service (circa €30 each way) but it allowed us to spend two suitcase free days exploring Paris. We never took a taxi - using public transport all the way.Another great recommendation from Laurent
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed again with Laurent this weekend and have had a wonderful trip.Les3chambres is completely charming, welcoming and quietly the best. It knocks 5*hotels into cocked hat. Certainly the best place to stay in Paris. Thank you Laurent and until next time!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B oozes quality and charm, just 10 minutes from the Eurostar, and such an oasis from which you can begin to explore Paris. Your host, Laurent, engages in your stay: has a host of sites and walks and small and large restaurants, so planning your day is easy. The apartment is cosy, warm and friendly. Comfortable beds, care and attention makes you relax. And the day starts with the breakfast that you need: fresh home made jams, croissant's straight from the bakery, in a wonderful sitting room. An easy recommendation and an easier return visit.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a wonderful discovery! We were delighted with the warm welcome we received at les3chambres in beautiful surroundings. Every aspect of guest comfort has been addressed with amazing attention to detail......and the breakfast - wonderful! This place has a soothing atmosphere, a great place to relax after sightseeing, and those sights are all within easy reach. We will be back, thank you Laurent.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Laurent is a very nice, present and interesting host. His B&B is eclectic, clean, calm and cosy. You sleep like in heaven in the extremely comfortable bed. Laurent serves the super delicious breakfast in the beautiful turquoise room with classical back ground music. The highlights in my mornings where (besides the chat with Laurent and the other guests) freshly squeezed citrus juice, fruit salad with mint and home baked apple cake. It all makes you feel, like you are visiting a very thoughtful, hospitable friend with a unique taste and great skills in the kitchen. Les3chambres is as luxurious as the finest hotel, but much more charming.
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just 10 mins walk from the Eurostar, this boutique B&B is absolutely lovely. The hosts are charming and well travelled, the room/ bathroom was very clean, strong shower, great linen, comfy beds and good products (Aesop). The breakfast was delicious, super fresh, great coffee and the cake and jam made by Laurent from fruits picked from his family's country garden. We were in Paris on business but it made it feel more like a holiday. We were also given a great restaurant recommendation (Richer).
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing stay at Les3chambres - Laurent was a perfect host, supplying us with great information and being always friendly and helpful. The apartment is great, just as you can see on the images! So much style and taste, there's a lot to see in these rooms and you really feel welcome there just as you step trough the door. The breakfast is even better than expected, great products and so well prepared! The room was super clean & the bed was like a cloud to sleep in - all in all a perfect place to stay when in Paris, we willdefinitely come back!
hotelName:
1    Les3chambres
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: La Chambre Parisienne was elegant, beautifully decorated, clean and smelled lovely. Located in an old house in a silent and safe street, with good access to several stations and the hill of Monmartre and artisan street.The hosts Greg and Bernd were beyond hospitable and treated as like their own guests. Thanks to them, for a short we could experience a bit of careless Parisian life. We got completely spoiled by the best breakfasts, crepes, deserts and dinner with generour amount of wine. (By the way, food adjusted to match my almost vegetarian diet preferences) During this 2 night stay we exchanged conversations, received lots of Paris travel, gourmet advise, interesting insights about local culture and even a private piano performance by Bernd. After our check out Greg packed us tea and a large piece of his own made fruit cake for our return trip home through London.Actually there were so many other moments of kindness and generosity, but this review will get too long. So just go to Paris and experience it all by yourself at La Chambre Parisienne.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved everything about La Chambre Parisienne! The house was beautiful, the room was clean and had every amenity. The breakfast was outstanding every day and Gregory and Bernt were so gracious and helpful. The house is located in a good location - just 2 minutes from the metro. We would highly recommend!
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This a very special Bed and Breakfast in Monmartre with fab hosts and an awesome breakfast. Lots of home made treats. Room is wonderful. I will be coming back and want to thank you for a special place to stay while visiting beautiful Paris.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Berndt and Gregory were lovely hosts. They were very inviting and friendly. Their breakfast was wonderfully over the top and they helped ease the stress of us being in a new city/country for the first time. We would highly recommend them to anyone wanting a host who will chat with you and not just check you in and hand you a key. It was like staying with friends. Tres magnifique!
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at La Chambre Parisienne. The room spotless was perfectly appointed with a comfy bed and luxurious bedding. Location was fantastic within very easy reach of gare du nord and gare du est plus two minutes from the metro network. It was also within walking distance of the Montemartre district and we even walked from the main city centre. The owners are wonderful and welcomed us into their home, sitting with us over breakfast and in the evening after diner. On the first evening we ordered dinner and it was wonderful home cooked fair. with a flair Gregory is a wonderful cook and makes his own yoghurt and preserves to serve at breakfast too. We thoroughly recommend a stay here and if we visit Paris again will definitely return.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gregory & Bernd are the perfect hosts.Their flat is beautifully decorated and very conveniently located for transportation and restaurants. They gave us great recommendations for local restaurants, and Gregory even went out with us one morning to show us a wonderful shopping street. Our room was very comfy and no detail was overlooked. We thoroughly enjoyed the gourmet breakfast prepared every morning by Gregory, and especially the lively shared conversations. The best meal of our trip was by far dinner prepared by Gregory and shared over wine and memorable laughter. We arrived as welcome guests and left as friends. Looking forward to our next stay.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a fabulous stay! Gregory & Bernd are the perfect hosts, so hospitable and accommodating. A beautiful room with a very comfortable bed and the most delicious breakfast to start off your day. Thank you Gregory & Bernd for an unforgettable stay at your lovely B&B. You made our stay in Paris even more memorable and enjoyable.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gregory and Bernd's place is the ultimate experience you want from a place in Paris. Upon arriving, Greg was so hospitable and communicative. The room and bathroom are squeaky clean and the perfect size for two people with a gorgeous view of the courtyard. The bed is insanely comfortable and perfect for rest after a long trip. Their place is also within walking distance of two train stations which makes trips from the airport, around the city and to trains outside of Paris so convenient. Beyond all of the amenities, chatting and having breakfast with Gregory (that he prepared!!) will go down as one of my favorite memories of our trip to Paris. Greg and Bernd are fantastic hosts who go out of their way to make your experience in Paris and in their home truly the best.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hosts are friendly, and always helpful. This is a unique and quiet B&B: elegantly appointed with a sumptuous breakfast. The bedroom has a fine mattress and sumptuous bed linens. Cleanest bathroom.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is part of a lovely 2-Bedroom Parisian styled apartment, which we were free to enjoy. The hosts Greg and Bernd are just two awesome individuals that made our stay memorable. Greg paid great attention to details and truly enjoys being a host. They accommodated our early arrival and served us coffee, tea, cookies and cakes. The apartment and the room were beautifully decorated and great attention was given to ensure we have everything we needed (umbrellas, sun block, coffee machines, facial cleanser, etc). We will definitely be back!
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a very nice stay in Paris.It was an academic meeting, but it's near the subway station and convenient.Good breakfast and introduction at the nice restaurant.You can spend time to feel relax and happy.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at La Chambre Parisienne! The place was gorgeous and spacious which made us feel right at home. Breakfast was wonderful with homemade jellies , fresh fruit salad accompanied with homemade yogurt, fresh squeezed orange juice and baquettes. The room was spacious and comfortable! I find our stay way better than some of the fancy hotels we have booked in the past. We would definitely book there again next time we are in Paris.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 10 days at La Chambre Parisienne were delightful. First, the accommodations: Grégory and Bernd have a single room for guests in their tastefully furnished apartment on the edge of Montmartre. The double bed is very comfortable, the room has all the gadgets and amenities, and the modern shower is all you could want. Everything is fastidiously clean, and there were flowers in our room when we arrived! The room isn't large, but in the mornings while my wife was still sleeping I was able to use the living room to read and catch up on email without bothering her. WIFI went well. The room is so quiet you that just don’t hear the city sounds, at least not in February. It overlooks an inner courtyard. As American tourists who wanted to go all over Paris, we realized after a couple of days that our location just two blocks from the Barbes Rochechourt Metro station was ideal. From there we could easily get almost anywhere. Grégory and Bernd are ideal hosts and we greatly enjoyed our conversations with them. (Bernd speaks English (and German) fluently while Grégory does very well in English.) My wife especially enjoyed talking about cooking with Grégory, who has culinary training. They gave us excellent restaurant suggestions and Metro tips and didn’t seem annoyed with questions about Paris they must have been asked many times. From the beginning to the end they were attentive and accommodating, never intrusive. Unlike many B&B hosts, they only have one guest room and one set of guests at a time.Our breakfasts were remarkably good, with selections of breads (Grégory went out for croissants and baguettes every morning before breakfast), meats, cheeses, a bowl of fruit, and on some mornings eggs and crepes. It was really more than we generally have for breakfast, but it fortified us for our long days on our feet. We’d go back.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay here and enjoyed our stay in Paris. Really nice people, a beautiful flat, breakfast was amazing, comfy bed and very convenient for the Euro Star! We hope we can stay here again when we come back to Paris!
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great experience. Next time I’ll definitely come back to La Chambre Parisienne. Great location, excellent breakfast, clean, super nice hosts, easy communication, good suggestions. What else do you need?
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was tired of the small hotel rooms in Paris and found La Chambre Parisienne on the internet. Great location between Gare du Nord and Montmartre. The booking was made via their website and was very easy and straightforward - even the amendment that I had to make. Communication was great and I even received an email a few days before arrival with details of how to get there etc.We absolutely loved everything about the place, starting with the fabulous hosts, Gregory and Bernd. Nothing was too much trouble. They both have a great knowledge of Paris whether for sightseeing, dining, museums etc. We were even provided with a few Metro tickets to get around.The bedroom is very nice with an extremely comfortable bed and beautiful bedding. A coffee machine is in the room also. Other facilities include bath robes and slippers and quite a variety of toiletries in the en-suite.Guests are invited to use the lounge and it was a pleasant place to get to know Gregory and Bernd over a glass or two of delicious French wine.Breakfast was amazing. The variety of items was huge ranging from smoked salmon, a range of cheeses, cold meats, homemade jams and yogurt, fruit salad and of course a variety of breads. Fantastic.They also offer to prepare evening meals which we had one night. That was mind-boggling. For only 30 euros per person including wine! The food was superb and the setting sensational. Lovely crockery and cutlery etc.We spent 5 nights here and with the welcome that we received and the quality of everything , we were more than happy.Thank you Gregory and Bernd. We will definitely be back.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bernd and Gregory were lovely hosts and couldn't be any more welcoming. We asked for recommendations of where to eat and where to go, they were so helpful and booked a table for us for a lovely french restaurant. The breakfast was amazing as they gave you a good selection to choose from every morning. We couldn't have asked for a better stay. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfy. We would definitely recommend this B&B to anyone who is looking to stay in Paris.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All of the reviews are true, this place is amazing as are the hosts Gregory & Bernd. From the meet and greet at the train station to the wonderful conversations at breakfast, nothing is too much trouble. The offering is sumptuous - a beautiful room with every need catered for, homemade fruitcake & chocolate tart left for us to help ourselves, amazing breakfasts to set you up for the day ahead and, best of all, genuine hospitality. We have been thoroughly spoilt and do not want to go home tomorrow.Thank you Gregory & Bernd, you've made our stay in Paris extra special!
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ...stay in this fantastic b&b! Gregory and Bernd are the ultimate hosts. Every detail is taken care of. Gregory kindly met us at the train station on our arrival, then walked us to our station on our departure. Who else does this? Our bedroom was so comfortable and impeccably clean. The decor is beautiful, and the breakfasts are very, very good, complete with most enjoyable conversation. What a wonderful home to return to after our busy days of sightseeing.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gregory and Bernd were fabulous and looked after us so well, it was like staying with friends - we couldn't have asked for more. We wanted traditional Paris and found it here in abundance. The food was fantastic as was the company. The location was perfect as well - 10 minute walk from the train station, 5 minute walk to the metro and about 10 minutes as well to Sacré-Cœur. Again, everything was perfect and we very much look forward to going back again.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are just returning home from a wonderful 3 nights at Bernd and Gregory's beautiful parisienne home and we cannot recomend this place enough. From the courtyard to the apartment and the room we stayed in, it is simply stunning!. The room itself is a great size and the bed is soooo comfy. We were hoping for the personal feel of a b&b but what we got was so much more. What we looked forward to most was the mornings. Sat at the beautiful dinning table with the hosts sharing stories and eating the most delicious foods was a real treat and made our holiday even more special. Both hosts made it so enjoyable that we almost didn't want to go out into Paris! We have left feeling very very well looked after and like we have gained two very funny friends Thank you for everything and we will see you again! Ps: Did I mention truffled eggs... made by Gregory.. YOU HAVE TO TRY THEM
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying with Bernd and Greg is like visiting with old friends in the middle of Paris! Their flat is chic and homey. Their decorating is gorgeous! But what is even better, is sharing breakfast and conversation with them in their lovely dining room each morning. We so enjoyed our stay with them....I felt like we were leaving family behind when we left. Treat yourself ~ staying with them is pure joy!
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was absolutely perfect, so much better than I could expect! Gregory and Bernd are extremely friendly and welcomed us like it was our home. Great people! The place is a parisian apartment coming straight from the movies (so very beautiful!). Room was very, very clean, with a luxurious deco, big soft bed and fluffy covers. Breakfast was unbelievably great, with magnificent home made jams (so many flavours, I'm sure I put on some weight!). Shower is wonderful, with pouring hot water. I absolutely loved my stay!
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a great time in La Chambre Parisienne, and I can definitely say this is one the best B&Bs I've ever been to.- Grégory and Bernd were extremely welcoming and helpful, we really enjoyed the company.- The apartment is beautiful, very well organized - and superclean.- The guest room is great & cozy, we couldn't ask for more.- Finally, Greg's breakfast is something you would trade Paris cafes for. Make sure you have at least an hour every morning to enjoy.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the perfect accommodation for any couple/single visiting Paris. First things first Greg and Bernd are outstanding hosts - my girlfriend and I were made to feel welcome immediately. I really enjoyed their company over lengthy breakfasts in their beautiful dining room. They gave us lots of useful information about things to see and do. They even went as far as to call around restaurants for us on New Year's Eve and ultimately selected somewhere for us which was just perfect. We enjoyed a celebratory glass of champagne together on NYE before heading out to town. They literally could not have done more to enhance our visit to Paris.The apartment itself is beautiful in a typically Parisian way and reminds you of classic French films (high ceilings, parquet flooring, big windows). Our room was super comfortable and had everything you could ask for including a Nespresso machine. The main problem was trying to get out of bed in the mornings - we could have stayed in bed for the entirety of our 4 day stay - it was just so comfortable! The location is ideal too - situated less than 10 mins walk from Gare du Nord, on a quiet street, it enjoys easy access to the central attractions of Paris, as well as being very close to Montmartre. There are a number of Metro stations nearby but to be honest we were able to walk easily to pretty much everywhere. La Chambre Parisienne added so much value to our stay in Paris - thank you Greg and Bernd! Tom and Zoe
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love, love LOVED my stay at La Chambre Parisienne. The flat is less than 2 blocks to the metro, 3 blocks to Gare du Nord and an easy walk to Sacre Coeur. Gregory and Bernd have thought of everything for your stay in their home. The room is perfect with a comfy bed, a walk in closet and a private, modern en suite bathroom. The breakfast each morning is incredible, down to Gregory's homemade yogurt. They were so accommodating, allowing me to drop bags off early so I could tour the city freely. The morning I left I had to leave very early and they even made coffee and breakfast cake before I left for the train. Don't hesitate - book your stay in their home!
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Previous reviews told us all we needed to know about booking La Chambre Parisienne, so the first thank you must go to all those reviewers, otherwise we would not have just had one of the best stays, if not THE best stay, we have ever had while travelling, and we have had some good ones before. My wife Cheryl and I always prefer the B & B option when travelling rather than impersonal hotels, although this was even a different experience to the usual B & B, as you are simply sharing Bernd and Gregory's apartment with them as they too go about their daily lives. They just give you your own keys to come and go as you wish.Their elegant apartment is situated less than ten minutes walk from Gare du Nord so is very well-placed for anyone arriving on Eurostar, as we did. It is situated in the very charming 9th Arrondisement, about five or six minutes walk from the foot of Montmartre and Sacre Coeur. Metro station of Barbes (Lines 2 & 4) is three minutes walk away. What can we say about Bernd and Gregory!! Just two of the loveliest people we have ever come across, they made us feel at home in their home from the start, and after five nights we reluctantly had to say goodbye yesterday to two people who very quickly came to feel like very old friends. Whilst we saw a lot in Paris and explored some charming neighbourhoods etc. some of our best memories of our stay will simply be the time spent with the two guys and the conversations we all had, mostly over breakfast, which you all have together, or sometimes later in the evenings. We can only summarise by saying they are wonderful company and we began to miss them both greatly from the moment we went out of the door to come home.The quality of the accommodation has been well-documented by many other reviewers and it is as good as anything we have ever experienced.
