Fantastic bed (with good firm mattress and quality bedding), lovely little en-suite in the room and many nice touches in the room if required, plus plenty of sightseeing literature, maps, eating recommendations etc. to help you on your way.The above-mentioned breakfast chats took place over a wonderful breakfast every morning, which every day left us not really needing anything else until the evening! Hams, cheeses, baguettes, brioches, pastries, home made (by Gregory) jams and yoghurts, juices, teas, coffee, fruit bowl............you get the drift! Even made sure they got Cheryl some decaff coffee as soon as they realised she could not drink non-decaff. The communication from the time of booking was always good and nicely informal, and by the time we arrived at Gare du Nord, to be met by Gregory with a board bearing our names (he also insisted on pulling our suitcase to their apartment!), we almost felt as though we were arriving to stay with friends.If there is anything more I can add to what others have already stated then I'm afraid I can't think what it could be. What I CAN say is that we would not now consider staying anywhere else in Paris should we visit again, and would 100% recommend anyone else to do the same.Bernd and Gregory, thank you so much for a wonderful stay, that will live long in our hearts and memories.Richard and Cheryl (Les Gendarmes des Croissants!!)
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely amazing stay with Gregory and Bernt! 5 star! They have the bed and breakfast stay perfected! Breakfasts were out of this world, comfortable bed with high quality linens, special touches including personal tour of the area, travel tips and advice, and lovely accommodation! We have been traveling the world for a year and this was one of our favorite stays! We'll be back! Thanks so much!
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My adult daughter and I were traveling together for a 2 week adventure. She had booked Le Chambre Parisienne and we hit the jackpot ! Warm and welcoming hosts, 5 star accommodations , Egyptian linens on the super comfy bed, everything you could ever need !Bathrobes , slippers, sewing kit . Shower cap,First aide kit, Towel warmer ,shampoo , conditioner , shower gel. Nesspresso machine and three different coffees, beautiful pottery cups to drink it from ,water in a glass carafe . Get the picture ? And our hosts were so accommodating !Gave great directions and recommendations for their neighborhood. Gregory even walked us to the metro ,Le Galleries Layffatte and Bon Marche for a real Parisienne shopping experience.And BREAKFAST !Oh my!I could describe it but the picture says it all!
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am extremely fond of the French Chambre d'Hotes system but I never thought I could find one of the best ones in the heart of Paris. My previous experiences in this wonderful city had been terrible, when it comes to accomodation. The charm of the place is equal to the owners, Grégory and Bernd. Extra comfortable bed with two different pillows, lovely details like a small chocolate piece on your part of the bed each evening, absolute silence during the night. Everything is elegant, charming and lovely. Superlative cleanliness. One just wishes coming back. Being in the only room they rent makes you feel like you "share" the flat. I have left the breakfast for the end... absolutely gorgeous. And the guys are so kind they showed us around the quarter during our last morning in Paris. So... perfect.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment is as beautiful as on the photos. We had a great time with our hosts who cooked for us delicious dinner. I can recommend you this place. The location of the apartment is very good. Walking distance from Paris du Nord. Close to metro station that will take you to any touristic attractions in Paris.
hotelName:
2    La Chambre Parisienne
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the hotel with my wife an daughter for 3 nights and must emphasise how great the location was...within walking distance to all the major attractions in Paris. My check in experience was also very pleasant.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great property for this area in Paris. Take the Le Bus Direct line 2 if you're coming from CDG as it will drop you right in front. Great service and staff, our host Renata was very kind and accommodating.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am staying at the Hyatt Regency Etoile this week. As an Explorist Hyatt regular member (including using Hyatt credit card), I was given 4 awards to be used for club access. I thought my Paris stay would be comfortable with the club access but the hotel denied to accept the awards. At the time of check-in, I was asked to call Hyatt member line to get them to inform Hotel for the access. I thought it was a strange request but I made the international call anyway. Then after being called to give access, the hotel denied again stating they were fully booked. While I stayed for 5 days, I only asked for 2 days of access.I still don’t understand why Hyatt gives awards for club access If the hotels don’t actually honor them. It makes me question the alum of the Hyatt loyalty program. It was a disappointing experience and I wasted quite some time and effort in this process. Not what I want to do on my vacation. Other than that, the stay was fine.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were overbooked, staffs were unprofessional and lied on separate occasions (water leakage thus rooms had to close down, sister hotel is just 5minutes away which was not the case, assured that everything was taken care and well informed in the sister hotel but ended up we had to wait for another hour upon reaching and only managed to check-in and settle down at about 3am...)
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The USP of this Parisian behemoth has to be its views - on one side you will take in a sweep bookended by Montmartre, while on the other side you can have La Tour Eiffel (for a price). The rooms have everything - including a safe with condoms! - and, although tight, are actually relatively spacious by Paris standards. In particular I recommend the comfortable beds and the modern bathrooms. The only caveat about this place is that it is not cheap. But if you can afford it, you'll be happy with what you get.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful staff, perfect facilities and a good location provuded by Hyatt hotel saved our time and money to have a memorable visit of Paris. You could get valuable information about the hotel and city sightseeing from the kind staff at front desks.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was in a great location, easy walk to the Arc and various other areas of interest. Friendly staff, very well kept and clean. The workout area was larger than expected and had everything you would need. The rooms were clean and nice.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Id expect better from a Hyatt Regency but I guess this is Paris after all. This is like a no frills Hyatt with the worst food ever in their so called restaurant Mayo. And get this, I wanted room service the first night I was there. So I looked at the seriously over priced menu but didn't care. I ordered which is usually very tasty a Burger Charleois. So the room service arrived with a paper bag which inside was a burger in a box and a bunch of French fries in a bag. Are you kidding me. For $40! What ever happened to a cart set with a table cloth, a proper dish, accoutrements, etc. Not here are the No Frills Hyatt. Ok the room was great ( but small which is the norm ) very comfy bed, nicely appointed bathroom etc. But my biggest complaint was the lousy and restaurant. Oh and I opted for the Buffet at lunch. Either I was late, or something was up again with a very poorly appointed Buffet for 35E. Dried out chicken, Some fish thing that was mashed up like mashed potatoes, (that's it for the main courses) some limited selection of veggies (try broiled carrots and that's it) some cheese (very average selection) and a selection of some crappy desserts. Honestly what a rip off. I've never stayed at a Hyatt that has such bad food anywhere in my life. Get it together Hyatt.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent modern rooms with everything you would expect. The restaurant facility was also better than expected. My overall opinion of the Hyatt on this visit is one that will see me use this hotel again when I next come to Paris.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent customer service and people are so nice and friendly. The staff are very helpful during my stay at hyatt. The room is clean and organized. I would highly recommend this hotel for business or/and leisure trip in Paris.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location for my business trip - Super modern, clean, tidy hotel, with great Metro links, Good size room.Check-in was very easy - Glad that the AC in the room was working well - super hot outside, so really pleased to have a cool comfortable room.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At the front desk, unskilled workers must receive assistance from a more senior factor, checkinqout takes a lot of time. Also they do not speak the truth I asked to eat breakfast at the Mayo resturant on the ground floor because I did not find anything to eat in the lounge on the 31st floor because I do not eat meat and / or pork, and all I wanted was an omelette, I was told that the food was exactly the same as the Mayo restaurant on the ground floor.When I asked to take my bags myself, they insisted that the suitcases reach the room immediately and I have nothing to worry about. I had to wait more than half an hour for the suitcases, which made me late for a very important meeting I had.When I left the hotel, the reception desk should be with six positions when only two are manned. And again that same representative who does not know anything must ask her colleagues everything and delay the people who wait a long time, a time that is very expensive on the way to the airport.It was verey unpleasend vacation for me.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hard product is efficient, simple and good. Everything is there. The views are the absolute show stopper here, quite unique as Paris has almost no skyscrapers. The service is good, with attention to detail. However two small points that could be reviewed and worked on: the noise. We sadly had loud neighbours the se one night of our stay and we let the reception desk know. The person that came up could have dealt with this issue in a better way in my opinion. Also, the club lounge is a tiny bit disappointing as the spread/offer is quite limited, especially during the evening. If I come back I may just go for the regular, standard range of rooms. Apart from those two experiences, this is a solid experience and a convenient place.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Complete Lack of sensitivity and ownership in delays in check in.Despite committing a 3 pm check in time they cannot deliver the room even untill 5 pm.Absolutely no ownership or courtesy by the reception staff to improve the service. You are just asked to wait without any certainty and no mitigation acts by the reception staff. Worst Check In experience ever
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can this be a Paris hotel?! Touted for its outstanding location, this venue has all the charm of a outdated dorm room. Perhaps business patrons don’t mind the gray floors and empty gray walls. Perhaps the lack of drawers and the depressing IKEA furniture is to their liking. But I’ve been booked here by my cruise line, and I couldn’t be more disappointed. A view isn’t everything.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On the West part of Paris, just inside the Periferique and next to the conferencecenter and Bois de Boulogne, this large Hyatt. Everything is as you may expect, and it is definitely much better than nr 700 or so at Tripadvisor. Rooms are not really small, certainly not to Paris standards and my room was in excellent condition. View on the Eiffeltower, think I got lucky, nice bed, good shower, large tv, iron, everything you need. Free bottle of water every day to be picked up at the ground floor, bit strange, but ok.Had breakfast at the club lounge, so cannot comment on the general area, but assuming the choices are the same, it is good, not exceptional. Bar at the top floor is worthwhile checking out, if at all for the view.With the underground close by, definitely a reasonable option to stay.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, wel located and the amenities were superior to most hotel in Paris. And upon arrival the front desk staff were just incredible , making me feel super appreciative and welcome
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I usually stay at the Meridien Etoile across the street when I attend the Paris Air show. I decided to stay in the same area for logistics reasons as the Meridien was fully booked and opted for the Hyatt Regency Etoile instead. I was impressed as this is an excellent hotel with top notch amenities. Staff is always available and helpful. The only small drawback is the lack of dedicated hotel parking. One needs to park under the Palais des Congres. This is the same building complex and to get to the Hyatt lobby from the parking , a short 4mn stroll through the commercial gallery is required. Directions are very clear and properly posted
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are all recently remodeledSo they are extremely cleanOnly drawback is rooms are smallSome rooms have view of Eiffel TowerLobby is generousConcierge is greatGood recommendations for toursClose to metro station, 1 block and across street Will be staying here again for business and pleasureElevators are a little different but neverHad to wait longYou enter floor on a keypad in lobby and screen directs you to which elevator Starbucks available in lobbyWe did not use lobby resturant but may try on another visiting
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I were were booked at this hotel because we were traveling on a Viking River Cruise. It is very modern and don't think we would have chosen it if we were traveling by ourselves. There was a mix of business people, as well as tourists. We found the staff to be extremely kind and helpful. We had a bountiful breakfast buffet in the restaurant every morning. There was also a small cafe that served the most delicious croissants, muffins, sandwiches, coffee, etc. Our room was on a high floor. It was a nice size with king bed, large TV and 120/220 voltage outlets. It was also quiet and we didn't hear any noise from the hallway or from outside. The decor was black and white, which was not to my liking, but that's just my opinion. I wish there had been a mirror over the desk portion so I could have used it while my husband was in the bathroom or vice versa. The large window provided a beautiful view of the city. However, I was disappointed that the view did not include the Eiffel Tower. I would have thought that Viking would have had some clout in providing this. When I approached the Viking representative at the hotel, she said we needed to make that request upon reservation (which we were not aware of, as Viking made our plans). Upon inquiring at the front desk, they said the hotel was sold out of Eiffel Tower views, so we were out of luck. That was the only unfortunate thorn in our otherwise pleasant hotel stay.There was a metro station close by and some nice restaurants that we came upon by walking around. Menus were posted outside.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked our Paris trip for my wife's birthday and the hotel experience was great from the friendliness of staff to the complimentary drink in the sky bar! Also, the nearest Metro station is a few minutes from the hotel. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were this trip with family. Our plan was to see Normandie some days after the trip to Paris. Views at night from the hotel 34th floor bar are perfect. I would hope that sometime in the future we would have the opportunity to stay at this hotel again. We recommend using local tour guide to visit other locations such as the palace of Versailles’s. You can easily spend an afternoon simply viewing the Eiffel tower.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was undecided if I should rate this 3 or 4 stars. But 4 is for clean rooms (my biggest priority), view and if I could add a second rating it would be 3 stars for the hotel’s overall customer conceptHotel is located about 20-30 mins taxi ride (cost €17) from Paris Gare du Nord train station (Eurostar). Otherwise you could also take a bus #43 in front of the train station and alight at Général Koenig stop just outside of the hotel. The location of this hotel is about 10 mins walk to Arc du Triomph and 30 min walk to Eiffel Tower. Some good points:- Rooms are a lil bit on the small side and cramped but we managed ok with a sofa bed turned into kids bed. We had the room facing the Eiffel Tower, even though it cost more - the view is worth it especially during sunrise, sunset and when the tower lights up sparkling. - buffet breakfast at the lobby has a very good spread including gluten free options- we were greeted by a Chinese staff name Alice who assisted us in our check in process. She was delightful to meet as first timers in Paris and the hotel. She definitely set a good first impressions for us and I hope she gets noticed as I didn’t not managed to meet her and say goodbye when I checked out. - if you need snacks, there’s a supermarket adjacent mall which is very useful for us considering we had a 7yo and needed some snacks. Some improvements / oddities in this hotel which I still can’t grasp the concept til today:- this is not a ‘cheap’ hotel by any means but yet I can’t help feel as if the concept of the hotel was made to feel as if it’s a cheap hotel. - you get a bottle of water everyday via a coupon and you need to retrieve the water from the little shop at the lobby. I have no issues with it although I found it strange they would make you exchange a coupon for a bottle of water when they could have just left the bottles in the room like all other hotels? So if you are staying 5 days alone, you get 5 coupons. Of course you can retrieve entire 5 bottles at one go. Btw these are small bottle of Evian water, one which you can gulp in one go. Surely at a rate we pay, at least 2 bottles per person a day can be given considering the size of the bottle?- if you want ice, you need to go to lobby shop to get because they won’t send it up. - “guest services” button on the phone was weird. I called enquiring bout ice as mentioned above, only to be told quite curtly before the person ended the call without saying anything further - “you need to dial 1 for this” - uhm, isn’t that what “guest services” call is for or am I missing something?- if you ordered food via the lobby shop (eg sandwiches), they charge you for delivery to your room - yes you get charged!- I highlighted this to front desk - the shower drainage is really poor. Not sure if it’s just our room but the water can’t drain fast enough and as a result the water rises up and overflows onto the floor outside.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small room, compared to lesser paid 4 star hotels which is poshAged Carpets and poor maintenance, maybe old buildingMelia 240 compared to Hyatt 343 Big entrance, reception, breakfast area, but rooms smaller, rundown carpets, lights intensity mask the aging.
hotelName:

review_body: For three nights we stayed in Hayyat Paris. The location of hotel is excellent and 10-15 minutes walking to Are de Trioumph and fashion street Champ Elysee. Many restaurants are within 5-10 minutes walk. The room was with a view to Efile tower, the weather was clear during our stay so every day & night we could see the icon of Paris. The room was well appointed but very small as compare to price we paid. Hotel is well connected to shopping mall and mayo market is open 24x7. Hayyat never disappoints so our stay was memorable, for tourist purpose this is hotel is the best choice.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in a nice area but it is pretty large and the rooms are kind of outdated. The outlets in our room were borderline dangerous. My wife got shocked and burned when plugging in a US adapter to one of the outlets and all power went out in the room. They also tried to rip me off with some bogus 100 Euro room charge but I caught it and they admitted it was their 'mistake' whatever that means. There are much nicer hotels in the area and I would not recommend this one.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile

review_body: Well appointed rooms, with fantastic views of Paris and the Eiffel Tower. Easy access to many great tourist attractions and the metro. The Mayo cafe in the lobby is a great concept and excellent value.

3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile

review_body: being located in convinient place, satisfied with my stay. also this hotel has business meeting rooms, which has sufficient facility. room was as expected, great view of the eifle tower. would like to use again in ucoming biz trips.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile

review_body: Aside from not receiving any special gesture for staying there on my honeymoon, which was a bit disappointing, this is a very solid and convenient hotel. Location, transportation, dining (high end all the way to food from grocery store) options were all great.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are clean and well maintained, and with all necessary facilities. Surprisingly quiet for being a busy hotel in a busy city. The staff both at the desk and concierge were friendly and accommodating. Will stay here also next time when in Paris.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights in May 2019 for our anniversary. Excellent property, great views and great location. Alice from check-in was amazing and helped us upgrade our room to a club room with the best view of the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe. We also added breakfast to our room which was delicious! Nunu, the VIP Supervisor, was very gracious in sending a surprise bottle of champagne to our room. Both Alice and Nunu made our anniversary memorable and we will definitely stay here again when we come back to Paris!
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel got renovated, the lobby is huge and nice however, our room had a smell from the AC. In addition they take over 300$ per night and they dont put water bottles and the mini bar is empty u can only order from downstairs and they take 5€ as delivery charge. The restaurant has specific plates not a large quantity. The staff is nice and helpful.For my family we found overrated.

review_body: They completely gutted this hotel and made it pretty nice.The rooms are small but very well designed so it doesn't seems so small.The lounge is very nice, big and with a great view for the breakfast. At night it's much smaller they make a big part of it a part of the bar so it can feel very cramped at night. Good area with plenty of restaurants. Highly Recommended!!

review_body: This Hotel is attached to a huge mall, just in case you forgot anything. It was also very close to the metro in a beautiful tree lined street. There were charming cafes in the neighborhood and we felt very safe.

review_body: This hotel has very recently been refreshed and is now a great place to stay on all counts. Metro station downstairs, express bus service to CDG airport round the corner, all of Paris on the doorstep.

3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile

review_body: First of all, I would like to appreciate the receptionists! kind, cooperative and professional! Next, the breakfast is perfect and you can find everything you expect, just the restaurant is a little cozy, but well designed! The rooms are small but very clean and the bed is really comfort! Location is fantastic, metro is closed to the hotel, only 300 meters to Porte malliot station. Arc and Chapms-Elysees are close enough and you can get there by foot! It could be a perfect choice in any aspects!
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile

review_body: We are grateful that the Hyatt Regency exceeded our expectations. The lobby was gorgeous, the staff were courteous, and made us feel welcomed. There is some construction going on outside, but it didn't take away from our visit. They celebrated our recent nuptials with an upgraded room and 2 glasses of champagne. We highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely be back. Camila at the registration desk was AMAZING! The hotel is attached to a mall and across the street from the Metro. Loved the location!
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile

review_body: A great stay at this Hyatt Regency in Paris - awesome views of the Eiffel Tower, very close to restaurants and the Arc Di Triomphe! Enjoyed the breakfast at the hotel - Champagne at Bar Windo was over the top; quite literally!!
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three nights at this hotel. The service at check in was great. Location was superb for us. We walked to see all the sights the first day....ended up being a 23 km day but didn't feel like it! Second day we went further afield using the Metro. Day three we heaed back into town on the Lime scooter rentals. All were great! There are many nearby pubs and cafes.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We’ve been staying here since Monday. I’ve accompanied my husband who’s attending a medical meeting. The hotel is very clean and the staff is efficient. However, as we are fasting Ramadan, we asked that we made a box from breakfast , which is already included in room fare, in the morning for us to keep in room till sunset time to be able to break our fast. Our question was refused saying that they don’t do that!! The given alternative was to see with the hotel coffee shop and they could prepare us a box for 9€. I don’t understand why should I pay 9€ when already I’ve paid 25€ for a breakfast that I couldn’t have by any means. The end result was trying the box for one night and was not satisfactory so we went out and got our late breakfast at our own leisure and choice. I’m really surprised as we’ve done the same at other hotels in Europe and the staff was understanding.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great experience this is not my first time in the hotel , I like it because it's in the center and next to Mall .beside the service is great : I like the staff I like the hotel , reception desk is great , stuff at breakfast warm, concierge help full will come back Thank you
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a conference. I think they had a refurbishment a few years ago - lobby and room look fresh and modern. Arrived 8am from 14 hour flight and had to go outside till 3pm for a room. Room had a great view of eiffel tower. Location is ok with some restaurants that also catch the conference crowd. Nice concierge and front desk staff. Present your room card at the lobby for bottled water. As with most european hotels, bring your own toothbrush
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the customer service was Excellent I will recommend this hotel to all my family and friends to stay here I had a wonderful stay and most of all my family members where very HAPPY we will visit again thank you
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a hyatt globalist I've seen all levels of service from hyatt properties, but this one was exceptionally good. They impressed us even before our trip by reaching and asking if we needed anything special.We got there and the entry was clean and the front desk clearly marked. We were able to find the world of hyatt desk easily and got checked in. The VIP manager (Keiko) warmly greeted us and gave us a special gift (much appreciated!).The room was modern and the bed larger than I've seen in many other euro hotels. We were especially impressed with the layout of the bathroom which was large and easily accessible. The room also had many outlets which we were very happy with.We checked out both the hyatt lounge as well as the bar on the 34th floor which had amazing views of the Eiffel tower. Both were clean and easy to navigate.Overall this hotel made us feel special and treated us with class. The staff were friendly and the hotel seemed well run. Definitely recommend and we will be back for sure.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice than i read another review in website. Room is very clean. When i stat hotel, i felt very safety and comfort. effel view is bestest in trip. Breakfast is also excellent. And good located. Very good. Very easy~ come from airport. Return too. Near lebus stop area. Just need 1min.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hyatt Regency Etoile is centrally located to most of the sites that visitors wish to see while in Paris. We used taxis for transportation and all trips were 15 Euros or less. And if a metro user, the subway is immediately handy from the hotel. For the shoppers, a huge shopping structure is located across the street. The Hyatt is a beautiful hotel, very comfortable and are ready to help you with their English speaking staff,
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 days at the Hyatt regency, a luxury hotel in a big building Porte Maillot, during a short romantic visit in Paris. The room was quite nice and well equiped,. However we have been surprised by 2 indelicate situations. First, we had to claim a bottle of spring water at a store with a ticket rather than having it directly at our disposal in the room. Second, the access to the bar at the 34 floor where we would have liked to share a cocktail, was prohibited by unfriendly staff. We have been asked to wait in the corridor, close tot the entrance while there was a lot of free places in the bar, waiting to a waitress who didn't showed up, while the waiting queue stretched...Such rudeness is not expected in a hotel of that standing..
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel with great location, about 10-15 minutes walk to Arc de Triumphe (Etoile station) which makes it a great starting point to other attractions in Paris (Tour Eiffel, Louvre, Notre Dame,..etc). Many great bakeries nearby for some breakfast or even lunch that are not that touristy. The airport bus stops right infront of the hotel which makes it easier to get to and back from the airport without having to hop on the metro and change different lines. Only problem is although I had Explorist status, they didn't give us the room before 12.30 due to overbooking (we arrived around 10am).
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice hotel with a very convenient location Staff was professional and friendly. Property is very attractive and rooms quiet and up to date. Views from Windo Bar are outstanding And the CDG bus shuttles you seamlessly to the airport and back. The hotel is very convenient to the Metro line 1 and RER C, making it very convenient for tourists
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile

review_body: We spent the night here on our way back from south of France. A beautiful day walking in Paris. Many nearby restaurants. Easy nearby bus transport to CDG and metro stop for getting into downtown and elsewhere. The top floor bar has a great view of the city and Eifel.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy to find your way back to this hotel as it must be one of the tallest buildings in the city! Breakfast good. Rooms a bit on the small size. Some rooms have views of the Eiffel tower however mine unfortunately did not
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We selected this hotel based on the price which compared to other hotels was consider "reasonable" since we plan to spend 10 nights in Paris and did all of our day trips from Paris to mont St. Michel and to Normandy. We love this location: one block away from the metro, and so many great restaurants close by. There is a great local french bakery about 6 mins walk as you head towards the Arc . we went there almost every morning for our croissants and super reasonable compare to the prices we pay in Calif! Love the service at the hotel- front desk check in went fast, concierge were super helpful (we were planning to do a one day visit to Belgium on May 1st but was inform that it was a national holiday there so most shops would be close ). No complains on the level of cleanliness from housekeeping from my room , but our friend did mentioned that when their hot cups were used for coffee in the room, it was not replaced until they had to ask for it. we didn't have that problem in our room. we would definitely stay at this hotel when we visit Paris again!
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: . Great view and kind staff. And very near every good place. Best hotel ever. U can ask everything then staff really consider and make it happen My family also was happy and satisfied with staff. Room. Almost everything
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed here for 4 nights and all I have to say it was an absolutely amazing experience. The hotel staff was so friendly and helpful. They view from the room of effiel tower was absolutely stunning. As we checked in , Raika at front desk was so great that she offered us couple of free drinks at their top floor bar #windo for our honeymoon stay. Location is great too with access to local bars and restaurants. Will definitely recommend this for visit and shall visit again.
hotelName:
3    Hyatt Regency Paris Etoile
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room was of a decent size with dual-aspect windows and coffee-making faclilities. I felt safe walking through the neighbourhood and there were plenty of places to eat and drink nearby”“Staff were friendly, room was clean and comfortable
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a wonderful place to stay while in Paris. The staff goes out of their way to help you with anything you need! There are so many cafes near. I would definitely recommend this Hotel. I will definitely be back!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I usually don’t write a feedback but then this is a rare case. I have visited many 5 star hotels but the people at Hotel Darcet are by far the best when it comes to customer delight. They were very caring and ensured that everything was taken care of. Yes the lift is little small but the rooms are decent. Hot water was available all the time. Room was cleaned everyday. They have a kitchen which can be used by the guests. It might just be the best budget hotel in Paris. Very well connected with Metro station and lots of eating places around. Rooms are well ventilated and cozy. I ll say just go ahead and book it, you will not regret it. GauravMumbaiIndia
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A brilliant little hotel in Place de Clichy, very convenient for the tube system, and if you want to walk then even the Eiffel Tower is just a 40 minute walk.The hotel is very clean, the rooms are basic but stylish. There isn’t a restaurant but you are able to eat your own food in the main room, where free hot drinks are available. There is a fantastic boulangerie on the corner for breakfast items and there are plenty of restaurants, supermarkets, bars and cafes with in a few minutes of the hotel.The staff are super people ad nothing is too much trouble. Samir (on night duty) is so Helpful and we had some nice chats in the evening when we returned. The lady in the morning (whose name I forgot to ask) was also very accommodating.If I am in Paris again I would not hesitate to come back here.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very well managed and provides an excellent, moderately-priced, choice in Paris. It Is located near a metro station in a place saturated with restaurants. And yes, the elevator is small and no breakfast is offered, but it is not a problem. Good option for an experienced traveler
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was portrayed as a value hotel by other reviews on Tripadvisor which was in a great location, which is why I booked it. Wrong. Location was only average and not close to anything (although there were a few cafe's around)The lift can only fit one person ... yep, 1 person at a time!You needed to carry your bag up 4 steps to even get to the lift. Not easy when the bag is 30kgNo breakfast available. There was a common area where you can put your own food in a shared fridge in you wanted. Yeah right ... like I'm going to do that.Room was like a hostel ... wait, no, I've stayed in hostels that were much better.Ran out of hot water half way thru the second shower each morning. My wife and I draw stays for the 1st shower.Price was OK, but for what it is, should be half.People at the front desk were really nice and courteous and doing their best.Summery: Find somewhere else.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This tiny perfect little gem will be my go-to in Paris from now own.Super affordable, sparkling clean, wonderful staff, cozy rooms. The location can't be beat - close to the Metro, and just a few minutes walk to Montmarte.The tiny shower took a little getting used to, but this is literally the only negative I can think of. STAY HERE!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here again for the 4th successive year, still fantastic value. Warm welcome as always. Lots of good restaurants nearby. Walking distance to Montmartre. Will not stay anywhere else in Paris! The hotel is always clean and cannot fault it for the price.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely , very clean hotel in a wonderful location. easy walk to Clichy metro. Every morning bought pastries at a shop next door to eat with our morning coffee. Staff was friendly and helpful. Lots of nice restaurants in neighborhood. Would stay again. Great value
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Hotel Darcet for 3 nights as two friends celebrating our 30th birthdays. The room we stayed in (room 14) was surprisingly big for a city hotel. The hotel is centrally located and has a metro station in close proximity. The room was spotless, quiet and even had air conditioning. The shower reached a good pressure and was also a decent size. The blinds well and truly blacked out the room at night so for those who like it pitch black you will be happy. There hotel doesn’t offer breakfast which didn’t bother us as being in a city we like to explore places to eat anyway but I’m guessing this is the only reason the hotel isn’t ranked higher than 2 star because it’s easily 4 star in every other way. Would definitely stay again when I next return to Paris!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked to stay for 1 week. Had a terrible check in process. The receiving staff was rude. I gave plenty of notice with my request but put me on 1st floor, (hotel only have 5 floors) with poor internet connection, it won't even accept the password given to me. He told me specifically which internet to connect and only find out from the owner and other guests that I can connect with better line. He even blamed me that it was my phone and told me that am the only one complaining with the internet. Really? I have been travelling and no issues with my internet in other countries I've been to. Didn't even offer to help me to the lift with my luggages. Then transferred me on the following morning with no notice. Then the owner (Samir) tried to make it up by telling me I can move again only for the last 2 nights on the higher floor. I declined as they should have given my request from the start as I made the reservations more than 2 months before my arrival. They tried to make it up to me by giving me free drinks (softdrinks and water). I kept saying no as I bought my own bottles of water during my stay but insisted. They should notify you if your request can not be granted before your arrival.The rooms are very small but clean. you will have to lay your suitcase on the floor. You can hear ppl talk in the nearby neighbourhood. Free coffee but no milk in the common dining room. You have to buy your milk for your coffee. As a paying customer, I always look for good customer service.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s an excellent 2-star hotel located near the Place de Clichy metro and bus stations. It’s within walking distance from Moulin Rouge and the many cheap bars in Montmartre. They also have free coffee and use of the microwave and refrigerator. The staff, particularly Ziane, is accommodating. Ziane even gave us free bottles of water, which is good considering how expensive it is in Europe. We’ll consider Hotel Darcet when we return to Paris.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a family of 4 (2 adult children), we rented 2 rooms in this quaint little hotel for 4 nights. The hotel contacted us in advance to confirm our arrival time, and recommended the best transfer from the Orly airport to the hotel. We were given rooms on the same floor, which was greatly appreciated. The rooms, although small, were totally renovated and really nice - comfortable beds, very clean and nice rooms. You could open the windows for fresh air, and if you wanted to sleep in the windows had an electronic shade that could be lowered to block out light. The location was great, right off of the Place de Clichy which had restaurants and a metro station. Moulin Rouge area was a short walk away. There was even a little grocery store across the street where you could buy prepared sandwiches and other food and drinks -- a couple of days we ate dinner early while out sightseeing, and then ended up heading over to the market later in the evening when we got hungry. The hotel staff was super friendly and accommodating. A thoroughly enjoyable stay.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently had a two night stay at Hotel Darcet and for the price we weren’t expecting much. However this is a really nice hotel very clean good amenities and friendly staff. Bedroom was well sized twin room with everything we needed and a nice view from the window. Small kitchen to which you can help yourself and cook if need be and coffee and tea machines always available in the reception room. Staff were very friendly and spoke English very well which only added to the welcome. For the price a lovely little room only hotel which I would definitely recommended and stay again!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Truly wonderful hotel, basic but very comfortable and clean. Room was comfortably big enough for two, the en-suite shower room was small but well laid out. Good shutters on the windows meant we could sleep with the windows open but still be dark. The area is okay, between Rome-Batignolles and Place de Clichy metro stations, so great for getting around Paris and surprisingly quiet at night. The second night was noisier with sirens but that was the night of the Notre-Dame fire, the windows blanked the sound and the room fan was okay to keep the room cool. Free tea and coffee in the dining room, the hotel doesn’t offer breakfast or other meals but there is a kitchen where you can keep your own food and a microwave. I would definitely recommend for a better than expected at the price stay and we will definitely come back.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the hotel with my 3 daughters. What a wonderful place for the money, it was perfect for us. Firstly the 3 staff at reception were so polite, kind, friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much.., thank you! The rooms were spotless and had all we needed. It doesn’t matter that breakfast is not provided as there is free tea and coffee and a kitchen with a fridge to use, kettle, microwave and plates etc. We went to the supermarket or patisserie and ate it at the hotel. Free water bottles on arrival is a nice touch too. Only thing to make it exemplary would have been fresh milk by the coffee/tea machines... but only because we’re English and love our tea Thanks for a great stay we would stay here again without hesitation. Position is brilliant. So close to the main attractions and to Eurostar. Staff responded to any email enquires prior to stay, within minutes!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for two night and we were glad to stay in this hotel. Very convenience to metro and bus, 1 minutes walk to number 30 bus stop which go to Sacre Couer (east) or Tour Eiffel (west). Five minutes bus ride to Anvers (Sacre Couer) and about 30 minutes bus ride to Tour Eiffel during rush hour. Number 30 bus comes every 8 minutes during day time. I prefer not taking the close-by metro because it is more interesting taking bus. Restaurant and bakery are everywhere and a few of them close at 2am. Not so good for early bird because place not open at least 7am but it is understandable for the late closing.The real gem of the hotel is their staff and they were so helpful, gave us lot of tourist tips in Paris. Big applause for Zion (day staff), Samir (night staff), Khalifa (morning staff). We learned a lot even we did not talk for long.This is a budgetary two-star hotel in Paris and everything were as expected. It wouldn't be fair to compare to a 3 or 4-star hotel. Having boiling drinking water was so convenience because of the shared kitchen. The 24 hours complementary nescafe alike coffee and tea were great. Cell phone signal and wifi in the hotel can be spotty. Our jacket and backpack got pick pocketed while having dinning in the restaurant close-by. They guy sit behind us pretended to be fixing his long jacket while he went through our stuff instead. We did not lose much because we put the valuable and passport in the hotel safe. We did report to the police station which was within 5 minutes walking distance.We would definitely come back to the hotel again in the near future.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is super convenient, closes to everything. Staffs are nice, free tea and coffee. Elevator is extremely small, glad that we didn't carry large luggage with us. Room is very basic but clean. However, we couldn't adjust the temperature inside the room, there was no air circulate unless we open the window but then would be too cold and too noisy at night. Also, water pressure in the shower could drop significantly that happened to me and my husband,I thought we were running out of water during shower, then the hot water came back very slowly. That never happened to me at any other hotels I ever been, so scary!!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Samire is super nice and helpful. All staff was friendly.Central hotel convenient for visiting the city, perfect value for money, beautiful, comfortable and clean rooms, excellent breakfast. Recommended
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cracking hotel in a great location. Very friendly staff. Thank you my friend Samuel for giving my wife varse to put her flowers in and all the bottles of water. lovely gesture. Beds where very comfortable and the room was plenty of size. The Shower was fantastic. Thank you to every who made us feel very welcome. We will definitely stay here again. see you all soon. xx
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Full disclosure, I never actually stayed at this hotel. However, I did almost arrange for my family to stay at this hotel. I am getting married in June and anyone who lives abroad and has family come from abroad will tell you that helping your family members find a hotel to stay in can be a hassle. This is especially so when you are forced to get married in high tourist season. During that time, things get very expensive. It can be hard to find flights and hotels and as I want my family to share my magical moment with me, I have been helping them to find affordable flights and hotels. I have a habit of going to visit 2 star hotels, which everybody should do. In France, 2 star hotels are not oblige to have air conditioning. Rooms can be insanely small and sometimes dirty. I want to check it out so I went today. I went to the Front Desk and explained my situation to the wonderful man who was working there. His name was Zian, I believe that is how you spell it. I'm sorry if I spelled it wrong. He was amazing! I had called previously and he remembered me after I explained my situation. I asked him if I could see a room and he gave me a small tour of the hotel and showed me two rooms including one that had a view of the terrace below. From what I saw, the hotel is magnificent for a two star. The showers are spacious. The beds look comfy. The place is clean and it has air conditioning, which is RARE for 2 star hotels. Before I left, Zian explained all of the options that I had to reserve for my family. He gave me his contact information so I could follow up with him and offered me a coffee. He is a true professional. If I ever have an opportunity to send somebody to this hotel or stay there, I will do it in a heartbeat. My family decided to go with another hotel, but I didn't want Zian and this hotel to go unnoticed, so I came to Trip Advisor. Zian, Thank you so much for the tour and the coffee! I am so sorry that my family chose another hotel. I will be sending people your way though!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nicely equipped compact rooms, friendly and helpful service. No breakfast or catering in house, but has a pleasant dining room with free hot drinks (Nespresso type and Teas) along with a communal kitchen and crockery/cutlery.I would have given 5 stars, but was annoyed that staff insisted that our Bromptons had to be stored in the broom/ luggage cupboard- first time in over 40 European hotel stays! They said was some issue re keeping the parquet floors clean, apparently...(bit of ignorance there as our Brommies are cleaner than most suitcases)
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The title says it all, this is not a fancy hotel but a good clean hotel just off Boulevard des Batignolles and not too far away from Place de Clichy and the Metro station there.Staff on reception are really friendly. Although breakfast is not provided there is an area set aside with tables and chairs across from the reception where tea and coffee were available all day and there were plenty of places to buy breakfast nearby. We were also given bottled water on arrival. There is a small communal kitchen where we could heat up food, boil the kettle and leave food in the fridge. Very handy indeed.Our room was on the 4th floor and we tended to use the lift as we were exhausted by sightseeing all day. The lift was very small and only accommodated two people at a time so at times there was a bit of a wait. Had we been fitter we would have walked. We would leave for the day early and would come back at about 5pm for a rest but often found that our room had not been cleaned by then so either went out again or sat in the communal area with a tea or coffee. The room was a good size and well heated ( it was February and very cold outside), comfy bed, lots of coat-hangers in the wardrobe,safe (also in wardrobe), TV and electric blind on the window. We slept well and heard virtually no noise although our room was next to the lift. Good shower with toiletries ( wall mounted dispensers) and a hairdryer ( again wall mounted).In fact everything you would need for a stay in Paris without breaking the budget.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was very happy to have taken my fellow tripadvisors' advice. Having a free night in Paris before being tied to a more expensive option, I was delighted with Hotel Darcet. I was early for check-in but was offered coffee in the small but effective off-lobby area. Whilst waiting was very impressed with the receptionist dealing with fellow guests in the most helpful manner. When shown my room I was delighted with a spacious and spotlessly clean room with an extremely comfortable mattress. I had an excellent undisturbed night (very efficient double glazing) and a great shower. The hotel does not offer breakfast (fine by me since I rarely take breakfast) but you are directed to good looking bakery opposite and it is in an area with all sorts of eating options including well-stocked supermarkets. Close to Metro, this hotel has no frills but is ideal for a traveller such as myself who just wants basic cleanliness, comfort and a very warm helpful welcome. Couldn't ask for more.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic price, location, and service! The staff is nice and the rooms are very clean. Although there is no breakfast provided, the hotel is located by several bakeries and stores. Very close walking distance to the metro, making any part of Paris very accessible!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location! My two children and I caught the train from the airport ( in hindsight this was a bit overwhelming but would be easy without kids or if I had another adult with me).Quiet, cosy, clean and comfortable. A friendly and helpful man on reception.The room is small but the size I expected to get for what I paid.I would stay here again.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No complaints for this hotel. It's close to a lot of shops and very close to the metro. Montmartre is a couple of stops away. The rooms are small but comfortable. The staff are friendly and helpful. And the room doors had a feature that should be standard on every hotel door in the world, but is hardly ever seen - they close slowly and so they're very difficult to slam shut. I've lost count of the number of times that thoughtless morons have woken me up doing this in other hotels, so anything that stops them is fine by me.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is close to the Place de Clichy metro station and located close to Montmartre and the Moulin Rouge is within walking distance. There are numerous restaurants, bars and small markets in the area. We (3 women) came back late every night and felt safe. The hotel has an elevator and the rooms and bathroom were very clean. There is a small sitting area in the lobby that has coffee and tea. There is a bakery across the street if you would like to get pastries. The staff is outstanding, they were very helpful and someone is there 24 hours. Thank you for a wonderful stay. I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reasonably priced. The hotel offers a simple kitchen and dining room suitable for breakfast etc. with free coffee and tee, which is very convenient. Good location, a few minutes from the nearest metro station. The rooms are very clean, quiet, good size, well heated (even too hot for my taste).
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 days and enjoyed the excellent location close to everything in Paris. Reasonably priced and very clean. Best of all is their excellent customer service. Samire gave us personal attention to our needs to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. Thank you so much Samire!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly staff,you feel like home,the room was very very clean and spacious. They clean the room every day.Perfect location and good conected.At the lobby you can drink tea or coffee every time you want.You can use the kitchen of the hotel for your own personal use.If you travel with your family in Paris this hotel is the best choice,i highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was one of the nicest trips we've ever had, and the hotel staff was one of the reasons. They led us to excellent food, and wonderful half-day tour, and a night event at the cathedral. We walked from the train to the hotel, and the entire city is walk-able from the hotel.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walking distance from Moulin Rouge, Montmartre, LaFayette, interesting location. Room is quite basic but it was ok. Staff is nice and they give free bottle of water at checkin. Free wifi available. Breakfast room has free coffee but if you want food you have to buy from the patisserie next door.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent treatment from the reception staff. Clean and cosy room I had, I will stay here again on my next visit to Paris. Just at the right location with walking distance to Place the Clicy metro station.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a good stay at this hotel this summer. Rooms are very small and sparsely decorated and the beds weren't great but everything was clean and functional. Most importantly, it is hard to find a better value especially with the location near Place du Clichy Metro stop with easy access to all the sights of Paris, and you are walking distance to Montmartre and Sacre Coeur. Located in a real neighborhood of Paris with a couple sidewalk cafes around the corner.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The most helpful and friendly staff work here. They took so much stress out of our holiday. Excellent part of Paris too. We really enjoyed our stay and are very thankful for all the help provided to us. Thanks to Hotel Darcet staff.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just spent two nights in the Hotel Darcet in the 17th arrondisement. The hotel was well located, immaculately clean and the reception staff in particular could not be more welcoming and helpful.There is no breakfast on site but a large dining room is available for guests use as well as a kitchen . Coffee and tea are also available 24 hours a day for free in this room .We asked for a particular room in advance and were delighted when this was allocated for our stay.The hotel is in a location where there are plenty of restaurants and patisserie to access. We will book here again when next in Paris.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a week in this hotel, conveniently located next to the Place de Clichy metro station (not too far from the Gare du Nord).All three receptionists were super friendly and helpful.The room was clean and well furnished.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First impression was how small the room and especially the bathroom was. Getting over the size it was noticeably very clean. They have desk clerk on duty 24 hours a day. Very friendly and helpful.When you leave hotel you leave key with them. Rooms have safe which are key operated. Location is great across road from 2 supermarkets, at least a dozen restaurants in a 5 minute walking distance.Lots of bars for you to sit outside enjoying happy hour and watch the crowd One problem is nearly everyone smokes so this can lessen the outside enjoyment.Hotel has an eating area and they encourage you to buy food and bring it back. There is a kitchen for plates etcWorth thinking about staying there
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A compact, smart and modern hotel having all ingredients to provide you with a comfortable and cosy no-frills stay. The rooms were clean and warm. The bathroom was small but clean and well- designed. What suited us the best was the kitchenette with a microwave, utensils, refrigerator, crockery and cutlery. The 24 hour provision for tea and coffee in the dining room was also very helpful. The staff was also very cooperative and eager to help. Our stay was for 2 nights and we're definitely coming back. Keep up the great job guys!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just left the Hotel Darcet after a three night stay. Our room was on the fourth floor, and faced the internal courtyard so it was very quiet. There is a tiny elevator (for two people only) but the stairs are more than manageable. Our room was spotlessly clean and was made up each day. We were also pleasantly surprised by the size of the room - there was plenty of space. Even though there was no fridge in the room - all guests have access to a kitchen with a fridge on the ground floor. Location wise, the hotel is about 20 minutes to the Sacre Coeur and it’s only a few minutes walk from the Place de Clichy metro station. This is a great hotel for the price and I would definitely recommend it to others.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband & I stayed 3 nights on our arrival in Paris. Room was generous size for Paris hotel, immaculate, modern bathroom, comfortable bed. Basic accommodations but everything we needed. On a small street near Place de Clichy. Very lively area until late at night. Our room was on the courtyard side so not a problem for us. Many restaurant & bar options in the immediate area. (James Bún a favorite of ours) Convenient to Metro, bus and walking distance to Montmartre. No breakfast but recommend boulangerie down Boul des Batignolles (not Julien but another block or two down). Bring it back to the break room to eat with coffee at the hotel. Nice small market around the corner as well. Hotel also offers a kitchen for use with fridge to store your food should you so desire. Staff were all very friendly & helpful. Excellent value. Stayed in two other hotels in Paris during our holiday but for the price, quality of the room and warmth of the staff, the Darcet is at the top of the list.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is everything you really need, good price, great location, amazing staff. The price is really fair compared to a lot of hotels in Paris. The room is not necessarily large but the bed is a good size. A firm matress with soft pillows. The staff was very kind and accommodating. We actually had two rooms as we asked to upgrade to a balcony which they were kind enough to do the next day of our stay. There is a patisserie across from the hotel and you can bring your food in the dining area of the hotel, which has various coffees and teas. The location is a 5 minute walk to the metro, with plenty of cafes and shops on the way. You can get to any of the main tourist attractions from the metro in less than 20 min. I recommend this place to anyone, and will definitely come here again for our next visit.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel just few steps from the subway. Couple a minutes walk from a Supermarket(s) , cafes, restaurants,bars.Very clean and they clean your room and change towels every day.Kitchen available for you use.Dinning room available for your use as well.Staff are very helpful and friendly.Interior terrace where you can sit and relax have a drink or eat.Location is perfect and central.Ill stay there again :) Rooms are small but it is a think in Europe
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good 2-Star hotel in great location close to two subway lines. Modern interior. Rooms average size for European city standards. Modern, clean bathrooms. Lunch room has coffee/tea. Kitchen is available for longer stays. Breakfast is not included. Friendly staff. Price appropriate for 2-Star in Paris.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just returned from our first trip to Paris and stayed at this wonderful little hotel. Great location to walk to Montmartre, Moulin Rouge and the Metro. The staff make this place a 5 star! So helpful with directions, information and restaurant suggestions. Free coffee and tea downstairs was welcomed each morning. They even kept my big suitcase when we made a trip to London for a few days on the Eurostar. When we returned to the hotel they welcomed us like old friends. Excellent beds and rooms (yes small) are spotless. We will definitely stay again and highly recommend Hotel Darcet!!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small hotel, great location, mostly nice staff, and the world's smallest elevator. Close to the metro and grocery with Saturday market across the street. We were able to check in early upon our arrival at 7am but unable to get late checkout since they were booked up. Was scolded by one of the staff for leaving our lights and aircon on when out for dinner. A little strange and creepy that they check your room even when not cleaning.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really loved this little hotel. Good rooms, clean and modern. Staff were all so helpful and friendly. It has a little kitchen and dining area with a very handy Auchan supermarket opposite so you can eat in hotel. The location is great, walking distance about 12 mins to the Montmartre district our favourite area and about 2 mins to Place de Cichy metro, which connects to everywhere. Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. Great couple of nights in Paris.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is small, but perfect for the price. Staff were friendly and helpful, especially with directions. The rooms are the basics but clean, sleek, comfortable and spacious. Good air conditioning too! The courtyards are a really nice addition, too. The location is good. Thank you!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was perfect - it was clean, has very informative, friendly and helpful staff and is in a great location (5 minute walk from the metro) . Also has a great coffee/tea station that is available to guests ! The rooms come with automatic block out blinds that makes the room pitch dark which was amazing!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel last year and returned this year. The staff are so friendly here - they recognised us from before, they organised us a transfer to the airport (After the one I had booked cancelled at the last minute) and even gave us water from their fridge when we were passing because it had been so warm. The hotel itself is ideally located within walking distance of restaurants, bakeries, supermarkets and "Place de Clichy" metro. The rooms are clean with A/C and good WiFi. The safe deposit box in the room was free to use. There was a communal fridge and tea/coffee facilities. All in all I could not be more impressed with this hotel!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is excellent, almost on place de Clichy, 10min to Moulin Rouge, a nice walk away from Sacré Coeur.There are supermarkets and reasonable food options around (crepes, fast food, Chez Leon, bars etc.).The staff were wonderful, the room clean, the bathroom recently updated.There is a common area downstairs with free coffee and tea. You can bring your breakfast from the boulangeries around.It was a really pleasant stay, Hotel Darcet will be our hotel of choice for our next visit as well.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived late in the middle of the night because our flight was delayed. Sami at the reception was waiting for us and was extremely welcoming. He made check in very quick and easy for us. He was always available to answer our questions and provide information during our stay.Hotel is very clean and provides all basic amenities ( flat screen tv, AC, tea and coffee 24hrs at the reception). 2 steps away from Place de Clichy, subway, restos open late, bakery across the street and short walk to theater district. Would definatly recomment if you are looking for a very clean, fairly priced but not fancy hotel.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are in the middle of or Five night stay and I have found the hotel staff to be very accommodating and helpful.. this is definitely one of the better hotels I have stayed at in this price point. I am not expecting the Four Season, but I do expect clean, comfortable, climate controlled rooms with good WiFi, hot shower, and response staff. This hotel delivered on all and more.. A few draw backs which are to be expected at this price point (inferior / or non complimentary in room amenities) i,e shower, lotion, condition, coffee maker. It did have an antique hair dryer that worked. This hotel is is in a centrally located location, and well worth the money paid.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Darcet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights and we'll definitely consider it again when going to Paris. The location was perfect - right next to the arc de triomphe and champs de elysees, and right by many of the main metro lines. The breakfast was simple but sufficient, and the staff were also really helpful and accommodated all our needs and requests.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here twice in two weeks. First time was for a full week and second time was just for a night. It is located right near the arc de triomphe and champs elysees. It is also located near many metro stations which is very helpful. The hotel is very clean and the entire staff is kind and extremely helpful and friendly. Would for sure come back here again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one week at Hotel Cecilia in June. Very cute little boutique hotel near Arc de Triomphe. Great location, 2 blocks off Champs Elysees, metro near by and numerous restaurants around.We upgraded to a balcony room and it is well worth it, I think that the rooms are a little bigger than the basic ones. Good AC in the room, good size and updated bathroom, comfortable beds.There is no refrigerator in the room but would be great to have some plastic cups and bottle water in the room. There is a water boiling kettle you can make instant coffee or tea.Breakfast is great, continental sty6le , great variety and complimentary.Front desk people very friendly and helpful in booking trips, restaurants,etc.I would definitely return and stay here.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a nice experience on this iconic hotel located just a few steps from the Arc de Triumphe on a very exclusive neighborhood with many stores and restaurants by walking distance. The rooms are small, but clean, quiet with private restroom. Breakfast and Wi-Fi were complementary. The front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for three nights this past week. Located near the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees, this hotel is clean and quiet. The room is good but there is no refrigerator in the room nor any complimentary water. The staff seemed rather indifferent bordering on aloofness. Asking for a ice seemed to be a bother.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommend...friendly staff, great location. quiet street, close to Metro. nice breakfast, short walk to L'Etoile. Rooms are aittle but comfortable with effective AC and nice size bath, free WiFi, Would definitely stay here again
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been to paris on a number of occassions and would stay here again. Hotel staff are lovely, rooms are clean, breakfast was nice and the hotel is in a great location and is walking distance from the Champs elysees. Perfect for families, couples and even just a weekend with your friends. Overall great hotel.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Cecilia Hotel was an excellent choice in lodging. It is a very short walk from the Metro 2 Charles de Gaulle-Etoile stop being only one street over and down half a block away. It was perfect for our excursions.Our room was on the first floor (2nd floor in the US) and we had a view of the Arc de Triomphe. The afternoon sun shining on the west wall of the Arc was beautiful. Our room was spotless and appointed with coffee (albeit instant with a kettle), extra pillows and full amenities including slippers. For Paris, the room was large and the bathroom was modern with a deep bathtub and shower combo. It felt luxurious and again spotless. We spent 4 nights in the hotel and had no complaints whatsoever.Breakfast was a variety of baked goods, meats, cheeses, cereal, yogurt and fruit. The coffee maker brewed various coffees including espresso, lattes and cappuccinos. Delicious. The dining room was serviced each time a guest finished eating. There is a bar and comfortable lounge area to relax anytime of day. The desk is staffed 24 hours. We loved our stay and this hotel has become our new spot to stay when visiting Paris.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent our honeymoon at Hotel Cecilia, and I request for a nice view, and they exceptionally offered me the best view ever from arc de triomphe, Lovely. The location was perfect, it´s a small boutique hotel however it is spectacular.We highly recommend.I must say,although the check in was 2pm, they also let me check in around 11am. Great service.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is the cutest boutique hotel I’ve ever been to. It was so clean , our view was spectacular. Everyone was so helpful & the location was perfect. There’s no better place to stay in Paris than Hotel Cecilia .
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located abut 100 metres from the Arc, this lovely little hotel is the perfect play to stay in Paris. One street back from the Champs Elseyee, it was still very quiet in the evening but close by to a number of restaurants and bars. Staff were friendly and attentive. Breakfast was very bust if you didn't get there first thing. The shower had a huge rain head and was very good in pressure and temperature. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Was terrific.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I took my 13 year old granddaughter to Paris during her spring break. After researching on TripAdvisor for a hotel, I chose Hotel Cecilia because of the positive reviews. We were not disappointed . The location is 2 streets from the Arc deTriomphe and Champs E’lysees and is also conveniently close to the metro and bus. This boutique hotel was charming and old world French. The room and bathroom were new and immaculate. We had a beautiful view from our balcony of the Arc.Breakfast was plentiful and had a typical Europeanselection. All services were excellent with Lucy being particularly helpful planning each day’s excursion.The price was fair for such a great location.Samir was helpful with our plans as I emailed with him before our trip.A special note about a ”find” during our stay. Around the corner on Avenue Carnot is a small restaurant L’Arc Food. It has a few tables and a LARGE menu of sandwiches, burgers, salads, pizza, crepes... and much more. Food is excellent and there is a young staff who opened this restaurant 2 years ago. Try it - you’ll love it!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel because I was doing the Paris Marathon. It’s literally 2 minutes from the arc de triomphe.The hotel is small and a very reasonable price for the location. The rooms are small and basic but very clean and the shower was wonderful! The breakfast is self service continental style. I took my own almond butter and almond milk because there wasn’t an option for vegan. The room service menu also has no vegan options.However you’re in Paris there are literally millions of places to eat! The staff were very helpful, they kept our bags after we checked out for several hours.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has the best location with a reasonable price. It is literally less than 2 mins to Arc de Triomphe. You can see it from the room window. The staffs are friendly and see how cute the room key is!! It is a real key!! Tons of restaurants around by. 20mins walk to Eiffel Tower.
