The room is standard European size, we have two ppl, we can handle it :)
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just a few meters walk away from Arc de Triomph and Champs Elysee.Hotel is reasonably priced and serves free breakfast.You can also buy hop on hop off bus tickets at the reception.Cons: Quite small rooms.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You would be pushed to stay any closer to the Arc De Triomphe ! My daughter special request was to see the Paris icon ... so I booked Hotel Cecilia. Literally ... you walk outside the front door of 'Cecilia' ... and there it is :-) ... the Champs Elysee just round the corner ... Metro a stones throw away.The hotel itself has a certain cute quiet charm (the Christmas decoration were v nice) ... and the included breakfast was better than most. Enjoyed a three day stay here ...
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location, and reasonably priced but there was no one on staff when needed. Our room was very cold and my husband was ill which practically ruined our one day trip to Paris. We called for assistance, to secure additional bed covering or help with the heating unit but no one picked up the phone. We also called for room service but the front desk clerk was not able to assist us. Eventually I had to walk out of the hotel to bring food back to room.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you arrive you see the Arc de Triomphe. The staff is welcoming you with a smile.The location is perfect, close to everything in walking distance. The hotel is clean and no noise of the streets. If you are in the summer I advise to take the room with the balcony.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Hotel Cecilia for four days after touring Normandy and the Loire Valley. The location is perfect because it is close to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Elysées with many good restaurants and shopping within 5 minutes of the hotel. “Le Bus Direct” bus stop is one block away-convenient if you need transportation to the airport. The hotel is on a quiet street not frequented by a lot of tourists. The staff speaks good English and are very helpful and nice.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my boyfriend Sept 30 - Oct 2. Mind you, we are Americans. And in AMERICA, if you stay at a hotel and put the Do Not Disturb sign up, that usually is a hint to housekeeping that we don't want you coming into our room. So I left some of my items out thinking they would be safe. WRONG!!! I had wrapped my retainers up and put them NEXT TO my contact lens case. When I came home from a long day out, I came to find the room had been cleaned and my retainers TOSSED! I confronted management about it and all they did was send me to a DEAD END of a company who takes care of their liability insurance. This BS company said that they would not consider MY LOSS as ANY LIABILITY AT ALL. It's not my fault some dumb employee didn't KNOW ANY BETTER and thought my retainers were TRASH! They were next to something that wasn't TRASH and YOU SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN IN THE ROOM IN THE FIRST PLACE. WORST PLACE EVER. WORST SERVICE EVER. They are ABSOLUTELY REFUSING to pay ANY AMOUNT OR OWN UP TO THEIR MISTAKE. They were NOT supposed to COME IN IN THE FIRST PLACE WHEN THE SIGN SAID DO NOT DISTURB. Now, I have to pay close to $1000 OUT OF POCKET to get a new set of retainers. Moral of the Story: DON'T STAY HERE UNLESS YOU WANT YOUR STUFF THROWN AWAY AND NOT HAVE ANY RESTITUTION WHATSOEVER.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Cecelia was a very comfortable hotel, great breakfast, staff was very nice and accommodating Excellent location to walk and to site seeing buses, Love Michaela at front desk she also helped us with reservations and recommended restaurants and shopping in the area . She was so helpful and friendly Would definitely stay again !
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our recent stay was so bad that I had to go back to check the reviews because this couldn't possibly be the same hotel! The entire street and all transportation was being shut down the next day for Armistice Day. We were informed of this after check in. When we asked the front desk person how we could get to the airport for our flight she said she didn't know. She offered no assistance with our situation. I have never had someone in the hospitality be so dismissive. Hours later we emailed the hotel and someone arranged a car hire that we would meet several blocks away. When we returned from dinner we asked the front desk where do we meet this car and what the name of the service was. He said ask in the morning. We were in disbelief that he won't answer such a simple question. In addition to the rude employees the walls were paper thin. We could clearly hear every word of the phone conservation in the room next to us. An email that we sent to the hotel that addressed our problems and concerns to this day has not been answered. We certainly won't be back to this hotel and do not recommend it to others.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room is very comfy and clean. Close walking distance to RER and bus stations. Arc de Triomphe is just around the corner. Cafe and shopping areas is all nearby as well. Lido is within walking distance as well.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 4 nights with my family from October 9, 2018.In the connecting room of Room № 32 · 33, I was deeply impressed by the Arc de Triomphe which I can see from the balcony.The room was clean and cozy, and all the family liked Cecilia.It is 3 minutes walk from the direct bus stop, Metro station, the location is the best. If you walk about 5 minutes in the opposite direction to the Arc de Triomphe, supermarkets(Monoprix) are conveniently located.It is a pity that there is no refrigerator in the room, but we were able to spend comfortable and calm time by being aided by friendly staff.I will definitely come back. Thank you!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the pleasure of spending four nights at this lovely hotel situated right in the heart of Paris overlooking the Arc De Triomphe. The room was well appointed with large BATH room which my wife loved. Individual air conditioning, good sized rooms, excellent breakfast to start the day, all was great in the hotel. The staff were ALWAYS very helpful booking tables and taxis for us so we could not wish for more from a hotel. The staff also recommended the "Le Hide" restaurant just around the corner which was a great eatery on the doorstep. A five star hotel with three star prices: a gem in central Paris. We would definitely visit again...
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arc de Triomphe & Champs-Elysées is at your doorstep- an excellent location with clean modern rooms. The shower is excellent and the rooms are a good size for Paris. The buffet breakfast is very nice - a variety of pastries, cold meats, fruit, cereals and lots of delicious cheese.The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, we arrived early in the morning after a long flight and they checked us in by 9am even though official check in time was 2pm! We were very impressed, would definitely recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great just walking to arc de triumph and metro.Easy access to everywhere and friendly staff.However the rooms are not noise isolated and the view of the room was other rooms windows!!!But totally satisfied with hotel and the breakfast.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at Cecilia's in the late evening unaware of our immediate surroundings. We checked in and met the accommodating concierge and went for a late evening stroll. Out the front door and round a corner and we were stopped in our tracks by the floodlit beauty of "Le Arc de Triomphe". In the distance was the Eiffel Tower beaming across the city. The hotel was so convenient for our weekend in the love capital of Europe. The room was smart enough and the breakfast was enticing and varied. Staff excellent and the shower worked! When we return it will be an ideal spot to explore those parts of Paris we still are to uncover. The tour buses start on the doorstep.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was ideal for our weekend in Paris. Great location that was right beside the Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe, but on a quieter street so you really don't realise how close you are! (There was double glazing on our balcony door too which definitely helps) Very boutique-like lounge/breakfast area that has a bar and piano with lovely comfy chairs. Unfortunately we didn't see anyone play during our stay -that really would have made it 5*!Room was spotless and had everything we needed. Shower was excellent. Reception is 24hr so doesn't matter when you arrive or leave which is always great to know.Breakfast was really good, lots of pasties, yoghurt, fruit, ham and cheese so something everyone! The only downside, and a small one at that, is the keys to the rooms are quite fiddly so can be a little noisy to enter and leave. But other than I really recommend for a comfortable stay that is in a great location. Good value for money.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Got lucky when I found a great deal for a single queen bed at this hotel. Everything was excellent and reception was very helpful. Also walking distance to a lot of great spots in paris! I highly recommend
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just got back from a five days stay at this hotel, and I cant say enough good things about it. A beautiful little place, classically furnished and decorated, in a nice building close to the Arc De Triomphe. The room we stayed at wasn't so little as I expected after reading about Paris hotels, the bathroom was spacious with two sinks (his-and-her) and even a bathtub. There was an air dryer in the bathroom (no mini fridge in the room though). The room had air-conditioning (which was crucial at the time of our visit) and a small balcony overlooking the Arc De Triomphe. This leads me to the biggest advantage of the hotel - the location. Five minutes walk to and from a central metro line, five minutes from the direct bus stop that takes you to and from the airport, ten minutes to the Champs Elysees. Being so close to the Arc made it so easy to locate and to reach. The area is full of shops, restaurants and cafes. Though our room was facing the street and giving us a lovely view of the Arc, no noises came through when the window was closed. The staff was very kind, answering all our questions and willing to assist in whatever we needed, especially a blond lady at reception whose name I unfortunately don't know. And though our reservation through a booking agency said it was "room only" and no breakfast, it was actually included in the price. We enjoyed a selection of bread and pastry, cheese, sausages, yogurts and cereals. The hotel was key to my good time in Paris and I would most definitely go back when I visit the city again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Made our third trip to watch the final stage of the Tour de France. We stayed at Hotel Cecilia again this year. This year we stayed for 11 nights. Room is small but clean. Continental breakfeast is included. Close to Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees, Metro, buses, cafes. . . Poncelet market is close by. Location is convenient for day trips. This year we took day trips by train to London, Strasbourg and Reims (chanpagne area).
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yet another stay at this hotel and still nothing to complain about. The staff are all very friendly and welcoming. The rooms are lovely and clean, and very reasonably sized for Paris. The breakfast room is clean and fresh and a good variety of typical continental breakfast. I look forward to returning there again in the near future.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The bed was soooo comfortable. The location was perfect. The staff could not have been more attentive and cordial.Especially Mrs. Lucie at the reception knows his job.Very nicely decorated interiors of the hotel.There wasn't much to dislike.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Hotel Cecilia in Paris for 6 nights from July 24 to 31, 2018 and watched the final stage of the Tour de France. The hotel was a perfect choice for watching the bike race. The Arch de Triumph was within eye sight from the hotel. I arrived early in the morning and fully expected to wait for my room to be ready. To my surprise, the room was ready and I checked in to catch up on sleep after an all night flight. My room was perfect for one person. Comfortable bed, nice flat screen TV, personal balcony, great free WiFi, modern bathroom with walk in shower. Now for the free daily breakfast. OMG, what a great perc! Pastries, cheeses, 4 types of meats, dry cereal, yogurt, juices and a wonderful coffee machine that makes every kind of coffee drink with the push of a button. Beautiful, spacious dining room so I never felt cramped. This was one of the best hotel finds yet! When I go back to Paris, I will stay there again. BTW, the staff was remarkable! So helpful, so informative and so eager to please their guests! There are not enough stars available to do justice to this great Paris hotel!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay here for 3 nights when we were in Paris this month. Great little hotel ... We got a fabulous price booking through Expedia. Its Europe, so rooms are always smaller than what one is used to in the US. But the room was clean, the housekeeping did a great job with cleaning our room and washroom everyday. The best part of this hotel is the location. It's just a block or two from the Arc de Triomphe. Ther metro is less than a five minute walk and that's the best way to get around Paris. Plenty of Ubers in the area so you're also never waiting around if you're going out later at night. The hotel staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about the best places to eat etc and gave us some great suggestions. Tons of places to eat and shop at, all within walking distance or a short hop on the metro. In all, this is a great place to stay and won't break the bank. The free breakfast buffet is definitely a plus... decent selection of food.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed just the one night, having booked several months in advance: two rooms - one for us and one for our son and his girlfriend. The reception staff were friendly- they could speak English but appreciated our attempt to speak French. The room were clean and the bed comfortable. View was down to the central courtyard. Breakfast was European and good quality ham and cheese, as well as pastries. Bar was basic. And just 100m from Arc de Triomphe. €350 for two room for the night. Great value for such a central location.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 1 night , 2 days, great room with plenty of space on 1st floor, view of L'Arc de Triomphe out of window. We were street side but no noise when window shut. We had really comfortable bed and large bathroom.Breakfast is included as a buffet style. Lots of choice of Toast, pastries, cold cuts, cereals , yoghurts and fruits. Good choice of hot drinks. The staff were very attentive replenishing food stocks. We left our rucksack in storage there and collected later, very simple. Also very close to Le Direct bus stop for CDG airport transfers.We will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are here now for five nights. Our room is toward back of hotel away from the street and it is surprisingly quiet. Very clean. The hotel is in an excellent location, we have been walking to most of our destinations. The staff is polite and professional and speak very good English. We are well pleased with Hotel Cecelia.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location near to the Arc de Triomphe which makes it easy to find after a day out sightseeing in Paris. The room was bigger than expected for Paris and the staff were very friendly. It was only a mile from Bois de Boulongne which was nice to go running in.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has a great location, wonderful staff, clean rooms, and a nice continental breakfast, all for a reasonable price. We arrived at 7 in the morning after an overnight flight and they were wonderful to get us a room ready as soon as they could. The included breakfast with a fresh fruit salad was most welcome and the nicest included breakfast of our trip due to the quality of the items available. We found no faults. Thank you for a lovely start to our vacation.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Hotel Cecilia for 4 nights and we were very satisfied about almost everything there:very clean rooms and restaurant/reception, very nice, friendly and professional stuff, good breakfast and perfect location. The only thing we did not like so much was the size if the room - it is very small. But we knew this before, so it was our choice. We preferred to choose a smaller room but a good location and good price instead a larger one, somewhere far from center, with bigger price. Hotel Cecilia offers a very good value for money.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights whilst visiting Paris for the Tennis.Was a fabulous location. Only a couple of minutes walk to the Metro and only 10 minutes to get to Roland Garros.Lovely spacious bedroom and bathroom, great continental breakfast and staff were so friendly. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was at a conference and wanted a hotel near by. It’s right near the arch and a short walk to Metro. You can even get luggage back and forth from metro! The rooms are large compared to other Paris hotels. Clean and very comfortable beds. Ask to be in back as if you like to sleep with a window open it’s noisy out front. The room on ground floor would be great for elderly as shower has a shelve you can sit in. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The personnel were all very friendly.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Happened on this hotel during a recent search. Glad I did. Price was fantastic and included a fabulous breakfast. Location is a block from the Arc de Triomphe which I could see from my room (425). Classic old style design was warm and welcoming. Will certainly return.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our 2nd time in Paris and 1st time at Hotel Cecilia. We really appreciate the centralized location to explore by foot, metro or bus.After a red-eye flight, we took the "Le Bus Direct" Rt2 from CDG and it dropped us off 1 block away from the hotel. We arrive early (10am) and our room was ready. This was great. It allowed us to freshen up before we head out to explore.The room was small but comfortable. The bathroom was bright and well equipped. Wifi and tv worked great. During our stay the hotel had all their a/c units upgraded and not working yet. It was not hot yet but I'm sure they will be working by the time you read this review.The breakfast area was spacious enough for the hotel and had plenty of stuff for everyone. You can find fresh fruit, bake goods, dairy products and cold cuts.The front desk staff was very helpful providing information and suggestions for nearby restaurants. Next time (There will be a next time!) we are in Paris we will stay here.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: View to the Arc de Triomphe, pubs and cafes close by, steps to metro. Was a great place to stay for our two nights in Paris. The breakfast was also very nice and the people at the front desk were pleasant and helpful. Would stay there again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This must be our fifth or sixth stay at Hotel Cecilia. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris. This time we were a bit alarmed to see scaffolding outside: but as we always elect to stay at the back this had no impact on us. In fact we heard no disturbance from renovations anywhere in the hotel.Why do we keep coming back? Well, as most reviewers point out, the location couldn't be bettered. Close proximity to the 'Le Bus' (used to be 'Les Cars') stop for airport transfers; excellent restaurants nearby; spectacular views of the Arc de Triomphe and a floodlit Eiffel Tower - all real plus points.Then there is the hotel itself. We have always found it very quiet, despite the prime location, and always sleep well in its comfortable beds. Rooms are a good size, with fresh décor and immaculate housekeeping. Breakfast is a continental buffet, not elaborate, but everything is of good quality (bread, pastries and fresh fruit salad exceptional), pots of tea or coffee are brought to your table, and buffet items are regularly and quickly topped up so everything is very fresh.Finally, all staff are welcoming and efficient, and seem to take pleasure in ensuring that your stay is a happy one.We shall certainly be back!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful the hotel is filled with character, comfortable, close to the arc de triomphe and the metro stations. Also close to the bus that runs from the airport.If you ever thought of taking a long weekend in paris, this is the perfect hotel to call your home base. No car everything is an easy walk or metro ride.Highly recommend!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for three nights to explore Paris before returning home, and I will never stay any where else in Paris! (I actually just booked our next stay, and panicked when Expedia said they were sold out for Bastille Day. Emailed the hotel and got lucky that there was availability for a family room!!)The room for this trip was a standard room with a double bed (no kids with us for this trip). The room was pretty basic, but was very clean and comfortable. Had a balcony with a view of the courtyard. The room was also a decent size for being in Paris.The breakfast was fresh and very tasty. Staff was very attentive, and brought coffee refills before we even ran out. Excellent service. The hotel staff was also incredibly friendly, and although I speak some French, they spoke English as well, which was helpful when I struggled. One of the best aspects of this hotel was the location!!! Right down the street from the Arc de Triomphe, literally, and close to the train, buses, taxis, etc. Also close enough to walk to the Eiffle Tower if you don't mind a 30 minute stroll with some awesome shops and cafes along the way.Last, but not least, the price for what you get can't be beat! I love this hotel so much, I was hesitant to review it because I don't want it to get too popular.. I might not be able to reserve a room next time!! Thank you for the amazing stay Hotel Cecilia! :)
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed one night at Hotel Cecilia. There was some refurbishment going on but since I was only there for the night it was fine. Great location. The room that I stayed (no. 18) simple, clean line, comfortable bed and good size considered the location. Breakfast was continental style, so not hot breakfast. The only thing I would say was the shower water pressure was a bit low but again it was fine. Overall a pleasant stay.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very noisy even late at night.. the bedroom was not very confortable, no A/C working, poor in fournitures.. the building is under renovation so building works start in the morning, and it becomes very noisy again I will avoid this hotel in the future
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was beautiful and the location was perfect. The breakfast was okay but good value. I had wish they had a "Do not disturb" sign to place on the outside of the door because the maid had opened the door in the morning. Not a big deal, but an easy fix. Definitely a nice place to stay for a weekend away with a loved one:).
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have chosen Hotel Cecilia mainly because of the ideal location to the conference venue where I was on business, but close proximity to Arc De Triomphe makes it an ideal location for everyone. The hotel is located on one of the quieter avenues, but offers short 2 min walk to the Arc and about 30 min walk to the Seine and Eiffel Tower.The hotel itself is quiet, single room I booked offered surprisingly enough space and decent size clean and rather modern bathroom. The room itself was rather simple but clean, although it had a slight odor which I had to minimize with a scented candle. Hotel offers good continental breakfast with good choice of cold cuts, cheese and pastries, fresh fruits and juices of course.Hotel staff is very nice, always ready to help. You are asked to leave your keys at the hotel desk if you are not in, which some of my friends found strange, but I have seen this before.Overall, excellent location and value for the money spent.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is pleasant, the staff are excellent, the breakfast is simple and standard (standard European) but fresh and clean, the room is a bit small and cramped, but definitely satisfying the needs, warm water all the time, very close to the Arc de Triomphe and centrally located.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great value for the money. Near metro, and neighborhood has nice shops, bistros, and restaurants. Room was clean, roomy, and comfortable- small balcony has view of L'Arc de Triomphe. Staff was friendly and helpful. They responded quickly and pleasantly to questions or requests, made dinner reservations, and provided good information that made our stay more pleasant. Good breakfast. Poor housekeeping one morning but this was corrected promptly. A/C went out but portable unit was supplied and it was fixed the next day. Only problem was the elevator went out the 2nd day and was still out four days later when we left. I would definitely stay here again. A little far away from the old city but good access to metro. Key part of a great Paris visit.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In the heart of the city. 2 km walk from Eiffel Towers. Close to food joints. Very quiet rooms and internet is very good. The morning breakfast is fantastic with various options.I like the bar in the lobby for casual evening get together and freaking out.In short nice hotel and value for money
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Couldn't ask for better0, when we didn't like the room we had booked they moved us into a room more to our liking. Breakfast included was so easy & comfotable & the staff went out of their way to help. That is all the staff whether front of house or behind.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location & is great value. The room was a bit small, not really enough room for 2 large suitcases, however it was very clean. The staff were all lovely & the breakfast was more than enough. Only downside was the airconditioner was not working so the room got a bit hot & stuffy. We were told it was being fixed however this did not happen whilst we were there. Stayed 3 nights.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On our recent trip to Paris we only stayed here one night and wish we had stayed there all week. It was very charming and clean. Room was nice size with beautiful modern bathroom. Staff was very nice and a delicious complimentary breakfast got us off to a good start in morning. Was within site of the Arc de Triumph. Would definitely recommend this hotel in downtown Paris
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What I liked about this hotel:1. Location. It is only a few minutes from Etoile and also a few minutes from the bus stop to and from both CDG and Orly airports. It is about a 15-20 minute walk to the Congress Centre and therefore convenient for those who attend a conference there. Needless to say, a metro station is also a few minutes away. The area is safe and pleasant. 2. Room. I had a room 54 on the 5th floor with a small terrace and a view on the street (with a part of the Arc de Triomphe also visible). The room was very spacious (also the bathroom!), especially taking into account the standards of the Parisian 3-star hotel. There was even a comfortable armchair and a large writing desk, so I could do some work on my computer. 3. Value for money (affordability). Paris is a very expensive city, but this gem of a hotel was surprisingly affordable (though not cheap by any means). 4. Staff. They were generally polite and pleasant. 5. Breakfast. This was a buffet-style breakfast served in pleasant surroundings. There could be more variety of food on offer, but for a 3-star hotel in Paris, this is probably as good as it gets. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel and would consider staying there again on my next visit to this fabulous city.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located very close to the Arc de Triomphe. Lots of restaurants within walking distance, both cheaps eats and more expensive places. The Metro is just a couple of blocks away so getting to the rest of Paris is fast and easy. The Hotel itself is quaint, the rooms are clean and the staff friendly. The breakfast is very nice with a variety of food, although I never did see any eggs. Good value.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I spent 4 nights here in May on her first-ever time in Paris (it was my first time back in 30 years). The rate was reasonable and the amenities, especially daily breakfast, were wonderful for the price. The front desk is staffed round-the-clock and nearly all the staff spoke English well enough that we had no problems communicating. The hotel is very close to the Arc du Triomphe, which I worried would mean we were in an overly touristy area. All it turns out to mean is that the hotel is very used to international tourists and is happy to serve them. The breakfast buffet included endless amounts of cafe au lait, cheese, ham, fruit, bread and croissants. The lobby was lovely and the room (especially compared to the "double" we had at a budget hotel in London) was spacious enough for two of us to feel comfortable, with a full modern bath (with a tub/shower you could actually turn around in without banging a body part into a fixture!). The location was ideal to hop on the Metro to go anywhere, and just a block or so from the Champs Elysees. We felt safe and comfortable and the staff was friendly and kind. The hotel is on a street with a beer bar on one side and a full-service restaurant immediately across. We also found a small convenience store to buy fruit, snacks and drinks just a few doors down. As newbies in Paris, we didn't spend much time in the room other than sleeping, so we didn't much care that the TV was terrible. Who goes to Paris to watch TV?
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have recently stayed for four nights with my husband at this lovely hotel and it far exceeded our expectations. Our room itself was not too big, this is expected in Paris but the bathroom was large, we had everything we needed, including a kettle with tea and coffee. We were at the front of the hotel on the fifth floor and our room had a balcony with a fantastic view of the Arc du Triumphe. The staff were lovely especially the waiters at breakfast.The Continental breakfast had plenty of choice and was constantly being topped up and there was never any problem for more tea or coffee. Great location iclose to the Arc du Triumphe and Champs Elysees, metro station two minutes walk. If we return to Paris would definately stay here again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was everything I could ask for. The location was fantastic, a minutes walk away from L'Arc de Triomphe. The hotel itself was very nice and the staff were very pleasant. We enjoyed the breakfast and found the breakfast staff to be very friendly. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We would definitely recommend this hotel and plan on staying here again when we return to Paris.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mother and I stayed in this hotel in March 2017 as a stopover from Australia to England. Room itself was not too big which is to expected in Paris but we did have our little balcony to step out onto and admire the view. The bathroom was large and included a nice deep bathtub. There were also two areas in the bathroom to 'get ready'. Handy when you have two ladies! The rooms were also warm. The staff were lovely especially the waiters at breakfast.The Continental breakfast was more than enough and there was never any problem for more tea or coffee. The location is fantastic. So close to the Arc de Triomphe and The Metro. The stop for the airport shuttle bus was only a five minute walk too.This was my mother's first time in Paris and loved Hotel Cecilia as it is not part of a large chain and didn't feel impersonal. We would stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great room - standard room, very spacious. We had bath/shower and the room had tea and coffee making. Very quiet room and comfortable bed. Breakfast was simple but more than enough. Loved the location, handy to underground but very easy to walk lots. Staff were always helpful. Would stay again and highly recommend.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was not cozy, it smelled toothpaste (which is not as awesome as you might think) and the room was not really clean. I had blood on my side of the sheet and it was a sheet, not a duvet. The air condition was really loud and sometimes made the same sound as a jacuzzi. The bathroom was nice though and the view from the 5th floor towards the Arc de triomphe is really really splendid. We only stayed here because of the HOP! strike, so if a nice room is not a priority, I would recommend this hotel. It is located only a few meters from the Arc de triomphe and Champs Elyesses.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: he location is FANTASTIC!! I never felt unsafe walking alone to the hotel late at night. Takes about 2 minutes to walk to the nearest metro (if you don't count the lights you have to cross). And 5 minutes walk to Champs-Élysées. The room was very clean, the Air conditioner was excellent in the hot Paris days. There were lots of different lights so you could choose how bright you wanted the room to be. My room had a bath and shower in one. Very nice. Good Closet space. As I was staying alone, I kinda expected a small bed but turned out to be a huge bed, maybe queen size I think. There were hard wood floors and I LOVED IT!! much better than the carpets in American Hotels. They change all towels every day and make sure you have extra soap by the sink. There is also soap to shower with that was very nice (I forgot mine at home)To walk to the nearest grocery store takes about 8-10 minutes, not that long.A very small problem, if you can call it that. If there is a "do not disturb" sign on your door, they cleaning staff still knocks on your door. I came to the hotel once at 5 am and went to bed at 6 am on Sunday morning. They knocked on the door at noon to see if they should clean. I was already up but what if I wanted to sleep longer? But as I say, very small problem but I wouldn't let this stop me at all from staying there again :) I would stay there again for sure if and when I travel again to Paris!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was in this hotel for a week in Paris, the staff is very nice and the hotel very cosy and cleanThe localization is PERFECT !! You are a step away from the Arc du Triomphe but away from all the madness and noise.The breakfast is simple, it was lacking the so typical baguettes, but apart from that it was good.I recommend and for sure I would be back here if I come to Paris again
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and found it to be excellent both in location and service.We were fortunately allowed to check in early and the reception staff were very helpful when we decided to get an additional room.Breakfast is a typical french fair with good bread, spreads, cheeses, juices and both tea and coffee.The keys are gorgeous and make you feel like you stepped back in a time a little. This hotel is within 2 minutes walk of the Arc de Triomphe and a metro station. I recommend it to all.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check out their website...the lobby is lovely. The rooms are quite plain but more spacious than others. They serve a continental breakfast which was quite good. The location was great. At the top end of the Arc de Triomphe which is where Champs Elysees begins, very close. Also check out La Placette for a great burger just down the street from the hotel. And around the corner a tiny but great French restaurant called Le Hide!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room was renovated and was very comfortable. The staff is always ready to help with any questions you may have. I find the hotel very centric and love to sit around Champs Elysee whenever returning from a day of sight seeing, bring the hotel a couple of blocks from it.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a nice balcony room on the fifth floor with an amazing view. The room was comfortable and the bathroom large and modern. The location was perfect with a short walk to the metro and Air France bus pick up spot. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly and lobby comfortable with several large chairs available. Breakfast was good and included assorted Pastries, ham, cheese, fruit and beverages. I can't say enough about the location...not only for the ease of transportation, but for the nice cafes' that were a short walk away. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This really is a great hotel with wonderful helpful staff, in a great location just down from the Arc De Triomphe (which is amazing for getting buses to anywhere in Paris). the rooms are not huge but clean and comfortable and totally fine. The bar and breakfast area downstairs are really attractive and atmospheric. All this and i think it is very good value. I would love to bring the family back to stay here.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been staying at the Cecilia whenever I am in Paris a few times each year for the past five years or so and have always had a lovely stay. The rooms and bathrooms are a decent size, clean and always neat. The people are lovely! Very helpful always at the reception, ready to assist with whatever you ask of them and will never hesitate to lend a helping hand. The location is absolutely fantastic - close to the metro and bus lines, with the airport bus just up the road. Nice cafes and restaurants around, with most of the sights of Paris within easy walking or metro distance. A nice breakfast too! Despite many offers to choose other hotels, I remain a Cecilia loyalist as it is a lovely little hotel offering good value for money with very nice people. Oh, and check out the room key! Its from another era.... and the view of the arc de triumph at night is stunning. I would unhesitatingly recommend the Cecilia.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We took the metro to Charles de Gaulle Étoile and exited on to Av. Carnot (follow the no. 5 exit in the station) Once outside, the moment you turn you can see the Arc de Triomphe...follow the road round to the left on to the Mac Mahon and you'll see the Hotel Cécilia in front of you on the left. We were greeted by the nicest bloke! So friendly and so informative. We checked in to room 24 on the 2nd floor and it was great. Lovely room with a view of the Arc. Just perfect. Nice bedroom, nice bathroom. Comfy and spacious. Nice shower too. We slept well and went down for breakfast in the morning. A good spread of breads, cheeses, hams, fruits, yoghurts and cereals. A constant supply of coffee was great too. Again, really friendly staff to help and assist you should you want/need it. The only downside was that in our room there was no wifi. I don't know if it just didn't reach up that high or what. It was fine in the lobby though, great connection...but in our room, nothing. Not that this was bad, I was on holiday so wasn't in dire need of it, but I do like to read the news in bed in the morning and I was unable to do so. It's cool though, I would certainly recommend this hotel to anybody. It's a great location and it's got everything that you could possibly want!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and i have just returned from a 2 night break in Paris to celebrate her 16th birthday. I chose the Hotel Cecilia based on price, location and Trip Advisor reviews and definitely made the right decision. Given that we were in Paris (not the cheapest place in the world), literally a few steps away from the Arc de Trionmphe and around 5 minutes walk from the Champs Elysee, the Cecilia was very good value. Our room was small but very clean and fresh and to be honest we didn't come to Paris to spend any time in our room other than to sleep so it was a non issue. The bathroom was a good size and again very clean. With a 16 year old, Wifi was a must and it worked well. Breakfast was included and was very pleasant. I would not hesitate to recommend this lovely wee place to anyone and I would definitely return.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My second stay at the Cecilia, great value in a wonderful area. Centrally located and right by the Etoille Metro Stop.. The staff is very helpful and accommodating. We arrived early morning and got right into our room. Will book again!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent stay. Hotel is very well located near the arc de thriomphe. From my window I could see it. Easy to go from ORY airport or fom CDG to the hotel. You can take the Le bus Direct shuttle from these airports and the stop is just 200 yards from the hotel. Also to go back is easy. Metro is just near the hotel, not more than 5 minutes walking. Not a fancy hotel but really enjoyable. Decoration at lobby and breakfast room was very nice. Good wifi. Good breakfast. Not so many options but very good for my taste. Breads, coffee and milk, hot chocolate, cold cuts, juices, yogurt and cereal available. No scrambled eggs and no sausage. Good room. I stayed at the 4th floor and noise was not a problem. Calm street with bars, mini market, drug store and shops around. Elevator is very tiny and barely fit 4 people. Big bathroom and excellent shower. Safe inside closet. Good heater. For the price, location, friendly staff and amenities, I will definitely come back.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spent 4 days at this hotel. Highly recommended. When we return to Paris we will stay here again. Friendly staff and right in central Paris. Breakfast very good and the room was comfortable. No issues at all.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a quad room, and it ended up being 2 rooms that linked together. Very spacious and clean! Can't beat the location either. Not cheap, but a reasonable price given the location. Awesome staff too!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for a quaint, boutique hotel in Paris, this is it!I took my daughter (9) to Europe for Spring Break and we had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Cecilia. My notes: - Steps away from the CDG-Etoile Metro station which is on both the RER A and 6 lines.- Arc and the Champs De Elysees are also right at your doorstep. This is a great home base for a visit to Paris. Not too far from the action but quiet. - We had a standard room which was pretty cozy. We didn't come to Paris to sit in a hotel room so it met our needs perfectly. - The staff were very friendly, helpful and didn't judge my terrible French! They spoke English, too. I cannot wait for my return visit to Paris and Hotel Cecilia!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Short stay this time in this traditionally styled hotel. I am disabled and the reception staff were very helpful, ordering taxis, bus tickets and getting information for us. We went for a Standard room, the cheapest, as we were only staying two nights and just needed somewhere to sleep. The room overlooked the back of the block but this meant it was very quiet, no sound from the nearby traffic hurtling around the Arc de Triumph.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have the pleasure of going to Paris every year and this is by far the best hotel I have stayed in - excellent value for money. Room was clean and comfortable and large by Paris standards with tea and coffee facilities in room - a rareity in my experience! Breakfasts were good, the hotel charming and the service friendly and efficient. I will be back!
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this little boutique hotel. The staff are professional and attentive, they speak fairly fluent English. The hotel itself is quite beautiful. The location is perfect for travellers spending a day or more in Paris. I feel this hotel would also be great for business stays, strong internet. There was a small communication glitch with cleaning staff our first day- the hotel attended to this promptly, so no issue there. Would stay again in Paris.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location. The staff - from front desk, housekeeping to the restaurant staff were all friendly. Breakfast was included. Beautifully decorated. The room was a good size- (we had a 'small' room) We've had such a lovely few days. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very nice. Staff are very cooperative and friendly. It is close to the arc and the Champselysees. The breakfast is good. Me and my freind enjoyed our stay so much and looking forward to return back.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Cecelia is located a couple of blocks from the Arc and a few blocks from the excellent Paris Metro. It is an old building that has had the interior modernized. The people at the front desk were very helpful in helping us see various of Paris. We stayed at the Cecelia for 5 days prior to going on an Insight Tour. The rates were reasonable and breakfast is included. As long as you do not need eggs, just about every other breakfast food was available - yogurt, granola, croissants, pastries, cheeses and ham were among the choices. The hotel is also within walking distance of several fine bistros I will be reviewing. The Cecelia also has free WiFi so I was able to listen to news reports from a station back in Wash D.C. along with checking email etc..
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Hotel Cecelia during the Christmas break for 4 nights. The location is very fantastic and the price was reasonable. We were so happy with the choice, that when we returned to Paris we stayed there again. The rooms were clean and spacious. It is right down from the Arc De Triomphe. We had a view room, but in order to see the Arc you have to lean out the window. It was nice to have a window that opened. The street can be a bit noisy, but there isn't much traffic at night and you are out exploring all day. The breakfast was filling with many choices. If needed, there is a laundry within walking distance.
hotelName:
5    Hotel Cecilia Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent one night during a cruise excursion. They were able to accommodate an early check-in and then a late check-out - thanks so much. The front desk folks were friendly and efficient. The room was on an upper floor and we found it to be pretty warm as Paris was just entering a sweltering phase. The air had to be on full to maintain comfort. Two huge, chilled bottles of water were a real saver.The room was comfortable with an oversized bathroom. Clean and very restful.Breakfast - a unique buffet with just about anything you could hope to enjoy for breakfast. The neighborhood was quiet, a few blocks to the nearest restaurant, a few blocks more to many, many museums.Would stay again.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is clean, eleglant and comfortable. Breakfast is excellent ! Comfortable quiet and a great location. Less than a mile from arch de triumph. Quiet, clean and comfortable. Staff is friendly, helpful as well as very knowledgeable.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff recommended a great restaurant for our first dinner in Paris. Very professional! They upgraded our room and we were very pleased with size(something we were concerned about). Slept very well!
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A truly fantastic stay at the Masion Astor in the 8th Arr.! The staff and service is lovely; friendly, helpful and responsive to any request. The true highlight and gem, is Fanny Suffert. She exudes the passion she obviously has for her position - a true service persona! Each morning at breakfast, Fanny made us feel welcome and treasured hotel guests. A seemingly small token, that we both, as non-French speakers, very much appreciated, was the time she took to speak to us in both French and English simultaneously. A really generous and welcoming touch. Maison Astor - you are privileged to have Fanny on your staff.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lot of guests complained about the AC and our AC was not working. We requested to stay in another room for the night since maintenance worker was not on site and they refused saying it's fully booked while actually not the case. We booked 2 rooms, both have practically no AC and we all had a hard time to sleep.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I visited Maison Astor Paris from 6th June for 3 nights. We were travelling for business reasons and to enjoy some time to look at a chateau. The hotel was in a really good location, one road back from the main road so it was a lovely walk to the Champs - Elysee, which meant we got to see lots and had a really good nights sleep. Really comfortable bed, nice bed linen, beautiful decor, nice fluffly towels and elegantly styled bathroom. I am quite a particular guest and found the hotel beautifully clean! We had champagne in the cute bar and ate every night (great menu - try the lamb rack) in the dining room which had a lovely glass ceiling. Breakfast was plentiful and staff were eager to assist with any request (i.e. me wanting my oranges sliced in sections etc!) Tickets were organised for the Eifel tower and we were pleased with the tour company. The conceirge and door staff were super we needed valet parking and they were super. (our French is not very good and they were most helpful). Reception staff were welcoming, efficient and speedy and the Maitre D in the restaurant was most helpful (one evening we asked for the lights to be lowered and they accommodated our request. We have stayed in numerous hotels in cities - we last stayed at the Shangri la when in Paris - but we enjoyed the Maison Astor Paris with it's boutique feel so much more. So much so we have booked to return on 1st August to celebrate my 50th Birthday - booking the rooftop suite and really looking forward to it so much now! Merci from the Mrs & Mr Ford.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been longing to write this review, as we travelled to Paris in March 2019, but only had the chance to do it now! It was a memorable experience, excellent 3-day stay and everything was beyond our expectation. The location was superb, especially for travellers who love to explore the city by foot. The room was extra comfortable, proper bed prepared for an extra person and had great ambience. The hotel design is modern and chic, and culturally-rich at the same time. The front desk staff spoke eloquent English, but the most exemplary were the breakfast lounge staff. They were very warm and welcoming, upon realising that we are devout Muslims, they advised on which food we should avoid and offered for specially-prepared omelette for us. The concierge staff helped us with the direction along the city, and booked us a nice ride to Disneyland on our departure day. The money were well-spent, worth every Euro and I will not hesitate to come back for more.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were expecting an experience much nicer than what we had. Most of the staff were nice and helpful while some made us feel like ugly Americans. We're used to mediocre treatment in Paris but this was something less.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It has the taste of Paris in rooms, reception Small, clean, tiny, tidy hotel, however the price was very high compared to breakfast available Bread, croissant, chocolate & cheese was perfect but overall break fast variety can be better Staff were helpful however, the bags was waiting to 20 min. To get it down, so I got it down by my self Location is not the nearest to metro / bus station but I have no problem to walk.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second stay at the Maison Astor this year, with this stay being for 5 nights, as we exhibited at the Paris International Airshow (Le Bourget). The hotel has a wonderful location within easy walking distance to the Champs-Élysées, the Louvre museum and Rue Saint-Honoré with it's amazing high end fashion stores etc. The hotel has recently been extensively refurbished and the room I stayed in (715) had a queen bed and functional, if narrow, bathroom. The room did have one major additional feature...a view of the Eiffel Tower. It wasn't the most amazing view, but it was pretty cool to start the day seeing sunlight on the Eiffel Tower and finishing it with a view of the tower illuminated at night. We didn't dine at the hotel (think about it...we're in Paris!) but we did sample the bar most evenings and the staff were very courteous and reasonably prompt with the drinks (the bar tender also serves the hotel restaurant and on some evenings it took a short while to locate him). The breakfast was well presented and tasty (including a combination of European meat and cheeses with fresh bread, in addition to cooked eggs and typical US fare) additionally the hotel kindly moved up the start of breakfast servings for us, to accommodate our early departure for the Airshow. Overall an excellent location on a quiet side street in a central Paris location, with attentive and professional staff and it's a Hilton property, so that always helps with the Hilton Honors Points accrued :)
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is part of the Hilton group but as a Gold member who has stayed in Hilton’s around the world this did not live up to the Hilton name. The room was very small (even for Paris) and the bathroom was tired with some maintenance issues. The service was, at best, average. For me it is the service that makes me choose Hilton time and time again. Shame about this one. There is a lot of choice in Paris and this disappointed.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stay at Hilton’s almost exclusively because I like a hotel in Europe with a bit of spaciousness , not the case here. Very nicely appointed hotel but considerably overpriced for the value, the Marriott Moxy chain is a better all around deal. Rooms are basically the same size and amenities ( Moxy being on the modern side) but the Moxy is considerably less expensive which leaves more money to do other things . Not a terrible place to stay but the value for points or cash is weak.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pluses: good bed, all very clean; good to have onsite restaurant for dinner after long day of excursions (some hotels of this smaller size in Paris do not). Breakfast good. Head concierge (older man, sorry I didn’t get his name) was kind and knowledgeable. Minuses: neighborhood is kind of a dead zone, 15-30 min walk from anything. Younger concierge was unimaginative, narrow, and judgy. Hotel a good place for first time visitors but more Americans than in our home US city (joking but you get the point, you won’t feel like you are in Paris and some might like that).
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose the Maison Astor because it seemed a good points value, and that assumption proved true. This is a good, European boutique hotel in a terrific central location. If you are a Diamond, it’s a solid choice. The rooms are adequate, if unremarkable, the (included for Diamonds) breakfast is pretty good, if not amazing, and the service is excellent, if not beyond what we should expect from Hilton.I still miss the old Hilton L’Arc de Triumph, now the non-Hilton L’Hotel Du Collectonneur. The rooms there were unbelievable (for Europe), the Executive Longe was the best in the world, the service was “wow,” and Hilton Diamonds were treated like royalty. Don’t expect anything like that at the Maison Astor (not that any of us actually deserve it). No exec suite (of course, in a Curio), no real room upgrade, and no acknowledgement of your preferred status beyond water bottles. For the most part, you’ll just be another, well treated guest in whatever type of room you paid for. And that’s good enough.Overall, the Maison Astor is a good Diamond find and a great way to use points. The location is so perfect that you’ll forget what you’re not getting in the hotel. It’s an ideal combination: a quiet spot in the middle of everything. The rooms are clean and up to date, and this hotel has few flaws, certainly none fatal. You won’t be blown away, but you will be comfortable.A few suggestions for management. First, get plugs in the bathrooms. In these small rooms, there’s no place to use as an alternative, and my wife was really frustrated with hair drying and styling options as a result. Second, add instructions to the non-standard (even for Europe) thermostat, which took me longer to figure out than any I’ve encountered globally. I half wonder if many reviewers who complain about HVAC problems (no AC) just never figured out how to turn it on. I showed a neighbor in a nearby room how to get his room cool after he complained that his open window wasn’t doing the job. (For MA guests, you have to turn on the power, switch to cool mode, select your preferred temperature AND turn on the fan.) The showers could also use some improvement. The hand wands don’t go high enough and the doors are to small for North American style bathing, and since nearly all of you customers are American or British, that matters. I could offer a few more, but these are the easiest to address. Small quibbles for a good hotel.The closest Metro stop is Madeleine, and it’s about .5 miles from the hotel. Central Paris is easily walkable from the hotel, and everything else is a short Metro or Uber away. From Madeleine, it’s just a few stops to the train station (Gar), from which you can make day trips out of the city (like Versailles or Fontainebleau).The easiest and cheapest way to get to the MA from CDG is to catch the Opera Roissybus between terminals 2E and 2F. It’s .8 miles (15 minutes) walk from the hotel, costs just €12/person, and makes the trip in less than an hour, which is about as good as you can do. Once at Opera, take Rue de Mathurins, then stay straight onto Rue Roquepine, then tun left onto Rue D’Astorg. The Maison Astor will then be 1/2 block on your right. Very simple.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great hotel located in the 8th arr placing you ideally close for all main attractions Paris has to offer.The hotel is modern Paris chick but still holds its elegance. The rooms are overly big but you do not expect that and they are equipped with all amenities required including wonderful bed linens.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife & I stayed here for two nights upon arriving to Paris. Full disclosure - I've been a Hilton HHonors member for almost two decades and being able to use points for this was the primary reason for choosing this hotel. Our thoughts on the property were:Location: Great - you can easily walk to the fashion district or a take a bit longer walk to many of the famous Paris landmarks. It should also be noted there is a Monoprix store nearby. If you're not familiar with them, they are a major retail chain that is the equivalent of a Target in the US. We went there the first day to stock up on water, soda and snacks which was much less expensive than getting them from the hotel.Staff: Great - Fluent in English; friendly, were very helpful in booking our transportation to the train station for our departureRoom: Good. We had an interior facing room which kept noise to a minimum. Room was nice, looked recently renovated and stylish. My two criticisms of the room were the shower and the bed. If you look at images of the bathroom, you can see that the shower is only half covered. The problem is that there is an opening in the seam that separates the glass and the wall which led to some big puddles on the floor after showering. Also, the mattress was soft. My wife likes that, but I prefer a firmer mattress, so my back was pretty sore after just two nights. Food: Very Good. Breakfast was included with our reservation. The selection was pretty typical, eggs, sausage/bacon, potatoes, fresh fruit, cereal and pastries. Everything was tasty, but nothing was amazing. We did not have any other meals here.I would stay there again using points, but I do think it would be a bit expensive if I was paying cash.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, REALLY comfortable beds. Our concierge Alexandre was very helpful. Breakfast was very nice and much more expansive than most Hilton properties in US. Rooms were average size for Europe. Elevator was tiny but so is the hotel so never an issue.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay here for my mother’s birthday- we reserved 5 rooms in all and were very pleased with all of them. We wanted a hotel with an onsite bar as a place to rendezvous our group of 8 when we were headed to dinner etc, and this hotel had a charming bar/lounge. The concierge we worked with (Stefan) was awesome and knew exactly what we wanted when we used him for recommendations- from a bistro near St Germain to a coordinated trip to Giverny! (This hotel also worked well for travelling with children!)
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Following check-in on May 31 and using an Amex card, I traveled to a nearby restaurant when the credit card was rejected. This was humiliating to no end. I then called Amex and inquired about the problem. It seems the hotel placed a hold for double the amount of the expected charges which placed the card over its credit limit.I went to the front desk and brought the problem to their attention. The lady there told me there was nothing they could do. The duty manager then came out and suggested there was nothing they could do as well other than process the check out early. He thought that would release the hold.The next day, I saw that nothing had changed with my account. The double hold was still there and my card remained useless. I called Amex again and they gave me a special merchant number for the hotel to call and release the hold.Back to the front desk I go and provide the number to the clerk and once again explain the problem. She dialed the number but then handed the phone to me! The Amex representative told me that there was nothing they could do without the merchant number, transaction number, etc. etc., none of which the desk clerk could provide.Not to make this a "don't you know who I am" moment, but I am a long time diamond member and nothing like this has ever happened. As I write this on June 5, the hold is still on the Amex account. Thank goodness I have other credit cards.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Paris is expensive, so if you need a bargain, this is not for you. Maison Astor is an elegant, midpriced hotel, renovated to modern standards while maintaining it's old world feel. The rooms are in excellent condition, service is good & efficient, dining room is under glass roof. Location is central, near Metro stations on quiet street. We booked for 4 days, which was good for us.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not sure what we were expecting. Very charming facility - almost a boutique hotel. We traveled with Hilton Honors points, so I won't complain about the room - maybe a little small for our needs, but adequate since we didn't stay in very much. Location - slightly off the beaten path, but easy walk to the Champs and we routinely walked from hotel to River, Louvre, and Eiffel Tower. Breakfast service was great. Staff - well, that's where I would have expected more - but this could be an American thing. If not for points, I don't think I would have opted for this hotel and maybe Hilton Opera.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Hotel in the perfect location in Paris and close to the Louvre! The staff was extremely helpful in arranging transportation and tours. As a Hilton honors gold member we receive free breakfast each night of our stay. The rooms are updated and boutique in size.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Could be so much more. Historical mansion with character in a quiet commercial area but still only 5-7 min walk to shops, restaurants and metro at Madeleine. Breakfast range and quality was ok. Our room was missing a desk chair; asked front desk twice if one could be supplied, but nothing happened. The following day encountered housekeeping who managed to find a chair………..As many other reviewers who stayed over the Easter period have pointed out, it was unseasonably warm over Easter and according to management it was not easily possible to switch the main a/c settings from ‘winter’ to ‘summer’. For a major hotel chain and boutique brand this was ludicrous and the sort of thing one can encounter in a 2-3 star hotel located around the Mediterranean. Poor management was further reflected in the front desk saying there were no fans available either and to open the room windows/French doors, which fortunately we could and did, but to little avail in relieving the very warm weather conditions. We noted a number of guests went and purchased their own fans – I hope they billed Hilton. Could have been a 5/5, but poor and unresponsive customer service = 2/5
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Outstanding service and accommodations. We had a 13-day stay and not once did we have a problem. The entire staff is well trained and responsive and has a "customer first" attitude that is genuine and heartfelt.The Concierge staff were particularly outstanding. I'd especially like to single out Stephane, Denis, Fabien, and Clement for their help in providing local directions, tickets to sites, dinner and travel reservations, and sound advice where to go and what to see. Our trip was made so much more enjoyable by being relieved of that stress.The restaurant served an excellent breakfast 7 days a week. The staff was always smiling and you felt that they genuinely enjoyed their work. We had a fantastic Prime Rib for two one evening while dining there.The central location of the hotel is superb. We walked to almost all of the museums we wanted to visit and had a Metro stop three blocks way for the rest.We didn't experience any discomfort with the HVAC system that we read about before our arrival, but that was largely due to the cooler weather we experienced and the ability to open the patio doors for a breeze.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very pleasant stay. Quiet, very clean hotel with great service and fresh updated rooms. The staff was very helpful, knowledgeable and were helpful in making reservations and suggestions. We enjoyed our visit and would definitely consider staying there again.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are many nice things about this hotel (e.g. location, room decor, breakfast), and the staff was very helpful and accommodating, but there is one major issue that needs to be dealt with. The HVAC system is from the stone age (seemingly can't provide the Hotel heat and a/c at the same time). We stayed in mid May and our room felt like an oven because the Hotel was still set to heat. We tried many things but finally changed hotels to get a good night's sleep. This is just not something I expect to have to consider when staying at a Curio brand hotel. Hey management, it's time to join the 21st century!
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is newly renovated, rooms are on the smaller side but in line with what you usually get in paris. I liked the location a lot but the most important criteria for me is a good night sleep and here the hotel fails. Even the hotel is newly renovated they have no ventilation system, i didn't even ask for AC as the temperatures were not too high , just some fresh air. That didn't exist and the room was hot and stuffy, only solution is too sleep with open widows what almost every one is doing and therefore you hear all conversations, snoring , etc from everyone facing the courtyard. Front desk’s solution was to offer a fan. Sorry but in this hotel category , end Mai in central Europe , it is really not too much to ask to have some kind of ventilation working.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly rated with no available air conditioning and a staff that could not provide fans or help. Greatly disappointed. Had to sleep with windows open and listen to other guests talking and smoking through out the night.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Diamond Member, we stayed 5 nights for a leisure holiday (50th Birthday and 20th Anniversary)"no upgrade available upon request" although the hotel did not seemed booked at all. Easy walk to a few different Metro stops, convenient to shopping and sight seeing. As expected, Paris sized room but not much room for luggage, but the bed was heavenly! The hotel restaurant is closed on Sunday and Monday except for the most delicious breakfast! The croissants are top notch! We will be back!
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We could not have selected a more perfect Parisienne hotel or location for my husband's first trip to Paris. The Concierge Team was extraordinary, ensuring we experienced the neighbourhood (L'evasion!) and had directions for our walks. Such a treat to return to our room each day. HIGHLY recommend. We will return. xo
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked another Curio hotel and prepaid and was moved here 2 months before we arrived. You think these facts alone would make their customer service go above and beyond but alas no.Firstly this hotel was designed by someone who clearly doesn't stay in hotels.From the first impression of a busy and loud reception with several guests audibly complaining about something to staff to the gym which is not a gym and purely for decoration to the roof top terrace that we mistakenly choose.The terrace looks great but it was so cold and rainy in May that we couldn't use the terrace and the fact is it has been designed for one person not two.We had 4 cases and the wardrobe could barely fit one so we gave up and just had our suitcases opened on the floor. Nice.There is a small bathroom with 2 horrible showers which you spend all your time trying to balance the cold and hot but only one sink, why?There is a small toilet which you can barely use.There is no dining table but a bar area. They give you 2 bottles of water but no means to open them. So you have to ask room service to come and open them, just bizarre.I asked why and was told their high paying guests keep stealing the opener. I said just bring our bottles already opened and they got the hint and gave me an opener which amazingly I left for the next guests...and did not steal.On the first morning we didn't know what time we'd wake so couldn't preorder breakfast for the room as it required a time. So I optimistically rang room service through reception and was told that unless I had filled in the preorder and put it on the door handle outside the night before I couldn't have any...yeah that's right...no room service in a Hilton owned hotel.There was no room service menu in the room. Guess that's why Deliveroo appeared popular.There are many great places nearby to have a cheaper cooked breakfast so we went their instead.So 2nd morning I preordered as I thought it would be nice to actually to have a meal in our room. It was fine if limited. We went out came back at 4pm and the trays and breakfast were still there...I rang to complain and was greeted with a "so? what would you like me to do". I said sarcastically how about cleaning the room?it summed up their reception customer service. we were clearly an inconvenience and they would prefer no guests who demanded a clean room...i also had to chase up replacements of water, coffee and tea...yeah in a 4 star hotel.when I checked in I had confirmed to them that I had prepaid. so on checkout I expected a smooth check out. nope. they had no record of my prepayment and even the fact that they had moved me from one of their hotels to another. disappointing to say the least. so basically they tried to steal a second lot of room money from me. outraged I said I had confirmation emails of all this but that I should not have to get my lap top out and find them as this was their job to make my life easier not harder and leave a good impression not bad ..they failed.so they now have to check their records and refund my blocked out money but they couldn't do it then as the manager was not free...or I'll be reporting them for stealing a customers money and tarnishing the Hilton brand yet further.Given their attitude to customer service while I was there this ending didn't surprise me. Disappointing all the same.Don't stay here.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location, close to the subway, restaurants and the Champs Elysee.The Concierge staff is spectacular. They are professional, knowledgeable and cordial and always made us feel welcomed. The restaurant staff, helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good, dinner was great.My wife and I were there celebrating our 30th anniversary. The hotel manager had a bottle of champagne and some delicious cookies in our room upon check in and that was a very nice surprise.We are Hilton Diamond members. We made our reservations in November 2018 for our May 2019 stay. I had requested a room with a balcony on our reservation. I was really disappointed that we did not get that room.
