As a matter of fact, I don't think we got any type of room upgrade. Our room was tiny and the French doors opened to an interior courtyard. When we checked in, the front desk agent told us that there was nothing else available. It made me really question the value of focusing my business on Hilton, given that Diamond status and 7 months advanced notice did not warrant a room upgrade.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this hotel. I'm so glad this is where I chose to stay on my solo trip to Paris. The staff was very friendly to me whenever I interacted with them. The rooms were clean and in great shape. The food was delicious (I ordered room service a few times.) I felt like they went out of their way to "surprise and delight" guests. The location is great--while the actual street is quiet, it's a very central location in an upscale neighborhood. Some of my favorite times were just were just walking in the area. The rooms are small, but 1. it's Paris, so that's unreasonable to expect anything else, and 2. you should be outside all day, so it won't even matter.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a great place to start the days in Paris. Walking distance from the Seine River, Louvre Museum, Opera Center and easy cab ride to almost any other destination that we wanted to visit. Very lovely historic building, great staff and breakfast every morning. Highly recommend this property for your visit.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family booked three rooms for five nights at Maison Astor and I was very impressed. From the beginning, the concierge Stephane welcomed us as if the hotel was his own home. He provided excellent dining suggestions off the beaten path, along with many other helpful ideas throughout our stay. The rest of the hotel staff were also quite helpful and charming. The rooms were spotless and comfortable, and looked out on an inner courtyard that highlighted the subtle architectural features of the building. The breakfasts were excellent and fueled the start of our busy days of sightseeing, wine tasting and of course dining on sumptuous cuisine. I am looking forward to a return visit and would highly recommend this property.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went to the hotel at about 12 but the room was ready at 2:30pm so left my luggage and went shopping and came back at 3pm finally got into my room it was nice got some stuff from monoprix water Diet Pepsi crisps chocolate etc loved the location of the hotel enjoyed my stay
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our time at the Maison Astor. Very cute property that was the home of John Jacob Astor ( who perished on the Titanic). The staff was very kind and helpful and allowed us an early and late check in which we really appreciated. The rooms are lovely - a bit small by American standards but hey this is Paris. The hairdryer wont work with the bathroom plug - may be code in Europe as we had this issue in a couple of locations. Comfortable bed and well located - we walked to most sites.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best beds we slept in while in France. The bathroom was very nice but no outlets to plug in hairdryer or curling iron to get ready in the mornings. The shower is a nice rain shower but water pressure was poor and took a long time to get shampoo/condition out of hair. Breakfast was great. Slept quality excellent.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This chef is unquestionably the best we have experienced in our 30 years of global travel. The menu was unique yet flexible. Non of our requests were denied. My only regret was not meeting the chef in person.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Maison Astor for 3 nights when participating in the Paris Marathon.The location is very good with a little bit of walking to metrostations. It is a very quite neighborhood so not problem getting a good night sleep.The staff was very efficient at check in and check out and the concierge desk was always very helpful.Breakfast was good but not Hilton style. Unfortunately the restaurant was understaffed in the mornings and the staff was running like crazy to get people seated, service coffee and juice and filling up the buffet. More staff would give a better experience for all.We had dinner in the restaurant one night and there was no problem with staffing. Food is very good.The rooms are very standard i.e. not big but not a problem for two persons.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed in several hotels around the world - from Brazil, Peru, Cape Town, Iceland, Austria, Germany, Spain, Italy, Greece, Macchu Pichu, California, Malaysia, Singapore, HK, Boston, NYC, Tokyo - and this was the first time in Europe that I stayed in a hotel that had NO AC (airconditioning). What’s worse is that I was not informed by the front desk upon check-in. This was not also on the website. When I went to my room, it was hot. I thought the AC was busted. When I called the front desk, that’s when they told me about the AC issue. Couldn’t believe it. Because of that issue, I had to leave the window open to let the breeze in. Unfortunately, by having it open, the street noise also could be heard - even the banging of the trash compactor every few hours (I was even wearing earplugs). I had lousy sleep throughout my stay, which I sorely needed since I was tired from my Iceland trip. Sigh. When we came back at night one time, an envelope was on the desk for a Mr. Romero - who was not me. And because someone from the hotel staff entered the room to deliver that envelope, the “Make Up Room” signage fell and our room was not cleaned. Good job hotel staff (sarcastic). I normally don’t complain about things like the above but I couldn’t help myself. I finally talked to the quality manager who thankfully was accommodating and apologetic. She was able to appease us so thanks to the manager. She was the lone bright spot in this hotel. One other issue was with my request for 2 laundry bags. I called at 11 PM to request for them, and one hour later, still no bags. So I went down to the front desk only to be told that they had run out of bags and that I should call at 7 AM the next day (when someone from Housekeeping is available). Firstly, I have never encountered a hotel running out of laundry bags and secondly, I wish they had the courtesy to return my call to inform me that they had run out. Eventually, the next day, I called housekeeping at 8:30 AM and asked for TWO (2) laundry bags. I only got ONE (1). Face palm moment there. The icing on the cake? When we booked our taxi the night before checking out, we explicitly said that we were heading to Gare du Nord (train station North). The next day, the luggages were loaded in the taxi, and then the concierge asks me what terminal. I reply, “No, we are going to Gare du Nord.” So the driver then unloads our luggages since he was expecting that our destination was the airport. And the concierge calls for a new taxi. Good thing I had ample time prior to the departure of my train. Another face palm moment there. There are lapses in this hotel. Maybe they should retrain their staff? In fact, during check-in, the front desk staff didn’t guide us throughout the hotel. She did not show us where the restaurant was (or the breakfast times) or even just explain where the fitness center was (isn’t that protocal?). I’ve stayed at the Marriott on Hausmann and at the Hilton Opera, and also in one hotel at the Montmartre area. I WILL NEVER stay here again. VERY DISAPPOINTED. A shame though because the location of the hotel is good. Near to the shopping of Rue Saint-Honore, and maybe 20 mins walking to the Louvre on one side, and then 30 mins walk to Eiffel. 10 mins to Champs Elysees. On a side note, the concierge staff was accommodating.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This small hotel is a little bit hidden away but do not let this fool you. It's a great location and quiet. Idea for exploring the area around Champs Elysees. What stands out is it's professional and friendly staff. It also has a nice and relaxing bar.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were extremely surprised when I asked the doorman who brought up our luggage for instructions for the A/C control and his response was there is no air conditioning until the summer season.Spoke to the hotel General Manager who told me that even tough the hotel is a newly renovated Hilton property, it is a difficult task to just turn on the A/C system because ot the building age. So we had 6 miserable warm sleep nights
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Single night stay in this Hilton branded boutique hotel. It is nice, it is extremely comfortable, it is in a lovely part of town and it is trying to be a bit of a boutique - like an old French Salon, especially the dining room. Does it pull that off - no, not especially well, the mono chrome wall paper with slightly kitchy images are too much and certainly are over bearing in my mind. The actual room layouts are difficult at best, the entrance and the dining room are both round, so it is very difficult to lay out square furniture in a way that doesnt feel like you are constantly having to weave through furniture. The bar is small - and kind of awkward. But dont let any of that spacial stuff take away from the food or the quality of the food, as ever in France the simplicity and elegance of the food is a class apart, genuinely so - the simple house pinot noir is a lovely drinkable wine, the bread at breakfast is nutty and chewy, the jams are sweet and sharp, everything about French food is the antithesis of America and you should put up with minor inconveniences to experience it.The rooms are clean and honestly fairly unspectactular - comfortable without being over the top. Chambres as the French would say - they feel like that.The location of this hotel is also lovely on a quite Parisian back street where you can whistle and smoke a Gallois on your way back from the cafe, in one of the most beautiful and romantic cities in the world.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time staying at a Curio. I was debating between the Hilton Opera and this property and I thought why not give it a shot. Beautiful decor, welcoming staff, that make you feel at ease as soon as you walk through the doors. Lots of thanks to Lorna, Alexandre and Denis Pirouelle. They made my birthday trip magical.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Terrible experience never resolved by hotel, response from management nonexistent, you know it’s bad when the bellhop has to chase you out the hotel apologizing. Items were removed from our room without permission and in confusion, when this was realized, hotel would not take responsibility. Some items never return, stolen by housekeeping. AVOID!!
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is stunning and every corner has wonderfully set art and furniture. We stayed in the suite with a view of the Eiffel tower and it was wonderful. The huge comfortable bed, true black out curtains and decor was all very high standard. The staff was both accommodating and friendly and very helpful in regards to directions for getting around Paris and how to see the sights.I recommend the restaurant as the food is amazing and will delight. For a city break you can't go wrong with this hotel and it offers some romance and peace in a busy busy city.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel and were very pleased with the choice: clean rooms, spacious, very kind personnel and service. All you need. We used Silver Honours points and felt privileged, where others would give a smaal room in a corner, they valorised us. We will be back, for sure! The location is great to discover all of Paris.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Paris Hotel! Gotta stay at this hotel. The rooms are great and food and staff are top notch!! We enjoyed the breakfast and would recommend getting it with your room. The location is great for walking around Paris!!!
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was a little bit small. But, I like the bed and atmosphere. Especially the linen and pillow were very sweet and comfortable.The staff were friendly and nice. The Hilton honor free breakfast was excellent.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 8 days in February; while there's nothing distinctly wrong with this hotel, it's distinctly sterile and the overall experience did not live up to the cost. Three other points: 1) The hotel is obviously new and the decor is "fin de siecle" but the interior designer, in my opinion, didn't quite get it right and the overall effect is a little "tart's boudoir"; 2) my room at least faced into a small inner courtyard and due to the proximity of other rooms, by the end of my stay, it was starting to feel rather like being an executive jail unfortunately; 3) one of the main reason I stayed at this hotel was because of the fitness facilities that I saw on the hotel's web-site; on asking about these, I was directed to the "fitness lounge" in which I found a running machine and a bench only. Despite all of the above, staff are helpful however and the hotel is definitely clean.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 4th time to Paris and I still love it!PROS Beautiful boutique hotel on quiet streetLovely lobby and breakfast room, with great food and eggs made to orderRoom is modern, clean, and has good lighting CONSQueen room is small but manageableNeighborhood is quiet and requires walking 2 blocks to Cafes etc HIghly recommend this hotel - nice to be away from tourist crazy areas
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at Maison Astor & I would highly recommend this hotel. The location was convenient to luxury shopping, metro stations, restaurants, etc. Our room had an amazing view of both the Eiffel Tower & the city, it was clean and the staff were always friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. Stephane & Alexander, at the concierge, were especially helpful with restaurant recommendations, reservations & directions. Stephane even mailed our postcards to our friends back home for us & Alexander helped me with a surprise from Santa for our daughter. Can’t say enough great things about our stay at this property!
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice location, small but comfy rooms. Nice bathroom. One of the towels was kind of dirty (makeup stain?). Concierge guy was really helpful and was willing to give us a lot of information. Really nice.
hotelName:
6    Maison Astor Paris, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated at the back of the Louvre museum. Ideal location walked everywhere. Lift and air conditioning were appreciated.Staff were unobtrusive but extremely helpful. Room and corridors are small but have everything you need. Would happily stay again.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for one night on a business trip. The room was described with 10 m2, which it probably was. No problem for one person. The room and the bathroom were clean and i could open the window. Not too loud outside. Staff was very friendly. Lots of stuff in the neighborhood. Will return if price is right.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. This hotel is within walking distance from the Louvre. It literally takes 3 minutes to walk to the Louvre and other nearby attractions. The downside is that it is very small and outdated. If you are looking for a place just to sleep and shower then this should be good enough. If you plan on spending time in your hotel room then book something else. The room is extremely small and cramped. The hotel staff are very friendly and they gift a bottle of red wine to the guests.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well situated, very accommodating hotel staff (Martin especially), nice rooms, quiet side street, very helpful in getting airport van, great restaurant recommendations, warm welcoming ambience, great security
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: good central location, room cleaned and beds made every day. downside is the room doors must be hollow as when other guests open close their doors it sounds like they are in your room! near a busy road so lots of traffic noise.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I always look forward to staying at this adorable hotel. The staff, facilities and the location are perfect for me. Its a home form home, the way a hotel should be. Service is friendly and always accommodating. The hotel is on the doorstep of the Louvre museum which is where i exhibit every season. Most important, i always get a good peaceful nights rest :)
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s a great location with clean rooms and friendly staff that is very helpful. The rooms are very small, with narrow halls and a tiny elevator. It’s a one minute walk to the Louvre museum and numerous cafes and restaurants. Avoid the Cafe St Honore next door, due to poor service and hair in the food!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: room small hot top floors;windows need closed due to noise;;staff helpful and breakfast good all options;no closet space hung on radiators;lol;and cost 860 f 3 nights;shop around is my message;good luck;pwl boston
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose to stay here because of the hotel's proximity to the Louvre. In that respect, the hotel does not disappoint. An easy five minute walk is all it takes to get there. It's also a convenient bus ride (# 48) from Gare du Nord to it. The staff was friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, the ground-floor room (# 100) we received smelled heavily of mildew. There was little natural light and the colors of the walls added to the rooms gloominess. There was a drain pipe near the door that treated us to a near constant sound of draining water through the night. If I were a younger man, I don't think these things would have been a problem. However, as I am an older man (mid-60's), these deficiencies made the night's stay uncomfortable.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros: Absolutely amazing location that’s a short walk away from the Louvre and the Siene River. Friendly, helpful staff. Cons: Room was incredibly dusty. Shower/bathroom had mold growing. Wife and I’s allergies would worsen only when in the room, and even upon return to the US have a lingering cough and congestion were trying to shake. At 6’0” I was too tall for shower (head hitting ceiling, had to bend every time). Breakfast offered was just alrite. Overall: Good location, bad everything else. We literally only were in the room to sleep/shower, other than that we were essentially forced to spend more time in the amazing city (which, I guess, wasn’t a bad thing).
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let's be realistic. Paris is by no means inexpensive. That understood, the Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants is a little jewel in the shadow of the Louvre. Everything besides the room sizes is brilliant and an amazing value. Tucked away on a side street, this 33 room boutique hotel is nearly perfect. The rooms at 10m (32 sq.ft) and 12m (39 sq ft) are very small, but efficient. nice-sized bathrooms and most 4 star services, this hotel is perfect for a short stay in the City of Light. The limited Breakfast at 13 Euros is high so recommend dining elsewhere.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location but very small rooms. it is a good option if you go for just a few days, Near the principal spots in Paris. Room very little almost claustrofobic. But besides that it is a place in a very good location with everything nearby.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was clean and convenient to all museums. The staff was excellent, helpful in arranging transportation since some of the metro lines were down due to repairs. Would highly recommend this hotel to stay while in Paris
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff here couldn’t have been more helpful. The rooms were spotless and serviced daily during our five day stay.The air conditioned rooms were very small, but ensuite bathrooms modern and clean. There are several floors in this building, but a small lift is available. It was difficult to get through the corridors with suitcases, as the linen trolleys took up most of the space, and this was a surprise.Breakfast wasn’t anything to get excited about. Very basic, and fruit didn’t seem fresh. Despite a few negatives, this is situated perfectly for travellers, with The Louvre a couple of minutes away. There are restaurants close by. The staff were the most helpful we had met in several weeks of travelling.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was wonderful! Great location. Friendly helpful staff. Room was small but charming. Nice breakfast. Good comforter, beds, pillows. Would have liked a sheet for the warm nights. But otherwise would highly recommend!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoy staying at the Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants when we come to Paris. The staff are outstanding, so knowledgeable and kind. The location on a quiet little street is excellent, just steps from the Louvre and near many cafes and great shopping. The Palais Royal and the Jardin du Palais Royal are just behind this lovely boutique hotel. We felt safe in the surrounding area at all times. The rooms are a bit small but extremely cozy and exceptionally clean. Breakfast is lovely. We can't wait to return.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location could almost not have been better. Right next to the Louvre.Many great restaurants and sights nearby in walking distance.The room is sort of what you expect in Paris, much smaller and much more expensive than basically everywhere else. Fair enough. But my god the cleanliness. The bathroom was moldy and dirty, with hair and skin residue in the shower and the amount of dust under the desk was incredible. It was impossible to shower or have a bath without at least in part flooding the bathroom. The room was at the end of a very narrow hallway, which was at least in part blocked every day with different types of cleaning equipment. Fortunately the room was right next to the emergency escape, for the idea to pass all of this in case of an emergency would have been terrifying. Cleaning staff did not come every day. It would have been nice to have a clean set of sheets after two days of 25+ degrees, but well. We got an apology and some towels and toilet paper from the receptionist when we asked about the cleaning around 17:00 in the evening but it seemed like this was basically business as usual.The receptionists were helpful and friendly, however the level of cleanliness really was a dealbreaker for me. We did not have the breakfast.I do not understand the rating, either on hotels or booking.com, but I suppose putting out a free of charge half bottle of wine makes everything better.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is clean and quite big. But a lot of noise during the night, probably the airco or fridge (in the kitchen). We heard al the water from rooms upstairs, running down the drain (somewhere in the wall) when the toilet flushed or there was someone in the shower. There was no option to open a window or get fresh air.I think it's quite expensive for what you get.But the location is perfect!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect Location, Friendly Staff - lovely stay. Only stayed 2 days but can’t fault place, it’s a quaint little boutique hotel,clean friendly, small but Ideal for money location & staff very accommodating - will definitely come back
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is perfect. Rooms are old. We were able to change the room after 2 nights staying on the first floor w/out view. The second room was great.Third floor,. Wanted to say, the beds are so comfortable, rooms are clean, lobby is nice. Check in time in 2PM, no earlier. They can watch your bags. We will stay here again next time.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great. It's basically right across the street from the Louvre and there is a metro station nearby which made getting around the city really easy. The train station is a 10 minute walk from the hotel which is really convenient if you need to go to the Charles de Gaulle airport. The staff was very polite and helpful. The one thing I didn't like about this place was the small shower booth. Overall this place met all my needs and expectations and I would stay here again.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is good. Just at the back of Louvre Museum and few walks away from the Metro and the Hop On, Hop Off bus office. The staff are friendly. I didn't try the restaurant as I haven't seen variety of food. The room was small, but I guess you get what you paid for. After all, this is Paris!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super location - Close from everything. Metro line 1 was very close by and the Louvre is at a walk-able distance. Service wasn't great - No one did the bed, changed the towels or hoovered the floor. Wouldn't recommended it if for the location.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a fairly small hotel with narrow stairwells and small rooms. The price is quite decent relative to some of the painfully expensive hotels nearby. The front desk and cleaning staff are super friendly and the proximity to Le Louvre and Les Tuileries is so convenient. The room is quite tight especially if you want to work at the desk. Breakfast is included as is free wifi (a little dicey at times) and TV. There is a small refrigerator and a handful of mini bar items but there was no price list for these in my room. There is also supposed to be a gym but I did not have time to locate it (which should not be difficult given the size of the place). Bottom line is that this is a clean, decent budget hotel in a great neighborhood (only 1.5 blocks from the Rue de Rivoli metro line 1 stop).
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 6 nights in this charming little hotel. The location was perfect... literally steps from the Louvre. A metro station is also very close with connections to all parts of the city. The staff was accommodating when we arrived in the morning following a long flight from Seattle... they offered us breakfast and had a room ready for us in less than an hour. That was very much appreciated as we needed a long nap before heading out to explore the city. The room was small but average for Paris. Housekeeping was excellent and the water pressure was amazing! The complimentary small bottle of wine was also very nice!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well...when I saw the price ans the pictures+location I was impressed.But reality bites.Elevator working just till the 3rd floor.Then you have to take the stairs and find your room.I must say-good luck with that if you search for room 407.Somehow the room reminded me of the book "Alice on wonderland"-tiny,with sealling starting where my head ended.Not really clean for me.The smell was unpleasent as well.Well located and that's unfortunately all!Pitty to pytanie do nice pictures and discover something else.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In general a comfortable hotel, but with one minor complaint and one major complaint. First, the larger complaint, and a note of caution: the “shuttle service offered” in the hotel description is not free. While this may be expected what with the distance of the hotel to the airport, there was a frustrating lack of communication about the exact terms of this fee. When we scheduled a shuttle service, we were told to leave a “Deposit” of 16 euros. When we asked the front desk about whether we would be getting the deposit back when we showed up to the shuttle, it was suggested that this was the case. It was not, and we were only told this when the shuttle was ready to leave. This was 16 euros we were not expecting to spend, and if we knew this in advance, we would have taken public transit instead. The minor complaint, which regards the bathroom in our room: the sink in the bathroom was very slow to drain, and after simply washing one’s hands, a sizeable puddle would form. The shower glass was also organized so that your bathroom floor would be completely soaked after a shower—we had to seal off a portion of the shower with a towel to prevent a soaked floor. Beyond these things, a nice hotel in the heart of the city, but these experiences certainly soured the impression of the hotel.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is very convenient. Metro, hop on hop off red and blue route just walking distance. If you dont mind of a bit old and super small shower room. Can find good vitnam food pho14. Best food I had there.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the Hotel is perfect, the breakfast was very good and the Service was excellent. The room had only a window bewteen the room and the bath and in the bath. The door frame bewteen the room and the bath was low. The bed was excellent. I did sleep very well.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we were bitten by bedbugs ! The body is covered with bites, which are very painful. We came to an important event but felt very bad and uncomfortable ourselves.our number did not clean a few days.We are very upset
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location near the Louvre, Concorde and Opera house, as well as restaurants and cafe's and quality shopping options. Clean, kind, warm and personal attentive approach of the staff to any question or topic. Had a great time. Strongly recommended.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first time visiting Paris and staying in arrondissment 1 was a great choice- centrally located to many of Paris top tourist spots. Across the street from the Louvre & the Tulleries, 10 minute walk to the Sienne and the right bank. Room was typical European size (smallish) with an extremely comfortable bed. Bathroom had tub/shower and nice sized sink area. Towel warmer was a nice touch. Separate toilet room was a nice feature since I was traveling with a friend. Front desk clerk was friendly and assisted us with calling taxi and able to communicate in English. Hotel did not have a lush lobby or bar room area but we were out all day & night and only used our room for sleeping and showering, perfect little spot for our needs.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were there few family members (some adoults and some children).The rooms are small but designed nicely.There's small elevator.Very small and tight coridor.The lobby is pleasant.Very kind service.Central, just few minutes walk from the louvre.Overall - good value for money.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location just across the louvre museum but I had a super tiny room that I couldn't move, there is a tiny hallway after the elevator to walk to the toom.Breakfast was fair enought but I am sure that with the fee I paid I was expecting much more. The pictures on the websites like booking or tripadvisor look much better than the reality! Definetly it is overpriced.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had 4 days here, it was wonderful. The staff were accomodating, the rooms were clean and the location was excellent. While the rooms, hallway and elevator are all very small but it was still comfortable and lovely.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just spent 5 nights here and loved it! The location was so so good. Literally 2 minute walk to the louvre and the metro. The staff were all lovely and very accommodating. Our room was small but very comfortable and we had a lovely courtyard view. I would definitely stay here again, it was an absolute pleasure from start to finish.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect situated, friendly employees. Little rooms, not enough places for charging. If possible do not take room on 2nd floor! Only upper and with windows to street not to country yard, or you will see your neighbors in bathrooms.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Centrally located and very near the metro. About 1 min walk to the louvre station. The hotel and room was small though with very tight corridors and a tiny lift. Toilet was sizeable. Basic hotel, good if you need a standard room close to amenities and restaurants and attractions. Waking distance to everywhere! Would recommend to couples.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well located close ti the louvre and place vendome and decent value. Thr bedrooms are not huge but very stylishly furnished and the bathroom nicely equipped with towels and toileteries. Breakfast for eur13 was ok if not the most memorable in the world. The common parts downstairs also nicely decorated. Only major flaw is the corridors to access the bedrooms which are narrow dark and really rather claustrophobic. Felt like a rats maze. Once i saw the room i was mightily relieved since the corridors do make a pretty dismal impression. But overall balancibg price location and the rooms against that issue, the hitel is a decent proposition.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, nice, friendly and very helpful staff. The rooms are a bit small, bit still comfy. Not rich, but nice breakfast, with good products, so it's more than enough. Is't my family's favorite hotel for years.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location for this hotel cannot be beat. It's right next to the Louvre, and so close to the 1/7 metro lines which makes transportation really easy. Because checkin was late in the afternoon, the front desk was very helpful by keeping our luggage before and after our stay at the hotel. The room was on the small side and the shower door didn't close all the way, but we didn't mind. We found a lot of value and memories at this hotel.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice simple laid-back hotel. Good for families. Right next to the louvre and very well located. A bit old and might need some renovations but service was good, staff very helpful and nice. Breakfast was fair enough and wi-fi was good. A nice stay...
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed on the first leg of a family visit to France. While the rooms are typically small, they were immaculately clean and well tended by staff. A nice morning breakfast buffet was available as were cocktails in the small bar. The location, a nice little cafe adjacent and price make this a definite return for me. Easy walk to the Louvre!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hotel! Absolutely perfect location and tucked up a side street 3 mins walk from the Louvre. The staff are extremely helpful, pleasant and welcoming. They will also keep your bags locked away after check out, so that you can enjoy any time you have left in Paris sans baggage. Also helpful in arranging taxis. Yes rooms are small, but very clean, serviced every day and have everything one needs.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in the perfect location and staff were helpful. Be warned that the corridors are absolutely tiny and you may have to go through various passages/doors to get to your room. The rooms were very comfortable and water in the bathroom was nice and hot!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 days & found it to be a great little hotel. The location was perfect, only a very short walk to the Louvre & an even shorter walk to the Metro. The staff were excellent, the guys on the front desk were friendly, helpful & courteous, even teaching us a little French each day.The room was clean & comfortable but a little small which was fine as there was just the 2 of us. The room was serviced every day which was nice to come back to after a day exploring.Just be aware the lift is very small & slow, 2-3 people only or in our case 1 person & a suitcase each trip.Breakfast was simple but enjoyable in very nice surroundings.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good place..My room was old ,but quite espace.All very narrow spaces ,like in all Paris .The subway it's very near and confortable .I didn'try the breakfast ,but near the hotel you can do a cheap breakfast.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel. Great location just a few minutes walk from Louvre. Wheelchair accesible area in the reception and really nice wheelchair accessible room. Nice neighborhood with cafes and bars. Close to bus stops.Polite and friently staff.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found this hotel just by chance, and I was very happy with my choice. Central location ( just a short walk from the Louvre and the subway station ), nice staff, large,roomy room. I would definitely come back. Merci.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Third time I have stayed at this hotel and I cannot find anything negative to say about it. Located close to the Palais Royal, Lourvre and less than 200 metres from the Metro it is pretty much in the perfect location. Friendly staff, good sized rooms which are equipped with everything you should need. Choices for breakfast are good and there are a lot of places close by to eat, either at lunchtime or in the evening.The hotel is also less than 100 metres from Rue Saint-Honore which is a great street to spend a morning walking the length of from Les Halles all the way to Rue La Boetie, taking in all the designer labels you want plus the E'lysee Palace and some great watering holes to stop off and people watch in.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I booked a trip to Paris last minute and picked Hotel Bon Enfants as our base.It is located on a side street within two minutes walk of the Louvre and a metro stop just around the corner. The location is fantastic with plenty of cafes nearby and a supermarket a street away.Staff are friendly and helpful. Yes the lift is small and the corridors are tiny. Thankfully we were in room 207 which is located of a stairwell and doesn't feel so claustrophobic. The room is small but has a double bed, desk, wardrobe, mini bar and TV. The bathroom is a good size. Let's face it, you're in Paris. You're using the hotel as a base and Hotel Bon Enfants is more than adequate.Room quaint and clean and serviced every day. We would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hotel, staff were very helpful. So close to everything. The subway didn't bother us, even though we were on the first floor. Very clean, nice compact little room, we had everything we needed. Loved the complimentary wine, that was a very nice touch. We would stay here again.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, nice rooms, very polite persons on reception. Very tiny corridors.Electronic keys for doors and lift did not work good. Ask for windows looking to street. It is important! Because other window looking to each other!Not good rooms cleaning. My tea pots, floor and sometimes towels were dirty.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superb location a stones throw from the Louvre; bedroom was clean, colourful and comfortable; staff were friendly and helpful. Would definitely book again- given that many inferior hotels are priced similarly for a much less central location you couldn't really ask for more.The rooms are all on first floor and higher (pretty typical for central Paris) but there is a small lift for access. Really helpful that we were able to book a triple room at only a small extra price as my sister was able to join us for a night. The triple room had very comfortable beds, and a separate toilet and bathroom which was helpful.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I needed a room for one nite and wanted to use Marriott points. I was a bit skeptical given some of the negative reviews but my options were limited so I took a chance. The check-in staff were very polite and spoke good English. The check-in area is small so it can get crowded very quickly if there are a lot of guests arriving/departing. I got room 1925, a large king room and hoped for the best. Getting off the elevator was not encouraging. The door frames looked those of a hotel that had been used hard. However the room itself was very nice, enormous compared to many French hotel rooms. It was well appointed, the bathroom was spotless and very nicely done. No bidet so keep that in mind if that is a requirement for you. A beautiful view of eastern Paris out the window. The bed slept well and there were no surprises through the stay. Didn't eat in the restaurant but the staff did get me a coffee when the machine in the lounge area was offline for cleaning. The hotel is a five minute walk from Gare de Lyon so it is so easy to get to and use it as a home base to explore the whole of Paris. This hotel isn't in the tourist area of Paris, good or bad depending on what you want. I actually prefer eating in restaurants filled with locals rather than tourists so if that's your thing as well, then you have plenty of options within a 5-20 min walk. You can cross over the bridge to the RER and you are two stops from Muse D'Orsay and other attractions. Bottomline, I'd stay again if the need arises.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just arrived at the hotel after taking the train from Cannes! Check in was flawless and the staff could not have been nicer or more professional!I love our room with great views of the Basilica of Sacre Coeur! Easy walk from the Gare de Lyon. Out the main door and to the left. You can’t miss the hotel! The elevators are a bit high tech for me, but I do feel they were designed for convenience and security. One recommendation that I always tell my friends, if you are arriving early from an international flight, we always splurge and reserve the night prior to our arrival, the additional cost is well worth having your room ready, rather than hoping that you’re room will be available prior to the normal check in time!Enjoy your stay!
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel from June 13 to 16, 2019. I was assured by Andra ( who also happens to be the customer relations manager) at the time of my check in, that the room I was getting was the best one available that could be provided to a Titanium Elite Member and a Lifetime Gold Member with Marriott for the last 12 years. What we got was a room with the following:1- A broken toilet seat which was eventually repaired on our request.2-A clogged sink that took forever to drain.3-An inadequate cooling system. We repeatedly tried to set the temperature but it just wouldn’t cool down the room.4-A pungy and nauseating smell on the 15th floor that we had to deal with every time we had to exit the room or the 15th floor elevator5- A non functional garbage binI am utterly disappointed with the experience at this property and the little regard and effort taken by the staff to ensure our experience at this property was a pleasant and memorable one. What irked me the most is that despite this terrible experience I shared by feedback via email to Andra (Customer Relations Manager) and Pierre-Yves (Hotel Manager) but I never got a response from them. Terrible experience and not what you would expect from Marriott. I will not recommend this hotel to friends or family let alone give it a second chance!
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent a week at this location and I can't tell you how happy I am that we chose this hotel. It is ideally located next to the Gare de Lyon train station. Which made getting to and from various tourist attractions incredibly easy. The staff at the hotel was also very helpful in getting us reservations when we need help as our French was just not cutting it. Our room was nice and large with an amazing view of the Eiffel Tower and Sacre Coure. The hotel is walking distance to the Bastile area, which meant we had great choices for dinner. There is also an amazing bakery across the street from this hotel. We started our day with breakfast at the bakery and did a quick stop for coffee on our return from our day touring the city.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I checked in at the CY Paris Gare de Lyon this Saturday morning. While the young lady very nice was, she was brand new to the job and had almost no clue on what she was doing. It took a solid 20 minutes to be checked in, despite mobile check in.Being a Titanium member I had to tell her what the benefits were, remind her it was a prepaid stay plus lots of other information. She then handed over the room cards to me and wished me a nice stay.Great but what's my room number? She apologized and said room 1712 on the first floor. I answered that I was thinking it should be the 17th floor, whereas she answered no no, first floor (in France, 1st floor is 2nd floor for the US).OK, first floor I go, which was ... the fitness center. No a big deal, I gave the 17th floor a try which was correct.I then had a nap and was suddenly waken up by the opening of the entrance door. I thought to myself that the staff should have at least knocked before entering but to my surprise it wasn't staff at all. Two people were inside my room to claim that room that has been assigned to them at check in.They were almost as chocked as me. This is just unbelievable. I immediately called the reception that put me hold, then apologized and said they will deliver some catering to my room for the inconvenience. I declined as this is not an inconvenience but an issue and sending some food and drinks were useless for me, I had dinner plans and was supposed to leave early in the morning.I dressed up and went to the reception to have an explanation. I spoke with Katia the duty manager who apologized a lot but couldn't really explain what had happened.She offered 5'000 points, free breakfast and what mattered the most to me, a call back first thing Monday morning from the reception manager to clarify what has happened.I don't like to make a big deal of problems, but here there are a lot of questions raised: how come a room can be assigned twice, what about my credit card and all private information that the hotel requests, where are they? If I wouldn't have been in the room, what would have happened? People having my room key could just take whatever they want and leave.I made the point to Katia that I want to address this issues to the upper management and again she promised the call back first thing Monday morning.I also mentioned that if I wouldn't have plans and short on time, I would have checked-out immediately as this isn't acceptable in any way.When I checked out on Sunday morning, the lady at the reception said "let me summarize your charges: you have a breakfast and some snacks from the market". I answered no, I don't have breakfast as Katia said it will be free of charge.Then she answered that I should have let her finished her sentence, she was about to say, the breakfast was complementary.I am sorry, this is not the way you have to say it. The right sentence would have been: " Let me summarize your extras: you have something from the minimarket and your breakfast is complementary"Before leaving the hotel I again said I was expecting the manager to call me back Monday Morning, I was again reassured it will be done first thing.We are Tuesday, no call. I checked my Marriott account, the overnight points are here, but no sign of the 5'000 points that were promised.Beside the safety and security issue of booking and giving access to the same room to different customer, the lack of follow up and mistake ownership is dramatic. I will also follow up with Marriott directly as this is just unacceptable.Needless to say that I will not give this hotel a second try.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been traveling to Paris on an almost annual basis for over a dozen years now. This was my first foray into a big chain hotel. What appealed to me at the time of booking was that it was brand spanking new and had an appealing aesthetic. While slightly outside of the center, it is conveniently located minutes away from Gare de Lyon, where you can hop on line 1 and 14 quite easily. There's a Starbucks next door if that's your thing (I personally avoid Starbucks whilst in Paris), as well as a Paul and Eric Kayser nearby if you're not wanting to spring for the 19 euro breakfast. There's also a Monop (smaller version of Monoprix) about five minutes away on foot if you're needing to stock up on water and snacks. As for the hotel itself, the way the rooms are laid out, each room has a view of the city, but the premium views are that of the Eiffel and the Sacre Couer. Having never stayed in a room with a view of the Eiffel, we were excited at the prospect of being able to see it outside our window but when we stepped into our room (1903), we realized tht we had to lean over to be able to see it in the distance. We did feel that the room was very spacious and it was probably the largest room we've had in Paris. The bathroom was fairly large for Paris standards as well. Now for the cons. The smell. Room 1903 had an odd stench masked by a fragrance that was a combination of lemon and musk, like a really bad men's drugstore cologne. I am assuming the scent was used to hide the smell emanating from the bathroom. Others have commented on the disaster of the design that is their bathtub. I can imagine pregnant women and elderly individuals having great difficulty getting in an out of the tub. Also, since the door to the bathroom is basically a glass enclosure, you will be awakened at night if a fellow room occupant goes to the loo and you are sensitive to light. Forget about privacy if you have to relieve yourself. Be aware that the light from your open window can be reflected onto the adjacent business building, which means that your fellow guests may be able to see you at night. Keep your curtains closed!Housekeeping was subpar. We stayed in two rooms over the course of our 5-night stay and both rooms were not vacuumed well, if at all. We accidentally broke one of the glasses in the bathroom and housekeeping failed to remove and replace for two days. When we checked into our second room after a long day of sightseeing, our sofa bed was not made up and we had to wait for someone to come and put sheets on. When someone finally arrived, all he did was lay the flat sheet on top of the mattress. Breakfast was fine but definitely not worth the 19 euros. However, since children are free, it balances it out. Front desk staff were all very polite and attempted to be as helpful as possible.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked a family suite but they said i booked a one person room. Had to pay $25 extra per night to get the room i booked. The bathroom sink was clogged before I even entered the room the first time and stayed clogged over half my stay here. The shower head stayed loose and kept falling off, the room has a stinky smell that occurs every once in awhile and the tv stopped working randomly. Complained the next day, but nothing has been done about it still??? Asked for a new room but they told me the hotel is all booked!! So I'm paying over $1100 for 4 nights and I'm stuck with a 50% working crappy room??!?!?!? Room 1603
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is what one would expect for Courtyard by Marriott. It has clean good sized rooms, comfortable beds and friendly staff. However it is a little far out, about twenty minutes from the Eiffel tower.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Courtyard Marriott Gare de Lyon is ideally located right next to Gare de Lyon station. We literally turned right on leaving the hotel and within half a block were walking down the steps to the metro. It made access throughout Paris easy. It's also ideally located for being able to walk just about anywhere that we wanted to go. The hotel is clean, the staff professional, the rooms nicely laid out. The only flaw with our stay was that the bathtub is horrible for accessibility. My mother had a hard time getting in and out, and even I found the access to be less than ideal. Also, I didn't like that the building is so modern looking and clashes with the beautiful Parisian architecture.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: By the 4th week of April most of the Paris hotel are very expensive. This was reasonably priced at around 250.00 Euro. I choose this hotel for location. 2 minute walk to Metro and bus, 10 minute walk to coin laundry. You can reach most of the attractions of Paris in less then 20 minute by using metro. Staff was friendly and helpful. I will stay again.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spectacular view across the city We could see the river and Eiffel Tower. Convenient location across the street from the Gare de Lyon. Access to trains.RER metro and buses. We walked to the Notre Dame. louvre and Eiffel Tower. And best of all. The bed was so comfortable. Great night sleep
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very trendy. loved the design. The receptionists were very friendly and offered me a room on the 15th floor with spectacular views. I recommend going for higher floors to enjoy that. The rooms are clean and nicely designed. Amenities include good quality products. I asked for bathrobe and slippers as soon as I arrived, they were very accommodating. I was given a room with 2 beds instead of a single one, the beds are small. The closet is tiny as well and barely fit my clothes, not sure how they expect it to fit stuff for 2 people. The entire room has 1 drawer and a shelf, not enough storage space. They had complimentary tea bags. Loved the furniture at the hotel, everything was well designed and good quality. There is a small market in the lobby with a variety of things to purchase such as water, chocolate, hygiene products, etc.. Breakfast was good, they even had a crepe station. I had lunch there on the first day, they have a lady chef there, I tried the burger, it was amazing. Location of the hotel is pretty good, very friendly area with restaurants, pharmacies, etc.. All in all a great experience, will definitely be back.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this new courtyard, very convenient. Staff spoke excellent English and couldn’t be more helpful. We had a wonderful breakfast, plenty of places to eat surrounding the hotel, the gare de Lyon is right there. The hotel itself is very quiet, neighborhood surrounding lovely to walk through. The only issue noted in other reviews is the design of the shower, not sure what they were thinking on that - would be tough for a senior or other disability to get in and out of. We managed, otherwise place is beautiful.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the hotel for four nights. It is a newer hotel with modern decor. The location is excellent. It is walking distance from the Gare de Lyon train station which makes travel around the city a breeze. There are also many restaurants within walking distance. We had a nice view of the Eiffel Tower from our upgraded room. The only drawbacks of the room were no drawers if you are one who likes to unpack on a longer stay. The design of the bathroom lights the entire room if used during the night which can be disturbing if you are not traveling solo.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel is beautiful, new and very spacious. Everyone with whom we interacted was courteous and helpful. The staff went above and beyond to help me find my cellphone that I had accidentally left behind in an Uber. No less than 4 different employees did all they could to assist and I am so grateful for their hospitality and willingness to help. I wouldn't hestitate to stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, reasonably-priced, conveniently located hotel in Paris. Five stars all around!
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights there because some friends lived near by. Hotel is new, we were upgraded higher floor and nice view of sacre cœur church. Staff is friendly. Rooms are comfortable with young modern style . Hotel is close to gate de Lyon.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 4 nights. 2 minute walk from Gare de Lyon. Newer hotel with very nice rooms. Food is expensive but there are options in the immediate area; check out Express de Lyon, a bar with great craft beers and a small, wheel-out the chalkboard menu. Osso bucco with tagliatelle is awesome. Check out from the hotel can be slow if there is a crowd. Would definitely stay here again
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in this hotel, good location at Gare de Lyon. The hotel is very efficient and focuses on the essential things in a hotel. Quick checkin, rooms are modern and nice, bathrooms clean and modern. The only thing which I did not like was the smell in the bathroom, coming out of the sink. I tried the gym, which is small, but has lot of equipments, open 24h. Breakfast very good and nice. Bonvoy Status could not be met unfortunately - if this was by high occupation or by own policy I would not know, probably the latter.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very new hotel, ideally situated opposite the Gare de Lyons so right next to the Metro.The newness showed in the bed, the bed linen and the towels which are absolutely top notch. The breakfast was excellent, served as a buffet!One block from the Seine. Cross the bridge and a couple of hundred yards up is the stop for the water bus which serves all the major tourist spots. Alternatively, an easy walk up to Notre Dame. The views from the upper floors was fantastic. My son's room on the end of the 15th floor had a panoramic view from the gare d'Austerlitz to Sacre Coeur.What was bad.Check in was slow and it appeared that the only way to check if the room was ready was to send someone to inspect!Lobby was small and cramped.Breakfast cost an arm and a leg. 19 euro ! In Tenerife you can get a full English with two of everything for 2.95 euro. It seems that hotels try and keep the headline price low and make their profit elsewhereOverallA good hotel, we will stay there again.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this new and very nice hotel for just one night as it’s right next to Gare de Lyon so offers a 35min transit to Disneyland Paris, with two kids (5, 8) in tow cut down the ‘non essential’ walking.Nice staff, we got to Paris early at 11am, checked in, rooms were available at 3pm.Breakfast was great, €19 per adult kids eat free so works out cheap as local places and the options and food were good, Crepes made fresh by the bar which the kids loved.Would happily stay at again. View from 13th floor attached. No new for room pictures, the hotel is 6 months old so everything is still as glossy as the brochure!
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brand new Marriott in very nice section of Paris! Good service, friendly staff! Near all public transportation, restaurants and shops! Easy access to all major sights via public transportation! Breakfasts good!
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here our first 3 nights of an 8 night Paris stay. Checking in early after an overnight flight, we were not awarded a room upgrade and because we just wanted to get in a room, we accepted a 3rd floor space. We are Marriott Titanium Elite members.The rooms are large by Paris standards and the bathroom , while modern and clean was tiny. The location, in a neighborhood,and just next to Gare de Lyon train station ,was just fine for us as we could walk to some locations and get the Metro quickly to move around the City. We ate breakfast in the hotel every morning with an $8 discount on the $19 buffet. The buffet was plentiful and very good and both the Night Manager and the morning Manager were very helpful and great! On arriving to our room we did notice an odor in the room and bathroom that came and went , but was definently noticeable. As we had been told at check-in that the facility was at full capacity, I did not request a room change until the morning of our 3rd day there. Katia , at the front desk, immediately responded by offering us a high floor room which we readily accepted . The view was amazing! This mystery odor has been mentioned here before and they need to resolve that. We very much enjoyed our stay there, however, would be hesitant to stay again unless it is cleared up. The staff was very efficient and friendly and everything else was very much in line to receive a 5 star review.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in Paris for business and I was looking for a good hotel average rate near the subway; this hotel fits the description, I came on Sunday afternoon checking was quick & friendly, room with twin beds was ok (got a standard room), not too much space for putting clothes, basic coffee facility (no nespresso mchine..), good wifi, small bathroom but all modern and brand new.Access to subway is easy (50meters..), and I found 2 very good restaurants in the area.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My experience with Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon has been great. Both, rooms and meeting rooms have an excellent quality. The people from the Hotel with who I had the pleasure to collaborate were taking care about all the details of our event, before and during the course of it. My person of contact from the Hotel was Marie Barbou and she coordinated everything very well, attending all our requests during the event. Besides the great organitsation and disposition of the events coordination team, the facilities of business area are very well equiped as they offer a variety of amenities to make you event even more special and a full success (sound system integrated in the meeting room, permanent coffee breaks, free break out rooms, candy bar, intelligent white boards, possibility to have breakfast in the business meeting rooms area...). To summarize, a great experience which make me think automatically about this hotel when organizing my next corporate event!
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel. I would stay here again. Wonderful experience. 20 min walk to Notre Dame, 2 min walk to metro. Geat location to getting around Paris. Hotel is new. The bed was super comfortable. Nice clean well appointed furnishings. The bathroom was very large and super clean with a nice size bathtub not sure if all rooms have tubs but ours e was a small empty refrigerator in our room which was wonderful for being able to chill a nice bottle of wine or keep water cold. Great AC. The front desk staff were very helpful, friendly. Easy check in and check out. there is a small little market you can get snacks, bottles of water, sodas and even wine. the hotel restaurant has one of the best burgers I have ever had. We really enjoyed our stay at the courtyard
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is brandnew, less than a year old. The room is so spacious and modern! The biggest room amongst all the hotels we've stayed during our EU trip. Right next to the subway, very accessible. Check in and check out was a breeze. Staff as nice too. Get a room on the higher floors if you don't want any noise. We stayed on the second floor but we were still able to sleep soundly at night despite the noise from cars outside. Only downside was that they don't have bell boys to help with your luggage and we traveled with 4 huge luggage. I asked the reception guy to help with our luggage and he gladly obliged. I would recommend this hotel. Value for money.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Johnathan took wonderful care of my mother during her birthday, by ensuring that she was both entertained, and that her drink requests were promptly answered. Moreover, Nicolas saw too it that the Nintendo was set up for our son each evening!
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:1. The staff are generally keen to help. 2. The restaurant serves quite decent food and drinks at night. Breakfast is good for its price.3. Location just one minute walk away from the entrance to the subway. 4. Quite a clean room. Comfortable. 5. Good views for some rooms. Cons:1. Requests from the room takes quite a bit of time to be fulfilled. I wait sometimes for half an hour before receiving the items I requested. 2. The front desk staff may be friendly and helpful. But they are busy most of the time. You would need to queue for some time to ask for simple directions. The staff at the main door couldn't speak in English. I think the hotel might be understaffed. Generally an average hotel. Nothing really bad, but certainly areas to be improved.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a week in March on a sightseeing trip to Paris. The location is great - just outside the crush of the crowded tourist areas. The train/Metro station, that can take you anywhere in the city, is right at the hotel's front door. We easily navigated the train from CDG Airport to Gare de Lyon station, and used the Metro to get around thereafter. The front desk and restaurant staff were very helpful, and while they endured our attempts at speaking French, were all quite fluent in English. The hotel itself is a brand new building, and extremely modern in style for a Courtyard by Marriott brand property. The room was quite small, and the WC was particularly unusual. It was also a very tiny space, separated from the rest of the room by frosted glass walls and a glass door with a wide gap that didn't afford the bathroom user any privacy at all. A case of style over function, for sure, but absolutely not ideal when sharing the room with another person. Overall, a very good choice when visiting Paris.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in Courtyard Marriott also this time as I like this hotel for for their excellent hospitality.Check-in time in the morning was really helpful for me to get ready to catch the meeting.Dinner at the restaurant is also delicious with French food and more enjoyable with excellent service, especially AMAL took very good care with her friendly behavior.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The main reason for choosing this hotel was the location. Gare de Lyon train station is one of the few main stations in Paris with multiple connections whether local or regional. Staff (Lisa & Katia) were exceptional. The restaurant was very clean. Breakfast was excellent. Rooms were clean. One of the many entrances to the Gare de Lyon station is just 20 meters outside the front door of the hotel.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We’re staying here for 2 nights in room 1916 ,which has a perfect panoramic view on Paris !The room was very clean and branded new :)Staff was friendly and kind !Also a big thanks to Barbara:)We had Breakfast and Dinner here .Food was very delicious and tastyDefinitely will recommend this hotel and give 5 stars!
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is not your typical Courtyard. It's brand new, and frankly, it's nicer than a lot of full service Marriotts I've stayed in. Service from the front desk was excellent and the hotel was spotless. I communicated with the front desk prior to my arrival with a couple special requests and they followed through flawlessly. They also spoke excellent English. The location CANNOT be beat- it's next to the Gare de Lyon train station and subway stops. The rooms are modern and comfortable, too. Pricing for breakfast is a bit steep- 19 Euros, but everything looked very good (and there is a Starbucks right next door if you want to grab something small and go). Would not hesitate to stay here again and we appreciate the effort they put into making Paris a great destination for my family.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is great, near the metro station as well as the train station. I was greeted with a warm welcome and a nice staff. Check in/out was a breeze. The queen room was a nice size, it was clean, and the advance room rate was a steal! The bathroom is separated by a tempered glass wall, so if the light is turned on in the middle of the night, it’ll wake you up. The water pressure in the shower is good and the water is hot no matter what time of day or night you use it. There’s no microwave in the room, but there’s a fridge and free tea. There was just one minor problem…there was a sewer smell in my room, but it was too late in the night for me to change. The front desk was fast to respond and send a maintenance guy to check it out. He came and sprayed. The next morning I smelled that same smell in the hallway, so I just figured that smell is just gonna be there. Overall, I would definitely stay again if ever in Paris!
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brand new hotel with a cool yellow grey look. everything was really superb. great service from all staff members. clean and big rooms with enough electricity sockets. delicious food in restaurant. just across Gare de lyon with no train noise and train station hassle. 10 minutes walking to republique and its night life.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with a business occasion in February. I had a big room with sofa, faced to the Gare de Lyon. Hotel is cosy, food very good in the restaurant. Breakfast has a lot of options and of course, French pastry :-). Rooms are very clean, I would add a very big plus for the bed and sheets which are really exceptional, I slept very well. One small minus for the towels, as some of them are very used, so they could be replaced. Reception people very helpful and smiling. Congrats to you!
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 4 days with my family and I gave to say that the experience was good.Rooms are as expected on a Courtyard, also the service at the front desk.In the restaurant the service need to improve, specially when there is a group activity clearly you feel that the personal has problems dealing with all that it requires and sometimes they have more that they could handle on their hands. Nevertheless, I have to remark that their actitude is great.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am only 3 days into an 8-day stay, and I am not happy for the following reasons:(1) At around 6pm this evening, I had just showered in my room after a workout and was completely naked. A housekeeper then entered my room completely unannounced and WITHOUT KNOCKING, and I am pretty sure she saw me naked before I could yell at her to get out. This is completely unacceptable and a massive invasion of privacy. She then ran into the housekeeping closet on my floor to hide and would not come back out even to apologize. That is not how you recover from problems in a hotel.(2) On Monday and Tuesday, renovation work and very loud drilling was occurring on what seemed like the room right above mine (I am on floor 2). It starts first thing in the day and lasts for the majority of the day, which has affected my sleep and my ability to work peacefully in my room. It would've been nice to be warned about this loud drilling and hammering during my 8-day stay.I gave my stay 2 stars instead of 1 was because of a waitress in the restaurant who provided impeccable service, and the rooms themselves are immaculate.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a couple of nights and were very impressed. The staff were super friendly and the hotel was situated in a very convenient location. We had a fantastic room with amazing views over Paris. We didn’t eat in the hotel because there are so many local places within walking distance. I would stay here again, especially if needing to catch a train to or from the Gare de Lyon train station.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had dinner at the courtyard last night and it was just awesome. The food was beautifully presented and the taste was incredible. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly and very efficient. I recommend this restaurant at anytime and it is situated in a very convenient spot. The pricing is very affordable. You will not be disappointed here.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To be fair, I gave it 4 stars because of the location and the staff. The room was extremely small for 2 people and the bathroom as well. The view, on the high floor was however, very nice. The proximity to the train and metro makes it really convenient to visit the city and to go to and from the airport. I realized after this stay that I prefer hotels that have a breakfast option for the Platinum members and a lounge. Courtyard does not have any of these. You even have to buy water for your room, nothing is complementary.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Service was top-notch, rooms were beautiful, and food was high-quality. Convenient location to subway system and plenty of good restaurants in easy walking distance. The concierge remembered our names and greeted us as we stepped off the elevator every morning. Laundry service was excellent (although pricy). Lobby was beautiful (although there was an odor from the plants that needs to be remedied). Fabulous experience at a terrific hotel!
