hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is brand new and everything there is clean. Rooms are rather spacious including a very neat bathroom. People at the front desk are nice and make you feel welcome, helping whenever you need them to.Hotel location is very well located 100m from the metro and the Gare de Lyon train station.On the downside, the breakfast (if not including in the deal) is a 19 euros buffet which I find a bit on the expensive side. However, there are plenty of alternatives around the hotel for a nice Parisian breakfast (e.g. les cadrans).
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 9 nights here on the 17th floor facing the city with an expansive view of everything from the Eiffel tower to Mountmartre. Hotel has only been open for about 2 months. A few small kinks to be worked out. These were- the elevators have a good security system to prevent unauthorized access to the floors. Using your room key you key in the floor you want. The system doesn't always work selecting the right floor, so make sure that the correct floor is shown before getting on the elevator. Elevator timing is a little fast on entering, so watch the closing doors. The lobby area is small, but on multiple occasions there was a smell of methane sewer gas wafting in the area. Not real strong, but off putting. Outside there is still construction going on and there is a set of steps to the left of the front entrance that are not marked. As we left on our last day a guest had not seen the steps and fell down. These steps need to be marked or removed. They appear to be left over from whatever was there before the hotel was built. The breakfast was plentiful and offered a choice of both hot or cold selections. The wait staff in the restaurant was very helpful. Ate a couple time other than breakfast. menu is limited but adequate and food is good. Location is excellent if you are traveling to southern France [ Gare de Lyon] of just across the river the Gare de Austerlitz. Also you can catch the Metro and RER lines in either station. There are multiple restaurants in the area, some pretty good. The room we had was a nice size, the housekeeping was excellent and our room was always clean when we returned from a day on the town. The front desk staff was very helpful with information on how to get to various locations such as Versailles and outlying area. Lots of business travelers coming and going but also some tourists. Language is not a problem as the front desk and restaurant staff speak multiple languages. All in all an excellent stay, now just to work out a few minor adjustments and it will be even better
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: With a walking distance location to the metro and major trains ( like the Tgv to Geneva) across the street.”, this courtyard is a great business option. The staff was very friendly , the rooms are sleek modern . There are plenty of food options around all day long . This is very close to Bastille trendy area.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was sadly only here for a night, but from the moment I checked in until I left the staff and service was top notch. They were very accommodating with requests that I had and were more than willing to help me with them. The room had an amazing view of the city, it was modern and clean. The food and service at the restaurant was amazing. The location of the hotel was very ideal, especially easy access to all the popular tourist spots.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location. Good service. Comfortable room. there were a lot of people waiting at the reception when I arrived but they made it effortless and easy by taking my passport and trying to expedite the process. The room is small but this is no luxury hotel. You get everything you need for a good night sleep.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This brand new hotel (in a renovated office tower) is ultra convenient and wins your heart with really friendly staff. The beds are amazingly comfortable! And most of the higher rooms have really good views. Security seems good too! There are just a few minor design defects. Most significant, is the shower head which is cheap and awkward, and the tub that is hard to enter/exit safely. Worst of all is the glass door between the bedroom and bathroom that floods the room with light. Try sleeping through that if your roommate visits the loo in the middle of the night!The rooms are really tidy, with safe, fridge, a nice table for working or eating, and a hot water kettle for instant coffee and tea. They could use a few more storage areas and more hooks for hanging coats and towels. Overall, if you don’t mind an office tower feeling to your hotel, and especially if you need to use the Gare de Lyon train station, this hotel will work out for you just fine!
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have a good and Fantastic View from our room. Good location to catch TGV train for a traveler. The hotel is in front of the main road, public transport is easy to get. Many restaurants nearby the hotel locations.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location for business and leasure alike (the metro and RER just beneath, the busses upfront), very big rooms (for Paris, I mean), SUPERB views from the upper floors, courteous staff (especially given the workload), decent breakfast.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for one night before leaving on a train trip to Barcelona. We were looking for a hotel to sleep and rest in before our train trip. This hotel would be good for any length stay in Paris. It is right across the street from the Gare De Lyon Station. We arrived from the US at 7:30 am on an overnight flight and were at the hotel by 9:30. The staff was very welcoming and did their best to accommodate us. They said they would get a room ready as soon as possible and would call us. We were in our room by 11:15am. It is a brand new hotel and the rooms were very nice. A large King bed and Flat screen TV. There was a hot pot with Nescafe and tea. Also the bathroom was well appointed and large. The area has dozens of restaurants and shops you can easily walk to in addition to the restaurants at the Station. We did not eat at the hotel so I cannot comment on that.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Paris for a week and really enjoyed our stay at the courtyard Gare De Lyon. The rooms are very nice (some have a view of the Eiffel Tower), the staff is most helpful with anything that is needed and the hotel is situated is a great part of town. He gym in the hotel is good as well. I would highly recommend this hotel and will be staying here again myself in the near future.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can I say?it is a brand new hotel, everything about it was nice, rooms were fair in size most definitely clean and comfortable, courteous staff always ready to help, very nice restaurant and great view.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chise this hotel as it was close to the train station. The newly opened hotel is fantastic with great service. Check in was super efficient and the rooms very well equipped and comfortable. Great stay and will be back.
hotelName:
8    Courtyard by Marriott Paris Gare de Lyon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the beginning of July for four nights. Upon check in we were told of an unexpected sailing so we had to schedule our trip around that. We requested a table reservation for the dinner that was to be served during the sailing and was told that a table could be arranged but they wouldn't be able to feed us because they were fully booked, and they were going to prepare meals for the other guests but not for us. We rushed our day to make the sailing on time which included a meal at a nearby restaurant because we were expecting to not be offered dinner with the other guests only to discover during the sailing that we could've eaten a nice dinner while sailing like everyone else. After getting into the room we did a quick inspection and found copious amounts of mould in the shower. The room smelled mouldy and the front desk clerk was very unhelpful and even went as far as to ignore us mid conversation to pick up the phone and talk to her friends for the next five minutes. The next day we set off for our adventures around Paris and returned in the late evening to find our hotel room door left wide open to any stranger passing by. Not sure why but they also removed the garbage can from our room and some of the complimentary toiletries. We had the shower drain back up on us while showering and went to report it to the front desk, they didn't care or know what to do about it. All in all a very unprofessional environment for a hotel or any sort of accommodation in the hospitality industry. Book elsewhere folks. Not cheap. Mouldy. And our personal space and security of our belongings was negligible.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I and my partner enjoyed the place, we really want to coma back for a different room soon. Thanks the jacuzzi was the best and the color changing, the bed was are very good size. We liked the top of the boat too when we can see whole France. And the candle for my partner birthday wow he really loved it, the food also nice cooked.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My entire day was ruined yesterday. I checked in and paid on arrival as your receptionist asked me to. I wish I had not. I booked this stay as I saw on your website that there is a cruise and dinner. I asked the receptionist when shown our room what time dinner was and she informed me there was no dinner and no cruise. I said I wanted to cancel my stay as the only reason I booked was for the romantic cruise, dinner and sleep on the Seine. My special day with my wife has been ruined. It is completely my fault As I did not see cruises were only week-ends but your staff handled it terribly and just dismissed any mention of my refund of €245 for a bed, toilet and shower. No Meal, no bar, no cruise. I was forced to leave and find other accommodation at a cost of €177. (why would I stay on an empty boat on the dock)So my experience of Le VIP Paris is a loss of €422 and no special night for my wife that I had planned. Terrible attitude by the manager. Completely let down by your company.You only get one star as I have to click to submit. It should be NO STARS.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booking:My girlfriend offered me a dinner and night on the VIP Paris yacht. We were supposed to have dinner in the end of July but my girlfriend got really sick and we had to postpone it. That meant we had to pay a fee of 100 euros!! We took the next available date which was in October. When we arrived at the reception on the boat, we also had to leave a 100 euro deposit for the room. And the breakfast costs 17 euros per person!! The guy at the reception was kind enough to offer us the breakfast because of the 100 euros extra fee we already had to pay.Location: The boat is located near Gare de Lyon but I wouldn't say it was easy to find. We spent at least half an hour looking for the boat and don't expect them to answer your calls if don't find the boat. Dinner: The dinner was really great! I definitely enjoyed the food and the singer during the dinner cruise. The view from our table was great and I truly had a wonderful evening with my girlfriend. The only negative point of the dinner was the price. Expect to pay at least 17 euros for a glass of Champagne and not under 20 euros for a half bottle of red wine. Night: The night on the boat was terrible. The boat was staying next to a nightclub-boat. I didn't get much sleep because of the music and the pounding basses. Breakfast: Because of the price (17 euros/person) I was expecting a truly amazing breakfast. I was really disappointed. You get some coffee and pain au chocolat but don't expect much more! I also noted the complete lack of personnel during the breakfast.I will recommend the VIP Paris but only the dinner. It was really memorable and really enjoyed view of Paris by night accompanied by the great performance from the singer.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For all you birthday,weddings , parties. The VIP yatch, propose a 2hrs30 cruse around the famous Seine with choix of different menus and cocktail. and a very pleasant personal. It is very ideal if you are visiting Paris for the first time
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have gone to quite a few weddings, both American and French, but this one was LEGENDARY. I got married on this boat and I must say that this venue is as good as it gets if you want to be sure to have an amazing event. I will be looking to come back for some anniversary celebrations!! :D So many of our guests described the evening as either the best wedding they can remember or one of their top life events period. The owner never ceased to bend over backwards to accommodate our needs and requests and to make little tweaks that we had not even thought of that made everything come off perfectly. No stress, no mistakes, no failures, no missed opportunities. I recommend this venue from the bottom of my heart and assure you that you are in good hands while on board. We reserved about one year in advance and given we had more than 120 people, the package that the owner proposed to us included just about everything we could want. For the per-person price that he quoted us - the package included the reservation of the entire boat from 4pm Saturday to 1pm Sunday, and this includes all 23 cabins which roomed about 48 guests for the event. The guests were required to pay for the rooms in addition to the wedding package but for an extremely reasonable price given the boat's location in the middle of Paris. Our suite was included free of charge and it had its own private deck behind the boat. First of all, the owner is the major asset of this boat. He has an amazing ability to remain calm and positive in all situations and he is very kind in general. Furthermore, he has done this kind of event so frequently that he is able to predict problems and resolve them before they even arise. Basically, the boat's crew managed things so well that we had very little to take care of regarding the preparation of the venue (except delivering the decorations the day before and organizing the photographer, our own cake, and some other little details). The boat even proposes a photographer option if you want them to manage that as well!Our price included an introductory hour of champagne, a delicious 28 piece cocktail-style dinner served to the guests by a wonderful waitstaff, very nice quality red and white wine served with dinner, a dessert (wedding cake), and a great DJ. Plus the boat owner managed the entire event and everything went forward like clockwork. Also, the boat has an arch already in place that can be decorated and used for the wedding ceremony backdrop. Given we had our own cake, the owner agreed to give us coffee, juice, and pastries for brunch instead!!Second, the experience of floating (fairly quickly) down the Seine, surrounded by friends and family while watching the beautiful sights of Paris fly by and dancing to your favorite songs is something magical that everyone who lives in (or even visits) Paris should experience at least once in a lifetime. Actually, this should just be something everyone does as regularly as possible :) The ceremony took place with the boat parked perfectly with the Eiffel Tower in the background. Also, as you go down the Seine, you have to duck your head or sit down for some bridges because the party takes place in the open air on the upper deck and you can reach out and touch the underside of several ancient bridges. The experience is breathtaking!Finally, there is a large dining room where the part can continue after the cruise without bothering the neighbors (too much) at the dock. The dining room opens up onto a lower exterior deck so people can still easily get fresh air. Also, there is a system to project photos and slideshows. The DJ was very talented but at the same time, completely willing to listen to our requests and ideas. In the end the music was a mix between our playlists and his own song ideas and we had a hard time keeping people from dancing non-stop until 5am!! He also took care of the microphones and PA system for the ceremony for a small supplementary fee (totally worth it). At the end, people could stay very late because they were sleeping on board. Such a strong point.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went on a Groupon offer for my 50th birthday. My husband and I had the most fantastic time. The yacht is pretty central to everything if your happy to walk. The food was lovely. Breakfast was a little expensive...but if you have a healthy appetite in the morning it's very reasonable. The wine prices are'nt cheap. 30 quid a bottle. However, I can not rave enough about the whole experience. The staff are so helpful. English is spoken very well. The cruise was amazing. The rooms are great. This is an experience that I will never forget. We loved every minute. We 've been married 25 years and it was one of the most romantic times we have had.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We organized our wedding on the VIP Paris Yacht Hotel as we were looking for a place where we could celebrate on D-Day & have a brunch the day after.Our guests & us particularly appreciated the cruise on the Seine river listening the singer's live. The dinner was nice and the brunch was great.Our room had a private terrasse, the junior suite had a jacuzzi, the other cabins are smaller, but it's great for one night...
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and my fiancé have just returned from a trip to Paris where we stayed on the Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel. We had a lovely stay on the boat and enjoyed the beautiful scenery of the riverboat cruise. The bedrooms where small however where very clean and had a lovely large comfy bed. The bathroom was also small but clean and had nice complimentary toiletries. Perfect for a one night stay. The starter was not to our taste however we enjoyed the rest of the meal very much. We found that the price of drinks was very expensive. All in all we very much enjoyed our stay.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I dont even know where to start with this hotel... you are supposed to book a luxury-romantic night and it turns out to be nothing like that. DONT GO... here is our experience:- Room: super small, you almost cant open the wardrobe because there is no space. The walls-furniture-wood were very old. The room has this light option with different colors and rhythms that reminded us of a cheap motel. Bathroom was super small and old.- Upgrade to superior room: is the biggest joke. You pay 51€ to enjoy a "view" to the river... the boat is located outside the city so all you see is a green -modern- ugly building. The windows are so small that you cannot see anything (in case there was anything to see...) and on top of everything they have a second boat with a restaurant right next to the main boat, so the first thing you see is the deck of this boat.- Dinner: drinks are not included (and are very expensive), quality is bad, quantity is poor. It is true the cruise was nice, but you do this in any other boat from 15 € per person and not 250 €. I had the feeling it was pure scamming what they were doing. We couldn't enjoy the dinner because we couldn't stop thinking of the money we were paying for that!! it is unacceptable!! and everything looks tacky with the lights and the layout...they try to make it look luxurious but not even the waitress come anywhere near to fancy.- "Extras": 30€ for a bouquet of flowers, which turned out to be 5 roses. 26 € for parking per night (when there is zero control and pretty much not a car was there). 40€ for a love pack (which includes some massage oil and another couple of worthless things.- Personal: they couldn't speak English, they were not unfriendly but they were also not friendly and the service was for a 3 stars hotel.We booked it in Groupon and was half price (around 260 €) but I wouldn't have paid more than 50€ for sleeping there. I could only imagine people that paid around 500€.Don't ever go there, there are thousands of more romantic and luxury plans to do in Paris. And when I read the nice reviews about this hotel I can only imagine that we were in different hotels becuase I really cant understand it.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The concept is very nice with a diner-cruise on the Seine, seeing all important sites under a very priviledged angle. The set-up is quite exclusive (max 70p. on the boat) and the staff is extremely friendly. Unfortunately, the food is, though quite good, nothing like a 4-5 stars cuisine but the drinks are priced as if it was: 8 € for a coke !!! Your bill can go sky high if you pick all the numerous options presented (flowers, breakfast, premium cabin, etc). Cabins are very ok with nice bathrooms and good beds. So all in all, stick to the basic set-up (may be a superior cabin with river view is the exception) and enjoy a lovely moment in Paris.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Paris hotels were fairly well occupied due to visits by Andy Murray and the Queen, but I managed to blag a room on board (would you believe it?) a boat. This 'hotel', as it turned out, duly set sail at 8pm and joined the yachts plying the Seine and offering dinner with views of Paris thrown in. It was a bit odd at first finding myself a single on something of a Love Boat - my fellow diners were all couples totally wrapped up in each other. Still, the hostesses paid me ample attention, and music and good food and Paris was more than enough for yours truly. Go for it - but preferably with un/une ami(e).
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I hate to leave a negative review, but I have been meaning to leave feedback for a while on a dinner cruise my boyfriend and I took in January. I had been really looking forward to celebrating our anniversary with a romantic dinner cruise, however after having difficulty finding the yacht initially, we were boarded on to a tiny, very unexciting smaller boat which looked nothing like what we had paid for or anticipated. We were told that the water was too high for the use of the main boat, but I would have appreciating being told this in advance as it really was quite disappointing and verging on claustrophobic. I had fortunately booked a Groupon so it was not full price, but it was still a lot of money for the experience we ended up having. I don't know if it really was because the tides were too high or because there weren't enough people, but overall I was sorry that it was not a more memorable experience on the boat that I had thought we would be taking. The food was okay, but not as good as hoped for either.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wonderful partner booked a special dinner aboard one of Le VIP Paris's yachts to celebrate my birthday. I've always thought that you should be wary when something explicitly calls itself 'luxury' or 'VIP' and, unfortunately, this experience did not prove me wrong. The initial tickets were very, very expensive but did not include any drinks apart from a glass of (mediocre) champagne on arrival. When we asked for tap water we were told that we would have to buy a bottle as the boat's water was untreated. Except, one bottle of Evian water cost 8 euros! I also couldn't help wondering what it was the staff were drinking--not to mention how they could possibly run a hotel on a boat with untreated water... Unfortunately the water was just the start of it. The rose that every woman received constituted another additional cost, despite it being of a poor quality (and, if I'm honest, tacky if you consider that every woman in the room was given the exact same thing...). The wines were all sold by the half-bottle, rather than glasses, meaning that you were forced to spend a lot if you wanted a drink with your meal. Whatsmore, the wine seemed very overpriced--I think the cheapest HALF bottle was 25 euros. After arriving we waited an hour and 45 minutes for our food to be served--no doubt a deliberate ploy to encourage customers to order a drink to pass the time (and perhaps an attempt to get you too drunk to taste the food properly). A member of staff kept shoving a camera in our faces asking to take photos but it was not made clear that we would be charged for these too. Needless to say, we eventually capitulated after much harassment and then got charged a ridiculous amount of money for some average photos--some of which were even duplicates that had just been re-printed in black and white or sepia. At the end of the meal we were asked if we fancied a coffee--again, it wasn't made clear that this would cost additional money--and ended up being charged 4 euros PER espresso. It is a shame that an experience that claims to be about luxury actually just felt like a tacky, gimmicky experience where Le VIP Paris tried to extract as much money out of us as possible. Everything from the decor and food to the staff and service was, at best, mediocre but the prices were sky-high. We could have had a wonderful meal at a Michelin starred restaurant for the same money and all I could think was that my partner--who had tried to do something so wonderfully romantic for me--had just been ripped off. Please, please avoid--it really isn't classy and it's terrible value for money. Men, if you're thinking of booking this, don't-- get your lady the most beautiful bunch of flowers, take her out for a meal at a traditional French bistrot and then take her on one of the bateaux mouches at night (you know, the ones that cost like 10 euros a ticket). Much more romantic and much more original.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited the yacht for a romantic dinner cruise on last weekend as a surprise for my Husband for our 10 year anniversary.Having looked at lots of different companies offering the Seine river dinner cruise, I decided to book with VIP as the yacht itself looked lovely and for the grand panoramic venues. Being our 10 year anniversary I wanted the wow factor and something special. Instead we were ushered from the VIP Yacht to a smaller boat for our cruise. I was told that because the water was too high we could not travel on the yacht boat. If this was the case then I feel guests should have been informed in advance or the cruise cancelled.This smaller boat look like it had been quickly converted into a restaurant. I was given a very small table facing the window. In-front of me was a large frame blocking my view. The boat looked nothing like the pictures on your website.Once back on the boat, I spoke to other couples and they too were disappointed. I also discovered everyone else had booked through Groupon except me. I feel like because everyone had paid a discounted price, we all received a discounted and poorer service and quality in food. It took over 30 minutes to order a drink and that was after requesting a menu as we seemed to not have one on our table. My vegetarian starter was poor and consisted of cold pasta shells and few salad leaves. This was okay for a starter but my main dish was appalling. Firstly it was cold, it appeared that the chef had just cooked a few vegetables and thrown it together on my plate with the same creamy mash sauce used on my starter dish. The deserts were nice.Overall we both had a very disappointing experience, and will remember our anniversary for all the wrong reasons. I would no longer revisit your hotel or recommend the dinner cruise to other friends.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Despite bad reviews, we were very pleased with this hotel that we reserved for the auspicious 2013 31st night celebrations. The superior room cabin was very comfortable though small, the bathroom was bigger than on most boats, there was a tv in the room and the heating worked very well. If too warm, there was a wide window that could be opened. The cabin was soundproof and we had a view of the river (cabin n°8).The dinner was good with big portions, drinks flowed freely and the music for dancing was great too.The staff was friendly and the cruise along the river while dinner was being served gave an added touch of uniqueness to the whole event.The price though quite expensive (+/-€800)seemed in keeping with New Year's eve outings. It included for two persons, the car park, hotel night, dinner, DJ music & unlimited drinks. We stayed one night and did not take the brunch which was a whopping €55 per person. Instead we had a lovely brunch for €35 for two, in a typical Parisian café nearby.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I were on our honeymoon and booked this trip well in advance. What could be better than a dinner cruise on the Seine! The cruise was formal and the food was excellent. We had wine with our lamb dinner and it was cooked perfect. We enjoyed cruising by the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, etc. We took our own pictures during the courses and even got some photos from their photographer with the Eiffel Tower in the background. They took plenty of pictures and we decided to purchase a few. We couldn't have been happier how they turned out.The back end of our honeymoon was a couple nights in Amsterdam. Throughout the 10 day honeymoon, we had purchased many items and decided to ship them back to the United States. We wanted to make sure the pictures would not bend or crease in our luggage, so they went into the shipping box with artwork we had purchased. Needless to say, our box arrived without the pictures or artwork. We were devastated! We contacted all parties involved, but to no avail. Again, we were devastated!I decided to email VIP Paris about the possibility they still had our photos on file. I explained our story about the pictures being stolen and if there was any chance they had them, I would surprise my wife and order them. I dealt with the Director of Operations who gladly told me he would reprint the photos, but I would have to contact UPS to pick the photos up. I established the account and the photos were picked up and delivered to the United States in 5 days! I can't tell you how elated we were to see the pictures again!! It made my wife's day! Thank you again VIP Paris!!!
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm writing this review based on the experience I had in November/December 2012, so things could have changed.I booked to go on the trip in August 2012, for a Sunday in November 2012 for my partner's 40th birthday celebration. The trip was confirmed and I paid for it. A couple of weeks before going on the trip, I reconfirmed our reservation and checked the dress code. We turned up on the agreed date and time to find the yacht unlit and with no one on it. We rang the number we were given on the booking documents and surprise surprise no one answered. The security guard working next door asked us what we were doing and when we showed him our booking documents, he advised us that there was no trip running. He then offered to check this for us and rang VIP Paris who confirmed the trip was cancelled. We were obviously extremely disappointed and so the next day I rang VIP Paris. They explained that they had sent a cancellation notice to me (I rechecked my emails and there was nothing) and that they could move my reservation or refund the money. I asked for a refund and thought that was the end of it. As it transpires, I had to email my request (even though it was their mistake) and send chasers, to be told we need your bank details again. I was told the money would be paid in 5 days, but it never arrived, so in the end I got my French colleague to ring VIP Paris and find out what was going on & tell them in no uncertain terms that I was annoyed. A few days later the money arrived - all in all it took 4 weeks to get a refund!If you are going to use this company, then I'd be very careful and check the day before you are due to go on your trip that it is actually running.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice but I will not do it again as Im not a fan of cruising I was in france on my way to Russia to do some business so I met a freind who wanted to do a river cruise to see as much of Paris as possible. He knew about this VIP . I wish I did not listen to him as I dont like be stuck in 1 spot but i can say the rooms were clean food ok and so damn expensive I will not do this again
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I booked this cruise as part of our 3 night stay in Paris and purchased it half price for the dinner cruise only. We struggled to find it, having been told we need to be there for 730, then it didn't set sail until at least 8.Pros - Intimate setting with approx 20 tables, access to deck for pictures and views of the sights.Cons - We didn't see any food until gone 10pm, we were pulled outside in the rain for about 100 photos which were priced at €12 each. When we sat back down we were again hassled about buying photos. No choice of food more a 'canteen'style set-up. Fillet steak was below average and no question as to how you'd like it cooked. No potatoes with dinner just chopped parsnip, nasty grape and ice cream dessert. Cheapest bottle of wine about €30, cheapest beer €8 for a small bottle.Altogether quite disappointed, would never pay full price which is approx €150 pp.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice concept : you have you diner and hotel on the boat on the river in Paris City ( for 1 night).The sleeping accomodations are perfect (we had a superior room). A lot of space to store, nice shower ....We were lucky and had very beautiful weather, so we could have our chamapgne on the roof terrace. The restaurant wasnotso nice decorated , but the menu was ok (nothing special, but ok). The staff is very friendly but not always so professional .The cruise on the river by night during the diner makes it all good of course!A pity the check in is only from 06:00pm.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at Le VIP Paris is amazing with a great attention to details. Will have to come back on our next visit to Paris as we didn't get to stay the night as all rooms were booked. We did have a super romantic evening cruise with a live jazz duet entertaining the guests during sinner. Even though it rained, Paris was even more magical by night on the Seine. Loved the experience. À refaire!
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A friend and I were in Paris for a day and a night on our way to a meet a group of girlfriends for a "girls trip in Epernay." We wanted to do a river cruise to see as much of Paris as possible and when we stumbled on the VIP yacht we thought "great, we won't have to get off the boat and go back to a hotel after the cruise." We could not have been happier -- the crew was very friendly and most accommodating; the boat was clean and cabins were comfortable; the cruise offered fabulous views of Paris along the river; the food and wine were excellent; weather was ideal (I'm sure the VIP crew put in an order for good weather to make the evening perfect) -- all in all it was an absolutely wonderful experience. I can't wait to take my husband back for the two of us to enjoy a romantic evening!
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon arrival, staff received us with a genuine smile (are we really in Paris?), and started to feel the welcoming atmosphere on board. I was invited to personalize the ambiance by ordering some little extras like a magnificent bouquet of red roses, chilled champagne in the cabin (next time I need to think of the strawberries!), and something I think was a “Lovebox” containing some surprises from a brand called Bijoux Indiscrets. Thanks for the advice, this little plus made a difference.I appreciated the privacy and comfort of the boat and our cozy cabin overlooking the Seine River, the confortable double bed, all equipped with shower and sanitary. Don’t expect a 100m2 hotel room – you are probably in the wrong place – but you get a real luxury Yacht comfort experience. For dinner, we had a table for two on the Seine with the possibility to walk around on deck during our meal. Quality of the meal was aligned with our expectations, and we just loved the chocolate dessert in duo. No need to describe our night onboard, the thing you need to know is that staff really cares about your intimacy, and that it was very … romantic :-) Waking up with the sound of the water lapping was very relaxing, too.VIP is of easy access, and if you really want to leave for a while you may find plenty of nearby walking and cultural activities: Bibliothèque François Mitterand, the Cour Saint Emilion, the Botanical Gardens, Chinatown and Mouffetard, among others. During the trip we could see monuments we would otherwise just ignore while strolling around in a city I thought I already knew well enough.I believe this is a unique and original service in Paris, which made me (us!) have a romantic moment in a different way. Overall, a Quality experience I would be willing to repeat.
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to spend a romantic and original night in Paris, this Yacht is the best choice!You will navigate on the Seine river and see the best sights of Paris especially the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame de Paris, the Louvre and many others buildings.The crew is friendly and responds to all your requests ( flowers, champagne, love box :)
hotelName:
9    Le VIP Paris Yacht Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and traveled to Paris to attend a black tie wedding, and Hotel Edgar was on the list of recommended hotels. We picked it because we dislike large hotels and prefer more the "local experience" when traveling, away from the tourists. This hotel was totally what we wanted. Also, we had a few requests to prep for the event ( hair appt, clothes pressing) and the staff was wonderful with helping us. Breakfast was great and relaxing to sit outside on the plaza. Had a couple meals at the restaurant which were delicious and full of colliding flavors. Rooms are small, clean and comfortable. Typical size for a big city hotel, and we were out most of the time exploring. Short walk to the metro station, just a few blocks.Note: the neighborhood is a spiderweb of streets, so it took us a couple days to get our bearings. Tip: Some friends had problems with taking a taxi to the location since there is a similar named hotel on the east bank. Be sure to provide the taxi driver a detailed address before you start your journey, or just use Uber.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here at the recommendation of my son who invariably stays here when visiting Paris on fashion buisness .We found it charming and the staff could not have been more helpfull . The rooms are admittedly small but VERY comfortable and all you need for a short stay . I asked to see a number of rooms and they were all quirky and interesting . This is not the Ritz but neither is the price but I would rather stay in this buzzy young admosphere than be mollycobled in a museum . It overlokks a small square with practically no traffic and there are outside seats and tables for drinks prior to dinner or lunch . There were practically no tourists staying there which is a blessing , lots of little groups of 30/40 ish people discussing buisness and politics . It was a delight and the food and wine was very good . i shall certainly stay again .
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for a few nights at the Edgar for the Ryder Cup weekend, it's located in a nice small square in a multiethnic area. Rooms are on the small side, but elegant and very clean. All the staff attentive and helpful. Restaurant is very good and overall quality/price ratio is extremely favorable. Only small negative note: the room at street level has some background noise from the bistrot, but more than acceptable. I'll consider coming back for sure
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is small and has a funky, quirky feel. Each room is individually decorated and designed, but most look over a charming courtyard. The hotel has a bar and restaurant downstairs which opens onto the courtyard and is perfect for people watching from early evening to late. Acoustically sealed windows mean that you sleep well even though you are directly above the action. It is close to 3 metro stations so you can easily get to wherever you want in Paris and the district is close to the Gare du Nord so it is also easy to connect with the national train lines.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed at Hotel Edgar twice. Each room is decorated by a different artist and it’s a fun surprise to see which room you get. The hotel is on a quiet street, around the corner from the fantastic Frenchie wine bar and walking distance from the Marais. The restaurant is nice but it’s not open every evening. The staff is incredibly nice and helpful. The one thing to be aware of is that the rooms are small (but not by Parisian standards). If you need more space, get the XL room. And there is a narrow stairway leading to the rooms. The staff will help, but it is a bit difficult if you have tons of luggage. I love this hotel and its ambience and recommend it for anyone that wants a unique place to stay!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: my mother and I spent a long weekend at this hotel. the venue is very nice and a bit hidden. the rooms are arranged in a modern and stylish way with a lot of details and attention. just in front of the hotel there is the Edgar's Restaurant which is excellent and gather a very hip crowd. the location is perfect, central and just a bit out of the tourist path.breakfast is excellent and the personnel very professional and helpful.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is really cute. Nice design, friendly atmosphere and a bit hidden. I think its great value for money. the location is just a bit uncomfortable, (in terms of the neighbourhood close to which it is) but its close to the metro and in a nice small quite square. The rooms are nice and clean, have also nice features about them. Staff was also nice. I didn't have the breakfast, but it was until 11:30! Amazing. So if you are not too connected to a certain area in Paris, i think this is a very good pick.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent two nights at the Hotel Edgar during a business trip to Paris. The hotel was perfect for my needs. Its pretty trendy and well decorated. I had a double room with shower, vanity and wc (no bath). The room itself was small but clean and neat, and had everything you may need. Linen clean.The hotel is above a restaurant which does get a little rowdy at night, which was made slighty worse by the fact, that due to technical issues with my Air Conditioning, I had to sleep with the window open. It would be quieter if the window was closed, but the noise may still get to some, so something to be aware of.Breakfast was fresh and tasty yet basic and was served in the restaurant below.All in all, it is a great spot, in a quiet corner, off one of the busier Boulevards in Paris. I would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only stayed at this hotel one night on our way back home.I wouldn't categorize this as the regular hotel one is used to. It doesn't have a lobby or common areas, as a matter of fact, the front desk is just a little desk on one side of the restaurant, but then again, who needs that when you are out and about all day.The room was awesome. They even upgraded us just because. From what we were told by the super friendly staff, each room is decorated differently and has a theme. There are dozens of restaurants and cafes 3 minutes away.The only negative observation I have is not about the hotel, but about the closest metro station. If you are taking the metro to hotel Edgar, get off at Sentier station not Strasbourg station, unless you want to walk by several ladies with the oldest profession in the world.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for a very brief but busy 2 nights at the wonderful Hotel Edgar this month. Small but charming, excellent restaurant, with lots of competition nearby. Best of all was the marvellous attention and kindness of all the staff. To rip off someone else's term "Ab Fab".
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Restaurant is just fantastic in every way right from the moment that we arrived till the moment we left the food is different to all the Bistros in Paris they specialise in Seafood but with a twistThe service is impeccable and they are super friendly we grazed our way through there menu and they suggested things they thought we would likeThe prices are reasonable I would recommend this and also it is part of a boutique Hotel as wellThe sweets choices has a really funny choice which makes you laugh
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, a few blocks from the metro in Montorgueil. Very close to Stoher, best eclair in Paris and the inventor of Baba au rum. Rooms are decorated in a modern style, good size for Paris. The fish restaurant downstairs is very good.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For some reason, I seem to have difficulties finding the right place for brunch, a place with a pleasant decor, scrumptious and innovative food and attentive and friendly service.I found places where 2 of the elements where present, never the 3 so far. And often it is the service that I find disappointing.Well not here, I went there for brunch on 6th november and I must say, not only was the decor fun and comfortable, the food interesting, especially the Haddock with lentils kedgeree style.But the best surprise, especially in Paris, was the best service I have in a long time: attentive without being obsequious, friendly and efficient from beginning to end.A breath of fresh air in the often conceited and self-important service style you find in this beautiful city.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spend 10-15 nights a month in hotels, mostly large corporate chains. They could learn what authentic service and personality looks like from Hotel Edgar. Even though the hotel restaurant had long queues on most evenings, the wait staff took time to explain to me (in English) details about each and every menu item, and offered me small tastings of dishes so I could make informed menu selections. The hotel, like many in Europe, has small rooms, accessible by stairs. The rooms are kept up impeccably, and sounds from cafe do not carry to the sleeping facilties. The closest metro stop is a five minute walk. The neighborhood is comprised of a healthy mix of various shops with some nefarious characters, but it added to the charm of the experience. The Seine is about a 20 minute walk. Thank you Hotel Edgar for a memorable experience, and for tremndous customer service.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was the biggest surprise. In a location I'd not stayed in before, hotel staff were super friendly, and the hotel had a great vibe. We LOVED our rooms, and I love the concept of each room having a different theme. It's in a great location from Gare du Nord on the metro (20mins door to door if not distracted by the shops). 5 mins from La Marais, and all the cool shops. Would I go back and stay - absolutely. Would I recommend it - absolutely... The only thing we didn't do was eat here, but we will next time!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay in central Paris.Staff are ultra friendly and helpfulThe place is cool and pretty funky - almost like a Paris version of the Hoxton Hotel in LondonHighly recommended and we stayed here on 2 separate nights
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good review first...the staff was amazingly friendly for Paris!Unfortunately, that is the only good thing about this place. The location is just awful. As a single woman traveler, I simply did not feel safe walking to / from this hotel to the major sights. Loads of sex shops, peep shows and prostitutes around the hotel, and dodgy looking shops and nothing else. It was very quiet, but in an unsettling way. The room itself was a wood paneled one {the one in pictures on this site}, which felt more like I was staying at a friend's cabin, than a hotel. Very "cold" feeling and uncomfortably small and bare. Not worth the money at all. I would classify this as a youth hostile, NOT a hotel. I definitely won't ever be back. Made my stay in Paris very stressful and just awful. Spend the extra money and stay at a mid- range hotel in the 5th or 6th. You'll thank me.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the room is really really tiny plus a big disadvantage that you can not see yourself in the mirror before going out... (there is just no mirror). all the rest is great! (breakfast is Basic) the Highlight of the place is the fantastic staff! unbeatable! all soooo nice and helpful. rooms are very clean. contain almost everything (no Minibar). bed very comfi. Location is great.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed just one Sunday night in August, but room no 11 had what I needed, clean bathroom, clean bed, interesting interior, quiet. As always in Europe there are rarely an elevators, but not a huge problem unless you have a lot of luggage. Air conditioning worked great, as well as WiFi.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best place to stay in central Paris. Very convenient. In the heart of the city center. The rooms are super clean, elegant, artsy and quiet. Great food; order the fish for dinner. Good breakfast buffet. Excellent terrace overlooking a small leafy square. Nice background music. Closest metro is Réaumur-Sebastopol
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been traveling to Paris for work quite frequently and my usual hotels were booked this trip. I decided to try out Hotel Edgar based on a recommendation from a colleague. It's a boutique hotel with a great restaurant/bar on the lower level which was always full when I arrived 'home' from work. The staff is fantastic and happy to accommodate to the best of their ability - especially Alexandra and Xavier.The room I stayed in (6) had a muted elegant feel and was a great size for my 4-night stay. The wifi was also great - probably the best I've experienced in a Paris hotel. The only downside - my room was right above the outdoor seating area so it was a little noisy until the crowd died down.I enjoyed my stay and will be staying again!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 6 nights at the Edgar recently. It was a wonderful experience. The room was appealing. The bed was comfortable. The staff was so nice and accommodating the entire time, very personal and friendly with us. We spent a lot of time sitting outside at the restaurant downstairs having drinks and food. All around we had a great time at the Edgar.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A week ago we spent a couple of nights in this charming hotel. A bit off the most touristic areas the hotel lies on a small Square with its own outdoor seating. The hotel has only 12 rooms spread over 3 floors, some rooms rather small but some a bit bigger. The 3 rooms we saw were comfortably equipped and with good beds.We were very well taken care of by the staff who were all younger and most spoke good English, some even very good.The hotel has its own restaurant that we tried it for breakfast, lunch and dinner on different days, and we can highly recommend it.But what really stood out for us was the really pleasant and helpful staff, and I would like to mention in particular Alix in the reception and a little bit of everywhere and Xavier in the restaurant. Made our visit to Paris really great.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is real hidden gem as this hotel, with a deep modern vintage personality, is facing a small square in the 2nd arrondissement in Paris, that is giving you the feeling to be more in a French village than in Paris (this is a plus ) You are few steps away from Les Halles as Bastille, still when sitting outside the lovely bar and restaurant and enjoying their not obvious selection of food and drinks, you might get lost in the imagines of a peaceful retreat away from city bustles .Everything in this structure has been done, I guess, expressly to show the imperfection of an old structure smartly converted in a trendy destination . Floors are uneven , rooms ( I was staying in a standard room) small sized (as unfortunately typical in Paris) but not as small as you can find somewhere lese. Decor played on pastel tones with touched of colours in line with the current decor styles, touches of modernariat everywhere, nice lamps and good bathroom with quality tolietries . Bed confortable and king sized . All staff are attentive and uncompicated , this is not a place for people looking for formalism , A nice new adress to be put on the list of those willing more personality than standardism Good price value, wifi working perfectly and free of charge , lively crowd at the bar in the evening close to two underground stations both reachable within few minutes, the area is also packed with bars and whatever needed to make your stay even more pleasantHip and cool . Highly recommendable
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights and really enjoyed it. The design of the hotel is quite special, which makes it a pleasure to stay there. The staff is very friendly.The rooms are very small (typical for Paris) but with a very comfortable bed. If you want to spend a lot of time in the room, then you better book the largest rooms. There was no noise coming through from other rooms or from the street. There is no elevator so you have to carry your luggage up the narrow stairs to the first or second floor.The hotel is in a nice area, within walking distance of lots of restaurants and pubs (avenue Montorgueil), centre Pompidou and Les Halles and 4 metro stations. At the same time, the street itself is quiet and without many tourists. It feels like you are all of a sudden outside the city.We had dinner in the restaurant on one evening (it is closed on Sundays) and really enjoyed it. The only minor point of the hotel is the breakfast. We would have preferred to have a bit more choice (e.g. fresh fruit) for the buffet of 16 euros pp.Overall, we can certainly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The restaurant is part of the trendy Edgar hotel. The menu is somewhat limited, but everything on it was very good. The boudin was particularly great. Both the crowd and staff were young and hip. Service was quite friendly and accommodating. Fairly-priced and cool place--I'd go back.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean, Excellent food, amazing staff and customer service, you should try their Burrata! I visited this retaurant twice during my short stay in Paris and I loved everything about it! It is a must visit when you are in Paris!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love this hotel! Every room has a different artistic theme- we stayed in a room full of toys and plastic snakes- excellent fun and it was very well executed.The rooms are not massive but definitely big enough and the bathroom was great.All staff are extremely friendly and the food and breakfast are both very good.The location is great, very close to the Louvre and the gardens of Tuileries and the neighbourhood was really cute and 'parisian' looking.Top marks!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 3 nights here and enjoyed it. We had room 6 which was a very good size by Paris standards. We had dinner in the hotel and it was excellent, mainly fish but other interesting options on offer. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel bar is very popular with locals.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were blown away by what we stumbled across when searching the quaint backstreets of Paris. From reviews we read, we were excited but didnt expect such a lovely botique hotel. Set back from the hustle and bustle you really felt part of the local culture. The hotel is set in a little square and looks modern. The staff were lovely and greated us warmly. They spoke great english and even assisted with bags. As were were on the 1st floor, and they dont have lifts... We chose to stay in one of their boutique rooms, that are all individually designed. Every detail was unique and well thought trhough. We had the black room... Everything was black... awesome. So different to what we expected, so much better than what we expected. they have a bar and restauramt downstairs. We ate there the ifrst night, and the food was amazing. Very authentic french and, but modern. Menu was in french, so dig out your dictionary or just guess like we did! we were always amazed with what was brought out. Pretty good value, and discounted becasue we stayed there. Another night we explored resturants close by and found a great place to eat- Frenchie- you must go! amazing and 5 min walk.On our way out, we left our luggage with the recpetion for a couple of hours before we headed back on the metro (5 min walk away also) They asked if we had any requests or recommendations.. we said no! and that we would love to come back!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this beautiful small boutique hotel for 10 nights and we are very satisfied! Every member of the staff was extremely friendly and helpful and they all spoke English. Special place in our hearts has the wonderful girl at the reception who was so nice that she made us feel like family! The room was beautifully decorated, was always cleaned to perfection and they even brought us 2 complementary bottles of Evian every day! The restaurant on the ground floor is superb and is filled every day with locals, which is always a good indication for the quality of a restaurant. The hotel is located in a nice area near the shops and a metro station. We will definitely stay there for our next visit in Paris! Thank you guys for a truly wonderful stay!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great find - from their wacky website to their impeccable service delivery this was the proverbial hidden gem. The rooms were individual, big enough for a short stay, clean and air conditioned - a welcome treat in this blistering Parisian heat. The location was close to the metro and all Paris has to offer. We ate once in the restaurant and the quality of food and wine was excellent. The buffet breakfast also was good. All in all we were very well looked after by the Edgar's team. Although not cheap I would rather pay extra for the personal touch and a little piece of 'Frenchness' that you don't get in large faceless hotel chains and would recommend this hotel to all my friends (and already have!).
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was nice and cosy, we had the only room with an extra bed, which was big enough, considering it's Paris. Great bathroom space, restaurant, decent breakfast (not too many choices, but good quality). The only downpoint is the staircase, which is narrow and hard to climb, but the all lovely staff will help you with the luggage as well!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A friendly and helpful receptionist offered to carry one of my two cases to my room on the second floor (they don’t have a lift); next time I’d accept as the stairs are narrow. The small bedrooms overlook an open area with trees and are at the end of a road, but this is central Paris so despite efficient double-glazing you may still hear some noise. The air conditioning works well. The bar and restaurant downstairs spills out onto the pavement, a delightful atmosphere. Wi-Fi works (not fantastically fast but adequate, but desk space is very limited, only sufficient for a laptop computer. The shower was sufficient, good shampoo. I’d stay again and next time try to be up in time for breakfast.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fabulous long weekend in Paris and this hotel choice played a great part in our enjoyment. Staff are excellent -they are friendly and very keen to help and make sure you have everything you need to make the most of your stay. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. They are quite compact but we'd gone to see the city not sit in the room. The atmosphere around the place was brilliant. It is clearly very popular and the tables were full every night and most lunchtimes. That is partly because of the great food and decent drink prices (for a major city). The place was buzzing and it was good to be part of it. When we went to our room, there was no discernible noise despite overlooking the mainrestaurant area. The air conditioning could do with some more oomph for the comfort of us more, well nourished fellows but that is a minor issue. Location wise, you're in a comfortable 15-20 minute ramble to much of historic Paris. Nearest Metro is 5 minutes away. Other reviews say the hotel isn't cheap but if you want cheap don't go to Paris. Is it value for money? Absolutely. We would happily stay there again.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this fabulous little hotel for business, but I will definitely be back for pleasure. Great design, kind and friendly staff and perfect location. Would highly recommend if you are looking for something individual and relaxed.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice authentic place, with upgraded fish meals available. Good food quality, maybe quite expensive. The staff is welcoming. We experienced a problem with a wine bottle but it has been replaced at once, without any problem. You can plan to go there with your eyes closed!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at hotel edgar whilst on a business trip to Paris and it was really great, staff were really friendly and always happy to help with anything. The rooms were well designed, comfortable, and clean. In total our group tried 7 of the rooms, and it was clear a lot of thought had gone into each of them, making a great change from the generic hotel room you normally see.Good value for business or couples.The location is great, near several different metro lines, up-and-coming, good mix of cool boutiques, nice bars and restaurants (and of course the wholesale clothes shops selling anything covered in diamantes).
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely little hotel with crazy decor, different in each room. Like all Paris hotels, expect small rooms, but it is the unexpected details at every turn that make it such a pleasure to stay here. That, plus lovely helpful staff make this somewhere I'd definitely recommend.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I will start w the good. Cute rooms and clean. Decent location. That's about all this hotel has going for it. No amenities. Staff is ok. A bit inconvenienced. Can't get food late a past 10:30.... Sometimes no one at desk. Hotel is a WALK Up, dimily lit. They seem to treat local customers better than hotel guests.Area is ok but when person reviewing mentioned seedy that's because there are hookers day and night a street away. All seemed harmless though.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although we arrived quite late in the hotel, we got a very warm welcome and still managed to get a table at the hotel restaurant. The atmosphere was great, the food lovely. The room was very clean an superbly decorated. I've stayed in Paris quite some times, and this hotel is by far the best. The manager was incredibly friendly, as well as the staff. An excellent choice. This hotel definitely added value to our city trip. The neighbourhood isn't the best you can find, but subways are close and if you walk for five minutes, you enter a nicer area. It shouldn't be a blocking issue. The hotel itself is a feature!Thanks to the staff and the managers for opening a funky and nice hotel in Paris. I hope it will be a success.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a few nights in May. What a really nice hotel! The rooms are small, but that is pretty much standard for Paris (unless you plan to spend a small fortune for your hotel).The pros:The room was perfectly clean on arrival and this standard was maintained by housekeeping every day. The room also had a very ‘’new’’ feel to it.The staff were really friendly and made us feel welcome. Additionally, they were always helpful. For example, we had an issue with our shower (one of the knobs wasn’t working) at about 10 pm one night. I went downstairs and informed the manager. About 10 minutes later he showed up and repaired it personally. I found the location really nice and very practical. You’ve got 3 different subway stations within a 5-6 minute walk (Sentier being the most practical in my opinion). Also you are only a about a 5-minute walk away from the Rue Montorgueil and all of its nice restaurants, bars, and cafes.Also, the restaurant/bar at Edgar is very nice and opened relatively late. It is a very nice place to sit down and have a few drinks to relax after a day of doing the sites in Paris. Again, the staff are very friendly.The cons:I didn’t really have any. If I were being hyper critical I would say that if you are very hungry that the restaurant may not get the job done as the vast majority of the menu is tapas and might leave you still hungry. However, as I said above, you are 5 minutes away from loads of restaurants and cafés along Rue Montorgueil.As for the reviewer who called the area ‘’seedy’’, frankly the only part of the area that might fit this description would be the area around Rue St. Denis / Blvd. St. Denis intersection, which is not right next to the hotel and is an area that you probably will not even see unless you need to go to the Strasbourg St. Denis subway station. And frankly, it wasn’t that seedy.All in all, I would certainly recommend this hotel. You are not very likely to find a hotel with Edgar’s combination of cleanliness, friendliness, and proximity to metro stations for this price.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Paris is expensive and you might have to pay +200 EUR/night, just to stay in a hotel room that is super small and has old furniture, BUT NOT HERE! Oh, what a treat this hotel was. The price is excellent for what you get, the staff is very friendly and helpful, the room had a more than decent size for Paris and everything was so clean (not a given unfortunately, so I have to spell it out here)! Regarding helpfulness of staff for instance: One of the shower knobs regulating the temperature was not working, we called down and within 10 minutes everything was fixed. Uncomplicated, speedy, friendly. Also, I would love to try all of their rooms since every room is different and was designed by a different designer (duo). This was the original reason why I wanted to stay at this hotel. We were in a room named "Fran by Dave" Other reasons to stay here:- Several metro stations very close by (2 minutes of walking)- Notre Dame, Louvre in walking distance. Go to Rue Montorgueil, about 2 minutes from the hotel. There are cheese stores, butchers, fish market places, fruit stands, cafe's, restaurants, pharmacies, etc.- Restaurant/Bar at Hotel Edgar: We had tapas once and the food quality was excellent, the ham was melting in your mouth, it was so tender....it also explains the price which was quite high, but this is Paris and quality was excellent! It was nice to have a bar there, we walked so much during the day, it was nice to unwind at the restaurant, have some drinks and go upstairs just fall asleep immediately.- Also, this hotel is tucked away several tiny streets from the main roads, so it is calm and not as crowded.I loved this place and will recommend it, or even better: Stay there again myself!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Edgar is a great hotel just north of the sites of Paris. The hotel room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. The staff was very friendly. We had a few cocktails in restaurant- we didn't eat there but the entrees looked amazing and the restaurant was always busy. Its located really close to shops and restaurants. The sites (Palais Royal, Louvre, Georges Pompidou, Notre Dame) are within walking distance as well. We would stay here again and will recommend it to our friends.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the concept of all the different rooms, a very parisian trendy boutique hotel. Located walking distance from all the tourist attraction of Paris (Marais, Louvre, Opera). The decor of the restaurant is very well done. Excellent food. Highly recommanded.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Edgar
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sally United States of America9.6This is a winning place to stay when visiting Paris. · The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. They have the teeniest elevator ever, loved it. The bed was comfortable, the fireplace(not a working one) was charming, and in addition to a table and chairs to have breakfast on, there was a cozy little settee. The large windows opened easily and let in a nice breeze. There was an excellent view of the dome of Saint-Augustin church, from our fifth floor room, and the French flag flying in the distance. There is a metro(9 line) station a 3 minute walk from the front door. We had a great experience here. I’d stay here again. · The street was noisy with the windows open. I’d guess the rooms on the other side of the hall might be quieter, but probably lacked our view. The shower sprayer did not have a wall mount, it just rested on the handles that control the water on and off. It worked well enough, just couldn’t stand under a spray hands free.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location: The hotel is situated at the prime location of Paris, 3 minutes walk from St. Augustine Metro Station. Easy access to public transit. 15 mins walk to the Gare de Lyon Metro Station which is served by high speed TGV bullet trains to various Europe countries. 20 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower.Rooms:Rooms are not very big in size but comfortably good. Neat and clean. There’s a beautiful small balcony from where you can enjoy the beautiful view city structures.Staff and Services:Very polite and friendly staff. Breakfast was less than average. There was no dining area and the breakfast was served in the room itself. The Elevator was very small. Overall the location, staff and the ambience of the d’Argenson was great. Ratings:Location: 5/5Staff: 4.8/5Breakfast: 2.8/5Value for Money: 4/5
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: D’Argenson would be a nice two star hotel to stay at under any circumstances: excellent location (especially if you are here to see the Caravaggio exhibit nearby), comfy bed and, my favorite touch, breakfast served in your room.Add to that that they are not only pet friendly, but they also DON’T CHARGE A PET FEE! The few pet friendly hotels I have found in Paris charge a hefty fee. No pet fee! Woo-hoo!This will be my new go-to when travelling with my dogs.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Don't book in 2018, they are renovating. It is dirty, they are working in the early morning, load, horrible smell of glue and paint. Very Small room, Rude Personal. No excuse, no warning up front. Worst hotel ever.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this is a nice hotel which is in the midst of renovating all of its rooms. location is excellent and the staff are very helpful. The only issue is that the lift is tiny so you have to be a bit patient and take a couple of trips up and down. For those on a budget, or those who are looking to stay somewhere which is less generic and corporate, I'd recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was fine, host was fine too, although he could not help us with the transportation details from the hotel to Paris Nord. There were works going on with a very penetrating paint smell, also the elevator was not big enough for hardly one person. Sorry, but not recommandable (for the moment). Well situated though.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for business and needed somewhere cheap and close to work. Found this for £60 and booked. When I arrived, I was greeted by a friendly member of staff and entered into what can only be described as the smallest elevator but very handy with heavy luggage. The room was perfect, couldn't ask for better especially considering the price. You'd pay more for less space in other hotels.Breakfast was adequate, nothing special but just what I needed. My one and only complaint is that the people in the room next to mine were loud and were up to gone 1am which isn't great when I've got work in the morning!Great hotel, don't hesitate to stay.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel from which to visit Paris. Very centrally located. Nice breakfast served in the room. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The only thing I would recommend is an eye patch as the outside lights shine through the curtains
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this Hotel in May 2017 during our 3 day trip to Paris. Its located at a pretty nice location which is not far from the Eiffel Tower. Though the lifts/staircases are suffocating and scary, rooms are spacious with french look. Breakfast is provided by the housekeeping person (they supply tiffins to your room) which is avoidable. This is located very close to metro/bus stand and makes it easy to go anywhere. Though we had a good time there (whatever time we spent) until we met one of the caretakers (gentleman who takes care of the property in the night). This gentleman is not only extremely rude but unreasonable and insensitive. We were returning with good memories from Paris but this person lived upto the french reputation (as generally known here). Overall, if you are visiting Paris first time and looking for a budget hotel, you could consider this place provided you can avoid this gentleman.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We love this hotel for the authentic Parisian feel and excellent location. However, we are disappointed that our room this time had modern furnishings inside a classical interior. Our memory was of a room with a wonderful classical feel about it. We truly recommend to keep the character of this hotel true to a Parisian classical atmosphere. Throw out the modern furniture and we'll enjoy visiting this hotel again in the future. It's worth ordering the breakfast brought to the room and the management is very kind.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our experience here was wonderful! This quirky little hotel served our needs very well - the room was spacious (the hallway, staircase, elevator and entrance to room number 14 were not, but that`s part of the charm!). The windows were very effective at keeping road noise down, and you could open them to hear the bustle of the city if you wanted to. The bathroom was very modern and shower quite roomy, though the drain couldn`t keep up - we learned quickly to shower in minute long bursts or have to towel the floor.Continental Breakfast was generous and arrived promptly when asked for (they usually asked when they saw you the day before). We bought too much food for a picnic lunch and they put the food in the fridge for us overnight, and chilled the wine we brought!The staff was bilingual and was happy to help with directions and restaurant suggestions.I actually shorted us a day on the initial booking, and my wife caught it - called them a week later and they honoured the price and let us stay in the same room! They didn`t have to do that and we appreciate it!We have fallen in love with Paris (cliché I know!), and we will happily return to Hotel d`Argenson for our return trip(s)!
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
