review_body: To start... we loved the lady at the reception! She was so friendly and helpfull and speaks so very good english! Also the younger man at the reception when checking out was so friendly and open! The hotelroom (12) was superbe. We were three persons and It was large enough, it was very clean and it was well furnished! We felt completely at home here! A hotel as you imagine going to Paris! The wifi was also very strong! The beds were very good, we slept like babies! You could hear people talk in the corridor, but you couldnt hear outside-noise, it was well isolated with double windows! There is this little elevator that was very helpfull for our luggage!The only thing that was disappointing was the man on duty on fridaynight.... He was the total opposite of the nice lady ;-) We will come and stay again!
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived off the eurostar at about 10.30pm and were welcomed warmly by our host - his English was not great but he was super patient and explained everything in slow basic French for me to understand!On Saturday morning we awoke to breakfast in bed which was lovely, a continental of croissants and baguette with tea/coffee and fruit juice, as well as fruit preserves, nutella, cheese, and apricot fruit salad.During the day we were able to visit the Louvre, Notre Dame, Rue Mouffetard and the Eiffel Tower easily, and then managed to get to the Arc De Triomphe and down the shopping street of the Champs Elysees before watching the Rugby in a pub nearby.We slept well and had a great checkout time of 12pm, and they were kind enough to hold our bags until we were ready to head to the Eurostar.As a bad side, It's very, very loud in some rooms - the doors are very heavy and the hotel is old, so anyone moving/leaving their rooms/flushing the toilet is harsh.We were in room 20, and it's the smallest on the second floor. This was fine for us, but if you need more space or want to spend more time in the hotel, I wouldn't choose this room.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a little taken aback by the glowing reviews of this hotel. I think it is fair to say it is a two-star hotel in every sense of the word, and if you are expecting services of any kind, forget it. Do some people just care that there's a bed and an included breakfast? I suppose so, and the price I booked certainly seemed reasonable considering how expensive Paris is. But...the hotel is in need of freshening. The rooms were not as clean as they could've been: grungy remote control, crumbs in the cupboard, stained rugs and chairs. The bed, which I didn't sleep in, had a thin mattress and minimal bedding. The antiques looked more like thrift shop finds, but again, the rooms were larger than expected, and there was a kind of charm to the old-fashioned turnkeys and the nook-and-cranny hallways.We checked in and were shown to our room via a elevator so small you could barely squeeze in with your luggage, one person at a time. It was creaky but I had been forewarned and it contributed to the historical feel of the hotel. When we got to the room, we found one bed; we needed two. We were shown another room; same thing, one bed. I checked my reservation and the manager admitted it was their error. (I had tried to communicate via email with the hotel twice before I let on the trip, and never received an answer) He offered us a second room at no charge for the night, and then he would see about adding another bed to the original room the next day. I appreciated that he offered a solution and was trying to make us happy.I don't usually stay in 4 and 5 star hotels because price is a factor for me, and since I'm the kind of traveler who doesn't spend a lot of time in the room, that's how I usually choose a place to stay. But...I do need and depend on basic services. I had fallen on this trip and wrecked my knee. When my friend asked for ice, the manager told her she needed to walk two blocks away for ice and water. Since I needed ice through the night, that wasn't going to work.We both realized we were not going to be comfortable so we chose to relocate, but it was not without a very uncomfortable discussion with the manager, and having to pay for a night because we were outside the cancellation period.I'd say if you are going for price, don't care about services, or being in a somewhat isolated area, a bit off the beaten track, then come ahead. If anything I mentioned would bother you, this hotel is not for you. I would also say, not that I've seen the hotel, and moved to another one for a better price, this place, though more affordable than some, is a bit overpriced given the state of the hotel.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is a block away from the Miromesnil Metro station, and the room was clean and beautiful. In the morning, we got a beautiful breakfast of fruit, pastry, yogurt, coffee delivered to our room at our specified time. They had the tiniest elevator I've ever seen, but it held us both (capacity 4? Yeah, 4 toddlers!). Great restaurants in the area, especially the (I think) St Augustine. Street noise was totally shut out by the windows. We would definitely go back.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I learned about Hotel d'Argenson from my uncle and I have to say that it lived up to his reviews. The breakfast was great, I felt very safe staying here and it was a block away from the subway. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It is important to know that the bathrooms are very small. I am an average sized person and found it hard to move or change clothes in the bathroom. The rooms are quite small but have everything you need. Important to note that the rooms also do not have AC... which is common in Europe but for a Canadian, I was not use to it.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly hotel, clean and good location. comfort room for 2 persons is available. Good price- quality.Charmant and not so big hotel. Breakfast is nice (which is given in your own room). Bathroom is comfortable.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a Great location, walking distance to the champs d' Elysee and then on to the other major attractions. The hotel has an old feel which is great while the rooms are large and comfortable.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel with no big expectation. Our focus was on Paris and this Hotel seemed to be in great locality. However, we found out this place very convenient. The staff was kind with sufficient level of english and ready to help with everything we needed. The room was clean and comfortable for a couple with a small balcony. It was kind of noisy there when we opened the window but otherwise it works reliably. The wi-fi wasn't really strong but enough for our needs. The Breakfast was tasty and we especially appreciated the flexibility of delivery.I would recommend it for undemanding people who enjoy local atmosphere.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel in Paris where they bring your breakfast your door. Also a lift which I'd very nice. Good location and close to Metro and big department stores. Patisserie next door and food Monoprix a few blocks away.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very cozy, however it is small. But the room was clean, the size was ok, personnel friendly and location is just 3 minutes from the metro station. What else do you need if you don't plan to spend your vacation in the hotel :)
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay! Decent , clean and Basic and value for money. We are not looking for luxury as we were out most of the time walking/shopping around and sitting in the cafe! We went for the corner room on the 2nd floor (with discount as it is a smaller room. It came with a little balcony overlooking the street view - not noisy at all at night (no lift by the way but has a classic stairs to walk up). No common room for breakfast hence they would bring breakfast to your room as the time you requested! Location is great! 15-20 mins away from Lafayette; 20-25 mins to Opera. ideal if you want to stay away from the tourist crowd. The area has very nice local authentic cafes, bakery and restaurants/bars. Quality is good and around with the locals! We use Uber/on foot to reach places so didn't get a chance to use the Metro!
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights in this family run hotel. We received extremely friendly and helpful service, our breakfasts were served in our room at a time to suit us and were delicious. The room was fine, very clean, but the shower room was a little on the small side, although, perfectly adequate for our needs. The bed was very comfortable, but it did have a waterproof sheet over the mattress,(we do understand and appreciate why!) which made you very hot.The hotel is in a perfect position to visit all highlights of the city centre. The metro stop, Miromisnel, which was just around the corner, was perfect to get to where we wished. Overall, a very comfortable stay and we would stay again, no problem.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel was really pretty and clean. Our Room was quite small, but comfy. The staff war friendly and helpful. The only point of critique were the sawage pipes. Whenever we or our neighbours used the flushing or shower ist was really noisy. But it didn't bother too much ;-)
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All the usual caveats apply; small room, tiny bathroom, but overall this was a pleasant experience. Not cheap, but not outrageous. Small but welcome breakfast served in your room. Nice neighbourhood, and two mins walk from the metro. Would happily go back.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The owners of the hotel were very friendly and very helpful from start to finish. Decor is traditional Parison but it could be argued slightly outdated. It was very clean though & had all you need. Sound travels though in this closely packed hotel so lots of privacy and quiet lie ins are not what you will get at this hotel!
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The good:We arrived at this hotel (excellent location btw) and I was utterly charmed by the decor! We were in room number 11 on the first floor. We found it at the end of an impossibly tiny corridor. No matter, we squeezed into the room - beautiful vintage-esque furnishings in a decently spacious room (by Parisian standards). The bathroom was so small we actually started laughing. When you enter it, you have to walk sideways (crab style) since it's so tiny. Still, it was very clean. The windows open out overlooking the street, and it was nice to watch life pass by. The bad:What we didn't realise, and the front desk person definitely never mentioned, was that our room was squished between the hotel's kitchen and their office. So at the crack of dawn (literally around 5 or 6am), there was all this incredibly LOUD clanking, banging and talking (yelling) right next door from the kitchen, that lasted all the way until 11am. We were already exhausted when we'd arrived the evening before, so needless to say we didn't get to sleep in at all. I really wish the front desk person had warned us, so that we could have requested another room (even if it meant paying a bit more). I was so tired the next day! :( On the bright side though, they delivered a light breakfast to us in our room (included in the room rate). The tray consisted of fresh baguette as well as delightfully flaky croissants, with butter and jam, and tea and coffee. I'd stay here again, but only if it's in a different room. Location was very good - it's close to the metro and Gare St Lazare, plus super close to plenty of restaurants, shops, and a Monoprix.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel has such delightful French charm.We stayed for two nights on the 5th floor which had wonderful roof top views from the balcony.With en suite bathroom- the room was immaculate and the bathroom spotless.Breakfast is served in your room- fresh croissant and coffee delivered by staff who were delightful and friendly.They let us drop our suitcases off prior to checking in - which gave us more time to meander this wonderful city.It is well situated- the nearest metro min walk. And once on the Metro never far from the iconic buildings.Reasonable priced.We shall definitely return.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel - all faded French charm, big windows and a little bit of grandeur(although they were about to close to renovate). Very clean, Well located. Great staff. Super value. Bed was soooo comfy.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Paris is quite expensive so there is no denying that this hotel provides good value. The rooms are large, nicely decorated and the washroom is adequate. The breakfast is good and held us over until lunch time. The location was a bit further from the Eiffel Tower and Louvre than we were expecting based on the other reviews. About a 30 minute walk to most main attractions. There is a metro station close by if you prefer not to walk which would get you to most spots rather quickly. The rooms were hot as it was the middle of July, but the fan in the room did help to keep it more comfortable. The lady we encountered at the front desk was very friendly and personable, we personslly found the two men were not as friendly or welcoming. Our stay at the hotel was good enough however, If we were to return to Paris we would likely choose something with closer proximity to the Eiffel Tower and other major attractions. Despite the likely price difference we prefer to walk as much as possible on our holidays and this was just a bit further out.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: near the station (miromenil, saint augastin)clean room ( nice bath room )nice breakfast (delivery room on time)but... small room but it's not too matter.if you want to cheap and good hotel, choose this hotel.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon arrival we had the option to select a bigger and newly renovated room for the same price as a standard room. We took the bigger room of course.The rom is located in the 6. floor, but no stress for us as you take the elevator to the 5.floor and walk the last stair.The hotel is typical "Parisian" with small corridors and a cozy atmosphere.The breakfast is served in your room and consists of croissants, baguette, butter, jam and your choice of drinks. The hotel is well located with short walking distance to Champs Elysee, Louvre or the big shopping center Galeries Lafayette. When I mean short, I think about 8-10 min walk.As we were so lucky with the weather our hole stay, we rented bikes, had a lovely picnic near the Eiffel Tower. I must say Paris is a beautiful city with so much atmosphere and culture, but it is expensive to eat, especially in the typical tourist places. Next time around we will go further away from the center to discover more places.But we will definitely stay at Hotel d`ArgensonThe owners/staff were very welcoming and made our stay perfect.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful room - extremely comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful - went out of their way to fulfil all our needs. No tea/coffee or hair dryer in room - but these were provided on request; also iron & table. Very good value. Good position for central Paris. Online reviews to be trusted and can't be recommend too highly!
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very, very good. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. But be honest with yourself about your type of travel and expectations. If you are a budget traveler, this is a wonderful place. We stayed twice in May, once on the second floor and once on the fourth floor, as a base between trips to Venice and London and to spend a little time in Paris. Both times we had a view of Haumann and the Shakespeare bookshop. We could not have been more pleased with LOCATION. 20 minutes of walking up Hausmann to the left and you are at the Arch d’ Triumph. Walk about 20 minutes in the opposite direction (know the city well or make sure you have a map) and you are headed to Louvre and other main attractions. In spite of the busy street, both rooms were super quite with windows closed. The lower room had a lovely, small balcony. The upper room had only a widow rail, but still offered a fresh breeze when needed. Bathrooms are small, but clean. Expect a European shower and have a bar of soap (you get one small bar). Our lower room had some rug spotting, some minor paint flecking on the high ceiling. Our fourth floor room had newer rugs, bathroom tile and curtains. Beds were firm. Using curtains and shutters, you can sleep till 10:00 if you desire. But breakfast is served at the exact time you desire (within 15 minute intervals) in your room between 7 and 10. The staff speaks multiple languages, is very fluent in English and was pleasant and helpful on all shifts. We hope to return to Paris in the future and this will certainly be a place we will consider again.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second time staying in this hotel. Still great. This time just for the week-end( 2 nights- 27-29 march). Thanks to the wonderful lady from reception ( sorry, I didn't get your name) we got a room on 5th floor on short notice and she upgraded the room for us by offering a bigger one. Rooms are confortable and cleaned every day. Breakfast is included in the room price and very good. The hotel is 10 minutes away from Tour Eiffel, Arc de Triumph, Gallery Lafayette...so well located. Supermarkets and restaurants near by.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love the hotel, 10 mins walk from Champs-Elysees & Arc De Triomph. The staff at the counter speaks good english. Breakfast is served in the room, croissant & baguette with coffee. Hotel is clean & bathroom is good. The elevator is tiny but if u dont mind carrying your luggage, then ignore the elevator. Very much recommended if u want to save money on accommodation yet u want to stay very close to the heart of Paris!!
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At a quiet part of Boulevard Haussmann. Just 2 minutes away from Miromesnil metro station. No restaurant but adequate roomservice for breakfast. Very good for a shortbreak in Paris. Excellent WIFI. Good price-quality-ratio.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at this hotel were soo helpful, that it has been a joy to stay at D argemson We stayed for 3 nights and would go back. It felt more like a good 3 star hotell. Good food, great location and fantastic service from the staff. We really enjoyed our stay. Also good beds and no noise from the streets :-)
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel. The breakfast was good too, with a tipical baguete and croissant. The room was cleaning every day. It was like in the photos, no big surprises. the attendant was nice and they keep your bagagges after the check-out.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel, it is situated in great location ten minutes walk from the arc. Breakfast included was a great addition. Room was small but expected from a small hotel in Paris. Overall great value for money and would definitely stat again without a doubt.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friends and I stayed this hotel from 27 Dec 14 to 01 Jan 15. Absolutely, it is convenient for us to go to metro, grocery store, pharmacy store, restaurant and so on. Staff are nice and especially a lady (Sorry I forgot to ask her name) She is lovely and adorable. We have taken photos with her as our good memory. ;)There are only a few flaw, which is old-fashion and small elevator of the hotel. Lucky me I stayed on second floor. So, I prefer to walk which is fine for me. ;)After checked out, I stayed a two star hotels in Disneyland Paris. The room is not big and it made me think of Hotel d'Argenson, which is much more better! ;)If I have a chance to go back in Paris. Of course, I will stay here again for sure. What a lovely place to stay and nice friendly staff.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was ok, clean, 10 min walk to champs elysees, street parking close to the hotel. For the weekend for us wos ok regarding the price and how close is from the city centre. Is very nice at list for the weekend.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An excellent hotel with very nice hosts! Absolutely my favour hotel in Paris, highly recommended! Breakfast is served in the room, very nice view over town.Quit hotel as well! Very clean, very nice bathroom
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are on our third stay at this hotel in the 8th arrondissement in Paris.. It is within walking distance of the Arch of Triumph and Jardin Des Tuileries (with museums and sights). We enjoy the friendly and helpful owners. The rooms are comfortable.. We always ask for a superior room with ensuite bathroom and small balcony. Convenience, old-world charm and good location.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1. No AC = Awesome street noiseOn a hot September night - with the wonderful floor to ceiling windows open onto a great location, there was so much noise, I tossed. First I tossed out of bed the long pillow that was to be shared by two. Then I tossed the plastic sheet that separated the mattress from the sheet from me. As I was hot and sweating - this was making the situation worse.2. Breakfast in bedWhen you see the breakfasts stacked on trays in the elevator from the floor up - you may choose to eat elsewhere....although the hot chocolate was awesome.3. Pop Up BathroomI'm sure all the rooms shared bath facilities in earlier years and these very nice, new bathrooms have popped-up inside your room. The lighting is terrible. The rainwater shower is too large for the shower stall so you will make a flooding mess. And fortunately, MonoPrix is only a block away so you can purchase some real soap and shampoo. Don't bring a new love as you hear everything in the room and in the bathroom.Yes - a great location and a wonderful price.. As a hard core New Yorker, I will not return and I will not suggest this.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a couple bed room for 3 nights. The only problem is that the hotel is a little bit aged. The elevator is so small, so is the bathroom in the room. The rest are good, the reception staff are nice and helpful, the cleaning staff cannot speak English but patient and nice. Bathroom is newly furnished so looks clean enough. The wifi sometimes very weak in the room.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was truly a highlight of our trip to Paris. The staff is excellent, the best service we could ask for. They speak English well. The hotel is very conveniently located close to the Arc d' Triomphe (about 1.6 km/1 mile) away and close to several public transportation stops, shops and restaurants. The breakfast is lovely (bread, butter, jam, croissants, juice and a hot beverage) and delivered to your room at a time you specify. The rooms are small and quaint, although there is no air conditioning and the walls are a bit thin. We had the best experience at this hotel and recommend it.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel D'argensen is is a very nice little hotel conveniently located close to all the major attractions of Paris. Rooms are adequately comfortable but have no air conditioning so could be quite hot during the warmer months. Bed comfortable but only a double so feels very small if you are used to an Australian king size. Breakfast is served in your room at a time convenient to yourself which is a nice touch and consists of juice, croissant, jams and coffee.All in all, good value for the location but with big concerns about the safety factors in the unlikely event of a fire. Although the owner assured me there are regular inspections by the local fire department it seems the regulations are not as stringent as they might be.For instance there are no smoke or heat detectors in the rooms, no sprinkler system and the thing that concerned me most was the complete absence of any means of escape.if you are on the upper floors the only option is to jump, which is not a nice position to be in if there are flames licking round your backside.It would be entirely wrong of me to single out Hotel D'argensen as the only hotel is Paris with these concerns as there are literally hundreds of similar hotels throughout the area.In conclusion Hotel D'argensen is good value and well located so a good choice, but if I were to stay again I would seek a room on the ground floor.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cute little hotel, remarkable resemblance with a dollhouse. Literally everything seems to be really tiny in this building. Rooms are old but still have a lot of charme. At least the bath was renewed recently. Walls are wafer-thin, so be aware of noisy neighbours. French-style breakfast is being served on the room, or you simply grab a Croissant from the Boulangerie next door. The excellent service and good location (walking distance to Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe) made our stay very enjoyable.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Almost all the reviews I read here regarding this hotel are true.I love how a bit old it was yet so charming and so Paris!Location-the major consideration for this hotel. We found our way so easily from the airport via roissy airport bus and another city bus transfer. So close to the opera where the hop on-hop off bus tour is located. Bus stops nearby the hotel. 5min ride to Lafayette for shopping and affordable grocery (mineral water euro.55 for 1.5L). Less than 10min bus ride to the Arch and Eiffel tower. Less than 15min bus ride to Garu de Nord train station if you are going to Amsterdam after Paris. 2 metro stations walking distance from the hotel. Bakeries & some restaurants nearby.Reception-owners are hands-on with their guests. The beautiful lady even offered us help on our luggages. They speak good English and were big help with tourists by giving maps and directions. Cute lift, can hold 2-3 persons.Our room-so spacious, opulent furnitures, everyday room cleaning and towel changing, with balcony overlooking beautiful buildings and small shops on the streets. a busy road is just near but we were never bothered by any noise. bathroom is spacious too with new fixtures, very neat.Breakfast-i love the hot chocolate and the fresh breads that made our stay in Paris very french.they also have vendo at the ground floor with just euro.50 for a mini cup of coffee or hot choco.Price. for the location and quality of service and accommodation, its worth it.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was large and quaint, with a roomy, clean fresh bathroom. Lovely view onto the square. The staff were friendly and welcoming and it was a real treat to have delicious croissants served in the room. The location is safe, attractive and convenient and there is a wonderful café / bakery next door. We didn't want to leave.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was above average. The room was small, and had a dated interior, but the receptionists were wonderful and 2/3 spoke English, and those that spoke English were extremely welcoming and wonderful. Note for travelers: as with many Parisian hotels, the elevator is small. My wife and I had a tough time crowding into the elevator with our carry-on baggage.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed here two nights in March 2014. It is a very Parisian hotel, a bit shabby, but with loads of charm.The hallways and doors are very narrow, the ceilings tall and decorated and the rooms have large french windows which leads out to small balconies. While not large, the room was of a decent size, and contained a wardrobe, two chairs, a small desk and a nightstand. The bathroom, although tiny, was modern and clean.The elevator is quite claustrophobic, I only used it once even though we stayed on the 5th floor... When it comes to breakfast, the croissants were some of the best that I've ever had, and it's quite nice to be in Paris and have breakfast in bed :)The location hotel is fine, the major attractions are within walking distance (if you like to walk), but the metro or bicycle is more convenient. There is a velib-station right across the street from the hotel, and I highly recommend to explore Paris on bike! The system is cheap and excellent, with hundreds of stations spread across the entire city (http://en.velib.paris.fr/).But: the hotel room was not very well clean. The carpeted floors were extremely dusty, and this was problematic for us, as my boyfriend is allergic to dust...All in all, the hotel is good value for the money, but do not stay here if you are sensitive to dust!
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really felt that the staff here went out of their way to accommodate us in every way. We stayed on New Years Eve. The staff was great about making sure we had a place to store our luggage during the day, getting us back in during the early morning ours following our festivities, and ensuring we had coffee and something to eat prior to our departure. We left before the breakfast hours even started (7 a.m. to 10 a.m.), yet we still were provided coffee and a snack. We were also provided an upgraded room with our own bathroom free of charge. The room was small, but certainly adequate and with a beautiful balcony and view. I highly recommend this hotel. I hope you enjoy it as much as we did.
hotelName:
11    Hotel d'Argenson
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very well located. Near to Orsay museum, louvre,metro gates,batobus port,norte dame and not so far from eiffel tower. The best is the view of Siena river from the room windows. The negative is that the rooms doesnt have air conditioner just an old fan.The matress and the bed were old as well the furniture and the floor carpet. Its a modest place to stay.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's hard to find hotels in Paris that are not super expensive so this is kind of a compromise.The hotel staff are very nice and helpful for the most part. We stayed here 2 days at the beginning and 2 days at the end of our vacation in France. The rooms overlook the Seine and the street noise if excessive but pretty muffled when the windows are shut. There is a fan which has seen better days but worked ok. My sister in law's fan was like a freight train so she was not able to sleep with it on in the single room next door.The carpet is in desparate need of cleaning. I wasn't about to put my bare feet on that floor, but I am a little fussy about hotel floors in general. I didnt' notice a nasty looking brown stain on the duvet cover until the morning AFTER we'd slept under it. Luckily it was at the foot of the bed. I would say this place is adequate. It's across the river from the Louvre and great location. Just know that it is a bare minimum hotel. Towels are flimsy, bed is very low to the floor but comfortable enough, esp when you have jet lag. Not sure I'd stay there again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful location with a view overlooking the Seine. Easy walking to top attractions such as the Louvre and Notre Dame. The rooms are small but clean and the bathrooms are fine. Very friendly staff and the desk staff speak excellent English. The bar is open 24/7 but we seemed to be the only ones who had a drink there. Breakfast available at a fair price. Road noise might be an issue for some but for us the trade off for the view was worth it. Not air conditioned so the rooms may be very hot in summer. Definitely worth considering for a good value hotel close to the place you want to go.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located on the Left bank of the Seine river directly across from the Louvre and only a block away from the Musee d'Orsay. On top of that you get the most breathtaking views of the Seine right out your window! The view was definitely the highlight of the room! The hotel is a bit dated and the rooms are on the smaller side, but it is clean and the staff is very friendly. Again, it was all about that view!
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This has a great location. Directly across the river from the louvre. Metro station about 8 minute walk. But the hotel is old. The bathroom was clean but the room felt very old. Beds were uncomfortable. When we booked we thought breakfast was included. But it was 14 euro per person. So we picked up croissants instead. We had the triple room which was three twin beds. Room was hot. We slept with the balcony doors open but traffic was loud. The place was ok but seems expensive for the quality. But again the location was excellent.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love this hotel. Even though the hotel itself is a little "tired" the staff and location more than makes up for it. I think they will be closed soon for a 2 year renovation, which makes me a little sad. I'll be calling nonetheless for a September stay, if in fact they haven't started the construction. Fingers crossed.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cordial, professional service staff, clean room, lots of old Parisian charm, plenty of history within its walls, fantastic location for walking in a city that was made for walking. Great views of the Louvre and The Seine from the rooms, large French windows. Single room was just right for the solo traveler, small but comfortable. Staff arranged early AM transportation to CDG was great and reasonably priced. Note: when traveling in summer, bring earplugs for sleeping when windows are open, street traffic and riverboat noise is loud. Don't know about noise with windows closed but read that recent improvements included new glazing to help with street noise. Would definitely stay there again. The hotel has housed numerous famous guests from the world of literature, music, and the visual arts, from Oscar Wilde, Baudelaire, Wagner, Sibelius, Pissarro, Reidy, Hemingway, and Blondin .
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights. It was our first time in Paris. We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The room was very clean. We stayed on the fifth floor and had an amazing view of the River. The location is perfect as it is in the center of the city, and within walking distance to the Louvre, Musée d'Orsay, Notre Dame, and of course the Seine River. The room was a nice size compared to other European rooms, and the staff provides an airport shuttle for only 18 euro per person. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a super hotel just opposite the Louvre. It has great views over the Seine. Although the rooms are quite basic, they are full of character and the hotel is good value. The breakfasts are good with fresh organge juice. Overall a great stay.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Musee Quai d'Orsay is next door and the student quarter lies behind the hotel with many small cafes, restaurants and brasseries. The hotel itself is classy with well-decorated rooms. Mine was on the first floor (there is a lift) and faced the river, which was terrific. The only problem was that I had to put my motorcycle in the parking garage for the Louvre (despite the fact that a sign said 'No Motos') and it cost a fortune - 100 euros a day.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brilliant. Loved it. Such a fabulous, very traditional Left Bank hotel - great postilion and overlooking the Seine. So friendly (great welcome from Veronique & Bernard) and it;s no surprise that this old hotel was the favourite of so many artists, poets & more recently celebrities). We will certainly return,
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 5 nights, in a room on the 3rd floor with windows that opened up over the river. We had super weather,and kept the windows flung open all night. Sleeping to the sound of the traffic was unusually calming, and omg the view. Rudolph Nuryev's apartment (has a plaque)is four doors down, and I could not get over that fact every time I looked out. The rooms are small, but cozy. The bathroom was as well. Tiny sink, no where to spread out my morning routine. The staff was welcoming and helpful, especially the gentleman who worked late afternoon, his name escapes me. He explained how to take the train to Versailles, and gave us a map that was highlighted in advance. The carpets in our hallways were pretty worn, that was the only real negative factor. Did I mention the view?
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location right on the Seine, opposite the Louvre and next door to Musee D’Orsay. Staff are very friendly and helpful, breakfast is simple but tasty. We booked a superior room which was on the 5th floor, there is a small lift, the room was adequate but without the windows open very stuffy. Noise from the main road was continuous and traffic on the Seine also raised the noise level. Having said that, the location is brilliant and to be right in the heart of Paris within easy walking distance of so many landmarks amazing! We would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location for the Louvre area!! he hotel itself has been in business for about 100 years. The building is from the 16th century and was built as an abbey. Monks resided here which is why the rooms are so petite. The floor in the bar area is original to the Abbey so be sure to take a look and appreciate. Oscar Wilde stayed in room 14 and they have had some other notable guests such as composer Wagner. We stayed in room #34 with a view of the Sienne.  This building has been purchased by an investor and will close Jan 2019 to be fully renovated into a 4 star hotel..no doubt the prices will reflect a 4 start hotel overlooking the Siene...get your stay in before then!! This hotel is blocks from the Louvre, musee de Orsay, place de la concorde, blocks from Paris City vision tours office and blocks from Paris Tourisme office. (Both of these companies book all kinds of tours from day trips to normandy to day and night boat rides on the Sienne) but it was nice to walk over and catch a bus to the Reim/Champagne area and not have to pay any extra for hotel pick up and such.We were in walking distance of Notre Dame, the Morais district...etcThe location could not be beat.The condition of the room left a little to be desired...it was kind of dingy..BUT for the price we paid, the location we were in and the absolutely romantic view of the Siene, i got over it very quickly. To open your giant windows to the street, the river and art vendors down below was like a scene out of a movie and certainly an experience i never thought i would be able to afford! I can also understand now why no fixes are being made in the building-they are going to rip it all apart in a few months to renovate..so it is not that hotel is being left to deteriorate..knowing this, i was able to forgive the conditions.The room, utilities and linens were all extremely clean.the bathroom shower has excellent hot water and excellent water pressure-i have very thick curly hair so good water pressure in the shower can make or break a trip for me!The bed was very low to the floor..maybe 2 feet off the floor. It was very comfortable. my husband and I are larger people and have back issues and found the size of the bed adequate and we did not experience any adverse effects on our backs.The street noise can be quite loud and does continue thru the night..but when the windows are closed, you hear virtually nothing. Again, we were there during very high temps so we had to leave the window open. We had such activity filled days though, that honestly, the noise didn't bother us, we were to tired, we slept thru it all.There is no building air con..only a room air conditioner which stands in the room..it was too small to make any difference..however we were there during a heat wave with temps in the 90s..and at night there was a lovely breeze coming thru the windows.They have a bar which we made use of several times, often times the only ones there..the bar tender is whomever is behind the desk.We were very impressed with Gerard at the front desk who went out of his way to provide help, information and was in general, very nice to converse with about Paris, the hotel and its history. The other front desk help was just fine, but Gerard I think really enjoys getting to know his guests.We paid extra for the breakfast option..we were unable to have breakfast 3 of the days we were there and they kindly did not charge us for that. Breakfast was served from a small menu, portions small.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here after our marriage on June 2nd. Its location is so amazing you practically walk to everywhere you need to see when you're on a very short vacation like us. We did visit Louvre just across on Sunday, but couldn't see Musee D'Orsay which is walking distance to the hotel since most places are closed on Mondays. In this short visit we managed to have dinner in Saint Germaine, Latin Quarter, Notre Dame, Eiffel tower and walked along the Seine river. All walking distance to the hotel. This hotel has very small rooms or ours was exceptionally small, but they are clean and when you close the balcony door, very quiet. To our surprise we didn't have any mosquitos when the door was open. There is no fridge in rooms which would've been nice. We chose no breakfast package so we don't have any opinion in regards to their breakfast. The staff were adequate, but not extraordinary. They were kind enough to call us a shuttle to the airport which saved us a few euros. Since the building is from 1800's, apparently some famous composers and authors stayed in this place in the past. There are photographs of Oscar Wilde, Richard Wagner etc on walls in the lobby. Overall we were happy for the price and location and would stay in this hotel again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We love Paris and visit as often as we can. The 6th is one of our favorite locations. This hotel is in a great location close the Louvre, Musee D’Orsay and great restaurants and shopping. The hotel is tired, dirty and desperately in need of a renovation especially for the prices that the rooms go for. The staff were nice and pleasant. We stayed in a double twin room which seemed to be larger than other rooms we saw. Our room faced an interior light well which although offered no Seine views was quiet. The furniture, carpet, paint and drapes were really old and thus made the room feel very dirty. We didn’t want to take our shoes off or our clothes out of the bag. The bathroom in our room was large and clean however we did see bathrooms in other rooms and they seemed tiny.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel du Quai Voltaire is beside the Seine River flowing through Paris. A small hotel but nice rooms, good restaurant but you will want to try all the other restaurarants around, go right when you leave. It is famous for a few writers who have written here in the hotel. It ws was recommended to me by a native Parisienne. It sits across ffom the Louvre one of the world’s great museums. You could spend a week in thr Louvre but likely will not, a day is good and they have a good restaurant. Very popular museum so either book ahead or start early in the morning. A very fine impressionist section with Monet, Manet, Cezanne etc. Trip advisor stuck in a strange photo for me which looks like a hayfield, just ignore that!
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want a large modern hotel, with a huge room, then spent a fortune and go to another hotel. If you want a charming experience in an older french hotel, in a great location, that won't bust the budget, then this is the hotel for you. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay from the moment of check in with the front desk person who had us chuckling, to the nice simple breakfast, to the hotel room (on the small side but charming). We had some concerns about being on such a busy street, but when you closed the massive old windows the room was quiet. The location is fantastic, in walking distance to many sights, to the metro, and to the Bato Boat. We will definitely go back again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As everybody else comments the location is very good being across the river from the Louvre and a couple hundred metres from Musee d'Orsay.Pricing of course is dynamic but will probably be in the lower ranges of other similarly situated properties.Rooms are small. Walls are thin. You can hear normal conversation of neighbours.The windows are pretty well insulted but when open the road noise (four lane busy road adjacent) is apparent.Consequently be cautious in the summer. No a/c so if you need ventilation at night the cost will be ability to sleep...Front desk staff general friendly apart from late night attendants.Breakfast is a bit of a joke as they can't seem to handle more than four people at a time. Was completely ignored on day one and left after fifteen minutes; struggled for a lone coffee on day two, and barked at on day three for trying to get waiter attention after being sat there for ten minutes. Pathetique!
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room we stayed in was very tired looking and a bit shabby but the view across the road was the Seine and the Louvre and of course the Tuileries Gardens. The hotel position is probably its best feature. They say free WiFi but there wasn’t any at all. There are some lovely restaurants just behind the hotel one of them being The Cocorico on the Rue du Bac, where the food was delicious and the staff delightful. In fact we went with friends and went back again. So really we used the hotel as a place to sleep in and we were out for most of the day. So all in all Its clean and basic, I would say don’t expect too much and you won’t be disappointed.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here a couple of years ago,I loved it,as did my wife.Rooms great,views amazing.Decor very French,great history.Nice friendly staff.Cracking chilled Rose in the bar at a good price.Please note.If you have no soul or appreciation of history.Please go to a chain hotel,with aircon,tv,room safe,trouser press,non creaky floors etc.Do not bother the good folk who run this hotel with your pitiful presence or adverse reviews.Keep up the good work,be back soon.Love.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great 3 night stay. The staff were very welcoming, spoke good English, gave us advice on how to get around town, room was clean and serviced each day. The hotel is located within walking distance of the best attractions in Paris. Opposite the Louvre, down the road from Notre Dam and on the river Seine. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Looking forward to our next stay.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The worst service I have ever received- they treated my group (75+ and I with absolutely 0 respect and the state of the hotel is clearly going downhill. Avoid this place at all costs whatsoever. The concierge doesn’t greet you and can only think of snide remarks even though you are giving them YOUR money.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel touts the Baudelaire Room as something extraordinary because he wrote some of his works in that very room. BUT, the room is more like a prison cell than a writer's retreat. The hotel has wonderful views of the Seine River but this room has a view of an old paint-peeling wall. It is dark, dingy and I banged my head against the "quaint rafters of the loft" several times. The worst hotel room experience in my 68 years for a rate of 179 Euros. I let the desk manager, Bernard, know of my extreme disappointment with the room and he told me that the hotel was fully booked and there was nothing he could do to change my room. I was staying for 19 days so I went over his head and spoke with the hotel manager. I reminded her that I was paying close to 3000 Euros for my stay and that I could find another hotel to take my money. She miraculously found a room with a balcony and view of the Seine and the Louvre for me which was just exactly what I wanted. But I had to play the Ugly American to get it.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quintessential location!! Greeted in English by the Manager and staff with a huge smile and warm greetings. Our room for 3 of us (3 adults) was huge for Paris and we had two lots of french doors that opened on to the Seine river. Bar was opened on arrival and we got to drink at our romeo balcony overlooking the water. Just divine. 5 mins walk to Louvre Museum & hop on hop off buses (we used the green ones) and 5 mins walk to catch our dinner cruise on the stunning Le Califfe. The bus frm Gare de Nord station was 2 euros each and was a 2 min walk frm the stop with our suitcases to hotel door. Magic on location awesum hotel and staff. Great 1 litre beer at the bar 2 mins out the door. What history. Thanks Hotel du Qual Voltaire HINT Dont sweat the small stuff
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located right on the Seine River and has easy access to most of the city. However, I'm sure there were bed bugs in my room. I was sick that day and spent most of the time resting in my room, and I woke the next morning with almost 15 bites all over my body. It was far from pleasant. I hope the hotel will seriously look into their cleaning so this doesn't happen to another guest.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with a small artist group May 2016 and will be back with the same group in September. The hotel is lovely and the staff was (almost all) helpful and cordial. The large casement windows in my room on the 5th floor overlooked the Seine and the Louvre on the other side. It's a short walk to the Orsay, the Orangerie and of course the Louvre. Lots of cafes and interesting things to explore. I prefer a smaller hotel with personality to a chain that could be anywhere, and this fit.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you read the reviews, you will quickly discover that this hotel is either loved or hated. Personally, we loved it! You can choose to view the hotel as tired or outdated, or you can view it as charming and quaint. We paid a little extra for the deluxe room which guarantees a good view and a good view indeed!! Our room was charming, clean, and cozy. The deluxe room is a liitle charger so if you want more roo, go this route. I not only loved the location ( easy to walk to majority of places), but the staff was so friendly and helpful. They arranged our airport shuttle ( about 36 euros for two people) and we were able to purchase the hop on hop off bus tickets through the hotel. I would stay here again!!
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful location along the river. Walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame and 40 mins on foot along the to the Eiffel Tower along the rivers edge. Rooms are small but bed was very comfortable and lovely service from the staff. Would go back again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hotel because it was in an old, now re-purposed, Abbey. The website pictures totally represent the hotel. The rooms were certainly large by Paris standards but they were bare - not even a bar fridge (I have medication that requires refrigeration) or tea/coffee making facilities and there was a sign in the room stating that no food or drink could be consumed in the room unless it was room service (and that was inadequate). The safe was broken and the room was so dusty and dirty that I didn't walk on the floor without socks. No air-conditioning either so I roasted most nights. I wouldn't stay here again if it was free.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love this place although not for the reasons you might think. It used to be a dump. But it's been Renovated and it's truly a French emerald.Central, on the seine, near the Old Masters Dealers thatI used to haunt in my youth. Exquisite,Audrey Hepburn's Paris.Stay here and enjoy it. I miss it so-
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the fact that so much of what we wanted to see was walkable from here. Staff is very friendly. Great location and reasonable price. Rooms are small - we are from the US but we generally expected that coming to Paris. Had a great experience and would come again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I must preface this review by saying I do not speak French. This was important because it was my first trip to beautiful Paris, and I was anxious that I would not be able to communicate. The staff at Hotel du Quai-Voltaire could not have been more accommodating, not only with my lack of French, but also everything else.The charge was E117 per night. I stayed three nights, and pre-paid E117 when I made the reservation. Coming from New York, I thought the price was ridiculously low. If there were a hotel across the street from the Metropolitan Museum, you can be sure it would cost at least E400/night. Even before I arrived, I received from the hotel manager a survey asking how they might be of help. I was dumbfounded. Who does that? Well, they do. I knew I had made the correct choice. Some call it a "tired" hotel. Yes, it's been there for decades, and the drapes and bedspreads could use a change. But the staff are lovely. They really care if you are enjoying Paris or not. They are not stuffy or pretentious, but friendly and helpful.Visitors such as Baudelaire, Sibelius, Richard Wagner, and Oscar Wilde have preceded you, which was a thrill for me. You are walking into history here. The view couldn't be more inspiring. From your window you see the Louvre, the Seine in all its variable rhythms, the Pont Royal, the Pont du Carrousel. The location could not be better for museum-goers wishing to visit the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Musee des Arts Decoratifs, Musee de l'Orangerie, and the Tuileries. The St. Germain antiques district is right behind the hotel, with all of its magical old shops, galleries, and restaurants. I couldn't have been more delighted with the location. The staff were very kind and helpful in every way. Upon my arrival from New York, I was craving a coffee, and it was quickly made for me and served in the small bar/breakfast room. A beautiful modern glass chandelier reminiscent of flowers hangs in the tiny bar/cafe. A perfect touch in the quaint room.The staff kindly offered to arrange a shuttle back to the airport. The cost was E26 -- not bad at all. They were on time and very professional. "The Shuttle" it was called - 06 29 46 39 52. I wouldn't hesitate to use them again.After my stay, another survey from the manager arrived in my email. They asked for an honest review. I provided it, including saying that the bed in my room was sagging a bit and needed to be replaced -- a twin bedded Room, # 25. (For only three nights, I felt I could deal with this. Had my stay been longer, I would have requested another room.)There is still a telephone on the side of the bed (!).The hotel is a gem. If you must have modern furnishings, this is not for you. But everything else considered, I don't know how you can do better in beautiful Paris.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at the Quai-Voltaire numerous times over the past 15-20 years and it never disappoints. While it is not the most "chic" place in town, it does have the best views and always will. It's hard to beat looking out your window and seeing the Seine, the bouquinistes, and the Louvre. It is also walkable to nearly every museum, site, and restaurant in town.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was so pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The location and the views cannot be beat. The staff were unbelievably welcoming and helpful. They really go out of their way for you. The rooms were far better than I expected. I usually stay in much pricier hotels, but since I knew I would have no time to spend in my room other than sleeping and showering, I decided to give this a go. Yes, the rooms are very small. I started in a regular double, which had a teeny bathroom, then decided to stay three extra days and upgraded to a superior double which was more spacious and had a nice bathroom. I found the rooms quite charming; cheery coloring, French door/windows that overlook the Seine and the Pont du Carousel - spectacular. Noiseproof windows that really work. The bed and duvet/sheets are as good as any 3-star hotel. Only the towels left a bit to be desired. Carpet a little worn, and wall hangings not exactly art, but none of this took away from the charm of the room. The hallways/stairs are pleasant. Small elevator, but who cares? I have spent much much time in Paris over the years, stayed in numerous hotels, and I can honestly say that this one is a find. It's not for those looking for pampering/luxury, but it is an unbelievably good place for the price.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A 6 minute walk from the Orsay Rer C station - easy to get to from the airport if you use the trains. Our room was ready when we arrived shortly after 11am. It was on the fifth floor, The hall could have used a reno, but the room was bigger than I expected, clean and functional. Best of all it had a million-dollar view facing the Seine, right across the street from the Louvre. Over the next four days we would leave in the morning and arrive back at night for bed, so it was the perfect location for us and we pretty much walked everywhere – a great timesaver. I would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No it's not an international grand hotel. It is very typically French. Yes the lift is tiny but the staircase is beautiful. Rooms not large but OK.!Breakfast is simple but the bread & croissant were fresh and the juice had recently been inside oranges. Great position for local restaurants - try those in the Rue de Bac - and for sight seeing. Would definitely come here again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel du Quai-Voltaire is across from the Louvre on the Left Bank with magnificent views of the Seine from all the windows. The location is perfect. The Louvre is across the bridge over the Seine, the D'Orsay is a short walk down the street, the Batobus is in front of the D'Orsay. It is walking distance to Notre Dame, to Boulevard Saint Germain, the Latin Quarter and rue de l'Opera to Galeries Lafayette. My husband and I have stayed there every year for 10 years or so.The rooms we have been in are not large but balconies in the rooms on the fourth floor make them seem larger. The manager and those who handle the desk are very lovely, helpful people. The reception area and restaurant are charming. It is reasonably priced and considering its advantages, it is inexpensive. I suggest checking out their website for a pretty good idea of the view and the rooms.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the HotelduQuaiVoltaire.com in November of 2001. I was meeting a French friend there and he, knowing the city, chose this hotel for our stay. It is located very close to the Musee d' Orsay and the Louvre, and nearby Metro stations make the entire city easily accessable. The hotel, in general, isn't lavish, but it's lovely nevertheless. Mostly I found this hotel quaint and charming, with relatively small, but clean and comfortable, rooms. Our room (as do all of the rooms in this hotel except a few) had a spectacular view of the Seine and the Louvre. The hotel is on a busy Paris street, so if you're a light sleeper, the noise may bother you. I recommend requesting a room above street level. We stayed on the 3rd floor and heard little street noise. The staff was very nice and accommodating. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable, charming hotel in the moderate price range.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights at this 3 star hotel. A true 3 star with rooms a bit tied, double bed only and a very small lift that feels like it will break down at any time. Pricing compared to other 3 star hotels we looked at was comparable, so it is value for what you get. We normally stay 4 star but prices in Paris at that time we're very high. We paid the extra for a room overlooking the Seine and the views were a big part of the appeal for this hotel. Busy road beneath but the room was very quiet if you keep the balcony doors shut.Breakfast was limited and we just paid as we went and mostly ate elsewhere. Position is a big plus if you are new to Paris and want somewhere close to attractions and easy to get your bearings.The Louvre is at your doorstep, Musee D Orsay 100 metres away and being on the river, it is very easy to walk along to Notre Dame, across to main Avenues and around to key areas. Some day tours leave from just over the river which is another reason I booked this area.The surprising downside was the lack of shops and restaurant options in the immediate area. Yes, walk 10-15 minutes and you find more options but after a long day of walking, there were few good priced options really close by.Transport options were okay with Metro lines within walking distance but like the restaurants, 10 minutes to connecting Metro lines.Overall it was fine for 3 star levels at the price offered.If you want lots of food and shopping options and are willing to pay extra, there are probably better areas to go to. If you want to soak up the Louvre, the river and the parks in the centre, this is the place then. Good value for what we paid for..
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a brilliant spot to stay. The staff were super friendly. The room was old and the floor was on a lean and made terrible noises when walking on it. Big bathroom. Tiny lift. No air con. Perhaps this is what inner Paris hotels are like, I'm not sure. We did feel like it was quite a unique experience.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Husband and I stayed here September 7-13, third Paris trip. We've stayed in 1st before and wanted to try the Rive Gauche this time. Also we sought a hotel with Seine views and came across HQV. Thanks to TA, I felt we knew exactly what we were getting. And we liked it even better. It is only 30-some rooms, and older, a quirky layout maybe (saw it was a convent in mid-1800s). And reviews said very small, tiny lift, creaky floors, no room service, etc. Size-wise it may not work for some or those who need amenities. But oh, those VIEWS! Just breathtaking. Kept pinching myself that I was seeing the Seine, Louvre, and Tuileries from our hotel windows. We had a regular room with Queen bed (not Superior room that's slightly bigger with balcony) but it was large enough for us and the windows fully opened to window rail for the breeze, sights, and sounds. (May not be ideal for small children). And the street noise was loud, yet with windows shut at night (no AC, though), it was muffled enough to sleep fine. We booked it almost a year ahead or as soon as we could, via Expedia as to have a third party, but we could have just booked through the hotel. I contacted them several times with questions and then a last-minute confirmation of our room (I absolutely wanted to confirm in writing that we had a Seine view as I believe there may be a few rooms that do not) and someone replied in English within minutes every time. Impressive. We arrived about 8 am on September 7 via taxi from CDG and our room was not ready, which we didn't expect. So we left our luggage and walked to Tuileries, then Notre Dame and the Isles, and checked in finally about 1 pm. We found the manager Madame to be most charming and the staff at the desk always friendly and helpful--with recommendations, maps, directions, and booking our airport return taxi. Our room was very clean, bathroom nice--newer, and housekeeping service prompt. We took the lift to go up to 3 (4th US floor) and the wide staircase to descend. The hotel is a block from Musee D'Orsay and across the river from the Louvre, of course. We were just thrilled with the location and overwhelmed by the views. We would love to return some day and would happily stay again at the HQV. We felt like we were really experiencing the heart of Paris.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed four nights on a family vacation. Great view over the river from L3. Room clean and adequately appointed. Bed was good.Walking distance to the Louvre and plenty of good restaurants (head right out of hotel!).Staff were friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast was nice, esp the fresh orange juice. I'd go again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is right on the banks of the river, and all the rooms have views of the Siene. So inexpensive, for Paris, that I had low expectations. However, the hotel is very comfortable. Rooms are small, as usual in Europe, and the hotel is a few blocks from a metro stop. But the location is ideal, and the views are awesome. They have single rooms, too, and also,with a rover view.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel due to the price, location and reviews that were OK. We expected small rooms but were happy that ours did not feel small. It was not high end but it was comfortable. Bathroom was a good size and both were very clean. Furniture a bit old (side shelf falling off wall) and lovely squeaky floor. Though we faced a very busy road along the river Seine (which was in flood at the time), the noise was not problem at all. The view was good. The location is excellent with the Louvre and D'Orsay very close. Good restaurants within and easy walk in a safe and quiet area despite a Medical Uni nearby. The area around the hotel has many art dealer businesses which were decorated with beautiful roses as part to the Art Trail on while we were there. There was a supermarket not far away. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good and made it easy to eat before we hit the pavement each day.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was very clean, staff was excellent. I thought the menu was a bet pricey, but the food was delicious and fresh. Walking distance to Louvre and approx. 1 mile to the Eiffel Tower and maybe the same in opposite direction for Notre Dame. I would recommend this place to anyone. It's about location, bus stop across the street, the Big Red Bus stops about 5 min walk and Metro 7 is the best to take from train station.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a perfect location to make the most of a sightseeing trip to Paris. It's a little pricey but it's so close to many attractions, particularly the Musee D'Orsay and Louvre, which means you don't waste time travelling. Access to the metro is also convenient and the area is very safe. Rooms were spacious (for Paris) and service was pleasant. We were able to store our bags before and after our stay, which was also incredibly helpful.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was to be our fourth visit to the Hotel du Quai Voltaire, which we had booked six months in advance and prepaid. We looked forward to the wonderful view across the Seine, the picnics made up of the best charcuterie from the rue des Martyrs to be enjoyed in our room. We were unprepared for the changes: a dangerous tiny shower, filthy rooms and halls, the elusive manager, and the frightened staff. We were shown to room 53 on the sixth floor (cinqieme etage). It was smaller than our previous rooms on the lower floors, had only a tiny box of a shower, no bathroom light, dirty carpets, wooden planks over radiators for shelves. We immediately asked for a room with a bathtub and two beds. The receptionist said he could do nothing unless we accepted a room with a tiny double bed. He said the manager would have to deal with this. Where was she? She hadn’t arrived. She was in a business meeting and could not be disturbed. She had left.When we examined the room further, we saw a sign: It is expressly forbidden to bring food or drink into the room. Next to this was a lengthy room service menu from their failing restaurant. What an insult!When it was clear that the staff would do nothing and the manager had made herself scarce, we attempted to use the shower. It was slippery, very slippery. A towel had to be laid down to prevent a fall. There was nowhere to put soap or shampoo, and there was nothing to hold on to except the plumbing fixtures.The water overflowed the shallow sides and flooded the bathroom.I asked the receptionist why, when we booked on their website months ahead we had been given the worst room on the dirtiest floor. He could only refer me to the missing manager. We left after the second night, losing one night’s prepayment. We found a better, safer, cleaner hotel.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For a tourist in Paris, there's no better location. Close to the Hop on Hop off bus and boat, Musee' D'Orsay, Louvre, and Notre Dame. The Hop on bus and boat take you to any of the attractions you could possibly want to see. The room was extremely clean and the service was above and beyond. The WiFi was reliable and free. The beds were exceptionally comfortable and clean and the en suite was modern and sufficient. The rooms with a view will cost more. If you're going to spend your time in Paris looking out of the window of your hotel, spring for the view....it is fantastic! The River Seine, the Louvre...perfect! But even without a view, the room was everything we needed it to be.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first trip to Paris was in the 80s and we discovered the hotel by chance. Being young our needs were basic but we couldn't believe the amazing location and views from the Hotel du Quai Voltaire. Returning for a mother/daughter trip this year lead me back to the hotel enjoyed by her father and I before she was born. The location, view, comfort and price are the selling points. The staff could not be more accommodating and helpful. The bathrooms are upgraded and the room is fresh and clean. The building is old so accept this as part of the charm. As a business traveler, I've been around the world and stayed at the best luxury hotels. If that is your style, you will be disappointed. But if you are seeking an authentic Parsian experience in a great neighborhood with warm support service, you will be happy here. My daughter is loving it!
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location...on the Seine across from the Louvre, a few blocks from the Orsay. The hotel itself is a bit "tired" in appearance, but comfortable, quiet (on the back side of building) and accessible.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 2 nights at the Hotel du Quai-Voltaire. PROS: The location is great, I mean it almost can't be beat. The view from the bedroom overlook the Seine and the musee d'orsay is less than a 5 minute walk (it also connects to the metro as well). I think, however, it was probably the only positive thing about the place. Well, that and the breakfast. Their breakfast is pretty good.CONS: The bedroom is rather old. The floor felt uneven in places and it "creaked" when stepped on. If that bothers you, then you might want to consider staying somewhere else. There is a no food no drink policy for the rooms. Being from out of town, and a first time Paris visitor, I felt this rule was a bit unwelcoming. I wasn't impressed by the service either. From the first day to the last, I never really felt welcomed. It always seemed as if we were bothering whoever worked behind the front counter. If I didn't have to return the room key every time I left the building, I would just avoid them entirely.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: True the location is great as its close to everything and the view is beautiful but the room itself is very shabby. It only just passes the clean option, towels are super small and the rooms are tiny. The bed is ok. It is very quite though given the location, on a main road.The staff are nice.There is no cooling here and no food or drink is allowed in the room.Hence no fridge. No iron either.Breakfast is ok. At least you can order eggs here. Everything else like baguette and crossiant you can get anywhere. We were pretty disappointed with this hotel. Probably would not recommend considering what we paid per night.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family has been coming to this hotel since the 1970’s. We stay here for its location on the left bank, looking across the Seine at the Louvre. So much of Paris is within walking distance: the Musee d’Orsay (.3 miles), the Louvre (.3 miles to the pyramid), Rodin Museum (1 mile), Notre Dame (1 mile), Luxembourg Gardens (1.2 miles), Eiffel Tower (1.9 miles). Many good restaurants in the neighborhood. Several Metro stations and bus stops are close by, to get you to the rest of the city. The modest (for Paris) room rate includes a good continental breakfast and fast Wifi.Don’t stay here if you want a trendy hotel or one with extra amenities. The rooms are clean but small, the elevator is tiny and slow, and the breakfast room/lounge isn’t much to look at.
hotelName:
12    Hotel du Quai-Voltaire
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very welcoming, well run, clean hotel. We had a family suite which was spacious (at least by Paris standards!). The room was quiet but also had a cute balcony. The desk was very helpful when we had questions, Our breakfast was included and had good choices,
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed about 4 days int he hotel. While the rooms were a bit small, they were very well maintained. The free breakfast is a great deal.The front desk also offers fairly priced tickets and roaming Wifi for your phone.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ProsGood location: If you’re comfortable walking, you can get to Notre Dame, Saint Chapelle, and the Lourve in 30-45 minutes as it’s mostly flat and a great way to get acclimated to Paris. The hotel is also close to the Metro stations for when you want to go further out or are arriving from the airport/Eurostar. Lots of restaurants nearby and felt safe.Friendly staff: A warm welcome from reception and helpful staff.Breakfast: Included if you book directly from the hotel website and offered a nice spread of drinks, pastries, meat/cheese, fruit, eggs, etc.Spacious and clean room: Comfortable bed & pillows, nice little balcony, TV/desk area, and kettle/tea/coffee. The double provided plenty of space to have a suitcase out and walk around the room. The shower had good water pressure and the heated towel rack was a nice touch.Opportunities I would recommend bringing your own toiletries as they provide just the basics of a shampoo/shower gel combo and bar soap. This should be fine for most folks but I do appreciate when hotels provide a fuller range such as shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, bar soap, shower cap, cotton pads, and Q-tips.Would recommend and stay again!
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent Boutique Hotel with fabulous service, details and helpfulness. I much prefer over big, over-priced hotels. Absolutely personal and charming in a good location. No matter what I needed or wanted ... they were right there with smiles!
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great area, near public transport. The room was clean and spacious. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We found a variety of restaurants and cafes within walking distance. I would definitely stay here again.
