hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I will never chose any other hotel when I visit Paris. we have found a new tradition for Paris accommodations. if you want a relaxing and caring experience chose this hotel . it does not disappoint to say the least .felt safe with the police station right behind us. very peaceful and wonderful. grocery store, pharmacy, train station, bus station , restaurant ,movie theater ,shopping within 1 minute and just around the corner. lovely lovely lovely!!!!!!!!! staff is amazing and speak several languages . they only hire the best I believe . super clean .I felt at home
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel had great accommodations! The bed was a dream to sleep in and the rooms were a nice size. The location is a bit out of the way, but it's easy to navigate Paris transportation. It's in a quieter area of Paris, so it was nice to sleep soundly.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are very spacious. Shower is great, view was fantastic especially sitting out on the balcony at night. Pool area is well attended and appointed with plenty of sun beds and attentive staff. Food in the Thai restaurant was delicious.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The kindness of the staff. Special note for Takon, the concierge who has been really helpful. The location of the shangri La is great , easy to move through the river to visit all the temples and the north of the town.Amenities in the hotel are gorgeous.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very happy with our choice of hotel. It was close to multiple Metro stations, restaurants, pharmacies and shops. The hotel is about a 25min trip by train to the Louvre. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. The best thing about the hotel is that our room was very quiet which meant that we could get a great nights sleep with no outside noise, no mini fridge noise and no loud air conditioning noise. I wish more hotels were like this. Would highly recommend La Manufacture.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were put up in an lovely room on the top floor with an amazing view. Very cozy, romantic and comfortable. Hotel was in the perfect spot to explore the city. Though we were often tempted to take breakfast in bed or on our little Parisian balcony.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: La Manufacture is a pleasant, clean, and comfortable hotel at a reasonable price. The staff is helpful and pleasant to deal with. There are some nice restaurants around the corner and it is not far from several Metro stations and bus stops. We did go once to the restaurant that they recommend, (L'Entracte) and we do not ourselves think much of it, but the breakfast served on premises is perfectly good.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We would thoroughly recommend this hotel . The staff were really friendly and most welcoming. Upon our arrival we were immediately provided with maps of the city, shown the landmarks that we were keen to visit and offered advice on the best way to get there. We even bought tickets to some of the places that we visited from the hotel. Our room was quite small but was clean, nicely decorated and the bed was so comfortable. We had a great balcony where you could sit and watch the world go by. The hotel is in a fairly quiet part of Paris, but it is just around the corner from a metro station, making it very easy to get around. There are plenty of friendly bars and cafes within walking distance of the hotel. We would certainly stay here again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Since I like almost everything about this .hotel, it is surprising that I rate it only a 3 out of 5. The problem is that the really unpleasant thing takes the shine off the rest: the way they bundle the evening meal as part of the package. As far as I can tell, there is no way around this, and the meals, in a mediocre restaurant (L'Entracte) down the street from the hotel, are definitely not desirable--but I'll not go into a lot of detail on that. Otherwise the hotel is quite good. The staff is helpful, pleasant, and multilingual; the lobby area is attractive; the room I have is also attractive and clean and quiet; the hotel is very well located; the breakfasts (fortunately in the hotel itself) are copious, varied, fresh, and the coffee is good. But since you can't stay here without paying for dinners you'll never eat, I guess this will be my only stay at the Manufacture.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I brought our baby to Paris for a few days and stayed at this wonderful little hotel. The staff was exceptionally accommodating and made sure all the needs we had with regard to our baby were met. We would definitely stay here again! Merci!
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was compact but very clean and above all quiet given the hotel's location - which is exactly what we had wanted. Good breakfast and helpful and attentive staff. It's close to Place de l'Italie with direct metro to Gare du Nord. Also within walking distance of the 5th arrondissement and locations such as the rue Mouffetard market, Jardin des Plantes and the Mosque. I would definitely recommend the hotel.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is excellent, close to metro, bakeries and supermarkets. The hotel is clean and organized and the receptionists are extremely polite and hospitable. The rooms are small but comfortable. Could have a small fridge.. Worth it for short trips..
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed recently in Paris in this hotel for 4 nights and the hotel reception staff made us feel most welcome and were extremely helpful- including some basic French lessons! The room itself (while small which is normal for Paris) was extremely clean throughout our stay and the balcony gave us the opportunity to enjoy later afternoon sunshine. Its location 5 minutes from the metro gave us a good base to explore the city. We would stay again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The stay at the La Manufacture hotel Paris was brilliant. All the staff were helpful and very polite. The rooms were great and breakfast good..We found the hotel a very good location, with only short Metro rides to places of interest. Very good, we totally recommend it and would return there again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was great, service was excellent. Very warm stay. I want to thank the front desk attendants for being some welcoming and providing information to us upon arrival about the local area. Thank you!
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its at nice location, right next to metro. If you like walking, you can walk to Effiel tower, which we also did. As other reviews say, certainly the rooms are small but it wont matter if you touring outside. Staff is really friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean. Bakery and restarturants are around.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights. Room was small but it was spotless. Great location close to city centre. Resptionst was very helpful. Thank You so much we will be back definitely. Highly recommended . Great place to stay
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good place to spend your time for relax during your sitting in Paris. The hotel has a good position respect of the Paris centre, 20 minute by bus. Bus service very close to the hotel. People so kind, rooms are very cleans and breakfast is good.The hotel deserves more stars... Three stars is not enough!!!
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second time in Hotel La Manufacture and I will certainly go back. The location could not be better, as it is one and a half block from Place d'Italie, a metro hub; half a block away there's a bus stop, so you are never short of transportation options.Rooms are quite on the small size, but average for a big city like Paris.Staff was really helpful with cab and restaurant reservations (I'd sent an email days before arrival as one specific bistro takes no reservation on line and they did the arrangement).Give it a try and you will not regret it.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good Hotel, clean and good French Breakfast. Service very good, people obliging and professional. And the position near Place d' Italie and Metro is super. Building from 19th century, very good mainained and "a jour" with all the facilities. Good Wifi.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is better than a 3 star. They only serve breakfast with pastries, croissants cheeses,boiled eggs coffee or tea. The staff was friendly and professional. The room was very quiet even though we were in the suite at the end of the hall next to the elevator. Five minute walk to metro place d'italie
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A beautiful place to stay in Paris. Priced competitively and the location is great. 100 m away from two metro lines. A few quick shipping places nearby. There is a laundry place right behind the hotel as well if you are staying long term. I don't there could be a better place at this price in Paris.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel, convenient for the metro in the lively 13th arrondissement. We stayed for three nights and our top floor room had views over the Pantheon and city rooftops. The staff arranged a bouquet of 40th birthday flowers for my wife. The room was very comfortable. There are some excellent bakeries and restaurants nearby, and your euros go further here than they would closer to the centre.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Hotel La Manufacture for 4 days while attending a conference nearby. The location of the hotel is great, near the Place d'Italie, close to metro and bus lines, with many restaurants, shops etc. in the vicinity. It's tucked away from the big avenues, so provides a bit quieter environment.The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room I stayed in was rather small - typical for Paris - and overall reasonably comfortable. The only criticism I have is about the poor insulation from the street, specifically the windows that left big gaps for the cold air to get in and create the drafts, despite the cranked up heating. Otherwise, I was rather pleased with my stay at La Manufacture.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed my one night stay in this hotel and got such a great deal - it's really difficult to find a nice hotel in Paris around Christmas for a reasonable price, and I only paid 65 euro which was quite a bargain. The room and bathroom were quite compact but this wasn't an issue for me as I stayed alone and only for one night. I would not suggest booking the 'Classic Room' with the double bed for a couple as it would be very difficult to fit two suitcases in the room with enough space to walk around. The balcony was a really nice addition. The staff were so friendly and helpful at all hours of the day and night. The buffet breakfast was awesome! Great location too and felt like a safe area. Closeby to some wonderful restaurants and a really beautiful little area called Buttes-Chaumont - recommend this area for easy access to the metro but with fewer tourists for a more authentic Parisian experience.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: nice hotel, if rather small rooms but with a kettle which is always a welcome addition to any room. very well positioned in the 15th arrondissement. friendly reception. didn't use the breakfast / kitchen facilities
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice room very confrot room and normally Paris too expensive but these hotal is good price it's very good.al staff is very kind also room services very kind. When I will be Paris I will stay these hotel.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very well located in a decent area of central Paris and near to the metro.The hotel is exterior and reception are very pleasant and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, reception is 24 hours which is a bonus.The room was small and the bathroom quirky and a bit dated but we got a great deal on the hotel and I think we would struggle to find anything better for the price in central Paris.We would definitely book again but would probably pay a bit extra for a bigger room next time.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed with my wife at La Manufacture for 3 nights, the hotel is super cozy and very clean. All the members of staff were very kind (and able to communicate in English, Portuguese and Spanish). Definitely recommended :)
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spend just one night in the hotel but it was enough to recommend it: the hotel is just one block from Place de l'Italia where you can catch easily public transport and it's surrounded by places to have breakfast, lunch or dinner. The receptionist was super friendly and gave us a map of Paris and her best recommendations. I really like the detail that the room has a kettle and includes tea bags and coffee to prepare yourself. Cleanliness and comfort meet our expectations, so I totally recommend it.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recommended by a friend of a relative, in Barcelona, I was pleasantly surprised by the reviews I read before making my reservation. The price was also a big deciding factor. Then, wonderful Giulia and I exchanged emails, and everything was set up. She answered every question and, what a great surprise, she was at the front desk when we arrived. We were upgraded to a room with a view of the Eiffel Tour, and offered to reserve or buy tickets for Museums, River Cruises, etc., right there at the hotel. Very friendly and attentive staff. Very helpful and accommodating. Room was very clean, and the bathroom was big, clean and with plenty of towels and toiletries. The Metro is right around the corner, and there are plenty of restaurants around. We had breakfast included and we enjoyed it. Great coffee made for you by the friendly girls in the kitchen. In general I think this is a great place to stay when visiting Paris. I will definitely recommend it and stay there again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We liked to hotel and the room. The room is small but we liked it as clean. Front desk is helpful. Some upgrades need to be done in the room.Wood part in the bathroom should change. More electricty plug near to the bed. There is only one in the room and one in the bathroom. Hotel is very close to metro and good restaurants around it. Courfour is very close for some shopping. Sound isolation between rooms are not very good but it didnt bother us. Paris is very expensive and it would be good if cheeper.Thank you.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel in a fab location. The room we were in was small, so maybe not great if you need space, but think this is pretty normal for Paris. But, it was clean, the bed was comfy and it was relatively quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful. Just by the Place d’Italia Métro, also easy walking into the centre, if you like that. Would totally recommend. And we got it for a good discounted price.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very enjoyable stay at this cozy hotel that reminded me very much of a sweet B&B ( with elevators and room service). The staff is wonderful, the room was small but very comfortable and the breakfast was simple but delicious. We had checked in at another hotel which I was very disappointed in - so we had to hurriedly find something else. I’m so glad we found La Manufacture - it truly saved our time in Paris. I would stay here again and wholeheartedly recommend it to friends.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel on our arrival in France.We were able to check in early and settle in after our long journey.The staff were very helpful at all times, assisting in getting tickets and general advice about getting around in Paris.The room was small by North American standards, but adequate and what we expected. Good value, no surprises.Place d'Italie is a very good hub for getting around Paris. Very lively neighborhood.We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extremely inadequate for 3 stars. The staff were helpful to the best of thier abilities given the constraints of inadequate staffing in the evening. When we first arrived, the toilet lid was broken but they found someone to come up and fix it after originally saying that we'd have to wait until the next morning. The room didn't have a lot of natural light and looked directly into offices.The lack of minibar/fridge was unacceptable. The amount of space required for 2 people was not sufficient and could barely fit the cases - especially since it was supposed to be above the basic size (the Comfort traditional) and we had needed the extra space as I was staying with my mother who doesn't pack light. The fact that the bar was closed in the evening as there was no staff to man it is ridiculous as that is when most people want to use it. The lack of space in the bathroom made it uncomfortable to have toiletries in there or clothing for after the shower. There was not adequate storage for clothes except for a tiny wardrobe that didn't allow you to access most items behind the front hanger. There was a nasty smell of sewage coming from the bathroom - especially in the mornings - throughout our stay even though we reported it and they said that they would check it out (the solution was to open the windows). We had to go down to the lobby to pick up and carry our order of coffee ourselves as well as the ironing board and iron even though there's supposed to be room service. The bedroom itself was clean and the bed was comfortable but the shower curtain had yellowing on the inside which can be disconcerting when it's by your face and you don't know what it is. Also the shower head could not go straight as the hose did not have enough space to fit between the pole and the wall. It could be hand-held so it could be managed. Although it doesn't sound like it, I don't like being so negative which is why we didn't complain about the size of the room and the shower situation. However, the staff didn't seem to have a lot of autonomy to make decisions for themselves so it felt like a waste of breath to complain. The location was nice in that there was a shopping center close by and the town hall around the corner meant that we saw a lot of weddings in our 3 days there. It was also convenient to the Metro. In conclusion, extremely disappointing especially in comparison to the hotel that we had stayed in the previous week which was also a 3 star hotel (The Hotel du Continent). I had booked La Manufacture after seeing all of the great reviews on trip advisor and am frankly completely perplexed by the difference in experiences.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had booked my room on booking.com. Upon checkin, I was asked to pay the entirety of three nights’ stay upfront (even though they already had my credit card number as guarantee: vive la confiance!). Luckily, I asked to see the room first, which was small, dirty and right next to a noisy lift. I then asked for it to be changed, in vain, as they were fully booked. The night manager was not even able to guarantee that the room would be changed the day after. I then chose not to check in and asked the front office to cancel my reservation. The staff member accepted to do so but my credit card was charged for the entire sum, and I only got it back through booking.com. This is an abusive, dishonest conduct, unworthy of a three star hotel. Beware of management, therefore, and of substandard rooms. The location, however, is good and the building quite nice (not the rooms though).
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location near metro Place d'Italie. If you have a car you can park in a garage five minutes walk. Quiet room even if not very wide and good breakfast at a right price. Staff is very kind. I can surely recommend it.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: thank you for the great service at an affordable price! I highly recommend this hotel and will be back soon. The rooms are clean, modern, reception is helpful and more tourists should explore this charming real part of Paris.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in Paris so we didn't have any expectations, it seems majority of hotels in Paris have tiny rooms & this one certainly was. Certainly couldn't swing a cat in the room or the bathroom! but very clean, comfortable (particularly the bed) & friendly staff. Location great, you have a metro both sides of the hotel.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights for our anniversary, and it was absolutely perfect. The staff at the front desk was incredible and helpful in every way. We had purchased some wine bottles on a day exploring the city, and the staff uncorked the bottles for us and provided wine glasses for us to enjoy in our room. We also had a small incident one morning where our room safe malfunctioned and the staff came and fixed it immediately so we could get our personal belongings out of it for the day. The hotel is located near SO MANY restaurants and bistros (we strongly recommend venturing across the street to the La Manufacture wine bar - so cute and reasonably priced!) and it was also near a bus station for easy transportation. Overall - excellent visit!
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is not in a tourist area but has a lot of the Paris aesthetic or vibe. Limestone 6 storey buildings, small streets and lots of shops nearby. There is a licensed supermarket on the opposite corner for food and wine. Its a great locale to explore Paris with a 30 minute walk to the Siene River / Notre Dame area. From here you can purchase and get on an open top bus tour to Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees, Arc de triomphe etc.Staff were helpful friendly and not obtrusive. The lobby was inviting and offers free tea and coffee 4pm - 6pm. It does not have a restaurant but room service is available and guests can use the cooking facilities to prepare a meal (microwave, crockery, cutlery) after 7pm. Wifi is also pretty good. There are 2 English TV channels but they were changing providers when we were there & they werent available so cant rate it. We did watch some entertaining sumo wrestling and soap box racing though.Rooms are small but very comfortable. We stayed 5 nights and found it great. The bed was great, sheets were smooth and high quality and we slept very well. Bathroom bright and clean. Cant fault it and great value for money.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was as described. Very nice was the possibility to use the microwave for self catered dinner.Although the room was pretty small (which is very common in Paris) it was clean and well equipped.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good place, staff very friendly and helpful. It's located near 3 lines metro, so the traveling is very easy. A big amount of busses stops there too. Near the hotel you can find ATM, Mini market and about dozen of cafe/restourant /pizzeria. Take into account that this place is not touristic and most of the visitors in hotel was French.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Too expensive, you pay to stay in a litlle room, when you enter in the room you make one step and you can jump in the bed. The breakfast is poor. The staff is very kind, good service, the room is clean and one big plus I will give for the bed, you can really have a good sleep there.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A classic building well maintained, the room was confortable and the personnel was very kind and willing to help with any particular need or advise for visitor new to Paris like us. The breakfast was very good. The only thing would've been a nice plus is a small fridge in the room as on the days of our visit whether was very hot.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was happy with the room. I asked for a room with street view and became it. It was very cleaned and not so loud. My daughter became a crib, which I asked for. The crib is overused and not stable at all. It is in fact dangerous and should not be used. The hotel should asap provide a new one for the smaller guests. It is only 40-50 euros. The staff helped my to advice to tell me which buses I had to take to all destinations that I asked for, because of the stroller. To take the bus is very good if you are on a budget in Paris as you explore the city in a beutiful way. We would probably stay there again, when we come to Paris next time.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I found this hotel perfect for our two days trip in Paris. Located near several bus stops and metro stations, this was convenient to go within 20minutes in all attractions. The location is not too touristic and have a great and homy atmosphere with plenty of greeneries along the streets.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at La Manufacture, we were happy with our room rate for 2 adults and a teenager (booked 5 months in advance), although the room was ever so slightly cramped for this number. The staff were outstanding for their helpfulness and ironing out small niggles. The breakfast was plentiful and very good. The hotel had good access to the Metro and was a pleasant 20 min walk, via the botanic garden, to the River Seine shuttle boat. The surrounding streets had excellent restaurants and patisseries. We would come again here.
hotelName:
13    Hotel La Manufacture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I booked my reservation, it was after much research and deliberation as trying to book a hotel in Paris can be overwhelming, even after visiting for years. It is not uncommon to pay a lot, for little in return in terms of service and actual hotel. But, I was pleasantly surprised by the Hotel de Suede. Upon my arrival, I was given a room where I felt that my request for a quiet area was honored. I'm a very light sleeper, and I could still hear door slams, but overall between the location and a consistent white noise of the air conditioner, I was very grateful. The room itself was apparently kept by a staff who understands how important it is for guests to feel like they're in a managed, clean space. This is not a given regardless of what one pays. But, for me, what or I should say whom won me over the most was whom I can only assume was at the least, the General Manager. Before even knowing he was the GM, he greeted this tired traveler with a kind and sincere smile. I know this sounds unimportant, but when one is far away from home, and is hoping the place one is staying in, can be at least remotely comforting, feeling welcomed is priceless. Having traveled extensively and having had the opposite experience at times, his demeanor towards his guests was very much appreciated. At one point, my dress got caught on a loose nail on the desk in my room. I alerted the young lady at the front desk and she was also very empathetic and told me she'd speak to her superior to see if they could help me fix my dress. After being out for a good portion of the day, not only did she remember me when I returned, but she had also spoken to her superior who I then found out was the same kind man who on my first day of arrival where I certainly looked tired and disheveled, he made me feel welcomed. He said he could see the next day if someone on his staff could help me fix my dress, yet when I alerted him of my early departure, he said that he was sorry nothing more could be done, but that I could be comped with a free breakfast for the inconvenience. While I now still have to pay for my dress to be repaired, I appreciated the gesture of the breakfast as he could have just brushed me off since I was leaving early and just be discounted as a dispensable tourist as do so many places that cater to tourists. An added gesture would have been to offer to pay the bill for the repair back home, but I can understand that this is tricky as it would require an honor system that unfortunately others might abuse, so an on the spot solution is preferable for the establishment and I can respect that. I chose this hotel because of it's proximity to the Miraculous Medal Chapel, after the reviews and fair price in comparison to other area hotels. Yes, it's small, yes it's a little out of the way for some areas, but it's really difficult to find a hotel in Paris that is equidistant to everything, and worthy of one's business, unless you stay in a houseboat on the Seine. I would encourage you to stay here because the GM makes you feel like your business is appreciated, like you as a person are respected and because the rooms are well kept and inviting. Don't stay here if you will complain about size. It's Paris. If you want big rooms, you have to look at hotels that cater to that as a non-negotiable. But, if you can adapt to the French respect of older architecture, without sacrificing modern needs, this is the place to stay. They make great use of the space that's available to them, in great and successful attempts to cater to the needs of their guests. Thank you, Hotel de Suede. May you continue to run successfully for many years to come.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is lovely! Clean, tidy and staff are friendly. About a 25 minute walk to the Eiffel towel and the same to Notre Dame in the other direction. Located in a quiet and safe street. Would definitely recommend staying here!
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a room for 4 which was 4 twins pushed close together. There was hardly room to put suitcases. The bathroom was large. Beaks fast is NOT included. Hotel wanted to charge 15 euros per person, not worth it. The hotel is on a quiet street close to a mini grocery store and several restaurants. The rooms are entered from a cute outdoor courtyard. Nice and clean.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best aspects of Hotel de Suede is the quality of the staff. All of them were extremely welcoming and polite and went out of their way to accomodate any of our needs and questions. The quality of the buffet breakfast is excellent!
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved it. Staff were very friendly and professional. My room was very clean, and even though a little small, I loved it. It faced the park and the sun shined in. Good location and close to Rue de Bac, which is a charming street with cafes, shops. I did not have the breakfast, so can't comment on that. This is not 5 star, but I still really enjoyed it and would go back. The room was mostly quiet, but I did hear the people walking heavy above me, and some banging and thumping during the day. But I was mostly out, so it wasn't too bad and it wouldn't stop me from staying here again.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was clean and comfortable, there were four of us sharing a room but the space was adequate. Nice view overlooking the courtyard. The staff were friendly and helpful, organising a transfer for us on our last day. Great location.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Convenient for Rodin and Orsay museums. Good selections at breakfast. Comfortable beds.Front desk staff gave poor directions multiple times. Sent us to the Orsay museum when we asked for Rodin.2 different people at the front desk told me several times that we did not pay for breakfast and later realized that we did. They did not apologize for their error. One morning we had a tour booked at 0700 so we did not have time for breakfast which started at 0700. We were told we could not have a refund; so we asked if we could take some croissants to go We finally got them after 0700 and we were late for our tour. We asked for water as the breakfast area was out. They gave us 4 small bottles and then added 13 euro to our bill! No wash clothes in the rooms. Hotel could use a refresh. I booked two adjoining rooms and was told they don't have that. They could only give us two rooms next to each other. This is a HUGE disappointment as I booked adjoining not next to!! Adjoining means there is a door in between!
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Simply for the location. One of the best in town. Too many things to list with in a 15-20 minute walk.You get what you pay for with the cheapest room. It's fine. But, there are nicer rooms. The room was actually good size. It just needed some updating, minor fixes. The staff at the Front Desk was very friendly and professional.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first expression was not very positive since the room was very outdated and could use some paint and maybe new doors etc. and the bathroom was tiny. But after settling in I got more positive since the room was clean and comfortable and the hotel is very quiet. The location was also absolutely perfect for me, both near my meetings and near a lot of shops and restaurants. So I would consider staying there again if the price was good.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel's location in the heart of Paris' 7th quarter is in itself a huge advantage. Close to the Rudin Museum, in a quiet area.Within walking distance of famous attractions, good restaurants and shopping centers including the famous BON MARCHEThe hotel staff is friendly and helpful in every question.The hotel is in a quiet street, asking for the rooms facing the garden and the back.The modern small rooms are renovated and have air conditioning.Breakfast is excellent and is made in the lobby - the living room adjacent to the reception.The hotel has a good atmosphere and its stay is part of the unique tourist experience to Paris.A good place in a great city.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for a week in May 2018.The location is central (in a quiet street near Matignon and Le Bon Marche). The standard rooms are quite small so it is worth taking a bigger room even if you are couple. The hotel has a lot of charm with inner patios and gardens. The staff is very nice, polite and friendly (at all hours of the day).The breakfast is gorgeous: loaded with fresh coffee and croissants..I warmly recommend it.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights in mid August. The staff was helpful and efficient. The breakfast was good and we loved the location. It was close to the metro and other wonderful places to eat. It was also very quiet. A great value. Our rooms were clean and comfortable.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There may be no place better situated for seeing the sites of Paris. For two days we walked from here to the major attractions. On the 3rd day we used the metro for the Sacre Couer on what was one of the hottest summer days in Paris. Our clean room was just off the quiet courtyard and was furnished pleasantly with plenty of wardrobe space. Breakfast was served in a dining area and was of the self service continental variety. What stood out for me was the service we received. On check in,we were warmly greeted by the receptionist, told where the nearest metros were and provided advice on local restaurants when asked. Further advice was happily provided whenever we asked during our stay. In addition the way that a situation was handled, involving the deposit on a lost safe key which we found in our luggage when we returned home a week after we checked out of the hotel, restored my faith that there are people who know the value of good service.Thank you.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Most of the staff is sour faced, unwelcoming, and makes you feel you are disturbing them.....especially the staff in the night. No courtesies exchanged ever. I was checking out the next morning so decided to give the safe lock back the previous night, and explained to the guy at the reception that it will be a busy morning trying to get to the airport, kids, luggage, taxi etc. The guy told me to return it in the morning and then said in a condescendingly “how hard is it to return it in the morning”..... I explained to him that I will be in a rush, two kids, luggage, etc...and will not have time and may forget. Whether it’s returning in the morning or previous night, doesn’t matter....there was no need for him to say “how hard is it.....”. Overall, none of us felt warm nor welcomed during the stay.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m sure this actual hotel is nice. However, their customer service leaves much to be desired. Our flight was cancelled due to a mechanical problem and we missed our two nights here- they refused to provide a refund/ somewhat understandable but what truly bothered me was that due to our flight changing we were in Paris at the end of our trip instead- they wouldnt even entertain the idea of shifting the reservation to the nights at the end of our trip. I even reached out to the site that I booked with, who tried to talk to themOn our account and the hotel was steadfast and not even expressing understanding at our situation- which was out of our control. I read reviews and others gave experiences poor customer service from this hotel- be warned! They were cut throat about it- clinical. Clearly, they don’t put their customers first, but money first.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a gem! This hotel has a stunning breakfast room- very chic and cute. The best part was the location in st. Germaine. A nice walk to the Lourve through a cute, local neighborhood lined with boutiques and cafes. My second time to Paris and I have not yet gone through this area, but it was magical. Very kind and receptive staff. The room was nice as well, not completely luxurious but a great bathroom, amazing soaps and a decent bed. Would definitely recommend to stay.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Because my cell phone and a pair of my wife's lace stockings were stolen out of our room, this review dropped several notches. The hotel location was ok, room was nicely decorated and spacious, the bathroom was modern and large for Paris, and the staff were generally knowledgeable and friendly. The breakfast was a very good quality continental breakfast buffet that was overpriced at 15 Eu each, but there is an excellent Boulangerie around the corner for a fraction of that cost. The rooms on the street side are noisy. We stayed 8 nights and left unhappy about the thefts,and the attitude that I had lost the phone. I am a retired airline pilot and in over 30 years have never had anything taken from my rooms.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first floor room for 4 was a little tight and required the sofa to be folded out to a bed. The room and bath were clean and safe from the street and close to the lobby. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful to direct us to undergrounds, arrange for a river cruise, and call our cab to the airport. The continental breakfast was wonderful with more choices than you can eat. We found a great Italian restaurant between one underground station and the hotel. There are other pubs and restaurants nearby as well as museums within walking distance.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a one night stay at this lovely hotel. Staff are there 24/7 and friendly and helpful. Our room was off of a lovely quaint courtyard. The room was a lovely size. Warm, clean and the bed was amazingly comfortable. Bathroom was a good size and clean with ample towels and free toiletries. Room service was prompt and the continental breakfast was lovely.. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So the room is typical size for a Parisian hotel. But first impressions in the lobby are not great. It looks tired and a little uncoordinated and lacking that French style. The room I had was the noisiest hotel room I have ever stayed in. You could hear every word the people above me were saying and footsteps and doors closing were really loud. I would not recommend this hotel sadly mainly because of the noise.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This lovely hotel is in the 5th Arrondisement with access to walking to many of the great places in Paris. Walked to Musee D'Orsay, Jardins de Luxembourg and other spots. Great area! The room was larger than expected with a modern bathroom. Highly recommend this boutique hotel. The price was right. Found a fantastic restaurant just around the corner that seats all of 20 people.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stayed at Hotel de Suede twice over the past three years and our college-age daughter and her cousin stayed there Spring 2017. The hotel was wonderful to them. Located in a more residential neighborhood near the Hotel Matignon and the Italian embassy, the small, European-style hotel is walking distance to everything from the Tour Eiffel to Musée d'Orsay to the Louvre. A delicious breakfast is served each morning. Rooms and bathrooms are well-sized and clean. We look forward to returning!
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, clean, above average size rooms, better than the 3-star rating. To be fair, I stayed for 4 nights in May 2017 while working locally, I spent very little time in the property – in fact I missed breakfast every day, but from what I saw – breakfast looked to be of good quality, as I ran past on my way to work…….. My room was unusually large for Parisian hotels and my bathroom had been recently refurbished. The décor was classic shabby chick – something Parisians pull off with aplomb, my bed was comfortable and clean. If I had a complaint it would be the attitude of the night porter whom I woke up every night at 0200hrs when I returned from work. I think he was surprised at the hours my team were working. All in all, very good value for money – I would be happy to stay again.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everyone at the desk was friendly. First night there were no nightstands but they got those put in without any issues. Room and bathroom were cleaned and kept so. I did not get the breakfast and looks like I did not miss much but again, it's a 3-star hotel. Internet worked fine. Flat screen TV but I never turned it on. I would definitely stay there again as I thought it was a value deal.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights. There were 4 of us in one room and it was perfect for us. Just a few minutes walk to the nearest metro station and grocery store. Within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. Very safe neighborhood with lots of fun shops. We loved our view into the courtyard. We would stay here again!
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A rather old hotel with a classic French style, which is actually quite charming. The breakfast was better than I had expected and the location is good just a 10 minutes walk from the Seine and many of the attractions of Paris.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Typical French hotel, one of the better 3* hotels I stayed in. Very well kept, clean and charming. Atmosphere is classic, not my style, but OK. Rooms are rather small, but this is Paris, I had worse ones before. Breakfast also typical French, not extensive, but good quality. Front desk and staff is very friendly. The area is very central, but remarkably quiet at night. Takes a ’15 minute walk to Luxembourg and ’10 to Invalides. Metro Sevres-babylone at ‘5. For those who come by car, the ‘Bon Marche’ rue de Sevres has an underground parking.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this lovely hotel because of its proximity to all must see places and also because of the immediate response to my emails ....thank you ms Diana . We walked from the hotel to : Invalides , Champs Elysees , Louvre , Orsay , Marais et led Vosges . We took the metro from Sevres - Babylone station to go to all other interesting places . Central area but far from the hasstle .As far as the hotel itself : an old charm hotel , with red velvet chairs at the peaceful lobby . Rooms quiet with a huge extra confy bed and flaffy pillows . Bathroom spacious with bath tub . Free toilletteries renewed every day ( even body cream ) not so usual for a three stars hotel . Breakfast , typically French!!! Loved it : fresh hot croissants , baguettes , cheese etc . Nespresso to prepare your own espresso(s) !!! Superb !! And last but not least the smiling and efficient staff . An excellent stay .
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked two rooms here on the recommendation of a friend and weren't disappointed. The rooms are a decent size by comparison with many similarly-priced hotels in Paris and the beds are firm, the bathrooms clean and well-stocked. The reception staff were friendly and very helpful. The only less-than-ideal thing was when we had breakfast at the hotel the staff failed to replenish the croissants, eggs and other items, leaving guests hungry and frustrated. That said, the breakfast was very nice and good value ... when the food arrived! I would happily stay there again! The location, neat the Rodin Museum, Les Invalides etc. is very good. Ask for a courtyard room!
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice staff, we had a cosy double (maybe QB?) with adjoining bathroom on the ground floor in the garden. Positives: Good shower, excellent location for walking to sights like Eiffel Tower, Louvre and D'Orsay. Coutome cafe is excellent and just around the corner, as well as restaurants and supermarkets. The hotel staff were all very nice and helpful with booking tables and tickets etc. Negatives: The garden location meant everyone walks past our window so the curtains stayed shut. The lobby door slams so was quite noisy with guests coming and going all the time. The wifi is free but very slow, so images on pages won't always load.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for four nights in Sept. 2016. I am disappointed with this choice. The neighborhood was fine, but seems like everything closed super early. We were hoping for more nightlife. The room was very small, it was clean, but felt old. The receptionists were nice, recommended two restaurants in the area. Nothing else noteworthy.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is situated among Embassies - it's a very clean and safe area. There are museums, gardens, restaurants within walking distance. I stayed her with my husband and two children and there was more than enough room - a king bed and two single beds lining the walls. There was a huge wardrobe with lots of shelves. The hotel staff were very helpful. They have maps of the city to give to you and they will give suggestions if you need them. The first day, we walked to the Eiffel Tower. On the way back, I bought some very fragrant cheese and ate some when we got back to the room. It was very fragrant, and everyone in the room was complaining, so I opened up the window in the bathroom and stuck it out on the ledge. It was in December and it was very cold outside, but the room was very warm and comfortable. There is a great brasserie down around the corner - we went every morning for coffee and croissants, etc. One day, we bought sandwiches there to take with us for lunch. There are also two pharmacies, one on either side of the hotel. It is also situated between two Metro stations, and there is a huge MonoPrix close by, and there was a church with a market where they were selling flowers, cheese, baked goods, jams, and soap. Do not miss a trip to the Army Museum and Napoleons Tomb. It is a couple of blocks from the hotel to the West. Another thing - the Rodin Museum is closed on Mondays.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a room with a king bed and two twin rollaways for our boys. Within walking distance to the Musee d'Orsay and Musee de l'Armee. Bathroom was completely remodeled and very nice. Staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Room was cleaned every day. Room was quiet and cool with the AC. Nice breakfast each morning included in our rate - warm croissants, with a selection of meats, cheeses, jams and honey. Fresh cut fruit and crepes, scrambled eggs and juices rounded out the offering. We would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There really wasn't anything we didn't like about this hotel. The room was nice and clean as was the bathroom. We had reserved the larger room as there were four of us and although it was cozy, we were comfortable. Staff was very friendly and willing to help with taxis, etc. Breakfast in the mornings was variety of fruit, coffee, juice, breads, a few selections of meat slices, cereal and yogurt.One of the main points of this hotel is it's location. It is centrally located from most of the main attractions in Paris. It was an easy walk for our family to most places we were going. Some practical information, there is a bank at the end of the block with an ATM for some quick cash. There is also a FranPrix store (like an American convenience store) just a couple of blocks away for some drinks or snacks, or a bottle of wine.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is pretty central and within easy commute. Small hotel but staff are very friendly and helpful. Only criticism we would make is the taxi service offered for the airport does not make it clear that you will stop and multiple hotels to pick up passengers. The taxi arrived early for us (we were ready - but did miss breakfast) Other passengers were not ready which meant we had to wait for them. The other passengers were departing from various terminals which meant on arriving at the airport we had a long walk to our terminal to check in - with long queues for security we literally went straight from there to boarding and only just made our flight on time. Although this was cheaper I would not do this again when you are relying on others to be on time.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just spent a week at hotel de suede and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke good English. The hotel was within walkng distance of the Eiffel Tower, the musee Rodin, the musee d'Orsay and the nearest Metro station was ten minutes away.Our room was of a very generous size and the buffet breakfast was delicious.We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Centrally located, reasonably sized rooms (for Paris), basic but with the essentials. Safe in room, bathtub, great Parisian breakfast, friendly and helpful staff. Local surrounds are up market and safe. Restaurants, bars, metro and shops all within a 5-10 minute walk. I have stayed here over a dozen times and keep coming back!
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel de Suede is the perfect Paris hotel with the best of everything. The staff is friendly and helpful, especially Semah during the daytime and Michael at night. They are never too busy to offer assistance. My room was very spacious for Paris with a comfortable bed and an updated bathroom stocked with elegant toiletries which are replenished every day. The location is ideal on a very quiet street but within walking distance of many top tourist attractions. The Rodin Museum is 5 minutes away and Musee D'Orsay 10 minutes. Even the Eiffel Tower and the Pompidou Center are a brisk 30 minute walk away. The breakfast is incredible! Crisp buttery croissants along with a selection of charcuterie and fabulous cheeses they also have scrambled eggs! There are many restaurants and cafes within walking distance. I have stayed in many Paris hotels and they have all been comfortable and pleasant but the three star Hotel De Suede is definitely the best!
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is all about the location...Just south of the river, 5 minutes to the nearest tube station, 15 minutes from the Eiffel Tower, absolutely spot on. The hotel itself is 3 star which is a fair assessment, but it is a strong 3 star. Clean rooms, well equipped, good showers and decent value for a city like Paris.Overall if you are looking for a nice hotel in central Paris for a good price, this fits the bill..
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the hotel from 3/10/16 to 3/16/16. Our stay was amazing!! The staff went above and beyond the call of duty to make our trip and our stay amazing! The front desk people were always giving us help, directions, advice on where to shop, where to eat, and what sites to see first!! My best friend and I had always heard how rude French people were, this was not the case!! The only rude people we met were other tourists!! Every person we stopped on the street gave us help with directions, and our questions!! It was the trip of a lifetime! The only thing I can stress is this: If you are planning on traveling to Paris, France take two weeks, because you can never see everything there is to see in just a week!!!
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a small hotel well placed but a bit far from metro station ( 500m) . We satyed in a suite with a very good bed, a sofa in the living room and a big bathroom. Very quiet because its faced the backyard. We didn t had breakfast and so the hotel was only to sleep ( and had very good night sleep)there are a few restaurants nearby where you can have breakfast. Boulevard Saint germain in a walking distance . The front desk is ok and called us a taxi to the airport. You can also make reservation to disney. Good Wi-Fi and ameneties. overall is a good value for price close to the center
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We based our selection on the reviews of others and they are pretty accurate. I had been to Paris before and knew I wanted to stay in this area. This is a quaint little place in a nice part of the City (7th arondissement) which makes it accessible to most attractions. We were able to take the train from the airport and it's just a 7 minute walk from your choice of 2 metros. We walked everywhere from the hotel! The reception staff (George) was friendly, the room was small, but clean and it overlooked a walled park offering a nice view, There are lots of restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice and small hotel. The rooms are big enough for 2 peoples. The breakfast is with fresh bread and different types of sausages, jam, nutelle, eggs, ... The staff bring also the breakfast to your room, without extra fees.The key has to be give to the desk on leaving the hotel and get it back on return. The desk is open 24h. The wireless is free, but to slow for voice over IP or whatching films. The staff are very friendly and give advices to book over webpages and not directly on the desk, because in the internet the hotel is cheaper. They provide directly a key for the internet to do the booking over internet inside the hotel. This hotel is located directly in the heart of Paris. I assume you could walk to 90% of all important visitor places in 20 minutes (Eifel tower approx 20 min and Notre-Dame also approx 20 min walking). The next Metro is approx 5 minutes by walk (one and a half street)Near this hotel are some small pubs and restaurants with a very nice and favorable food. We will come back to this hotel in our next visit to Paris.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family of 4 who spent Xmas in Paris and stayed at this hotel. Everything was perfect beginning from our clean, warm and comfy family room. The bathroom was also luxurious with all the necessities. Our room was cleaned / refreshed every single day. The breakfast was also very fine and plentiful as staff ensured that nothing ran out and they were always topping up without having to be told. Free wi-fi which worked just fine. Staff were friendly and nothing was too much to ask for. We had an early check out and asked if we could have breakfast half an hour prior to the set breakfast time. This request was welcomed with a smile - we enjoyed our last breakfast and left with a smile. Thank you to all of the staff and we wish you all the best for the New Year!
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights with our 2 children, the room was a bit cramped as we had the sofa bed out for the kids, however would of been a spacious room with it as a sofa. The bathroom was nice and modern. The breakfast was delicious and the hotel was in a great area and we managed to walk to most places. George who was in reception was just fantastic, he was so nice and very helpful and just made our stay that bit nicer.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our recent five-night stay at Hotel de Suede was wonderful. Rooms were very nice and very clean. Bathrooms were updated. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was expensive and did not have much to offer. There is a lovely Pâtisserie nearby and I would suggest going there for breakfast. A few small restaurants in the area. The hotel is not located close to any major sites except the Rodin Museum a few blocks away. We spent quite a bit on taxis to get places.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights, we only needed a 3 star hotel as it was just somewhere to sleep and shower, and we were not disappointed. The room was probably smaller than average but loads of storage so not really a problem as we didn't need to leave anything on the floor. The place could probably do with updating but our room was always clean and our fifth floor room also over looked a lovely park. The hotel is perfectly placed for exploring the city with at least 2 metro stations just 5 minutes away and a variety of cafes and bars.Our only negative would no tea and coffee making facilities in our room, as Brits we rather struggled with this but it was a small price to pay,
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is set in a very quiet district. Giving you the chance to recharge your batteries after a long day of exploring the hustle and bustle of central Paris.Staff were very polite cheerful and helpful.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is the perfect location to explore the city. Quaint and very clean rooms. Reasonable prices. Accommodating staff. Subway is close and the subway is easy to maneuver so you can get around. Safe area. The coffee in the morning is good. The bakery around the corner is fantastic if you don't want the breakfast buffet. The hotel will charge you for individual items off of the buffet if you can't eat a full breakfast. Enjoy.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was nice as far as median priced hotels go. The rooms are small and in need of updating but it had a nice balcony. The staff was VERY helpful and made our stay easy and enjoyable. The WiFi was spotty and kind of slow. There was a hot water issue one night. They offer a decent breakfast buffet if you're in a hurry for 13€. A little out of the way but very quiet. Because the staff went above and beyond to help us with whatever we needed, I would stay here again.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel de Suede St. Germain is in a great location, a perfect quiet neighborhood. We really liked our stay, great room, and very quiet. We were there when Paris was really hot, and our room had less than adequate air conditioning, the only thing I can say bad about our stay. Otherwise, great place to stay, and would highly recommend the property.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel for our family (with 2 kids, age 11 & 8) on booking.com for 3 nights. The first night was charged immediately on the credit card, and I was presented with a copy of the credit card receipt on arrival. The hotel is in a great location. We walked every morning to the Eiffel Tower (approx. 15 mins) and got on to the Big Bus Tour Company tours (2 days, night and cruise package) which was a great value and fantastic way of seeing Paris in a short 3 day visit. The hotel staff are friendly, hotel is spotless (very clean). The only criticism I have is, we were a little cold on our first night, so we asked for an extra blanket for our second night. We were told that, there were no extra blankets with an attitude of "sorry, we don't have any extra blankets. You are not to first to ask for this", so if this is something they are aware of, surely they must do something about it. If you book room only, breakfast is 13 Euro per person. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel. A short stroll down the road, there is a nice cafe selling fresh croissants for 1 EUR. Just step out, turn left and right at Rue de Babylone, it is literally 1 min walk to get to this cafe. We are leaving and our check out is 12 pm which is nice. Overall, good stay, good value and a great location. Hope they improve on the extra blanket issue.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is in a very quiet area about 8 long blocks up from the D'Orsay. If I was going again I would stay in the same area only about 8 blocks closer in. We did walk to everything but it is a very long walk. The underground it right around the corner but we had already seen a purse snatching on the underground here and decided walking was better! The rooms are outstanding, super quiet and everything was pretty new. Just wish it would of been closer to the river. Once you are by the river you can walk to everything. That was something I wish I would of know before picking a hotel. George was great! Very safe neighborhood walking at night was not a problem.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here the beginning of June 2015. Room was clean and comfortable. The staff, especially George and the other night receptionist, were exceptionally helpful. The hotel serves a very good buffet breakfast.
hotelName:
14    Hotel de Suede St. Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 2 nights at the Hotel Danube in the heat of summer. The location was perfect, near the Seine and the wonderful cafes and shops of Saint Germain des Pres. We enjoyed our air conditioned room decorated in quaint French style. The staff were so helpful. Ahmed even made coffee for us at 4:45AM as we waited for our taxi. We will book this hotel again.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely large quiet room 7 overlooking Rue Jacob (no noise double glazing) Separate loo was great. Nice heated towel rail. Needed new towels a bit tired. Shower under pressured. Very clean. Lovely fresh and new bedding and VERY comfy bed. Nice little table and good storage. RECEPTION & all staff very obliging speaking good English. Check Airport taxi transfer price to be as Hotel says before you depart Hotel - greedy Driver can up the price en route. Reception very attractive and Hotel smells lovely. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was lovely with large modern bathroom, tub and shower stall. Staff was friendly and helpful, making and changing reservations for dinner, museums etc. daily housekeeping excellent, all requests for extra towels, wastebaskets etc were met immediately. The manager, Mark, seemed anxious to please, and all requests met with smiles. There is a breakfast but it is not included, and no room service. Ne t door a lively Compton’s with coffee and croissants- wonderfulGreat location.!
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our family hotel in Paris. We always stay at Hotel du Danube during our regular trips to Paris. The rue Jacob location is excellent in Saint Germain close to the river, restaurants, art galleries and shops. The receptionists are always very helpful with all of our requests. Comfortable beds, clean and silent. We don’t feel the need to go elsewhere.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have repeatedly found this charming, boutique hotel to be extremely clean; spacious rooms & baths. The staff professional, accommodating & friendly. As a single female traveler, the location excellent with metro, museums, shopping & restaurants within short walking distance.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were more than happy with our room and glad we chose to upgrade to an Air Conditioned Room. The hotel for us was in the perfect place and also had the right room comforts that we need after a long day of sightseeing. The room we had was not spacious and was fine for us. There was nothing broken or tired. The bed / pillows were comfortable. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. There is a Café right next door and you are a 5-minute walk to nightlife dinner action in one direction and the River Seine in the other.We totally enjoyed our stay and needed a room/hotel like this after long days on our feet walking the streets of Paris :-)We would recommend this hotel based on our stay and the budget we had for our time in Paris
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 8 nights in room 26 which was amazing. It was our first time in Paris and only booked this hotel via reviews/web location. The staff at the hotel are very helpful and friendly, particularly when asking for directions or advice for things to do/best way to get somewhere. It took us anywhere between 2-5mins to get to the St Germain Metro which gave us easy access to everything, and I mean everything. The rooms were neat and tidy with no complaints at all! We loved staying at this hotel and will be back here, requesting Room 26, in 2 years time
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms can be small, but they are nicely decorated and furnished. The staff is welcoming and helpful. The neighborhood is the real star, with easy-to-walk-to must-see museums and churches, excellent restaurants, stylish boutiques, easy access to Metro, and the Seine practically outside your door.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, easy walk to everything. Room was comfortable but a bit small. Staff very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was not included in room booking but it was good. As we were in Paris for only one day, we booked one of less expensive rooms. Next time we would book a larger room, if we chose this hotel.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, easy walk to everything. Room was comfortable although wallpaper was a bit overpowering being orange and pink, staff very friendly and helpful. Really enjoyed our stay, would definitely stay here again
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is great . It was my first time to stay in St germaine area and I love it . Not too many tourists and restaurants-cafes-night life are nearby , nice and quiet neighborhood. Les Deux Magots is just 2 minute walk away . I initially booked in booking.com then I tried contacting the hotel directly for a quotation and they gave me around $200 lower than booking.com :) Our room was small though , typical of Paris hotels . But was clean .Overall - I love it and recommend it to my friends.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The elegant foyer and front areas of the hotel promised more than they delivered. I booked a family room for myself, my daughter and two grandchildren. The space was fine and the children (9 and 7) could not leave the room without our knowledge.However, the room was shabby with broken curtain fittings which meant that the curtains could not be closed properly. The shower unit head was broken so that the water flow was unregulated. The shower controls were dangerous: separate hot and cold taps at child height with very hot water. The room was cleaned everyday and plenty of towels were supplied.Staff were friendly and polite.However, we did not feel that the room that we had rated a three star level.One evening the fire alarm went off. We evacuated down the nearest stairs to the foyer.The staff were unable to find out why the alarm had operated and after half an hour we were allowed to return to our room. The event was chaotic and there was no information offered as to what was happening and no evidence of a check on who was in the building.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first visit to Paris and staying at Hotel du Danube was the perfect location. It's walking distance to many attractions. The staff is very friendly and helpful. My cousin and I stayed in one of the large rooms on the front and we loved it, the bathroom suite was beautiful. It is next door to a cafe and near many places to eat and shop. I am looking forward to a return trip. Thank you for a wonderful experience.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are large, by Paris standards, and the bathroom in our room was huge. The shower was great. The hotel does have an elevator, and an inviting lobby.It is located in St. Germain near several wonderful restaurants, and it's near the Metro and within walking distance of the Seine.On our most recent stay the A/C didn't work but they loaned us a large fan and made compensation on our bill. Michel, and Jeremy, are quite nice and like to share their knowledge of the area.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our Hotel Stay was not a good one . When booking the room, a photo of the room was shown . When we arrived , this was not the room I HAD EXPECTED . The room was so small , there was no room to place your luggage. You had to walk sideways to get into the bathroom. The double bed took up all of the space. No mirror in the room, only in the bathroom. The tub was so small that you had to stand sideways to take a shower.The hair dryer did not work, when complained about it , the management supplied a hairdryer,except the electrical outlets did not work. My husband could not use his electric shaver and I could not blow dry my hair. Nothing was supplied in the room .No Closet for your clothes, no water bottles, no coffee pot. no soap. We paid $289.00 per night for the worst accommodations . After complaining for 3 nights, the management transferred us to a very nice room for 1 night . The hotel management knew that the original room WAS NOT a first class room and could not accommodate 2 people, yet they charged top dollar for the worst accommodations. I certainly would not recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location. 2min walk from canal (hop on hop off boats) & 2min walk to bus stop (hop on hop off bus) making it super easy to get around. Close to bars, restaurants, cafes (cafe del flore 1min walk). Room was small but you have to expect this in all of Paris. Room was clean and tidy. Bed was very comfortable and bathroom decent size with bath/shower/vanity and toilet in one.Staff were friendly and helpful particularly Mohammed. He was very accomodating and friendly. Nothing was ever too much trouble. Prebook a shuttle from the airport or take a taxi to the hotel. Both a reasonably priced. Breaky was delicious (continental basket of french croissants/pastries with juice, tea or coffee around 13euro) you can also purchase a hot breaky (a tiny bit more). It can be brought up to your room or eaten in the courtyard. Safe in room for your passports etc. Powerpoint in main room. No power point in bathroom annoying for us females but there is a supplied hair dryer fitted to the wall. Its a minor con but the shower head needs adjusting or replacing. Whilst the hot/cold water pressure is perfect the shower head lets it down. An easy fix for a more enjoyable shower experience. Id definately stay here again. Great hotel.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stay here frequently -its a lovely hotel with a very friendly staff. There is a nice cafe next door, lots of restaurants around -the location is great. I have tried a fair number of the hotels in the neighbourhood and this one is by the best!
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is charming, comfortable and has a warm and welcoming staff. Located in the heart of St Germain des Pres (one block away from noisy Boulevard St Germain), with a fabulous location. One block from Laduree and it's great pastries, 2 blocks from Cafe de Flores and 3 blocks from Cafe Deux Magots. The hotel is decorated in beautiful wallpapers with coordinating draperies, antique furniture and extremely comfortable beds. bedrooms are larger than most parisian miniscule rooms. rooms have small refrigerators (with water) and glasses, safes, and free wifi, plus closets with a full length mirror and double-glazed windows keep even the street side rooms quiet at night. Many packages include a wonderful continental breakfast in the courtyard or the blue & white porcelain breakfast room. Baskets of a variety of mini pastries (croissants, pain au chocolate, hard rolls and more), plus your choice of a hot beverage and orange juice. If you arrive prior to check-in time, they will store your luggage in the closet while you stroll around Paris. Larger rooms with marble shower and bathtub are particularly lovely. Atmosphere, atmosphere, atmosphere, coupled with a warm and friendly staff make this property more desirable than many hotels at a higher price.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed in numerous hotels in Paris and this was by far the worst experience. When I arrived, there was no one at the desk. I turned around and noticed a man sitting at the computer opposite from the desk. He eventually greeted me and looked at me wondering. I said I would like to check in at which point he finally got up and went to the desk. In the morning, I went downstairs expecting a nice breakfast. When I arrived, there was practically nothing out. Ten minutes later a woman showed up to serve some other people food. She took about 6-7 minutes to do that and never glanced at either me or the couple who had also entered the dining area. The couple got so upset that they went to speak to the manager. I eventually had the opportunity to order. I asked for scrambled eggs. I was asked three times in the following ten minutes whether there was anything else I wanted: yes, scrambled eggs. In the meantime, in reaction to the other couple's bad experience, the manager came to help out. He asked me twice whether there was anything I wanted: yes, scrambled eggs, please.
