They didn't have yogurt even though it is on the menu. When checking out, I found out that the eggs were extra, they are not included. The only food that is included is a bunch of pastry items with zero protein (cheese is not available). European hotels tend to have fantastic breakfasts, this was a disappointment both for the service and the food.Based on the photos of other reviewers here, I must have had the smallest room. That's okay, it's Paris, I'm not there to sit in my room. But it was also not as clean as it could have been. I was going to put my jeans somewhere in the bathroom and fortunately checked before doing so: the rod was dusty. Also, the bed is rather uncomfortable, I woke up with considerable pain in the morning.I do agree with the other reviewers on one point though: it is a very good location.With so many hotels in Paris, do yourself a favor and skip this one.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Since many years we love this beautiful boutique Hotel in Saint germain des pres. You feel very welcome by the manager Monsieur Michel Sario and his team. The rooms are decorated with love and no rooms is as the others .There are a lot of Galleries in the Neighbourhood and a lot of very Good restaurants and cafe s like les deux magots and cafe de flore. We look forward to our next vacation in the hotel danube. Many greetings from Germany.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So nice to be back in this lovely hotel.. definitely our favourite hotel in Paris. - Staff are charming, thoughtful and kind - I arrived on crutches and immediately was shown a choice of rooms, which M. Sario thought might be easier with my 'sticks, ie bigger bathrooms. It was undoubtedly much easier! Jerome kindly organised for a nurse to come in daily so that I was at least able to spend some time enjoying Paris....A gem of a Hotel, wonderfully placed for both the Left and Right Banks, 400 metres from the Louvre and the Musee d'Orsay....Thank you all again for your kindness. -
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a cute, cosy hotel. It's an old building, so there will be creaky floors and footsteps from above.We stayed int he same room two years ago - and there was the same problem with the shower leaking into the bedroom. I'm not sure why they haven't fixed this, as clearly the carpet has been replaced many times. However, that is the only real thing I can say that is somewhat negative. Regardless, I will stay again.Wait. One more thing. I say this all the time when I stay somewhere that uses a blanket! Yuck! No one wants to sit on or inadvertently touch a blanket. Use white duvets! I always ask for a sheet to cover the blanket (so it's covered from the top and the bottom) because to me it's the same at sitting on the coverlet that every credible source tells you not to touch. :)
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel Danube is a small, nicely appointed hotel in San Germain Des Pres. The staff is excellent and the bed and bedding 4 star. Bistros and restaurants in the vicinity are outstanding. The metro is very close, but best of all, many of the Paris high points are within walking distance. The superior room was very spacious.We were there for 11 days and loved every minute.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have also hesitated in sharing this gem publicly as I love this charming and perfectly located Hotel. During the 10 years I lived in Paris (just around the corner) I frequently had friends stay here and now consider it my home whenever I visit. The staff is extremely helpful and welcoming, the rooms are comfortably and tastefully appointed and rue Jacob is in the heart of St. Germain, a short walk from the Louvre and Musee d'Orsay. Having stayed at many hotels throughout the city these past decades, this is my favourite. I am looking forward to another visit soon!
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Don't be deterred by the quirky dips in the floor and the tired carpeting in the hallways. The rooms are large and quiet and our room was ready for our early morning arrival. After many stays in small Parisian hotels we were surprised to find a very large room and an even larger bathroom with walk in shower, separate huge tub and large sink with plenty of storage space. The staff was extremely nice and helpful from the front desk to housekeeping. Probably the best I have met in my many visits to Paris. The included continental breakfast is served in a lovely room with an adjoining patio for outside dining. I read some negative comments about the breakfast before we booked but it is exactly as advertised - Continental. Eggs are available for an additional charge. The young lady serving in the breakfast room is very nice - ask her to warm your milk for morning coffee. Location is great - easy walk to Louvre, Norte Dame and good neighborhood restaurants. If you're not familiar with Paris you may find the elevator to be very small but it's fairly typical in older hotels.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I along with another mother~Daughter stayed here recently. This was our first visit to Paris and we were very satisfied with this property . The location seemed fairly centrally located . We could walk easily to several tourists attractions or to the bus/water taxi pickup . The front desk staff was very welcoming and helpful. We had to leave the hotel very early for our flight (3:00 am), our private shuttle was late and we were concerned. The gentleman at the desk began to organize another way to the airport. Thankfully our shuttle arrived . We really appreciated his efforts. The breakfast is satisfying and it's nice that you can order some eggs or yogurt to go with the pastries , juice and coffee.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Always stay at this Boutique Hotel in Saint Germaine des Pres.We love the location and quaint French decorEasy access to Museums, restaurants, boutiques & galleries.Love Rue Jacob....a very special Parisian street!!! The Prestige rooms are of good size, very comfortable and have an updated, big bathroom that is unusual in Paris. The front desk staff, specially Jérémie, Raymond & Gregoire are very helpful, friendly and corteous.I left my bag in a taxi and Gregoire was most helpful and went out of his way to recover it. Always a great time when at this hotel in Paris!!!!
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the fourth time we visit the hotel , and every time we leave we are all so happy with the service . The location is great , no need for taxis , trains .... The 6th arrondissement has such a big variety of restaurants , bars its amazing ! The staff is very helpful , rooms are spacious and very clean ! It's such a cute boutique hotel , you can't go wrong !
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've just returned from 6 nights at this lovely hotel, which is situated in a very pleasant neighborhood that's easily accessible to many Parisian sights, cafes and restaurants. We were able to walk everywhere.I decided to book this hotel when I saw the bargain I'd be getting by making a non-refundable reservation, which included breakfast.....just 160 euros for the top-category room. All hotels give a reduction for non-refundable bookings, but here the reduction was considerably large.Our Prestige room was very spacious, and the bathroom was huge. It was a luxury to have so much space in the room, especially after having been accustomed to Parisian rooms half that size. The large bathroom was a real plus to me. I'm a very early riser, and every morning, I'd have coffee and use my IPad at the bathroom sink counter, and this enabled me to relax and have my own space without disturbing my sleeping husband. The bathroom was not only very spacious, but very modern and had both a VERY large shower and a bathtub. We only used the shower, which was incredible......lots of hot water and great water pressure. The toilet is separate, which, of course, is very convenient. The towel warmer was an added luxury. The only thing it was lacking was a magnifying mirror, though it made no difference to me since I had brought my own.The room itself was a delight....far from modern, but decorated with charming period furniture, which gave it a lot of character. There was lots of space to store our belongings, and we felt comfortable at all times. I requested to view other rooms, and I was kindly shown several rooms that were unoccupied. (I saw all room categories except for standard.) I really liked the fact that each room was unique......different colors, different furniture, different decor....each one had its own charm. Keep in mind that these are not renovated rooms with modern furniture and updated carpeting. This is an old hotel that has maintained its original charm. Like the Prestige rooms, the Superior rooms are quite large, but the bathrooms are average size. Prestige rooms facing the street are larger than those facing the courtyard, but for those of you who like to sleep with the windows open and need absolute silence, I suggest requesting a courtyard room. My personal preference is a room with a street view, even if it means hearing some street traffic in the morning. (When the windows are closed, you don't hear anything.)The breakfast room was a gem, and we truly enjoyed having our first meal in such lovely surroundings. We were entitled to a continental breakfast, which could be supplemented (additional cost) with items such as eggs in any form. The gentleman who served us was very kind and pleasant, and we looked forward to seeing him every morning.At this point, I would like to thank the wonderful staff for the amazing surprise that I received on my birthday.......a beautiful bouquet of about 4 dozen pink roses. The flowers were (and probably still are) absolutely gorgeous !!!
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located a couple of streets up from the Boulevard St Germain and close to a few metro stations on the useful lines 4, 10 and 12. So you can easily get to where you want in Central Paris. Line 4 takes you directly from Gare du Nord main railway station (Eurostar) to the St Germain metro which is about a six minute walk away. Our rooms were comfortable and quite large for Paris, although the decor was rather quirky. Beds comfortable. And free wifi. We didn't have the 13 euros continental breakfast in the hotel as the family wanted to experience the cafe culture of Paris. Some of the restaurants nearby are slightly pricey, in terms of both food and drinks. Beers around 10-12 Euros for 500ml. A couple of nights we walked down to the Odeon area where a number of restaurants/bars do happy hours (see my other reviews) with beers and cocktails at 6 Euros. The excellent Musee d'Orsay is about 10 minutes walk. The Eiffel Tour is about 30. Not much contact with the hotel staff as we were out and about most of the time but they were approachable and helpful. As a general point, almost everyone we met in Paris was very friendly, with people stopping us in the street to ask if we needed directions. And we managed to cope with a mixture of English (widely spoken) and schoolboy French.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you like the predictability of large hotel chains, Hotel du Danube is not for you. This place is full of quirks but ultimately very charming. This was my second visit and I spent two nights there. The location is amazing and rue de Jacob is particularly nice. The rooms are smallish but tastefully decorated with some period furniture. The breakfast is excellent (but you have to walk through a courtyard to get there and you have to pay 1.80 euros extra if you want an egg). The staff is friendly. An added bonus is that you can use the hotel wifi from the equally quirky and charming bistrot next door.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose the Danube based on Trip Advisor reviews which talked about generous room size ( for Paris). I booked on their website because that was advised, and I got what they advertised as a discounted March rate including free breakfast. When I received confirmation, the room size was quoted as being 12m square. Alarmed, I wrote an email immediately requesting an upgrade to a larger room. Response was vague indicating hotel was full. When we checked in, we were shown to a 5th floor garret room off the elevator. It was straight out of the 1950's! Decent sized bathroom, but very tired. During the 4 nights we were there, our key didn't work at least 10 times. Staff mostly accommodating with one exception ( man who initially checked us in). Hotel staff admitted on check out day that we had received one of poorest rooms in hotel, and that had we asked, for a little more money we could have had a nicer room. He said posted room rates were never charged as such. I felt very duped, and said so. There are nice aspects to the hotel, but it has plenty of competition and in no way deserves the gushing accolades of so many of the reviews it receives.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have just returned from spending a week at the Hotel du Danube with a childhood friend who had always wanted to visit Paris. I had stayed here before, but some years had passed since the last time. The hotel has the perfect location, being located just off Blvd. St. Germain, directly across the river from the Louvre, and between the Musee d'Orsay and Notre Dame. The rooms are some of the largest that I have experienced among the variety of three-star hotels that I have stayed in. The room rates are normally at the high end of what I am comfortable paying. Going in the off season, and being willing to pre-pay, I was able to get an attractive discount. I always choose a superior street-side room. The rooms are well soundproofed, beautifully decorated, and extremely comfortable. There is a large well-lit closet, an in-room safe, facilities to make coffee and tea, and a mini-fridge. The toiletries are replenished daily. The continental breakfast can be served in the breakfast room, or brought to your room. The quality of the breakfast items is first-rate. The front desk staff is well-informed, friendly and polite. They helped me locate a pharmacy when my friend became ill. They arranged for a taxi to take us to the airport, which we took care of the night before we left. We paid our bill then, so early the next morning we could just get up and go. The neighborhood is a lively one, with restaurants, cafes, grocery stores, and shopping close at hand. I honestly cannot thing of a single negative. I can recommend this hotel without hesitation. I hope to return sometime soon. Merci beaucoup et a la prochaine fois!
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent the weekend in Paris arriving on the Eurostar from London. The hotel was very easy to locate from Saint Germain des Pres station which is on line 4 from Gare du Nord.Upon check in we were thrilled to receive an upgrade to a Prestige room. A wonderful surprise and very appreciated.The room was spacious, very clean and quiet. The bathroom was huge and the shower great. To top it all off, the bed and pillows we so comfortable it was hard to drag ourselves out of bed each day to go explore Paris. I miss that bed now we are back home!Breakfast was lovely. Fresh juice, pastries, rolls and condiments with a nice filter coffee.Thank you to all the staff who looked after us during our stay.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my second stay and again I was so happy to be there. Central location within walking distance of almost everything. Nice people working there, a surprising good price too (booking.com was fully booked so we went directly to the hotelsite)The room is not too big but had a window on the inner court, so: peaceful and open windows at night. Perfect bed, good wifi and nice bathroom. The bath needed maybe some repair because the bath stop didn't work properly but that was the ONLY remark. And for who loves them : fresh, wonderful flowerbouquets in the entrance and corridors.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been to Paris on many occasions. And whilst I have had nice times, my main gripe has been about the hotels. You can pay a lot for a room which turns out to be small and boxy. You couldn't even swing a cat in many of them but you pay top Euro.So, on my last trip I was pleasantly surprised by Hotel du Danube. The property is in very good shape, the room we stayed in was a very good size, clean, and charming with a spacious ensuite bathroom with separate shower and toilet. Wifi, tea/coffee making facilities, tv come with the room.There is an option to have breakfast delivered to your room at no extra cost.Check in/ check out was quick, easy, and the staff very helpful. Very pleasant stay, made even sweeter by the unexpected upgrade!
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ...and what a wonderful surprise: a 5 day stay in Paris with an exceptionally good weather for this time of year, combining business and leisure at an overall affordable price. The hotel was selected with the following criteria : no more than 150 euros /day including breakfast, "strategic" location (my wife is a Shopper with capital S...) near boutiques, but close enough to the Louvre and to Musee d'Orsay which is my absolute favorite.So this small elegant and cozy hotel that I picked, was what I really needed: no big morning buffet but an absolute basic continental breakfast served by a really nice gentleman, no luxury lounge but exactly the size to wait for a taxi or read a newspaper, quiet rooms not big but with enough space to walk around, with a super comfortable bed, nice and clean bathroom and just a short walk away from food and drinks as well as super chic boutiques for people with medium plus incomes. All the above, plus a wonderful relaxed walk in the Jardin des Tuileries was the best recipe for 5 relaxed days "a Paris" .
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our fifth or sixth visit to the Hotel du Danube. This is a small hotel on Rue Jacob in St Germain de Pres (6th arr). GREAT location--just minutes by foot from the Seine, great galleries, major museums, gardens, shopping and other sights. AND, so near many fine neighborhood bistros. I want to especially mention that we arrived on an early flight from the US. When we got to the hotel around 9a.m. the front desk staff said they would have a room made up quickly since prior guests had just left. We have never had they happen before anywhere and were so pleased. We also got a room upgrade. How nice! Staying at the Hotel Danube is like visiting a familiar, good friend.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited this hotel on business. Was pleasantly surprised. Very clean....big rooms....very comfortable beds....we had two singles...friendly & very helpful staff from the reception to the breakfast room....also reasonably priced.Already booked for your return trip in November!
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first trip to Paris and Hotel Danube for a week with a group of girl friends, Mary said this is where she always stays, and when I return to Paris I will stay here again. You cannot top the location and reasonable prices. Rue Jacob is about 2-3 short blocks to the Seine river by the Louvre and the hotel is on the quiet end of St. Germaine des Pres. A short walk gets you to the hustle and bustle, the Metro subway trains, the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter, Luxembourg Gardens, and more. Small grocery stores are nearby for an evening bottle of wine with cheese in the room or patio area. The staff (Romain & Jerome especially but also Michel, Gregory, Thomas and the breakfast staff too) goes out of their way to be accommodating, but unobtrusive. They helped us re-do plans, map out locations, get quick affordable transportation, communicate a correction on a follow up trip to Bayeux - above and beyond. The breakfast service was great with this boutique hotel's charming, relaxed feel. Note it is an old building remodeled with some uneven floors and circular stairs, but beautifully decorated, and amazingly quiet even facing the street as the double sets of windows surprisingly blocked noise better than most newer hotels. I loved it, will return again, and highly recommend Hotel Danube. Paris was so much more affordable than I was expecting - pleasantly surprised!
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our second stay at Hotel Danube (this time for 11 nights), and when we return to Paris we will stay here again. The staff (Romain, Michel, and Jerome) goes out of their way to be accommodating, but unobtrusive. If you need them, they will go to the nth to help you out. The breakfast is perfect, and saves time and money. You cannot top the location. Rue Jacob is Paris immortalized. But the hotel is on the quiet end of St. Germaine des Pres. A short walk gets you to the hustle and bustle. It is a short walk to the Louvre and Musee d'Orsay. From Danube we walked to Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter, Luxembourg Gardens, and more. This is a Paris hotel that makes you feel like you are truly living in the city. We love it and recommend highly and without any reservation.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel Danube is located on one of my favourite streets of Paris, in Saint Germain and just a short stroll to Laduree. The hotel staff were very accommodating and went out of their way to make our short stay in Paris for my family and I comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful. We had a lovely room with the most comfortable beds. Will definitely stay again.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well, this is a little "find". Located on Rue Jacob in St. Germain, it is perfectly located for just wandering. Great access to lots of shops and restaurants. This is a very old hotel, but our room was just lovely....it actually had 3 floor to ceiling French doors....one located in the bathroom which had obviously been completely redone. The people who work there are extremely friendly and helpful. Would stay there again in a heartbeat!
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for three nights attending a course in University of Paris. Hotel was arranged by the course organizer so I had no idea what this hotel is prior to the stay. It's a three star hotel, yes it's small but it's very good in terms of location, service, breakfast and room cleaniness.Its close to river seine and its about 10 minutes walk to Louvre. Metro is 5 minutes walk away.My room was on the top floor, it's spacious and clean. The most surprising thing is the bathroom which is very very spacious with separate large tub and shower.Breakfast was served in a small breakfast room, its continental breakfast and I really enjoyed the simple but fresh Parisian breakfast.I used to stay in large and branded chained hotels and this hotel had really impressed me.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best boutique hotel in Paris!!! We just spent 9 days in Paris and loved it.1.Location in Rue Jacob in Saint Germain des Pres....truly Parisian ambiance, perfect location for art & antiques lovers!!! Close to everything. Metro is close by and taxis are available just in the corner. Walking is easy all around St Germain and 6th arrondisement. We even went to the 7th and Orsay, L'Orangerie and the Louvre . Also great walk to Notre Dame.2. Great rooms well designed, renovated and decorated but with a real French flavor.The hotel has WiFi and Flat screen TV in rooms but has kept a real old world classy ambiance3. Prestige rooms have the best renovated bathrooms !!! Large with tubs, enclosed shower with invisible glass doors, large sink, warming towel rack, separate WC . All separated from your room by doors...one from room to bathroom area ; another for WC; another from WC to rest of bathroom. Important if someone is sleeping and the other person is in bathroom.4.Front desk staff is the best!!! Jerome, Jeremy and Romain are friendly, helpful with a great attitude and have great suggestion.Speak English well. They call for reservations if needed in restaurants and can find out if certain museums are open or whatever you need. 5. TV has CNN, BBC, and other European channels on top of their regular French channels. In Spanish I suggested they offer TVE 1 rather than TVE 24 Hrs....that offers only news and no programming.... BORING!!!!..TVE 1 has both news and programming. We have watched it all over Europe so we know its available. 6. Breakfast is in lovely room by the central patio. Well served and ample offerings at 13 Eur. Well priced for Paris. The bistro next door charges 10 Eur for a Crème or Café au Lait with a piece of bread(baguette) and butter.7. Great area for restaurants, bistros and Brasseries. The Epicerie around the corner in Rue St Peres if fabulous!!! Great to buy water BUT there is so much more....fruits, already made food & from baguettes to sweets. Great for informal lunch at the courtyard of the hotel.All around a GREAT experience!!
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second time we are staying at the hotel ! The location is the best ! The room is wonderful ! Staff is very helpful ! Quiet rooms and close to great cafes and restaurants ! What more can one ask for ? Reasonable prices as well given the great location !
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, friendly and caring staff.Everything you want to see is walking distance.the people are very welcoming.Dont be fazed by the small elevator at first..Wifi works great.I will certainly stay there next time, too.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The joy of getting home is what it feels like - we've been coming here twice yearly, and it's always lovely to arrive after a long journey. Everyone is delightful, charming and very accomodating. I've said it before but it really is the perfect place to stay..always clean, and of course a brilliant location.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed in several hotels in Saint Germain de Pres and currently The Danube is my preferred hotel. After two stays in two different rooms both facing the street, I see no reason to stay elsewhere. It is posted as a 3 Star but France or Paris have a different classification or standard than The States, a Best Western in Dayton Ohio would be a 3 Star - in France that Best Western would be a Two Star - I have decided to find the best 3 Star hotels in Paris and stay in their best rooms - it will always be cheaper than that extra star and you would hardly be in shabby surroundings. Hotel Danube situated between The Seine and Boulevard St Germain in one of the most charming quarters in Paris, easy to walk to musee' D'Orsay, Lourve, Rodin. Notre Dame a ten minute walk, centrally located, Hotel Danube , lovely boutique hotel.I recommend and I have stayed in hundreds getting close to thousands of hotels and this one was a fine choice for me. I shall return a' tout.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good little hotel in the centre of Paris. Best bit of advice is to go elsewhere for breakfast if it is not included in your rate as room is small and choice does not relfect the delicacies of Paris at the finest of what it can offer for the cost, but this choice is enitrely up to you where you go. Ask to see the rooms first as they vary in some way and you may find one to your liking but all are generally clean and well presented. There is a certain charm to this place however and certainly you will hopefully get a good nights sleep in preparation for the next day. The staff are polite and there is lots of charm in the area to explore if you like art.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice rooms with beatiful old furniture. Clean enough but not extremly clean. Very friendly staff. The continental breakfeast was good, but the breakfeast room was to small for all the guests. Very central in Paris and good for sightseeing.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have visited this hotel many times over the years and always return. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Love the location one of the best in Paris !! You can walk to the Louvre and other famous locations. There are great restaurants, bars and if you are interested great shopping, all at your doorstep. Who could ask for anything more ..
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This ideally located hotel boasts a fine set of rooms around a small garden courtyard. Our standard room featured a variety of handsome antique furnishings in an old school setting, with a modern updated bathroom. We appreciated the separate wash closet and the small refrigerator and open shelving in the ample clothes closet. Breakfast was very pleasant in a small room off the interior yard, though it proved too full to visit at certain times of morning. In warmer seasons more space may be made available. On both days of my stay I asked for use of an iron to press a shirt I needed to wear for work. Brief efforts on Day 1 yielded a friendly shrug (no iron could be found) but a promise to call up when the house iron could be located. Day 2 yielded the same response, something of a surprise when they understood that I had asked the day previously and truly needed it. I covered up with a sweater. No harm done, but I would have appreciated more generous effort with a hotel of this kind.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely little boutique hotel in an ideal position (it's walking distance to almost any must-see in Paris and 5' walk from the metro station St Germain de Pre). My room was on the top floor with an adorable little terrace. It was clean and comfy. It had tea/coffee facilities, which is not - alas - very common on the continent. Check-in and check-out were speedy and professional. Free wifi. Breakfast is OK (served not buffet and typically French). I cannot comment on the price as I was there on business and the room was prepaid for me.
hotelName:
15    Hotel du Danube Saint Germain
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent the week at this lovely, immaculate B and B; cannot say enough about our hosts who made our trip to Paris even more wonderful. Grounds are beautiful and very safe. Great neighborhood and close to the metro. Assia and Nathalie were so friendly and helpful in every aspect of our stay. Great breakfast with wonderful conversation. A must if you are staying in Paris!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Assia and Nathalie welcome you warmly into their spacious, beautiful and wonderfully clean apartment. Breakfast focuses on conversation as well as tasty food (freshly squeezed orange juice, freshly made chocolate croissants, expresso or cappuccino, fruit with cheese). Dining becomes a social experience, a French custom (but not so common in our native New York), where questions are answered and opinions are shared. It is as though you immediately become a member of a family that is supportive and kind. For example, Paris became very hot the week we stayed (up to 100F) so Assia decided to buy each room a (very expensive) Dyson air cooler so that we would be more comfortable (most B+Bs do not currently have air conditioners, and AC is prohibited in this apartment building since it is a registered historic site). This is a truly "premium" housing experience for tourists and I believe that it is worth any extra money that it may cost. We are very glad we decided to stay with Assia and Nathalie for our week in Paris
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I enjoyed our time with Assia and Nathalie...the B&B was immaculate and comfortably set up. More room than most shoebox Paris/other big city accomodations. Breakfast was a time for sharing activities, recommendations and opinons...good conversation, freshly purchased baguettes and croissants as well as accomodations for my gluten-free diet. The location couldn't be better...fantastic neighbourhood with both charm and a buzz, and easy walking to many of the sites. Room was so quiet it was hard to believe we were in a city of millions. Thank you to our hosts for making our stay so enjoyable, and for the departure morning excellent coffee!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow what a wonderful stay we have had with Assia & Nathalie!Assia greeted us with the warmest welcome, a freshly made cup of coffee & ideas to help us plan our days & nights in Paris!Assia even booked on line tickets to see the fabulous “Atelier Des Lumieres” which is 400 of Van Gogh’s paintings accompanied by music!It is on in Paris till 31 Dec 2019 .... such a big help to score on line tickets, thanks Assia!Her restaurant suggestions were spot on & she booked those for us as well!! All within an easy walk from the B & B!The apartment is brand new, modern, spotlessly presented & very spacious!!Our favourite aspect of our stay was the warm & generous hospitality offered to us by Assia & Nathalie!Chatting over breakfast was so relaxing with freshly squeezed orange juice, delicious fruits, yoghurt, baguettes, ham, cheeses & great coffee! We loved hearing about life in Paris with the girls.... Thankyou Assia & Nathalie for sharing your home with us & making us so welcome!The most enjoyable stay we have ever had in Paris!!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having just returned from a magical three weeks in Paris, I have to say that this wonderful B&B is one of the best places I have ever stayed. Assia and Nathalie are perfect hosts and really took me under their wing, spending hours chatting to me and ensuring that I had everything I needed and wasn’t at all lonely. The apartment is beautiful, with everything you could possibly want or need provided. It is very secure and is situated in a very safe part of the city. Although several metro and bus stops are within easy walking distance, the city centre is less than half an hour’s stroll from the apartment so I tended to walk everywhere. I will be returning this summer for another lengthy stay and can’t wait to see my lovely friends again. Come and stay here; you will not be disappointed!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tucked away but in the heart of Paris is this wonderfully welcoming B&B run by Assia and Nathalie. Nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are immaculate, the breakfasts are of excellent quality but the conversation tops them all. Whilst on a very short visit to the city I was made to feel extremely welcome, breakfast is served around one large table and this gives all guests the opportunity to share previous day experiences and ideas of places to visit. Assia and Nathalie will also share their recommendations along with maps and guidebooks. The location is quiet and secure with only a 15 minute walk to the centre. There are however loads of places to visit and eat at right on the door step. The Metro is a 5 minute walk away. I can’t rate this B&B highly enough. Thank you for a wonderful visit, I hope to be back soon.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely apartments to stay with wonderful hosts.Room are modern, light, peaceful clean and fresh with all home comforts and views of the well maintained internal gardens.Healthy breakfasts served with fresh coffees and gorgeous freshly squeezed orange juice.The building is stunning and ideally located to walk everywhere in the 4th district.Can’t wait to go back
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 4 nights with the very lovely hosts Assia and Nathalie. Assia and Nathalie understand the true meaning of hospitality. Our room was just perfect and spotless.They gave us a wonderful welcome, many tips about the best local cuisine as well as many local sights to see close to their home. Breakfast was delicious every morning. Freshly prepared fruit, meat and cheeses and locally baked authentic French baguette and croissants along with freshly brewed coffee. Just perfect.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This luxury B&B is in a wonderful location, only a 5-minute walk to Metro Lines 1 and 8, and about 20 minutes walk to the Notre Dame Cathedral area. The building is very secure and quiet. The rooms are lovely and well-appointed. Breakfast is delicious. Many great restaurants close by. Beyond all that, Assia and Nathalie are amazing - I have never been taken such good care of by a host. I entered as a stranger, and I left as a friend.I highly recommend this fabulous B&B!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a wonderful B&B! Location is perfect. My sister did not know it when she booked it but this is within a minute’s walk from one of her go-to places when visiting Paris (Meert). It is close to many restaurants and sights like Place des Voges and Picasso Museum. The building has very good security. Our room was comfortable and had all the amenities we needed. The bed, sheets and pillows were all conducive to good, restful sleep. The room smelled like a spa...so relaxing and refreshing! Assia and Nathalie are wonderful hosts...complete breakfast, entertaining conversation, great recommendations for restaurants in the neighborhood and very attentive. They helped us with our heavy, heavy bags and when we had a hard time finding a ride to Montparnasse (Uber was scarce due to some closed roads for the marathon, which we did know about), Nathalie literally ran to the main street to flag down a taxi. Wow, I couldn’t believe it and was so grateful for the help. That’s excellent service! Book here if you want a secure, comfortable place to stay away from home with very attentive and generous hosts. Merci beaucoup, Assia et Nathalie. A bientot.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I spent 4 nights in Paris mid-March at this lovely B&B. Assia and Nathalie are incredibly kind and hospitable and really go out of their way to make you feel at home. The building is very lovely and feels very safe and secure. It is very close to Place de Vosges and about a 10-15 minute walk to Ile St Louis & Ile de la Cite (Notre Dame). It's also super close to two different metro lines which we used with no problems whatsoever. We stayed in the Notre Dame room which was a great size, especially for Europe, with a comfortable bed and large bathroom with a jacuzzi tub which we did take advantage of and it was lovely! The room was cleaned daily and a bottle of mineral water provided, and there was also a mini fridge. Breakfast was served in the dining room next door and included your choice of croissants, fruit, bread and cheese, ham, yogurt, etc. as well as fresh squeezed orange juice and coffee or tea, whatever you like. Assia and Nathalie provided excellent restaurant recommendations and helped make reservations, and also made sure we left each morning with tips, advice and directions for whatever we planned to do each day. Overall a wonderful stay and I would highly recommend!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spend 5 magical nights with Assia and Nathalie at their lovely home. They are the most gracious and patient hosts, nothing was too much - making us an early breakfast, dinner reservations, tourist tips, directions, even surprising us with a box of macaroons for our anniversary!The room was spacious with an extremely comfortable bed, the bathroom huge with a wonderful jacuzzi. Breakfast was fantastic with a wide variety including the best croissants, fresh fruits and yogurts, bread, cheese and ham, coffee and juice and more. The neighborhood is charming with a lot of nice places to eat. I want to especially recommend “Le petit marche” which was recommended by Assia, and turned out to be the surprise restaurant of our trip, with superior food to some Michelin star restaurants we dined on previous nights. Thank you Assia and Nathalie for the best weekend anniversary celebration!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed with Assia & Nathalie for the second time and we love it. The B&B is right in the middle of the Marais close to all the shops and some great restaurants. Assia & Nathalie are so friendly and help you with anything you need (reservation with restaurant, booking a taxi, etc.)The room is very cosy with a view to the garden, it is very quiet (for a good night sleep), the bathroom has a bigger size then in many hotel rooms in Paris and they serve the best breakfast we have ever had.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Assia and Nathalie are such great hosts. The recommendations they gave us for restaurants and places to see made our vacation even more enjoyable. Their beautiful B & B was so comfortable and the breakfasts were outstanding. We loved visiting with them and will definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Assia and Natalie helped make our long weekend in Paris really enjoyable. Their quiet, spacious and comfortable B&B is part of an attractive historic building in the Marais, close to the Metro and easy walking distance of Notre Dame, the Louvre etc. Their accommodation and breakfasts were excellent and they were exceptionally welcoming and informative. We look forward to returning in the not too distant future.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B was perfect in every way! Assia and Nathalie are amazing hosts, giving us wonderful recommendations, serving the most delicious breakfast in the morning, and giving lots of privacy. They are warm, kind, and so welcoming. The B&B itself is located in a beautiful building in the Marais, close to the best shops and restaurants. The room was impeccably clean and beautifully decorated. It had everything we could need, like tea and coffee, maps of Paris, a jacuzzi tub, and the most comfortable bed ever. We traveled around France and stayed in several different places, and this was by far our favorite accommodation. Next time we come to Paris, we'll certainly stay with Assia and Nathalie again. Thank you both for an amazing stay and for making us feel so welcome!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 days in Paris with Assia & Nathalie and we loved it. The room was comfortable and welcoming with every practical detail attended to, plus charming touches to make it unique. The bath was large with a jacuzzi and shower, and the breakfast was first rate, including fresh croissants each morning from a local bakery. The best part might be Assia herself, a knowledgable resource for restaurants and things to do in their neighborhood.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Assia & Nathalie are great hosts.lovely, Welcoming, kind,Helpfull, Thoughtfull, very patient with every request we had. The location is goog-Neighborhood is a unique developing area, The room is lovely& the breakfast is great!!!Definately enjoyable stay.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Notre Dame room at Assia and Nathalie was just lovely. Overlooks a beautiful courtyard, comfortable bed, very clean and the bathroom has an amazing HUGE tub which I fully took advantage of almost every evening to soak my weary legs after MILES AND MILES of walking the streets of Paris. Breakfast is offered every morning and Assia was very accommodating to my requests for croissants and fetched them fresh from a local bakery. A lovely way to begin each day. They really went above and beyond to ensure I was comfortable and had everything I needed not only in the apartment but for my days in Paris in general. The ONLY downside is that you are in someone's home in a condo building so you do hear others talking, walking, etc. but I am SUPER SENSITIVE to noise and energy of others. In general the building and the room is VERY quiet considering it is in the middle of the Marais district. I'm sure other guests don't notice it at all.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed in many different types of accomodation in Paris over the years and none of them live up to Assia and Nathalie’s B&B. It is spectacular. They are spectacular. We have finally found the perfect place to revisit time and time again. The room has everything you need, is spotless and in the perfect location. Both Assia and Nathalie are wonderful hosts and will bend over backwards to please. I think we have found friends forever in them ❤️❤️❤️p.s. we miss your shower!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful stay here! The host is so sweet and helpful. She helped us with directions, finding restaurants and even offered to do our stinky laundry since we had been traveling around Europe (MUCH appreciated!)Le Marais is such an amazing neighborhood and the location of this B&B is perfect. The room is quiet despite being so close to everything which is perfect.Thank you so much to Assia and Nathalie!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first time stying at a B&B and we don't regret it one bit. Staying at Assia & Nathalie was like staying with family. They were so warm and welcoming from the first day until the day we left, and we were there 9 nights. Every morning Assia was there to welcome us with the finest french bakery items, yogurt, coffee and cannot forget the amazing fresh squeezed orange juice and fruit platter. Not only did Assia make sure our stomachs were full but we had great conversations and got ideas of things to see and do. They were always willing to go the extra bit and help guests get to the metro and buy tickets or provide maps and detailed metro directions to ensure their guests were never lost and returned home safe. The B&B was in a great location and access to the metro was only a few blocks away and there were some great restaurants in the area (take Assia & Nathalie's suggestions you cannot go wrong). I would recommend Assia & Nathalie for anyone looking for a great place to stay with amazing hosts and getting a bit of the local feel of Paris in the quiet Le Marais district. Not only was our stay at Assia & Nathalie great but we have made new friends and look forward to returning to visit.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon arrival in Paris my husband contacted Assia. She immediately emailed us with instructions on location and codes to get into the building. She greeted us with warmth and kindness at the door and began our introduction for easiest access to and from the building. She was very thorough. I noticed the time and knew that we had a tour scheduled within an hour of our arrival and without hesitation Assia and Natalie realized they had to change gears and get us on our way. They pulled out the maps and began plotting our transit plan. They both knew in order for us to make the appointment they would have to walk us to the appropriate train station. Assia wrote down the street names to look for and handed us metro tickets and sent us on our way. We arrived perfectly and with 6 min to spare. We never would have made it if it wasn’t for them. The next morning we met the other couple staying at the b & b. They arrived the night before and we all had a lovely breakfast together that Assia prepared. Everyday Assia would assist us with travel plans, directions, and recommendations. She supplied us with maps, umbrellas and even did a load of laundry for us since we were on an extended trip. That was above and beyond what we could ever expect! The room was renovated and new. Clean and comfortable. Extra touches like water, coffee, slippers and toiletries were welcomed. The location was exactly what we expected and easy to navigate (especially with Assia). We would enjoy going back some day.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The B&B of Assia and Nathalie is very well located. We stayed in the Place des Vosges room. It is a very nice and quiet room.Assia and Nathalie are very charming, very warm-hearted.They are passionate hosts.It felt like staying with friends.Excellent breakfast.Assia and Nathalie do all they can, to make your stay as pleasant as possible. They provide a lot of inside information, concerning very good restaurants, subway, visits, etc.We highly recommend this place, run by two passionate ladies.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Assia and Nathalie are super hosts. This stay was my first B&B type stay. They had wonderful fruits/breads/beverages every morning. The accommodations were stylish, comfortable and immaculate ! The peak experience of my stay was the fact of having made two new friends in these twosweet hosts.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Asia and Nathalie do it right! Their B&B is an excellent location in a wonderful part of Paris. Walking distance to all the museums and everything you’d want to see. Their unit is immaculate and well decorated, yet it has a warm feel to it, as well. As for the hosts themselves: They are genuine and gracious with intimate knowledge of their neighborhood and Paris, in general. They bent over backwards to help us and point us in the right direction, not to mention they recommended restaurants that ended up being our best meals in Paris. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Assia & Nathalie are the best hosts ever! Thanks for your hospitality. Stayed in both rooms. and it was spotlessly clean.Beddings are high quality. Location is accessible to everything. grocery, restaurant, bar , shops,etc.. I love the old feel Paris too when you enter the building. Definitely my place when in Paris!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic B&B run by 2 intellectual women who offer you a warm welcome and have a list of restaurants, bistro, chocolate & pastrie makers, and places to visit in the nice Marais area to visit.Breakfast is based on a list of a wide selection of high quality food starting with baguette, croissants, complemented with cheese, ham, etc with the aim of avoiding waste. The plate with fresh cut fruit is just delicious.The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated with fantastic pictures make by the owners. For Paris standards they are big and contain a high quality bed.We aso liked the lovely and intellectual converstaions based on their large cultural knowledge.if you want to stay in Paris and especially in the Marais in a historical and quite building and you want to feel home and you like cultural and intellectual conversations stay in this fantastic B&B.We'll certainly return.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a fantastic place. The owners were the very soul of hospitality, making sure everything was perfect for our visit. There's a jacuzzi. They lay out an amazing breakfast in the morning and are always warm and friendly. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed a few nights in Paris in the lead up to a conference I was attending in another part of France (Lyon) in March. I have previously stayed in the Marais district, and love it for it's lively but village atmosphere, proximity to galleries and museums, local and authentic cafes and restaurants, and great shopping. Traveling as a single female, I wished to stay in a familiar area, but still have a unique experience.My stay with Assia and Nathalie exceeded my expectations. The Notre Dame room I stayed in was incredible - much brighter, more spacious and finer finishes than hotel rooms I was considering, an extremely comfortable bed, and glorious outlook onto a secluded courtyard. The bathroom was sparkling clean and plenty of room. The shower over the jacuzzi works well (great water pressure and temperature) - and although I didn't think I would use it, I must admit that soaking in the jacuzzi was a luxurious and relaxing treat!Assia and Nathalie were lovely guests. The layout of the apartment is such that you can come and go as you please, but still have the advantage of their local knowledge and interesting, flowing conversation when or if you'd like it. Walking off the street and through the beautiful old building to their renovated apartment, one really feels like a Parisian! Recommendations for restaurants were spot on, and Assia kindly made some phone calls for me as my French is terrible!There was a wide variety of breakfast to chose from each morning - everything was fresh and delicious (e.g., yummy organic yogurt, freshly squeezed juice, warm crossaints), and certainly the best coffee I found in France! It also provided an opportunity to chat with the other guests, Assia and Nathalie, which added a personal, homely and warm touch to my stay, without being intrusive.Assia and Nathalie have found the right balance between super comfortable accommodation and professionalism, and sincere hospitality. All in the perfect little pocket of Paris. I wish I was back there already!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to get the most satisfaction of your stay in Paris - you need to come to Parc Royal Marais! Assia and Nathalie - these are two people who treat each tourist with great trepidation and love refer to every tourist who has come to Parc Royal Marais. We received only positive emotions from communicating with Assia and Nathalie and great pleasure from staying in Parc Royal Marais. I would very much recommend these comfortable apartments to all my friends!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: How wonderful to find lodging that feels both private, and also welcoming and engaged. Assia and Nathalie's hospitality was top notch - every detail was considered, even adjusting the breakfast to accommodate vegans. The bedroom was spacious and comfortable. We stayed in the room with the whirlpool tub - which was perfect after more than 10 miles of walking in one day. The location was perfect. Non-touristy restaurants and shops nearby; walked to all the sights. We were even able to come back mid-day to take breaks before heading back out on our sightseeing. Please note that the whirlpool room does not have a separate shower - so you need to take a bath with a hand shower each night (a bit tricky and you can get a little cold). However, we didn't mind because the whirlpool was totally worth it. Just a heads up, they have another room with a shower only - if that's something you'll need. The rooms are part of an apartment suite that is located in a historic building with an amazing gate and an original fresco on the ceiling in the foyer. Gorgeous!In sum, Assia and Nathalie made us feel like we were old friends, helped us orient like a local, and made us excited to return to stay with them next time we're in Paris. Thank you!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow, where to begin? Having traveled fairly extensively, most often in b&bs, we weren’t expecting perhaps our favorite ever experience to be in a major world city. When we arrived jet-lagged and exhausted, our kind hostesses let us sleep away the morning, gently introducing us to our first day in Paris with cappachino, an amazing breakfast spread and lively conversation. Each morning our hostesses went over our itinerary in detail with us, with instructions to call them if there was ever a problem. We felt that we were staying with dear relatives. Thank you ever so much, Assia and Natalie.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was exciting to be back in Paris recently for 3 nights! We were pleased that we also had the opportunity to return to this beautiful guesthouse! This place is well deserving of the excellent reviews! The hosts, Nathalie and Assia are wonderful! We really enjoy the calm (quiet) of this B&B. It was a great return visit! Thanks for the wonderful memories!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I almost didn't write a review as I don't want this charming place to be unavailable the next time we go to Paris but Assia and Natalie deserve the best as they give the best. Their place is magnificent and their beds so comfortable, we wanted to lounge all day. Breakfast was wonderful and our hostesses were a delight.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a delight! The nicest hosts (Assia and Nathalie) made us feel very welcome and comfortable. Right in the wonderful Le Marais district in the heart of Paris they offer two appartments.The interior design is very stylish and modern but still manages to be cosy - incredible!With the host Assia you have your very own insider guide to paris and she was very helpful in every possible regard.Our Notre-Dame room had a jacuzzi!The rooms are squeaky clean without the smallest fault.We"ll be back!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Incredible B&B !! Cozey , homey, spotless and in a awesome part of Paris!!! I loved Assia and Nathalie, they are knowledgable,personable, caring ,sweet and thoughtful! Breakfast was great! Room was spacious and modern .
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A little hard to find at first but a great neighborhood with tons of restaurants and shops and close to two Metro stops and buses. Assia and Nathalie went above and beyond to ensure our stay was fantastic. They had great breakfasts and were full of friendliness and knowledge for us first time travelers to Paris on limited time. Rooms were spotless, and the best part was talking to other guests from other places staying there at the same time for breakfast. I want to return in the next few years and will be staying at Parc Royal Marais for sure! Way to go Assia and Nathalie!!!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked the Notre Dame room for a surprise trip for my girlfriend and certainly could not have hoped for a better, more welcoming or more pleasant experience! The room itself is beautiful and spacious and located in a lovely and quiet building in the Marais district and thus very central to many of Paris sights. Everything was very clean and tidy, the beds were very comfortable and the Jacuzzi in the large bathroom a luxurious and relaxing bonus you normally only find in very expensive rooms. With all that already being perfect the hosts Assia and Nathalie are really what made our stay an unforgettable experience and something that stands out from every other trip we've made so far. Both are very friendly and knowledgeable of the area and helped with suggestions for sights, restaurants and public transport to plan our visit to the wonderful city. Assia also organized a beautiful bouquet of flowers for my girlfriend. During the delicious breakfast that was freshly prepared for us every morning we had some great chats which really made our stay feel more like being with good friends. I cannot recommend the Parc Royal Marais high enough and I'll certainly would visit again anytime!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have visited Paris on many occasions but have never experienced a welcomequite like that of Assia and Nathalie to their beautiful Chambre d'Hote. The B&B experience was new to us and was much enjoyed. The location is superb with easy access to St.Paul Metro a few minutes walk away. Our room was spotlessly clean, very well appointed and extremely comfortable and our bathroom was larger than some hotel rooms that we have had in Paris in the past. Breakfast was delicious with an extensive choice, beautifully presented and a great opportunity to get to know our hosts and their other guests. As a general rule, we tend to keep to ourselves however Assia and Nathalie immediately put us at ease with their easy charm and engaging conversation.This was made all the more enjoyable discussing the previous day's events with our fellow Australian guests. Recommendations for everything are on offer and no request is too much trouble. We can not recommend Parc Royal Marais highly enough and would be delighted to return. Karl & Patrick.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As wonderful as their lovely B&B is, Assia and Nathalie are easily the star of the show! Both are wonderful, friendly, engaging and eager to help.Staying at the Parc Royal Marais is like staying with old friends - as long as your friends have impeccable taste, allows you to stay in their best room, provides you with delicious food in the morning (we're still dreaming about those croissants), and provides you with all the right suggestions about where to go and what to do...on second thought, I'm not sure if I have any friends like that (I can only wish).The Notre Dame room that we stayed in was lovely and the bed was very comfortable - all the amenities were appreciated and the decor was extremely tasteful.From a pure nit-picking perspective - air conditioning is not a standard feature in Paris so we left the windows open and the Parisian mosquitoes feasted on me. Assia was kind enough to lend us the use of a fan and I should have just used that and closed the windows.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfectly positioned in the Marais, warm welcome from our hosts, newly renovated comfortable rooms, beautiful breakfast and lots of helpful tips for places to eat and visit. If you like staying in B&B accomodation it would be hard to beat this in Paris. Exactly as advertised. Would definitely stay here again . Thanks Assia!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very good and clean rooms with everything tyou need . located in the center of the Marrais . surrounded by beautiful small streets and gardens. excel ant breakfast ( love that orange juice) .but the best thing about this place is the hospitality if Asia and Natalie . they really made us feel at home and helped us all the time . for example , we had a flight back at night they gave us the room for the day and did not want to take any money for that !! cant wait to go back !!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived a little early in Paris and were warmly welcomed by our Hostess. Our accommodation was ideally located in the Marais district close to restaurants, shopping, galleries and museums. Our room was beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean and our bed very comfortable. Breakfast with Assia and Nathalie was fresh, varied and delicious. Our hosts answered questions about our plans for the day and then we set off to enjoy our second last day in Paris. A number of restaurants were recommended and proved to be very enjoyable. We left on our way home glad to have found a home away from home and two new friends in the Marais. Geraldine and Colin
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I had an absolutely perfect week! Parc Royal Marais is in a fantastic location--great shopping and restaurants, easy access to public transportation and very close to many top tourist stops. Better yet--we cannot say enough about our hosts Assia and Nathalie. They went above and beyond assisting us daily with mapping out our exploration of the city, providing tips for restaurants (and reservations if needed) and places of interest. We started each day with a delicious breakfast, which would not have been as enjoyable without the engaging conversation with Assia and Nathalie. We have been raving about them since we returned and cannot wait to return!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you arrive at the Parc Royal Marais you feel welcomed. Assia and Nathalie take care of you and serve an excellent breakfast accompanied by interesting conversation and a good laugh. The appartment and the property are luxurious and quiet, but still in a Central location in Paris. A lot of the tourist attractions are within a walking distance.We have been in Paris a number of times, but never had an experience that cam compare to the Parc Royal Marais
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed recently for 2 nights and Assia and Nathalie could not have been more accommodating. The room was spotless and our every need was catered for. Breakfast was very fresh and beautifully presented. We invited Assia and Nathalie to sit with us at breakfast and their knowledge of Paris, local restaurants and tourist sites was very helpful. We had a lot of fun with the girls especially with Nathalie correcting my poor French as we covered many varied topics. If you want service, hospitality and the care factor you can't go wrong with Parc Royal Marais. Go to their website for further information.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Asia and Nathalie thank you for all your precious effort while we are staying in yor hotel.it was really over our expectaions esspecially the breakfast and the bathtub.we always remember your hospitality.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the pleasure of staying with Assia and Nathalie in the Place de Vosges room for our three nights in Paris and could not have been happier with our decision! If you are not satisfied with some of the hotel options available in the Marais (as we were when we were looking for accommodations), Parc Royal Marais is the perfect solution. You have all the benefits of an apartment (larger, better value) with all the benefits of a hotel (a concierge, breakfasts, room cleaning, etc) and for us, it was the best decision. The Marais is a fabulous neighborhood and between our feet and the subway, we were able to get all over the city quite easily.The room was exactly as pictured, which in our experience is rare, and we were very happy and comfortable. We were welcomed upon our arrival by Assia who explained various aspects of the room, the neighborhood and helped us narrow down a few options for lunch. If you prefer a shower over tub, the Place de Vosges room has a beautiful bathroom with a large rain shower head. High end bath gel, lotion and shampoo is provided together with luxurious towels (nothing worse than rough, thin towels - not the case here!) In the room, there is a little area with tea and bottled water (which was replenished daily, although the Paris tap water is very good quality), an empty mini fridge to keep leftovers or snacks and two closets. Assia and Nathalie anticipate your needs and are extremely lovely hosts. One day we returned with a bottle of beautiful French wine we purchased on a tour and the next day a bottle opener was left to open it without us even having to ask! Each morning we enjoyed breakfast and lovely conversation. Assia is fluent in English and Nathalie is much better with understanding and speaking in English than she gives herself credit for ;-)Some notes: (1) if you book directly you receive a lower price than available through third party websites (highly recommended to book directly); (2) the breakfasts are OUTSTANDING and something we looked forward to each day. You are offered many choices and we picked baguette, French cheeses, pane au chocolat and a gorgeous fruit plate and the quality was as fantastic as it was delicious. In fact the espresso and cappuccino, bread and cheese was some of the best we tasted in Paris; (3) if you are a light sleeper you will be very happy with the quiet rooms. While Paris is a big, loud, beautiful city - the location of Parc Royal Marais is such that you would not even know because it is very peaceful and serene.Overall, this is a wonderful property with wonderful owners and I encourage anyone looking for an alternative to a traditional hotel to seek out this fabulous little spot!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this lovely apartment for a few days on our return trip to Paris, but I wish we'd stayed here first! Assia and Nathalie were kind and gracious and helpful in planning our short time in Paris to make the most out of it. The room itself is of a high standard, with lovely modern luxurious finishes--seriously, most amazing jacuzzi bathtub--and a good combination of comfortable and classy. The room overlooked the courtyard, which served as a nice break of green space in the city. We liked the ease and security of entering with a keypad, as well. We would absolutely stay again!
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This bed and breakfast is by far the best we have stayed in in Europe. Both Assia and Nathalie couldn't be more welcoming or hospitable. I arrived with flu and just wanted to sleep. They so kindly even offered to bring me some soup. The breakfasts are prepared with care and nothing is too much trouble. As I said don't look any further. This is the BEST
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We can't believe that there could be a better bed & breakfast in Paris. The accommodation in Parc Royal Marais is in a great location and is stylish and tastefully decorated. Assia & Nathalie are charming hosts. They prepare a sumptuous breakfast including a fresh fruit platter together with croissants & pain de chocolat fetched daily from a local bakery. Their recommendations for local restaurants were perfect and Assia assisted with bookings for restaurants and taxis - she & Nathalie even arranged discounted tickets for us to Opera Bastille - a trip highlight. To be able to linger over breakfast chatting with Assia & Nathalie made us feel part of the neighbourhood for our 7 night stay.If you are looking for B&B accommodation, don't go past Parc Royal Marais.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I spent three weeks in France in September and stayed the first six days at the Parc Royal Marais while in Paris. We stayed in 8 bed and breakfasts in France, and the Parc Royal Marais was our favorite. The owners (Assia and Nathalie) are charming and helpful. They recommended sites to visit, showed us which buses or metros to use, prepared delicious breakfasts and even gave us a personalized tour of the Latin Quarter, where they had lived before moving to the Marais. As a retired attorney who loves culture and music, I was delighted to be in the company of a former UNESCO attorney and a classical violinist. Assia and Nathalie speak English well, and that added so much to our knowledge and our experience in Paris. We were able to discuss world events and gain insight into how the French view the world. Our room was beautiful, comfortable and overlooked a garden. It was quiet, and designed with care. Everything was new, relaxing and state of the art. Breakfast is at the time of your choosing, and Assia goes to her favorite bakery each morning to bring you delicious croissants and petite pains au chocolate. (I remember them longingly now!). Each morning, there is fresh squeezed orange juice, fresh fruit salad, cheeses, meats and the most delicious fresh ground coffee espressos and cappuccinos! You won't be disappointed in your accomdations if you choose Parc Royal Marais.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 3 nights with my mother. My mom really liked delicious breakfast, clean bedroom, and the location(Marais has lots of lovely shops, restaurants). I think it`s good choice to choose this B&B. And I will never stay these B&B ever. They are kind, sweet host.
hotelName:
16    Assia & Nathalie
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived there were four categories of upgrades available on the Hilton app for this hotel for both nights if our stay. When we weren’t upgraded, we were told the hotel was full. Breakfast selection was minimal.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The english speaking staff made our stay very convenient, they are truly first class. the hotel isn't much to look at on the outside but the inside is stunning. Every detail was thought through. The chefs in the kitchen served up some of the best food we had in our 5 day stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris. i've already mentioned it to several of my friends for future travel. Cheers!
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely little boutique hotel with fantastic service and accommodations. Would definitely stay here again. Not exactly close to the big things to see but still in a great area. Everything is just a short taxi ride or a decent walk, if you choose.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have traveled to Paris maybe 200+ nights over the years and have stayed at many Paris hotels. The Niepce is a 4-star property on a quiet street ( Rue Niepce) that is quite nice, within walking distance of most major attractions. Rooms are very nicely appointed, a a bit larger than most you’ll find In Paris. The hotel has an in- house restaurant that not only serviced hotel guests, but outside customers just looking for a nice restaurant.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is not my first time visit Paris but it’s the first I choose to stay at this kind boutique hotel. The stay at the hotel far beyond my expectations. Very helpful front desk guy guide me through the hotel and provide in-depth introduction to Paris. The room is also a big plus, nearly everything can be controlled by the iPad. Amenities provide by the hotel also at a very high grade. It’s sad that I only would be staying at Paris for a short time. I would definitely stay at this hotel next time visiting Paris.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is among the best Curio by Hilton out there - and as a loyal member at Hilton I have tried a few. We visited last august. Warm welcome where staff was amazing and helped us getting our luggage and tired kids out of the car. Beautiful room with nice bathroom. Maybe not the biggest rooms but more than adequate and very, very comfortable. Breakfast is delicious. The selection is not as you know it from big hotels with mass produce, but what they offer is of the highest quality and more than enough. The bar is über cool again with great staff. We decided to not eat at the restaurant this time since we wanted something a bit more laid back with two small kids. But my wife and I will be back for a weekend late March and are really looking forward to eating at the restaurant this time. And once again enjoy the warm hospitality of the hotel. Great work to all at the Niepce Paris.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Whilst a little out of the centre of the city, this hotel is a perfect little oasis. The overall quality is fantastic, complimented nicely by incredibly friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast selection is a little limited but what’s there is all good but the real winner is the restaurant in the evening. The food we had was utterly delicious, perfectly cooked and beautifully presented. Supplemented by a delicious wine from a cleverly put together (if slightly limited) wine list and quirky, happy waiting staff. I can not recommend it highly enough. If you’re tall, like me, prepare to be unable to stand beneath the shower, but the head is not fixed so it’s a tiny issue. And apparently the bedroom lighting is a little too ‘romantic’ for the application of delicate makeup (a mirror light is required apparently) but these are seriously the only ‘faults’ I could pick out. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend and/or revisit.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unassuming entrance in a quiet neighborhood leads to a very well appointed, very clean, very comfortable, very well run boutique hotel. General Manager Rozlaine H. has assembled an amazing staff. EVERYONE who works there is extremely hospitable and helpful. Special thanks to Maeva, Samira, Diane, and Pedro at the front desk for facilitating our array of sightseeing side trips and transportation. Likewise, much gratitude to those serving and preparing our delicious food and beverages, and to those who kept our room and common areas immaculate. Although the 52 room hotel was booked full, we rarely encountered other guest outside the bar and restaurant.
