It was as if we had this beautiful Paris home to ourselves for our eight day stay.As stated in other reviews, the neighborhood boasts many bakeries, bistros, grocery stores/pharmacies, the Pernety Metro Station, and a not to be missed Trip Advisor Certificate of Excellence winning restaurant - La Cantine Du Troquet.On our first day we walked from the hotel to the nearby Montparnasse Tower which offers stunning panoramic 56th floor views of Paris, its monuments and districts. It gave us a good idea of the "lay of the land" and reinforced our good decision of choosing the Hotel Niepce as our home base.A highly recommended property. We will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At last a good hotel in Paris. I went there as I grew tired of the traditional Hilton, Hyatts and others. This hotel was a fantastic surprise, it is clean, very well decorated and the restaurant is a little jewel of French/Japanese cuisine!I loved it so much I elected to stay there again every month.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Niepce Paris Hotel is a hidden gem in Paris. An excellent property in the heart of Paris that offers elegant rooms that are small but comfortable. The rooms are very nicely decorated in modern decor with a safe, small refrigerator, large flat panel television, robes, slippers and a tablet to use in the room. The bathrooms are clean and the showers are efficient though there is not a bathtub. The staff is very friendly and professional adding to the elegant feel of the hotel. They check you in and out very quickly and are very knowledgeable. The breakfast buffet is small but the food is high quality. The eggs are fresh as is the various breads.The highlight to the hotel is the location. Tucked away in a quiet area but close enough to many services. Right outside the doors, across the street is a large and convenient supermarket. A few feet more and your on a quaint little street with shops and restaurants. The subway station is also a 2 minute walk and will whisk you away to any part of the city. Overall, a wonderful, clean hotel in a quiet little area that has easy access to services. Great service, pleasant rooms, good breakfast and terrific value!
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed the hotel ok, but wasn’t sold on the location. Booked two standard queen rooms, mine was TINY and my dad’s was much larger, which we found odd. After getting out of bed, I’d leap over my suitcases each morning to get to the shower. Comfy bed. Small bathroom, but very clean. No matter how I adjusted the thermostat (could be done via the box on the wall or the iPad on the nightstand), the temperature in the room would not change—and it was VERY WARM. I woke up in the middle of the night on several occasions dripping in sweat and had to change clothes. Kinda gross, right? Attached restaurant has a limited menu at dinner time.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Never again! I was expecting a hotel style facilities, but ended up with a day-bed type arrangement with the feeling that I have been checked in and out every time I entered the hotel. Only two chair in the lobby. It felt like a jail.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was amazing beautiful property in great location the rooms are beautiful... definitely a best kept secret on a side street close to restaurants... close to train station restaurant has a limited menu for bar and dinner but breakfast is amazing and drink menu also.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful boutique hotel located in nice community in the 14th arrondissement situated feet from the Pernety métro station. Beautiful rooms, excellent food, attentive and friendly service! A great choice when visiting the city of lights.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time at the Niepce since I usually stay at the Hiltons in the 8th district. Staff very friendly and helpful. Good ambience and decour. Quit and relaxed neighbourhood if you avoid Gare Mountparnasse. Got a very generous upgrade. Look forward to return.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing staff! The location was great. The bed was so comfortable. But above all the staff was so courteous and really attentive. You will not regret staying here. It was so close to the train which is super convenient.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My gf and I came on our first trip to Paris and it was INCREDIBLE. Really a great spot with tons of amenities. It feels like TRUE luxury without a luxury price tag. The staff was amazing. And you must try the restaurant and bar!
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our very first stay at this hotel, the rooms are beautiful, the staff was absolutley amazing; engaging and very knowledgeable and so friendly and helpful. We had a couple of minor issues that were resolved right away.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff makes this hotel. They’re friendly, attentive and helpful. If you enjoy strolling through beautiful streets of Paris then the hotel is walking distance to all the sights. The neighborhood of shops and restaurants is lovely and the metro stop is nice and close. I’m so happy we picked this hotel and I look forward to returning.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon arrival at the hotel we were checked in by Pedro who was so friendly, welcoming and helpful. Our room was lovely, with tasteful decor and plenty of space. The buffet breakfast was tasty & laid out very elegantly. There was not a huge selection, however, it was certainly sufficient. There was a problem with our shower which was promptly fixed.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were fortunate to stay at the Niepce for 3 nights. The staff couldnt do enough for us and our rooms - lucky enough to stay in the Duplex suite were beautiful and spacious. Spread over two levels there were seperate living areas and a large bathroom. The Niepce location is fabulous, away from the hustle and bustle of Paris. We enjoyed staying amongst the locals. The district Monterpasse has soul. Lots of great cafes, bars and restraunts all in walking distance. The station is 50m walk from the hotel and you are in centre of Paris in 15 mins and Moulin Rouge in 20mins. Thoroughly recommend for those who want to live like a local.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Staff Made this trip to Paris very Memorable. As this hotel is Close to Metro. It was easy to access all sites throughout the city. The Restaurant in the hotel was fantastic. Between Breakfast and Dinner options. The food was Delicious. As someone in the group had a gluten allergy. The staff made sure all food was prepared for that restrictions. They went out of their way to explain the menu options. Again Service Was Wonderful.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this hotel, very quite, good restaurant, extremely helpful and nice service by employees. Just renovated hotel and not expensive, great value for money. Walking around is a pleasure, easy to reach underground.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is brand new, hence everything is sparkling clean and newly designed. The location is fine, in a non touristy neighborhood, safe and lots of restaurants and shops around. If you are in Paris for the sightseeing you will have to take subway or taxis, but it is very easy to do so. My room was beautifully decorated and quiet, but very small despite not being the most basic one. The bathroom is great and the bed comfortable. Staff at reception are very friendly and professional, and they went out of their way to help me with a couple of things. The only thing that I would improve is breakfast. The buffet is way too basic for the price. You do not have to pay for the eggs as it said in a previous review, but there is little choice, particularly if you are not into sugary stuff. Overall, though, a very nice friendly hotel.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t say enough about how friendly and accommodating each and every member of the staff was at this hotel! They went out of their way constantly to make our trip so special. My wife and I visited Paris for our honeymoon and this hotel was the perfect location for us to stay. The location is excellent and the area is quaint. We felt so welcome because of the staff and the fabulous condition of the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a stress free trip to Paris! Thank you so much to everyone at the hotel for making our honeymoon so special, we will hope to visit sometime soon again! A million thank you‘s!!!
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The straff was really helpful and kind, especially a Franch man who worked at the nightshift. The room was great, frech. The breakfast was not so good, just a little bread and cheese, juice and coffe. Not glutenfree bred and no lactosfree milk. And you had to pay for the eggs.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I recently made our first trip to Paris and choose the property—not knowing Paris— based on the fact it is a Hilton property, was fairly new and seemed to be centrally locates. The hotel met or exceeded every expectation. The staff is worthy of 6 stars as they truely understand the meaning of superior customer service. We were a bit concerned about traveling to a country where we did not speak the language, the Staff we very fluent in English and did many things for us to help bridge any communication gaps while we were there. The property is magnificent. I am a stickler for cleanliness and this hotel is spotless and beautifully decorated and appointed. The room layout was a bit different but we were in Europe. The restaurant we wonderful as well! All in all we found it to be five star property!
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at the Niepce on two occasions for business. I have found the staff to be very pleasant, professional and efficient. Always a smile as if they actually enjoy working there! The rooms are somewhat small by US standards, but the design and comfort level more than make up for it. The beds are very comfortable and the AC more than adequate for the room. I ate at the restaurant for breakfast and dinner and was never disappointed. The food was excellent (except for the undercooked bacon ; )). The bar is OK, but perhaps they could do a little something there to make it more of a mingling spot. Seems a surprisingly underutilized spot. I will definitely stay here again and would recommend to other travellers.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at the Hilton Niepce,The rooms and lobby were modern but really classy as well.We would recommend you to have lunch or dinner at the restaurant it was delicious!The only thing we thought was a little odd was the location, you would expect a hotel with this kind of luxury to be more located at the city centre.But overall was or stay great!
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was certainly a good find for us. My wife and i spent four nights here and had a very pleasant stay. The staff was very accommodating and extremely pleasant. They had no problems helping an English speaking old guy by making phone calls and making arrangements for activities. If you are looking for the "hustle and bustle" of Paris this is not the hotel for you. It is in a very nice neighborhood south of the Seine close to Montparnasse rail station, we did walk to the Eiffel tower from there but it was a hike. One evening we just walked around the neighborhood and enjoyed a much more real feeling of what Paris is vs. the areas North of the Seine closer to the Champs-Elysees. Lastly...while i am used to European hotels having small rooms this could have been the smallest room i have ever been in. If one of us was sitting at the table/counter and the other want to get to the other side of the room the only way that was possible was to crawl across the bed.Rick
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just came back from a two week trip from France and stayed at this hotel twice. This is an unexpected little gem. Near the metro station, lots of little stores in the area including bakery, grocery store, pharmacies and small restaurants. The staff is extremely nice and helpful, specially the front office ladies. Special thanks to Diane who patiently answered all our questions, helped make reservations at restaurants and in general was always there extremely pleasant. The rooms are a bit tight in Europe but the cleanliness overall was amazing. They get extra points for having shower caps, which most places seem to not provide anymore. If we go back to Paris, we will stay here again!
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel opened three months ago - and really still smells new. That was exciting. I usually don't stay in Montparnasse - but since I had to leave towards the south the next day, I chose this hotel (and becauce I collect HiltonHonors points). I got a parking space right in front of the hotel - thanks to the summer holidays and a national holiday. Everyone left Paris - except for the tourists. You have to climb down some stairs to get to the front desk - which is the only not comfortable thing at that place. A nice smelling elevator gets you to the room - I was helped with my luggage - very friendly. The room was ok big - no real space for my suitcase - but enough room to unpack, if you needed to. Nice features like lightswitches for every light directly next to your bed, crisp linen, cosy bed, big bathroom - cool design and international TV channels. I came back from a stroll through Montparnasse (I have been to Paris a lot - but forgot how nice this Quartier is) - and had a good night sleep. I did not have breakfast at the hotel - so cannot say anything about the food there. But the style and the staff would make me go back.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a travel professional for 30 years, I found this lovely boutique property to be a "hidden gem". The hotel staff was welcoming, friendly and accommodating. My room was clean and comfortable. This hotel is not in the middle of the action, but it's close enough. There is the Pernety metro stop a stone's throw away and the area is filled with lovely patisseries and sidewalk cafes. There's a supermarket right across from the hotel for your convenience and several pharmacies. Once you buy your metro ticket at Pernety then you can enjoy Paris and it was lovely to retreat to the hotel in the evenings as it's in a quiet residential area. The only issue I had with the hotel was the a/c not feeling cold enough but other than that, I give this hotel 5 stars and the next time i am in Paris I will be staying there.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is not in the heart of Paris but it was amazing and accessible to everything you would need and want to see in Paris. The metro is around the corner. There are lots of quaint restaurants and boulangeries throughout the neighborhood.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We highly recommend! Everything was perfect from the cleanliness of the room, the location, the friendly staff and the accommodations. They made our stay very comfortable. We would definitely stay with Hilton Hotels again!
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel slightly off the beaten path, but very close to the Metro. Restaurant staff were wonderful, along with the gentleman that checked us in & gave us great directions. Rooms are gorgeous & lush!
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a clean and really lovely hotel with the best air conditioning in Paris! The staff is amazing. Breakfast pretty awful but the bar is great and Lily at the front desk made us feel very comfortable after an awful experience at a different hotel that we switched from last minute.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wish I could have stayed longer. All the staff was do sweet and helpful. They got me cabs when I needed them. Artsy style and a pretty big room compared to other French hotels. Air conditioning! Beautiful room..has the shower I want in my dream house. There is also a small grocery down the block.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although the hotel is clean and well designed for the price point, it is in a more quite part of Paris so be prepared to Uber to most places you will most likely visit as a tourist.Service stood out the most during our stay, they were very attentive to all guests. It is a smaller boutique hotel so odds are slim to get HHonors status upgrades. (We were warned of this before making our reservation)
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family recently stayed at the Niepce for 3 days. It is a very nice, clean and modern hotel located near the Pernety metro stop. If I recall correctly, Pernety is 2 stops away from the Montparnasse station, so metro connections to most Paris locations are very convenient. There is a very nice restaurant and lounge steps away from the lobby. Although we did not have dinner there, we did enjoy our breakfasts and occasional drinks in the lounge. The staff were friendly and accommodating, and we'd especially like to thank Maeve, Diane and Brice at the front desk who really helped us with recommendations and changes to our itinerary.The neighborhood near the hotel is also clean and friendly, with many restaurants, cafes and shops nearby.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hilton Niepce Paris is a new boutique hotel in Paris. It was not as centrally located as I expected, but using the train was very easy. The rooms are very clean and the staff was very helpful and sincerely nice.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best air conditioning hotel in Paris. You do not want to miss breakfast, no need to look for a local restaurant after a long day. French/Japanese fusion cooking using great ingredients. Only one block from a metro stop, straight line to the center of Paris.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: nice hotel in a great neighborhood within a 15 min walk from Montparnasse and 10 min bus from the bus shuttle to CDG. Staff was friendly, bilingual and the front desk agent actually escorted me to my room. Something that I have not experience at any other hotel. Room was small, average by European standards, but perfectly adequate and bathroom was larger than most French bathrooms. And they had A/C which was clutch in the current heatwave. Around the corner from a Metro station. Would stay here again!
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first trip to Paris, my husband's tenth. He usually stays at the Hilton property closer to center of town but with this new hotel we decided to book at Niepce. When we arrived we were greeted with a friendly staff who gave us recommendations on things to do and dining options nearby. The restaurant is pretty pricey but we found lots of good food nearby. The rooms were modern and while a little small, gave a great boutique hotel atmosphere you don't typically receive at Hilton properties. I love boutique hotels but also love the Hilton experience. The front desk staff was great in assisting us with printing out our tickets as well as helping us make reservations and plan our day. Subway is very easy to use and the Pernaty station is right around the corner. Would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Paris.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed here for 7 days in Late June. The hotel rooms, while a little small are very accommodating. The hotel is very beautiful and the staff is exceptional and very helpful. They found me a romantic restaurant for a private candle Light dinner, booked it for me prior to our arrival. They will book all tickets for all Paris attractions for you and advise you on the best time to go. They always have a smile. know your name and are glad to see you. W. S. Bennett
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff and breakfast were great! Short walk to metro station and cool cafes at night.Staff wonderful especially lucie and odile !! Thanks for your assistance!Will be back for sure! Thank you Tim KoshulWhistler
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great location for setting Paris. It is very close to the subway, walking distance to excellent restaurants, and they have a excellent staff who gave us great tips for seeing the Paris. The breakfast is excellent and the neighborhood is quiet.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is intimate with a great staff. The location is great too. The neighborhood has many great eateries and shopping. The metro is close to the hotels and it makes navigating the city a breeze. Amazing hotel with a luxury feel.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel because it was within a few minute metro ride to everyone we wanted to see within the city of Paris. The metro is literally around the corner. It is in a small neighborhood so there were cafes, bars and shops to eat, grab breakfast, etc. The hotel is brand new, super modern and lovely. The staff was amazing and we slept well. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel very friendly staff. Was very helpful and accommodating. Room smaller than I expected but not unusual for Europe. Nice clean and comfortable. Bed was very comfortable.Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Seems like an old military barack transformed into a hotel, in a quiet neighbourhood. Very nicely decorated. Half a block from metrostation. Rooms are ok, with ipad control. Breakfast is fresh in the restaurant, which seems to have been a patio which is now covered. You have to go down the stairs to get to reception, which is not always easy when you have a heavy suitcase. Kind service, even received a welcome glass of champagne. There are many small restaurants and supermarkets around. Close to Montparnasse station and cementery. Maybe a bit pricy, but so is Paris.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: New within last 2 months. Very well maintained and efficiently managed. Room small but conviently furnished and very clean. Located within walking distance of restaurants and bars. Major attractions within 3-5 miles. Staff very friendly, helpful and spoke excellent English. Especially helpful with taxi scheduling.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay here was a last minute substitution for another Hilton property but definitely no harm no foul! The hotel is is a residential section in Montparnasse but is very convenient to the Metro so getting to the sights was easy. The place seems new with all the latest amenities. Room is a bit tight maneuvering with luggage but is quite lovely.
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at this boutique Hilton hotel is wonderful. Thoughtful, attentive, and kind. The hotel’s decor is sheek. The restaurant is in a wonderful setting. It is right by the metro making getting around all of Paris very easy. The room was clean and comfortable. They helped us arrange a taxi to the airport and made our stay, beginning to end, very comfortable. Thanks so much!
hotelName:
17    Niepce Paris Hotel, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I rarely give a bad review but this hotel did not live up to expectations. Yes the rooms were small and a bit out of date, but considering that price that was to be expected. What I didn't expect is that the room was not clean. It was not clean on arrival and was not cleaned properly during our stay. Nail clippings on the bathroom floor, and hair on the shower floor (which remain there after the room was "cleaned" the following day since we didn't use the shower the first night.) There was mold under the silicon grout and not just a little either. The carpet was dirty although to be fair it could have been just old stains that are now permanent. We choose not to look to closely at the room condition since we would be there only two nights and we are not very picky about that sort of thing. The thing that bothered me the most though was that there was a nail that stuck out of the carpeted floor a good solid quarter of an inch above the carpet, right in the doorway to the bathroom. As my wife is diabetic we are very careful about foot injuries. I had to lay the shower rug folded double over it so she didn't step on it in the night. I mention this for a few reasons. First of all I find it difficult to believe that the cleaning help had never noticed it (since it clearly didn't pop up there overnight). Secondly I also found it difficult to believe that no one reported it before we got that room. Lastly when I told the gentleman at the front desk I was left with the impression that it would be immediately forgotten once we left. I say that because when I described the issue to him he didn't seem terribly interested, and after I described precisely where it was just out side the bathroom door he then asked me if it was in the room? ....it was as if he wasn't listening to me at all. He finished up by telling me someone would look at it "tomorrow" but he never wrote anything down nor logged it on to a computer. I suspect, possibly unfairly, that it is still there. My final disappointment was that our bags where stored in a hallway after we checked out of our room but before we finally left Paris at the end of the day. Most hotels would have put them in a secure area.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location - moments from the Luxembourg gardens - the Perreyve is a clean, comfortable hotel with very considerate unobtrusive staff. It’s ideal for a short break - I look forward to my next visit..
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been staying at the Perreyve Hotel for more than twenty years whenever I visit Paris, but recently there have been some changes which make it more difficult to enjoy the visit. A mechanism for closing the doors of the rooms has been installed and it is no longer possible to close the doors quietly, like a civilized person; the doors don’t close unless you slam them violently. The consequence is that during a great part of the night you cannot sleep because of the neighbours coming home and slamming their doors. Also, one of the gentlemen at the reception now has the habit of talking by phone during a great part of the night; his voice is loud and it is impossible to sleep until he decides to go to rest. Also, the windows have been sealed; it is impossible to open them if you want to let some fresh air come in. All the rest, like the location near the Luxembourg Garden, a friendly and efficient staff, a good breakfast etc., are just fine. What a pity!
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful location;close to everything and for what's not nearby public transportation is right there. Lovely breakfast, and the hosts were so accommodating, warm and gracious. Be prepared for extremely small rooms, but location is everything!
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located next to the Luxembourg Gardens on a quiet street in a great neighborhood, Hotel Perreyve has a very welcoming staff who are eager to please. The breakfast that they serve is generous (the bread and croissants are great) but if you want to eat outside, there are plenty of good choices within a couple of blocks. They also serve wine and snacks which are a good value. Although the rooms are on the small side, they are nicely decorated and extremely clean.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, at the heart of everything, close to transportation but you may not even need it, everything is a walking distance, EVERYTHING. Rooms are clean, staff is friendly, breakfast is nice. Great stay!
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The concierge welcomed us with a lovely smile and help with every question! Our room and especially the bathroom were spotless, The latter is in contrast to the majority of commercial bathrooms in Europe. In the morning we were treated to a warm welcome in the bistro and a full breakfast including a large cup of coffee and several delicious french pastries and a generous baguette. The only surprise was not finding an English station such as CNN on TV.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed our stay here. Close to Luxembourg Garden, museums, metro and other sights. Comfortable, clean hotel and accommodating management. Quiet street and felt very safe here even at night. Price was good and recommend including breakfast with your room. Not too many places nearby for early morning coffee.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I first stayed at this hotel when I was a Graduate Student at the Sorbonne (1973-74)and was working at an office on rue Soufflot. It was a very convenient walk from the hotel across the Luxembourg Gardens to the office near the Pantheon. Over the years, whenever I returned to Paris as a teacher and then tourist, I chose to stay at Hotel Perreyve. They greatly remodeled the bathrooms in order to provide the basic amenities that an American would require, shower, sink, toilet. I was very impressed during my most recent stay, June 2018, at these upgrades. The rooms are simple, not the Sheraton or the Hilton, but they are clean and provide a TV, phone, desk and comfortable beds. The breakfast bar provides an excellent choice of items including cereals, yogurt, breads, cheese, fruit juice with a choice of tea, coffee and hot chocolate. The price for the room plus breakfast is extremely reasonable considering Paris and the location, near the Luxembourg Gardens and the Latin Quarter cannot be beat. I can recommend this hotel without reservation--although you need to make your reservation in advance because this quiet little hotel is getting to be known more now. Bon sejour! April who was in Paris.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are returning guest of the hotel, and have always enjoyed our stays here. The staff are extremely helpful and pleasant, and the location, a few steps from the Jardins de Luxembourg, is perfect. We would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at this hotel to attend the tennis every year since 2003. It is an ideal location for city travel and for walking. The close proximity of the Luxembourg Gardens is a great asset.We enjoy seeing the hotel staff and we regard them as our friends!
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is nicely located a block away from Luxembourg Gardens and well situated for a number of bus and metro options. While I normally book a single room, I had booked a good price for a double in this case, with breakfast included. I only ended up using the breakfast on two of my four days, but it was nice to start the day with a pot of coffee and steamed milk and a few pastries without having to go searching for a cafe and patisserie first thing.My initial room was a rather large double, but I unfortunately found it felt a bit dark and airless for me - as the locked window overlooked an interior wall/small air shaft. Madame at the front desk was wonderfully helpful and patient with my request about whether a change would be possible, and the next day found me moved up to the 4th floor in a technically smaller twin - but with a street view, and an airy light blue wall color - which I enjoyed for the rest of my stay.After being in a London townhouse hotel without a lift earlier in my trip, it was nice that the Perreyve had a small but swift elevator when I was hauling my luggage, or just felt too tired to take the stairs at the end of a day of touring the city.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a Lovely single room with double bed on the fourth floor with balcony looking over a charming street in the st. Germain the pres. clean and adorable room, updated bath with a tub and shower with wonderful water pressure. I was charmed by the decorations and authentic building, beautiful wood staircase with stain glass windows. Kind and professional and helpful staff, especially Kamil Das, who valiantly tried to help me locate my phone lost on a Uber ride.The location is right around the corner from the Luxembourg gardens. This is the neighborhood I would live in for peace and quiet, yet close to the action!
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not very happy with my experience at Perreyve hotel, very small rooms,bad smelling in the room,even the towels were smelling , dirty bathroom. I found hair on my pillow,disgusting! We didn’t even wanted to try breakfast. Very disappointed,don’t recommend.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the 4th time I’ve stayed at this hotel. I keep coming back because I know I will be comfortable, safe, in a wonderful location that’s not full of tourists and always well looked after by friendly and super helpful staff.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were so uncomfortable in this hotel, that we decided to book a new hotel (Marriott) and leave intermediately . Hotel is very dark, cold and humid, rooms are extremely small and poorly equipped. The pictures shows a much nicer hotel that it really is.Poor hotel at best
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Of the many bargain hotels I've visited in Paris, this is my favorite.The staff so helpful and considerate (not typical for Paris in my experience), the rooms were clean and standard European in size, the bathroom was beautifully updated but the balcony was amazing. A corner unit with a wrap-around balcony was so appreciated and well exceeded my expectations. I'll be staying here my next trip to Paris!
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location not far from the Luxembourg Gardens. Very quiet location.We took my daughters (6 and 8) and since very few places in Paris can accommodate families at a reasonable price, I was lucky to find this hotel. It was priced as a family room, but we had two completely separate rooms across the hall from one another.One room had two twin beds pushed together and the other was a full size bed. I ended staying with my daughters as I didn't feel right having them across the hall, but that was fine.Shower pressure was amazing. Cute little bakery on the corner that we went to almost every day. Metro station is close by and the front desk is super helpful. Wifi worked well!Would definitely recommend this property and the price is right!
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked single budget room which turned out to be twin so more space. Immaculately clean. Fab power shower. Hotel location excellent; small, quiet street in St Germain (6th district) just 100 metres from magnificent Luxembourg Gardens & many cafes. Best of all were the helpful, friendly desk staff: Laurent & Tambi. Would stay here again for its cost, location & lovely staff.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very basic, but still in a charming way. I stayed in the single bed room which was small but cute. The channels are all in french which was a bit frustrating, especielly when I was not able to stream anything because of a poor wifi that disconnect itself every other minute. The walls are thin and you hear other doors slamming pretty loud out in the hallway. The bathroom though was really nice and clean!The hotel serves a basic, but good, breakfast för 10€/day. The staff were in general nice and helpful. But the location is what make this place worth the visit - right next to the wonderful Luxemburg park and to a lot of other nice places in Paris! Tip! I asked for a room high up and got a private balcony on the 5th floor, which was a really nice bonus :)
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were brought here by friends to spend a night before a train to Brittany.Location: two block from Luxembourg Gardens, close to restaurants and cafes on a quiet street.Hotel: typical Parisian with a street facing breakfast room/lounge and rooms distributed over 3+ floor with lift access.Room: our room was no. 01 on the ground floor. It was small, furnished with a double bed, wardrobe, small desk, AC and a large wet room with wc and shower. Decoration was modern and minimalist. Cleaning standards ok although some of the mosaic tiling was moulded. Soap and shower gel is provided.Sleep quality: very good considering ground level and proximity to reception.Customer service: efficient.Breakfast: €10 per person for juice, tea/coffee, pastries and cereal. No cooked /savoury options availableOverall: at €120 for a double what you pay is for the location.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly small hotel in a great location - quiet but central and easy walking to the museums, shops etc. Nice cafes and restaurants in the neighbourhood. Elevator to top floor (6th) is small and room was also very small, but good modern bathroom and fast wifi.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a small hotel. I've stayed in this hotel twice. I had a single bedroom with no breakfast. The room is quite small even for a petite woman like me. You can move around much in the bathroom. It's really a standard room with LCD tv, a table, and a chairOn another trip, I had a double room (a bit more space)There's a coffee shop near the hotel. I think it's called rose bakery. It's quite pricey but tasty.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Accomodation (room 11 upstairs) is a SMALL 1 double bed single room with clean small modern bathroom A small lift will take luggage to 1st floor ,but no room for people so need to take stairs to Room. Location next to Luxemborg Gardens, and some Cafes nearby.not too bad for a few days to see Paris sights.,
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent choice largely because of the location. It’s nearly at the gates of the Luxembourg Gardens, and yet the neighborhood is extremely quiet. Other advantages include a number of metro lines close to the hotel, and proximity to the upscale clothing shopping area northeast of Bonne Marché, around Rue du Four and Rue du Dragon. On Sunday mornings, it’s a 5 minute walk to the Marché Bio—in our humble opinion, the very best street food market in Paris. A feast for the eyes and stomach!Otherwise, the hotel is rather minimalist. Rooms are fine, but small; service impersonal. The breakfast is not worth the price, esp. with so many great cafés nearby. Bread and Roses, kitty-corner to the hotel, is really fantastic. Our bed was great, though, and the room was very quiet, so we have no complaints. I definitely plan to stay here again next time I’m in Paris.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel through Accor personally on the phone and after reading reviews requested a room on the top floor in the corner. I was quoted a price and paid also adding that it was our 40th wedding anniversary. We we arrived we were given a room on the first floor that was not much bigger than a shoe box. When I went to complain I was told that was what you paid for the higher rooms were much more expensive. No matter how much I tried to tell her that's what we were quoted and showed our booking confirmation she would not budge. I sent an email to Accor to complain and got an email back to say they would be in touch within 48hrs still waiting........ Apart from this this is nothing close to the hotel except the gardens and not much variety for eating. Would definitely recommend somewhere else.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We paid $170 euros/night in May 2016 and were forced to cut the week-long trip short by 3 nights due to unprecedented climate-change induced rains that flooded the Seine, closed museums and cemeteries, and made tourism almost impossible (up-ended umbrellas, wet boots, etc.). This was beyond the control of the hotel staff, who were persistently gracious and helpful. I only wish we could have gotten a refund for the three unused nights!
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms may be small, but Paris is immense - and just outside your door at Hotel Perreyve. Just around the block you can pick up a baguette or pastry from some of the finest-rated Parisian bakeries, then you can make your way to the Jardin de Lux, which is just down the road. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and quiet, and the surrounding neighborhood feels safe in the evening. The staff is friendly and can communicate well in English. They were able to accommodate our needs both in terms of comfort and in terms of computing equipment (electronic adapters, etc.). They were kind and patient. For the price, I think that this hotel is hard to beat in Paris.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We paid A$630 for 4 nights booked through Hotels.com. We arrived from CDG airport by taking one of the frequent trains and changing to Metro line 4 at Saint-Michel for Saint-Placide. Gare du Nord is the alternative station to change to the Metro. There are some stairs involved in both options, I believe. There is a small walk from the Metro to the hotel and it is probably best to work out your left and right turns ahead of time.Staff were always friendly, polite and spoke good English. There was a lift. The entry and breakfast area was pleasant but we did not breakfast in when there were so many interesting options within a short walk. The hotel is in a pleasant and quiet back street just a short walk from Rue de Rennes in the 6th, which is a charming part of Paris to stay. There are many pleasant places to eat and drink nearby.Our room was clean and pleasant but very small. I have been told that this is what one must expect in Paris but it was very small. Having said that, because of the oddly shaped room there was space for our bags and storage space with a safe. There was a little table and chair. The lighting in the bedroom was poor, but good in the bathroom. There was no coffee making or fridge. The bathroom was modern, clean and tiny. There was free WiFi.There are no cheap options in Paris.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for my birthday and it was delightful! It has an excellent location, with the Luxembourg Gardens literally on your doorstep. The hotel is located on a quiet street, but close to restaurants and shops. All of the Paris attractions are easily accessible via walking, or for longer distances there are Metro stations nearby. The rooms are quaint and charming with a lovely balcony and are of excellent value for Paris. The staff are friendly and and the breakfast was delicious with a choice of tea, coffee, juice, cereal, crossaints and bread rolls. I would definately come back to this hotel!
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel for my girlfriends 21st and was delighted with it.It took me a long time to pick this hotel and is was a great choice. In a great quiet location inces away from the Jardin du luxembourg which is beautiful. Had great evenings sitting with the locals on the grass. The hotel is within walking distance to all of the landmarks, (if active and enjoy walking).We even walked to the arc de triomphe which took around 30 minutes but was lovely walking through paris.The staff are lovely and polite and the breakfast was perfect, with tea, coffee, cereal, crossiants and toast. Couldnt complain atall. And was served a beautiful little dining room.The room was great had a balcony with a view of the city roof tops. Was very nice to sit outside in the morning and nights. It was extremelly quiet of an evening as well.Overall I would highly reccomend this hotel.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for a week. The hotel was chosen because of its excellent location (Luxembourg garden, walking distance to many other attractions, close to RER and Metro lines) and the price was relatively good. When we have checked it, the things became even better :) Very friendly personnel, let us check in early at the morning since we had an early flight to Paris, gave us a room on the top floor with a balcony and a nice view on the neighborhood.There was enough place in the room for all our belongings, no any complains, good bathroom. The breakfast was fresh and great, all you need to start an intensive day.What was very surprising, a fantastic restaurant just on the corner: Jo, Cuisine bistrot. Highly highly recommended!
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was in a fabulous location, close to Luxembourg gardens and in walking distance to lots of cafes. There is also a laundromat close by. The room was very small and the bathroom was tiny, but we used the hotel as a place to sleep so all we needed was a comfortable bed and a clean room which is exactly what it was. We had an issue with the wifi and weren't able to get wifi for 24 hours which was very inconvenient. We advised the Madame on duty but apparently it was due to the rain! However when the duty staff changed the gentleman on duty was very helpful and we were soon reconnected.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is an inexpensive choice in a great neighborhood near Luxembourg Gardens.The rooms are small although they have some larger ones. The staff is friendly and extremely helpful. It is a residential area near good buses and metros. Plenty of restaurants and shops. Very quiet. My wife and I have stayed there many times and always come back.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights for my husbands 30th birthday. I have to say the room did not look like what I saw online! Tiny room so small the bathroom door didn't open all the way from hitting the bed. Very outdated decor, looked classic online but actually it's just old. Had a window that didn't open, it was locked shut. Went down stairs to get a key to open it, was met by a grumpy old man who didn't know where it was and didn't want to help me. The only decent thing about this hotel was that it is in walking distance to the Latin Quarter which was great! Don't start here!
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 7 nights on a 4th floor room (there is an elevator) at this quiet, charming, and well-managed hotel of excellent value and located on a quiet street so very close to the stunningly beautiful Jardin du Luxembourg. The breakfasts, which we booked and paid for in advance on the hotel's own website (a great value), were delicious, and the staff were professionally attentive and friendly. The room is small, but we had good water pressure in the shower, which is often lacking in inexpensive European hotels. An added plus is that just across the street at 5, rue de Fleurus is Restaurant Jo, a bistro serving yummy traditional French cuisine, with owner Geoffroy very welcoming to those of us who speak hardly any French.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our 5 night stay at Hotel Perreyve. Our room was on the 1st floor, I requested a corner room on booking but didn't get it. One thing to know - this is a small, quaint hotel. Do not expect space or modern facilities. The room was tiny and I bruised my elbows every time I used the shower ;) But thats all part of the charm! We thought it was lovely. The bed was very comfortable, we had great sleeps. Virtually no noise from the street, a very quiet neighbourhood (we stayed from a Sunday to a Friday) . Only noise was from within the hotel, we could hear all the noise/conversations from reception so would book a room on a higher level next time. I wore earplugs so it wasn't too bad. Only other negatives was our room was right above the entrance which glowed lights all night but the curtains did a good job at blocking out most of the light. The service was polite and helpful, the owner called and booked us lunch at a nearby restaurant as our french wasn't good enough. By far, the highlight was the location. There are plenty of cafes and patisseries nearby for breakfast lunch and dinner plus several food markets. The Luxembourg Gardens are virtually on your doorstep - a beautiful oasis, perfect for people watching! We walked everywhere, 15mins to the metro, 10-15mins to Notre Dame. You actually feel like a local Parisian in this neighbourhood, surrounded by locals walking to work/uni/school, away from the noisy touristy spots yet still so close to all you need.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was great! Still in Paris but it took a metro ride to get to the main attractions, say a ten min walk to the metro & depending where you were going a ten or fifteen minute trip including changing lines if need be. It was very clean, the rooms were dated but in great condition, the staff were excellent, it had all the facilities: wifi, bathroom, A/C which in a Paris summer is a must, and there was a lift which is very handy with luggage. The bed was very comfortable and it had BBC & CNN channels for the news. Reception staff were great and answered all questions and gave directions. They also recommended local eateries. I went to Georgette which was medium to high priced, but fantastic food! It could be quite expensive if you have a three course meal but one course and tap water was perfect for me. It was Bastille day weekend and lots of places close on a Monday but when leaving I saw a couple of cute bakeries. A quiet area with limited eateries but all quality. It had a cute breakfast area down stairs and a small sitting area with magazines, cozy and tastefully done. It was not far from Luxemberg Gardens which I walked through to get there, a lovely spot for a walk, beautiful grounds. A great spot!
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights in April 2015. The hotel is small, but nicely situated close to the Luxembourg Gardens and not too far from nice restaurants, bars and 2 Metro stations. The rooms was very small, similar to the elevator, which barely fits 2 people. The bathroom was also very small. But the rooms and bathroom was clean, and as we were only using the hotel for sleeping, it was fine.The person at reception went out of his way to help me connect to WiFi.In all, the hotel is small, but more than adequate for a couple of nights.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great location for our first trip to Paris and as stated close to the subway. We found the room very small and hard with 2 cases of luggage. The breakfast was very basic and we only had it once - lot of other choice nearby anyway. Other than that the room was quiet and tidy. A little annoying was the fact that the hand held shower had no way of hanging up to use it without hands.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was terrific, very close to one of the city's many 'Velib' bike rental points. We requested two separate beds, but the hotel apparently never received it. The bed was comfortable nevertheless. Breakfast was also alright, but there were only sweet items available, which made it a very sugary breakfast. Apart from the average amenities, the rooms were very clean and personnel was very friendly and accommodating. Would certainly recommend for a short stay; for a longer stay I would recommend a more upscale hotel.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights recently. It was our first trip to Paris and we loved the location. It is quiet and the Luxenbourg Gardens are lovely. It was very central and we did walk to most attractions. It is a walk but it is easy flat walking. The staff were multilingual and very helpful. It is a boutique hotel with a quirky edge. The room was small but ok and vey clean. The lift is extremely small though, but not a problem just interesting.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a typically Parisien hotel. The rooms are comfortable but basic. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotels strongest point is its location its situated beside the beautiful Jardin du Luxembourg with easy access to the RER and metro lines. There are plenty of good restaurants and bars within walking distance. We were lucky to have room 64 on the top floor which gave us a great view over the roof tops. We would both definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel in advance and understood the no-refund policy.. I did the same with my air tickets not intending for anything to change. My mother and I were meant to have this trip to Paris but we had a death in the family. Still keeping intentions to make this trip, we were hoping to push the dates to after the funeral and keep the same hotel in place. Unfortunately the hotel would not even change the dates despite the fact that Expedia agreed to. It's a shame that there is such a lack of compassion, I will be booking another hotel in the end.. and the $300+ that I'm losing will just be pocketed by the hotel.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't have a lot to compare this to as it was my first trip to Paris. It was a solo trip as my wife was travelling for business so I was looking for a decent location, close to the RER trains and the Metro. This place really filled the bill. I arrived early in the morning after an overnight flight and couldn't check in yet, but they happily let me store my bag for a few hours and I went in search of a coffee. The hotel is in a great spot just a block off of the Luxembourg gardens and there are many cafes in the area. It's a more residential neighbourhood which I liked because it was nice and quiet at night. Room was small but clean and I was only there to sleep at night. I found the hotel to be a great home base for exploration, the staff to be friendly and helpful (and very tolerant of my barely understandable French). I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have had only good experiences at this hotel! The helpful, friendly staff, the location, and the hotel in general all meet my requirements and aesthetic sensibilities. When I'm in my pleasant, clean room with updated bathrooms, with the tall, long windows open, I feel like I am actually living in Paris. Yes, the rooms are small, but it is Paris after all. The area is quiet, safe, and near my beloved Jardin Luxembourg. I love walking in this area, and the Metro and RER are in close proximity. You can easily find a patisserie and other places to eat near near the hotel, but I very much enjoy taking my petit dejeuner at the hotel. It is during this time that I often meet other travelers who are in Paris for the same reason as myself - to simply enjoy!
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times on business and have always had a good experience. The pluses for the hotel are its location one block from the Luxembourg Gardens, being on a quiet street away from the tourist hordes, helpful staff most of whom speak excellent English and are free of the snotty attitude still present in some other hotels, free WiFi, and a stylish lounge and breakfast area. The interior of the hotel has been refurbished since I was last there a couple of years ago although this seems to have pushed the prices up a bit. The negatives are the usual in Paris: the small size of the rooms and bathroom, and lack of air conditioning, which is not a problem except in high summer. The hotel has an elevator, the breakfast (optional) is quite good, especially the coffee, and the bathrooms are modern and clean. You can take the RER train to the Luxembourg station, which is on the other side of the Gardens, within walking distance unless you have heavy luggage. There are also Metro stations nearby. Notre Dame is about a 20 minute walk and there are many good restaurants within fifteen minutes walk (and also many bad ones since Paris is now well stocked with mediocre food). In case you are interested, there's an AutoLib' station outside the hotel.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with a friend for 3 nights in September. The hotel was lovely, very 'french' décor and we found it to be very quiet. Very good air con system in the room which was easy to use. Nice comfy bed. Good enough sized, clean bathroom and the shower was very good. Included a hairdryer and some soap/ bodywash. Full length mirror in the room. The metro is a close walk which can get you to all the landmarks within half hour or less, with lots of lovely deli places along the way to stop for fresh croissants or baguettes. It is also close to the RER B station, about a 10 minute walk, which goes directly to the airport. The hotel is literally next to the Luxembourg gardens which is absolutely beautiful and lovely to relax in in the evening. There is also a couple of nice restaurants/ cocktail bars just around the corner which are very reasonably priced. I couldn't connect to the wifi and therefore on our last day we had to check out online and we had to ask the receptionist to do it for us. It was far longer than I anticipated and she had to re-input all our passport and personal details which took some time. She was very nice about it and very helpful so I would like to say a big thank you for that. We were also allowed to leave our cases on our last day after check out for a few hours without any hassle. Definitely would recommend a stay in this hotel. The only thing missing is a kettle!
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hotel primarily for its location, near the Luxembourg Gardens, Place St Sulpice and Montparnasse. I was pleased with my room, which had windows in two walls, making it light and airy. It always felt good to come back to.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed 5 nights at the Perreyve. We stayed here 28 years ago on our honeymoon and have been back to Paris multiple times since then but have always stayed elsewhere. This trip I decided to try the Perreyve again to see how it compared to our memories. We were not disappointed. The hotel has undergone a freshening and basic renovation and retains its charm. Our room on the 1st floor (up one from ground floor) was fine. Good quality air-conditioning but also had opening windows with a "Juliet" balcony. When the weather is good it is nice to be able to open a window. I found the WiFi Internet access was very good. Strong wireless signal and fast connection. One of the best network connections I have had in a European hotel. Breakfast service was basic but adequate. The hotel's location is perfect. It is in a quiet residential area with an easy walk to multiple Metro stations, restaurants and the Luxembourg garden. The staff of the Perreyve were friendly and very helpful. Thank you for a pleasant few days in Paris.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was here on business in June, 2014. Good location, if far from metro stations, but not a memorable hotel. Very much a two-star, to judge by the small, dark room, the shabbiness, the tiny grinding elevator, the minimal breakfast, the lousy TV, and the totally disfunctional wifi. There are much better hotels on the Left Bank, for the money.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room had a window that could not be opened. Unfortunate, but something I could deal with. The main problem I had was the glass was papered over on the outside. It looked like the painters forgot to remove the masking tape and butcher paper. The effect was like staying in a prison where you could not see the outside world. Very depressing. The shower was too small and the worst part was, I think there was a mouse in the wall. I heard it scratching most of the night. The location was great, close to St-Germain Des-Pres where I prefer to stay. The neighborhood was quiet and yet close to restaurants and bars on the other side of Jardin de Luxembourg. There were also great restaurants on the hotel's side of the Jardin that were less touristy. Food everywhere was outstanding. Being close to a Metro stop was a bonus.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are relatively well-kept and the building itself is pretty nice. The location fabulous - a stone's throw from the Luxembourg gardens in the rue madame. Walking distance to St Sulpice, St Germain and so on. Highly recommended. Service and staff perfectly fine.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been to Paris for christmas Eve with my husband. The city is gorgeous during christmas but very crowded. We could not find any empty hotel thats why we choose this hotel. The rooms are very very small. But the Hotel is clean It is next to the Luxembourg Garden but far away from the city center. You can not sleep because of the noise of the elevator inside. St germain and St Buci is the best place for accomodation i think.There is a nice place for breakfast near to the Hotel.
hotelName:
18    Perreyve Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is awesome!! It's a small quiet hotel. The staff is extremely nice and their breakfast in the morning is great. One of the biggest things for me when I travel is that they have good air conditioning and this place has an amazing air system. The location is right next to the metro which takes you everywhere. loved it will come back
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been at the Hotel Comete on holiday with my daughter, end of April. We spent there five days and I must say I really liked my staying. The hotel is clean (rooms, bathroom, breakfast room...). Our room was small but cosy and comfortable: they cleaned it every day, leaving a bottle of water for every guest. In the room there was also the espresso machine Nescafè if you want to enjoy Italian coffee. The bathroom was small (but who cares? You just need the hotel for the night!) but fully equipped. No noisy people, no traffic noise, but a still and quiet place. Breakfast is great: plenty of different kinds of food and beverages, clerks of the hotel very friendly and helpful.The hotel is near the underground station which takes you everywhere in minutes but if you want to walk it's not far from centre. There is also a wide choice of restaurants nearby, as well as a supermarket.Definitely, I had a gret holiday!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed my stay here at Hotel Comete. Very very clean room. Comfortable bed. A/C worked great. Love the shower! This hotel is a bit from the “major sites” but for that exchange you get a quiet safe surrounding. UBer rides to any major site about $15-20 USD; if your traveling solo or would rather save a few Euros there is a metro spot at the end of the street. Breakfast is nice - great coffee machine. Good selection of cheeses, sliced meat, breads, scrambled eggs, bacon, croissants, neat machine for making poached eggs and fresh squeezed orange juice. Day staff was very friendly- especially Erna who was very accommodating and helpful - Thanks Erna!!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I got a great deal for this hotel via secret escapes and I cannot fault any part of it. It’s a very small boutique hotel and every member of staff was friendly and helpful. It was stylish, very clean, and the breakfast was delicious. Honestly the best scrambled eggs I think I’ve ever had - I need to know the secret!! Thank you for a wonderful stay and I’d definitely stay here again and recommend to others.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled as a family of 5. After an exhausting but highly enjoyable 3 days in Disneyland we commuted up to this boutique hotel. Check in at 2pm but our rooms were available on arrival after mid day. Fabulous reception staff who welcomed us by name as they were expecting us! 2 rooms were adjacent and although separate were on a secluded corridor with one door so when locked opened up our stay into a fantastic suite. Only 4 rooms per floor (6) so each floor had similar suites throughout. The beds were fabulous, clean linen and soft pillows and quilts. Air con, water, fridge, Nespresso machine, hairdrier (excellent), toiletries, bath in one room and shower in other. Large plasma tv in each room, free WiFi and proper single bed added for extra child. Fresh towels, water and housekeeping each day. Trouser press and iron and irojing board. Breakfast fresh and substantial. 10 min walk to tour eiffel line and course de vincennes metro at top of street (1min). Lots of restaurants, supermarkets, take aways within a few minutes. Staff very friendly with great English. Bar on site. Unfortunately we couldn't stay longer. Jam packed schedule for us from.morning until nite. Kids wanting to go home at every opportunity ie hotel comete as they loved it. All in all fabulous and I would hope to return and I am not easily pleased lol!!!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Comete for a weekend break in October. Our room was a reasonable size for a weekend break and the finish was stylish and practical. At breakfast there was a lot of choice and despite being late comers the food buffet had been replenished and was fresh. The staff were very welcoming and informative. The area surrounding the hotel has a secondary school and feels safer to walk around. Would definitely return to stay at Hotel Comete.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 3 nights to do a tourism “blitz” on Paris and, as has been noted by others, although it is not in a central district, it’s proximity to the Metro makes it an ideal, and very good value, base.My room was clean and quiet, the bathroom, with an excellent shower, was very modern and well equipped. Again as been noted by others, the staff go out of their way to be pleasant and helpful. The breakfast is extremely good and varied and the nearby streets offer a wide selection of different restaurants.A really ideal base
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been very comfortable in Comete Hotel. Very nice and tidy rooms. And the staff very helpful. My daughter and me needed a break and we could not choose better. Amazing the silence and respect to intimacy. Breakfast: seemed home made. Thanks for making us happy.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s a rare thing to find such a low-cost hotel in Paris. Such amazing and spacious rooms. Clean and tidy. Staff was super helpful and welcoming, and helped me a lot organizing a surprise for my bf. They gave us a better room, because of the occasion we had. Strongly recommending!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed three nights. Staff was courteous and helpful. The rooms on both occasions were clean, comfortable, quiet and had good bathrooms. The breakfasts were great. Most of all we took advantage of the hotel's proximity to the metro which made our Paris visit so easy! We will come back to this hotel when we return to Paris. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was really impressed with this hotel. The staff went out of their way to be helpful. The room was extremely comfortable and the breakfast was great. I highly recommend the hotel and will hopefully stay there again in the future.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is off the center of Pariss, but close enough to take Metro 1 toward La Defense and you are getting to all the Paris attractions. Also, there is a nearby term that can take you to other areas of town. The staff is very nice and helpful, especially Angelique that assist us by giving us instructions on how to get around and find the local scene. The area is very ethnic and on Saturday there is a local market.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been to Paris several times, at different hotels over the years. While we did not encounter any rudeness in our previous visit, we can’t remember a more obliging staff than those I encountered at Hotel Comete. We arrived few hours prior to check-in time and when we explained to Tamar that we needed to attend a family function, she was able to request a speedy room clean up. We were able to access to our room two hours prior to the standard check-in time. Later, Angelique took time out to explain the touristy spots that were easy access from the hotel on the metro line 1 (the metro line closest to the hotel). Beside the fabulously friendly staff, not just Tamar and Angelique, but everyone else we dealt with, the hotel has a boulangerie/patisserie a stone throw away (around 300 m away). We spend many happy mornings exploring its croissants and patisseries offerings. The super market Franprix is also conveniently close to create a pick-nick basket of your liking without breaking the bank. We also like our room, which is of decent size for two persons. Actually, we just came back from Kyoto so the room was quite large compared to what we were used to in Japan. The only minus, and this is very personal, was the daily free water bottles we received from the hotel. We would have preferred that the hotel provides a refill fountain for our water bottles and thus, decreases the amount of throw away plastic. Overall, we love this hotel.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our recent stay at the Hotel Comete. The location was was very close to the Porte de Vincennes Metro Station on Line 1 - which made getting to all the major tourist spots very easy! The staff were welcoming and friendly. We had a room for 3 people and had a good amount of space. The bathroom area was quite large with 2 sinks a nice shower. The only thing we would change about the room is that we wish there was a full-length mirror. Every day the hotel provided free bottles of water in our room, which was a nice touch!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a week in Paris and stayed at the Hotel Comete. The rooms were very nice and the breakfast was so delicious! The staff were particularly helpful and attentive. The location is good--near a Metro station. I highly recommend this hotel!!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my third stay at the Hotel Comete, and it's just as good as ever, if not better. Having stayed in many hotels over the years, I can say that this is one of my two favourites (it's a close call as to which is best) and easily the best value hotel in a major city. Why? Firstly, the staff go out of their way to make sure everything about your stay is perfect. Secondly, the rooms which, while compact, are tastefully furnished, spotlessly clean and equipped with everything you might need, including a safe. Third, the modern bathrooms with rain shower. Fourth, added bonuses such as the espresso machines in every room, free bottles of water, and fresh macaroons on the first night. Fifth, the excellent breakfast with fresh croissants, breads, beautiful scrambled eggs, cheeses, fruit, apple tart, yoghurts, and more. Sixth, the location, in a nice area, just a minute from the metro line 1 and tram lines 3. And finally, the room rates which represent amazing value for money. Superb!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent orange juice and breakfast. Yogurt, scrambled eggs, hams, cheese are really good. Bathroom shower needs better design, water splash out a lot. Very convenient to local cell phone stores and markets. 2 blocks to subway station short walking distance. Close after 11pm. 30 mins subway to Champ Elysées. It’s a direct line, no need to transfer. Daily pass €3 unlimited within Paris center. The manager and the girls are really nice. Other guys not so much. In room WiFi weak.Safe neighborhood quiet street. I would stay there again and recommend this hotel to anyone.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was clean, comfortable and the staff was friendly. Located in a quiet zone (not much touristy) but i think is safe and close to metro by walk. The room has a nespresso machine, great beds, modern bathroom, well decorated and big windows. Please try the breakfast was plenty of options and delicious!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: OK, so I booked this place for just one night and the amenities in the place were just fine. The room was clean and the service was good. The coffee machine though was complicated. I'd have really preferred a simple kettle. The macaroons on the bed was a nice touch though....Breakfast was delicious. And the coffee there was greatThe only problem I had was the neighbourhood. I had chosen this place because it was right in the middle of my trajectory in terms of where I was coming from and where I wanted to go, however I didn't realise that it was close to a public square where they chose to have a demonstration. The metro to the stations were disrupted and I took a taxi to be on the safer side. A little warning would've been nice... Apart from that really nice place to stay
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it is probably one of the coziest hotels i've stayed in. it was clean, nicely decorated. the patio was like sitting on the porch of you own home , with two line on which huge light bulbs hanging above you. the staff were great . breakfast was minimal however enough to leave you very satisfied. it is also very conveniently located close to the metro. i would recommend this hotel for couples on a budget.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great en cosy place and yet very suitable dor business and leisure alike. Interior inspiratie is the sixties. Very tastfull. Breakfast excellent. And service very correct and friendly. Relaxed place. Clean and for Paris city not too small rooms either.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my stay in Comète Hotel. I had a Warm welcome including typical French delicacies and water. The room was Clean, nicely decorated and it included a Nespress. The neighborhood is quiet but close to public transport and easily accessible from périphérique.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
