review_body: very nice hotel, great breakfast, quick arrive to city center with metro line 1 (metro station 2 min walk), decoration and design in the bathroom is very classy!the receptionist at nights not very nice... started shouting at us in French beacuse we wanted to host friends in our room...
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel had incredible rooms. Bathrooms were nicely appointed, and breakfast was great. The immediate area surrounding the hotel is a little plain, but only a few blocks away are some good restaurants and shopping. Water pressure was great, elevator was big enough, and front desk staff was very helpful!!!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Almost brand new 3 star elegant hotel in east of Paris. 300mtr. from metro. Room (Deluxe Room) very nicely decorated (but not over designed) with separate bath room anex toilet. Everything in room was rather new so that was nice. Room cleaning was accurate. Most positive thing however I found was the breakfast witch was exellent for a 3 star hotel and only 13 euro. Didn't expierence any inconvience of other guest rooms or outside stuff like noise. Personal settings possible for airco/heater, room did still smell a little like new. Nice flat screen tv with lots of HD channels. Neighbourhood rather calm (although some schools at nearby). Staff rather friendly and professional. So in my opinean a very good Hotel.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best hotel in every thing, comfortable, clean, quiet, free wifi, close to all means of public transportation and the best staff i had ever met.This will be of course my destination every time i go to paris.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brilliant hotel close to the metro line.The hotel was very clean and very relaxing.The hotel Staff are very friendly and helpful and speak good languages.Breakfast was good.Room was clean and well presented.Only bad point was there was not a good selection of wines.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a newly renovated hotel where we stayed for three nights and had a very positive experience. The room and shower were nice and clean; the staff is friendly and accommodating. We didn't eat any meals in the hotel so no comments food-wise; the neighbourhood is not anything spectacular, but the hotel location is very accessible via Metro line 1 to/from Central Paris. We will stay in this hotel again on our next visit to Paris around this time of the year and recommend it to everyone who wishes to opt for a three star hotel with a very good quality of service.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed with my family for 3 days & 2 nights. The place was lovely with very nice & accomodating staff. I loved the several choices of food during breakfast. The place is near metro train stations. I will definitely recommend to friends.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights and loved it. We were traveling with our infant son and the hotel was very accommodating. They made sure to have a baby cot set up for us and a baby chair every time we came down to breakfast. It is super close to a metro stop so it is easy to get anywhere you want to go in the city. We also really enjoyed walking around the neighborhood. I thought the room was a good size compared to other Paris hotels I've been in. The only downside I would have is that the wifi could be spotty in our room but it was free so I can't complain much!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this nice hotel online. It's well located near metro stop so it's very easy to visit the city. Staff is very friendly and helpful and the room are nice, clean and comfy. We will stay there again when we visit Paris!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great little place to stay and fairly quiet. The hotel owner sent a survey in advance to address any special requirements we had. We did request early check-in for around 9am which we didn't think would even be possible but we decided to indicate it on the survey anyway. To our surprise and delight, a room was made available for us even at such an early hour. Also, instead of housekeeping knocking on our door, they actually phoned the room! That was a pleasant difference from other hotels, and much appreciated.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice design hotel with excellent location which bring you to the city center by subway conveniently. The front desk service is very heart warming and able to provide any help for your trip in Paris. Thanks and will be coming again!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful stay at this boutique hotel. Found a really good deal online and was not disappointed. Easily accessed by the metro, fabulous breakfast and lovely staff. Rooms are small but perfectly formed, very comfy bed. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked my stay a while ago and discovered that I had made an error with the dates. The hotel was very accommodating and made the changes for me with no problems. It was really easy to get to from Gare Lyon- only three stops on the number 1 line. One of my friends complained that I was "far out"; I didn't find this at all! The connections and ease to move around Paris from here was perfect for me. The room that I had was on the third floor- everything was in good condition; very clean and seemed brand new. Free bottled water is provided and was replaced daily; along with a little mini bar fridge with soft drinks. There's a lovely coffee machine in the wardrobe to make coffee or tea- and this was refilled every day. The bathroom is a good size and I loved the shower and toiletries provided :-) In the bathroom there is a fixed hair drier- which had enough power and did not cut out every five seconds. I would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights in July, 2016. Location - Not center of the city but don't be put off by the location. It is a 3 minute walk from a metro station and the hotel is worth it. (Metro Line 1 - Port de Vincennes)Reception - very friendly...easy and uncomplicated check in and out.There is free wifi and it was a good speed. Very clean. Very nice bathroom. Great shower. Tea/coffee maker in the room. Overall, glad we stayed here and would stay again easily.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel Comete Paris is a 2 min walk to the nearest Metro line with straight connection to Louvre, Champs Elysee, Marise, Eiffel Tower and easy connection to Notre Dame, etc. The Proprietor and his staff are all lovely and very helpful. The rooms are air-conditioned, quiet and clean and the showers are hot and powerful and the beds are very comfortable and cosy. We were there with our teenage daughters and had a super stay and consider it very good value for money.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed there for 6 nights, the whole staff was very helpful and friendly,The breakfast was fresh, the room clean, and the internet speed was good too.I was surprised that the receptionist guy (his name was Rasheed) who was extremely helpful and polite, he was the hotel owner! he was serving us breakfast in the morning and cleaning our table, and he even helped us in reserving train tickets online, he was working as a regular employee to make sure his guests are served well.The metro station is less than a minute walking, there are several restaurants in the area, and hotel area is near a major park in Paris (still need a metro to reach it though)I highly recommend this place
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this Hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was immaculate and very comfortable bed. Bathroom spacious and well equipped with top of the range toiletries. Breakfast selection excellent. The Hotel is located down a quiet road and we felt very safe, it is also close to the Metro or trams. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a very pleasant stay at hotel comete .The location is perfect the metro is just infront of the hotel.The staff is very friendly and offered me tips about how to get thw most of paris,the hotel is not far from all attractions.Highly recommended!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there for 4 nights while I was travelling alone to Paris. The hotel is very close to the metro station therefore very close to everything in the city since if you are travelling to Paris you are probably going to depend a lot on the metro. The area is a very nice one, close to cafes and shops and also very safe at night. I usually got in at around 10 and nobody ever bothered me.The staff are extremely nice and helpful. The room is modern and always clean. And the breakfast was really tasty and always fresh.I would definitely stay there if I'll ever go to Paris again.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was four night, the hotel is clean, beautiful, all things is new. The people working there are good. I need to say that the hotel is near of the metro, so near of all places. The breakfast is delicious and beautiful Congratulations for all team Comète!!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Comete Paris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was so kind and helpful!! Was accidentally locked in my room and they quickly came to the rescue! Great cafe and delicious bakery right across the street. Overall, a perfect little resting place.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a low cost hotel and is situated on a very busy junction. The noise at nighttime is dreadful. Obviously you can’t blame the hotel for traffic noise, horns, sirens and scooters but you can expect a certain degree of effort to combat it. Poorly fitting single glazed windows don’t help for example. On the positive, it was reasonably clean and reasonably well maintained. Very steep stairs would be a fire officer’s nightmare.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay at the hotel was pretty bad, but in general I must say the hotel is good. Why a bad stay? well, first of all, I have been assigend to a room at the fifth floor. With no lift and a very heavy luggage, it was a real nightmare (even though I must say, the porter was so kind to help me for at least halfway. I still want to thank him).So my suggestion is that you check at which floor you are. Also stairway is so steep that it is also kind of dangerous if you have heavy luggage with you. Secondly, my room was extremely cold because the heating was off and not working. So I asked the porter again to help me on that. He did it, but it took a good 3 hours to get a decent temperature in the room. Quite bad then. In general though, rooms are nice and cozy; shared bathroom more than OK. So I guess I was unlucky.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very convenient location. Bus and underground metro nearby. Metro is exactly 10 feet away. Bus is 25 metres away. We got the corner room with a balcony like grill. A magnificent view of the streets four way crossing. Food joints nearby. No food issues as they are open at least till 10 pm to 12 midnight.This hotel itself is old but not very old and quaint architecture. Budget hotel so some space crunch. A wooden spiral staircase runs from ground to above as the only access point. The main door is digital key controlled with security cameras all over.I would have given it a five however no air conditioning as with most euro hotels. No lift. The receptionist would be and is kind to heft the suitcases up to the room. Better travel light just in case. Single French TV channel which of course was French to us.There was a radiator in the bathroom which could be used as room heater or to dry clothes. Which we did. Not to leave the windows open in the night as insects might get attracted to the room light. In such an event simply ask the receptionist to help out.No restaurant in the hotel. Keeping in mind the number of food joints around its not an issue.Definitely coming back here for the excellent location, good rooms and excellent service.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean with a spacious bathroom, the mattress was very comfortable (especially compared to other, more expensive hotels we've stayed at) and the staff was always helpful. We loved the proximity to the Metro, which takes you fast to the centre of Paris.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Seriously? To get to the room on the fifth floor I had to climb very narrow and steep stairs. Great exercise, but not what I was looking for at 10 pm with suitcases on my hands. Only to find a tiny room with a shared bathroom with all the rooms on the fifth floor. I don't believe that people are still considering this property as an option for 90 euro per night.The "lively" neighborhood means there are cars horning all through the night and "many restaurants" means greasy kebab and other joints that lack hygiene.Lesson learned: you might have to spend more than a hundred euros per night for a decent stay in Paris. If necessary.If not, better avoid this overrated destination, and travel and enjoy places where you get more for the money.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very sweet and clean and the receptionist polite and helpful. This hotel is on the outskirts of Paris, but the metro line is just a few steps away. The area of the hotel is not very pleasant and is very noisy during the day and the night.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The metro is right outside, and there are plenty of restaurants and small grocery stores nearby. The room was updated, the bathroom was clean. We had a room in the 6th floor, the views are nice but there is no elevator in this hotel, climbing the narrow spiral stairs was exhausting. The room was quiet, only heard noises from the hallway. Overall, great place, would stay again.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not that bad for our experience because we only came to the room to sleep. The hotel only has small stairs to get to the rooms and frecuently it smelled like pee. On the other hand we would recomend staff that speaks more English or Spanish. But above all the room had just the right space, it looked clean, and the staff were very helpful.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for a week. The hotel is simple, but was a very nice place to stay! The staff were really friendly with us and could speak English. - The room was small but it wasn't a problem for us. The beds were very comfortable. We had a bathroom in our room, so we didn't have to use the shared one.There's a kebab place right around the corner called "Buffet Dost" and the food there is delicious. There are also a lot of markets, bistrôts and other stores in the neighborhood. The only downside is that there isn't an elevator at the hotel and the stairs are very narrow, so if you plan to take a lot of luggage with you it might be a problem. Our room was in the 3rd floor, so it was very tiring to get to it after a very long day of walking.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was good but we were in the fifth flour and hotel doesn't have elevator and it was very harmful for us to go up. Toilet and bathroom was share. A very good point was the place. Exactly near maraichers station
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very small hotel. Stairs only, so i had to carry my huge luggage 4 levels up and substandard room with no aircon and it was quite dirty when i went in, like there was dirt on the floor and toilet paper on the floor in the toilet. Honestly i rather pay more to be in a nicer area. But its literally beside the metro so thats extremely convenient. And if you need halal food, its everywhere here!!! Also it came with very simple breakfast of croissants, bread, butter, nutella, jam, banana, cereal and juice to choose from. The 2nd night was extremely warm and having no fan was a killer. The bed was sinking in the middle and i was alone and the pillows were so flat. I could not sleep properly at all. Very disappointed stay. And there is no way to get help for the discomfort i was in. I'll be very honest here, I really would rather pay 20euros more for a hotel that is so much better. Really sorry but thats how i feel after staying in 3 different hotels.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got a good welcome as soon as we arrivedThe room are typical Paris style, small but all you needRoom 514 on 5th floor with a small stair.. aie!!The hotel is near by metro station and makes everything accessible for your visits...20min from eiffel tower or arc de triompheThe only issue we had was that the heater broke during our stay, the receptionist send us quickly a portable one to make our stay the most confortableWifi was okFor the price you pay in Paris that is a good deal, overall i would come back there if i am in Paris
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for 3 nights, in a small room with shower, on the 6th floor (no lift), and overlooking Parisian rooftops. If what you want is somewhere clean, practical (next to Metro station), cheap, with very helpful staff, then look no further! It is somewhere simple for the night while you get busy visiting Paris during the day. But if you want something fancy, then this is not the place for you.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family of two adults and a child, we tried to book a single double room, as our child didn't have to sleep in a separate bed. The website didn't allow us, however with few E-mails and a phone call the reservation was done exactly the way we wanted in less than an hour.The hotel is small in size, with no lift. Restaurant has only for tables. but on the other hand, it is very clean, staff are very friendly, they help with the bags.The room was warm and clean, WiFi connection was perfect. The breakfast has not much varieties, but it was very delicious.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a small but very nice hotel, clean, with pleasant employees!We were all day out, visiting Paris, so we didin't stay too long in the Hotel, but we still like it.Subway exit just in front, literally. Btw breakfast nice too
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was there for 5 nights with my husband.It´s a very small hotel and the stairs is narrow. So it´s not comfortable to go upstairs. But the staff was very friendly and the carried our suitcase. Very friendly.The room was small but the bed was convenient and we ha a cupboard for all our clothes. Good shower with really hot water. The hotel is very central, only a step out of the hotel and you enter the next metro station. The area is very bustling so you have a sort of restaurants and shops you need.There are loud noises outside, but when you close the windows, it is very silent in the room. Maybe in the summer it could a bit loud to sleep with open windows. But we stood there in October and all was fine.We hat some problems with our mobile phone. Our charging cable didn´t work. The hotel manger was very friendly and gave us his for a day. Very friendly hotel staff!!!
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only drawback to this hotel is no lift, which, after a long trek around Paris, is hard going. We were on the 3rd floor and all floors are accessed by an old, but beautiful, spiral staircase. Check in was smooth, offered help with bags and given a printed map of where to locate car park. The Metro station is located directly outside the front door of the hotel which is great. however after climbing the steps of the Metro to then go up 3 floors is hard work, thank god I wasn't any higher up! For the Metro i would advise you buy a "carnet" of 10 tickets for 14,40 euros instead of 1,80 euros each! Room was comfortable and shared bathroom had a great shower. Our room also had a sink and hairdryer. Area was Moroccan/Egyptian/north African community mainly, but very friendly and great little cafes, restaurants and shops. Bakery (patisserie) near car park has the most amazing goods, croissant, cakes allsorts. Portugese custard tarts (Pastel du nata) were the best. All goods cheaper than in centre of Paris. We paid 3,50 euros for pain au chocolate, pain au raisin and a Portugese custard tart. A croissant in centre Paris is a minimum of 2 euros, that was the cheapest we saw!
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family (4 members) stayed at the studio room of the hotel for 2 nights. We really enjoyed our stay thanks to the kind hotal staff. The hotel is just in front of a metro station. It is so convinient for travelling.The hotel staff kindly helped us wiith a taxi booking as we were having a trouble with another taxi company I already booked. He kindly waited for the taxi with us outside of the hotel. Thanks to him we managed to get our flight smoothly.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location with easy access to the centre of Paris. Good wifi and nice clean rooms Had a shared bathroom however was not really a problem as enough to find one not in use when needed. Easy to get too from bus station and too train station
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great fittings in the room (shower), with a good kitchenet, along with a comfortable sofa bed and double bed, owners where extremely accommodating and even let us store our bikes in the lobby. Was situated in a lovely little neighbourhood, right next to a metro station, with reasonably priced and great service in the local restaurants. Also beside a carrefour. Overall excellent stay to finish and excellent trip!
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location. Metro station Maraichers is literally on the doorstep of the hotel entrance! Neighbourhood "ok" ...we didn't explore the local area much. (Hotel is on a busy street so it's noisy if you have window open). Room was very nice - very comfortable bed and pillows. Facilities were good; nice clean sink area, hairdryer, TV, tea and coffee making facilities (with coffee and teabags!), fridge, safe, drawers and wardrobe area. Very modern decor and clean. We were on the 3rd floor which has a shared bathroom; this is also a shared toilet! I don't mind using a shared bathroom but found it a hassle to have 1 toilet on the floor. If you're someone who uses the toilet a lot in the night this is something to consider. Or when you're dying to go when you wake up but the bathroom is busy for ages! Overall I would recommend this hotel and would return. Room very modern and comfortable. The main thing to consider here is the rooms with a shared bathroom and toilet.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Six floor with no lift! The wooden spiral stairs not suitable for children and old. We stayed on the sixth floor, at first we were worried having to climb so many stairs, but when we saw the view over the roofs of other buildings we stayed put. We had our own bathroom. Clean room and bathroom. Tea and coffee facility with kettle. No milk. There is a fridge so you can buy a little carton from lidl near by. If you miss breakfast there is a nice bakery near by. Wifi ok. The hotel is near a cross road so it is noisy, but at late night it get quite.The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast consist of croissant, French dread, boiled egg, ham, fruit salad, jam, honey and Nutella. But is not replaced so you need to get there early. Nice coffee though. The best thing about the hotel is just outside one of the exit of Metro station Maraichers, on line 9, outskirts of Paris. The hotel is not right in the centre of the Paris, but with the fast Metro trains, this is not a huge problem. The problem is the hotel is not in a nice area, not the most prettiest part of Paris. Absolutely no nice restaurants in the area, we looked for one but didn't find one, the ones recommend in the area are horrible, eat in one of the restaurants on Rue Mouffetard, nearest metro Place Monge. Our train was late in the evening so the hotel let us keep our bags secure on one side. It would have cost us money if we had stored the bags at Gare du Nord. Cheaper to get few more Metro tickets to come back to collect the bags. Talking of the metro tickets buy 20 tickets for two for four days. Easy to buy with a card or Euros at the automatic machine, they are in English. At Gare du Nord don't queue with everyone on the station at the top, go down to the metro station and there are no queues.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel for 3 nights.All in all it was good.- clean Hotel and rooms / friendly Service but rarely English-comfortable bed- nice and tasty breakfast (sadly small diningroom and small choise of cheese and ham)-The WiFi in the 5th floor didn't work even after our complainment no reaction- in the shared bathroom the drain of the shower was clogged-no elevator
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you plan to visit Paris all day long and use this for the night this is a nice option. The subway is a few steps away and the room overall was ok to sleep after a long day walking. Fist time ever that I'm in a share bathroom hotel but it wasn't bad.it was clean and we didn't have to wait long for showering in the morning. The staff was helpful and after check out they allow us to keep our backs on the reception all day long
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In general, our impression from this hotel was very good. We stayed in Paris for a weekend and we would consider this hotel once again anytime. It had some pros, some cons, so I’d like to expalin it a bit more…PROS:Great location - although it takes some time to arrive to the city centre, Montmartre or Eiffel tower, the metro entrance is literally three steps from the hotel (line 9) (lines 1 & 2 are also just 5 minutes’ walk). Very nice and cozy interior - hotel is very nicely decorated, a bit smaller, but everything in place, everything clean and new. That's actually what we perceive as "typical french style", therefore we were very pleased with it.Friendly staff - although we met only one guy (at the reception and at breakfast) we absolutely cannot complain. He was polite, friendly and very helpful.Good price - Well, to be honest, it really is one of the less expensive possibilities in Paris. And for the value we got, very very nice prices.CONS: Very small interior - As I already mentioned, hotel is nicely decorated, but very very small. At least we had very small room, the corridors were also very tight and the staircase, wow, I've never seen something so small. Also the dining room was very small, but that's I guess normal in Paris (both restaurants we visited were also very small or let's say cozy)A bit cold room - I know we chose a bit strange date for visiting Paris (start of March), but even though we expected our room to be at least a bit warmer. The heating almost didn't work and therefore we had rather cold nights (but we slept well anyway =)6 floors without lift – We’re still young and had almost no luggage, but I can imagine that some older people with more luggage could have serious problems with very small staircase that leads all the way up to the 6th floor. Our room was at the 5th and it was something to get up there everytime =)A bit limited breakfast - We're actually not used to opulent breakfasts and specialties, but having to choose only between Nutella, jam and cereals is a bit limited even for us. I think it wouldn't take so much effort to get some ham, cheese or fruit/vegetable. The breakfast was very good, don't take me wrong, but it was every day the same, limited choice.----------------------So, just to sum up everything a bit. The hotel has a great location, very friendly staff and is nicely decorated. Unfortunately it is a bit smaller – small staircase, small rooms, small breakfast. With a bit of effort, I think at least the breakfast could be much better. Anyway for that price, I would surely recommend it to anyone looking for something different than standard IBIS.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family with two kids - age 7 and 9. We were able to get a family room (double bed for Mom and Dad and two cots for the kids in one room). This made the price better and it was nice to have everyone in the same place. The room was very small but that did not bother us as it was just a place to sleep. It is right on Metro Line 9 which made it easy to get everywhere. (Half an hour or so to Eiffel tower, Musee d'Orlay etc). The included breakfast was excellent - croissant baked on site, bread, corn flakes, fruit salad, nutello and butter. We were also on the 5th floor and there is no elevator so be prepared to lug your suitcases up the a winding small staircase. The internet generally worked well although sometimes you had to be patient as it went in and out.Our two concerns. 1. It was supposed to be no-smoking but our room definitely smelled like smoke as did the hallway outside our room. We left the window open all day to try and air it out. They explained it must have been the person who stayed before us. If you are allergic to smoke or it really bothers you, don't stay here. 2. They had quoted us 94 Euros a night and then when I went to pay, explained there was a tax on top of this. It wasn't a lot (about 4 Euros a night) but I explained that that was something they should have included in the email. After talking they didn't make us pay the tax. Having said that, they were extremely friendly and if we were to go back to Paris, we would stay there again.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good trip. It is a good place. Thanks. We had just a problem with noise, the windows are not very isolated but the staff were very nice and helpfull. We could come back in this place and we recommand!!
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: +newly renovated, room quite comfortable. +location is good. next to subway (maraichers), close to porte de vincennes (5m) or nation (10m walk). bus 26 from Gare du Nord stops at maraichers as well. or you can take velib rental bikes around the corner (anywhere, really).+ television with fair range of channels (many programs can be subtitled)+wifi has comfortable speed, +staff is friendly and helpful. +fair price, though this may be low season.+breakfast is fair croissant/coffee/moroccan(?) bread + jam etc.+no elevator, but exercise is good for you.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: nice and clean, perfect location , on a metro station. Very helpful staff and kindRooms were a not very big but, with all you need.There is no lift, but the staff is very helpful and if you have luggages they bring them upstairs..
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was met by Kareem who was very pleasant, and assisted me by carrying my case to the 2nd floor (thank you Kareem, I appreciated the gesture after a long journey).A few days before arriving, there was a pre-authorisation on my Debit card for the full amount, not a problem and standard practice, but, although it was immediately cancelled by the hotel, (Kareem showed me the receipt), the money was still showing on my account as a pre-authorisation and so the funds were unavailble to me to pay my bill. This may not have been anything due to the hotel, however I recommend the hotel follow up to check the process so this can be avoided in the future. I travel a lot, and this was the first time it has happened. For info, I bank with CITIBANK. I was able to arrange for an additional transfer but just in case this could happy again, be aware - check with your bank before you arrive to ensure that any pre-authorisation has been completely cancelled so that funds are available to you when you arrive in Paris. As other reviewers have mentioned, the stairs are quite narrow (spiral staircase), and I can see how those who are not quite as young and fit as they used to be may struggle to carry large luggage to upper floors. However, the staff were very happy to help so don't be shy to ask for assistance if you need it. I believe the hotel does have plans to install a lift in the future, but it may not be for a while.The hotel is quite new, and the room I stayed in was a good size for Paris, furnished and finished to a good standard and a large bathroom (bath with shower) by Paris standards. I was in a double room on my own, the bed was a good size and very comfortable. However I think the room may be a bit cramped if you are 2 people with multiple suitcases. A fridge was provided and very much appreciated, something I personally feel should be standard in all hotels. The price paid was very competitive compared to the more central hotels, and if you don't mind a short metro ride, it could save you some money. Free wifi was sufficient for my needs, emails and some minor browsing, and signal strength was fine on the 2nd floor.I did not try the breakfast, however I was invited to have a coffee when checking out, and the breakfast room is quite nice. An espresso was very welcome before departing to the airport, thank you.Locally, there is a supermarket very close (turn right as you exit the hotel, 1 minute walk), and several fast food and restaurants available, although on this occasion I did not try any of them. There are several ATM's available close by.Pros - Pleasant staff, good location, furnished and finished to a good standard, good competitive price.Cons - Traffic noise. I was in a front facing room which is overlooking a busy junction. The first night I slept well, probably helped by the long flight, however, the remaining 2 nights, I was constantly woken by noisy traffic, trucks unloading, bikes/mopeds etc. This is not the fault of the hotel of course, the windows are insulated, but if you are a light sleeper, I would recommend a room not facing the main roads if they are available. If I am able to secure a quieter room next time, I will certainly return and fully recommend you give this hotel a try.
hotelName:
20    Hotel de L'Union
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 5 nights for a small conference at the hotel. After a long international flight, I was greeted by friendly and helpful staff. Because I arrived early, my room was not ready yet, but they offered to get a room ready sooner and stored my bag while I went to a nearby restaurant for lunch. When I returned, I was able to get into my room with a king-size bed. The room was reasonably large for a Paris hotel (smaller than American hotel rooms), it included a large desk with storage drawers, a small refrigerator, a comfortable lounge chair and side table, a closet with room to hang clothes as well as shelves, a safe, and a spacious bathroom with a tub/shower and side alcove for the toilet. The bed was comfortable, soft surface but firm enough underneath. The hotel has a bar and restaurant as well as a bright breakfast room that served a buffet each morning that included warm foods like eggs and meats, as well as cold foods such as yogurt, fruit, juices, breads, and toppings. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Metro/RER station at La Defense Grand Arch. There is a shopping mall and several restaurants in the area. It is a convenient place to stay while exploring the city. I enjoyed my stay and would gladly stay here again.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 5 nights in a king balcony room that was spacious and well equipped. The overall stay was good. The location superb close to metro lines, a few 100 yards from the the Arc de Triomphe and many cafes.I am a Titanium Bonvoy member and stayed on points we did get breakfast for two each day complimentary. The exercise room was good and the staff was professional
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed staying here over the World Cup. The room was spacious and comfortable. The staff were incredibly helpful with requests I had for tickets. The service was consistently solid. Location was very central to everything. I would definitely recommend this hotel
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for four nights in business, and it was absolutely perfect. Especially nice was the excellent service I received from everyone at the hotel. The rooms are quite spacious for Paris, and well-appointed. I enjoyed the Nespresso, and especially appreciated that the man restocking the coffee station left extras of my favorite coffee pods. The hotel was quiet and location made it easy to walk to the Metro. The neighborhood also offered good shopping, a grocery store and many nice restaurants to choose from. I hope to return next time I’m in Paris!
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay at the Renaissance was only one night but I wish it was longer. The hotel is excellently located on Avenue de Wagram (right on the RER and central to so much of Paris). Most rooms overlook a quiet courtyard with a picturesque view of Haussmann rooftops. Absolutely silent and blissful for recovering from jetlag. I received a welcome email in advance of my trip and had a very smooth and pleasant check-in (thanks for the coffee and croissants!). The room was faultless and every aspect of the hotel seemed smooth and polished. Unfortunately there was a taxi shortage on the day of my departure due to the Paris airshow, but the staff made this known in advance so other arrangements could be made.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights here and were generally happy with location and cleanliness. It took about an hour to reach the hotel from the airport via taxi as it was morning rush hour. The location is excellent! Steps from the Arc de Triomphe, the Charles de Gaulle etoile station and Champs Élysées.The room was spacious and very clean. We did not use any hotel services or the restaurant.The concierge team had emailed me prior to our arrival and I booked le louvre tickets and front of the line guided tour of Eiffel Tower with them. They confirmed everything via email and I felt this was a safer option than booking via trip advisor as I was not familiar with the company on trip advisor. Upon arrival at the hotel, they handed me an envelope with the tickets and the dates printed outside the envelope. I verified we had 2 tickets for each but I should have examined each ticket thoroughly. The louvre tickets were fine but the Eiffel Tower tickets had the wrong date printed on them. They stated May but we were in June. Not even sure how they would have printed a date that was already passed?? The company blamed the concierge and the concierge blamed the tour company. After wasting over an hour getting to the tower, waiting half an hour at the meeting point, then calling the tour company, we could not get in. Their later tour was sold out as were all tours for the following 3 days! The line at the tower was thousands of people deep so we left....angry and disappointed. After discussing the error with the hotel to great extent, we were obviously refunded for the tickets and they paid for our taxi to the train station the next day. It did not take away from our extreme disappointment at wasting a day and not going up the tower.The staff were polite and professional in dealing with our anger and disappointment.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is beautiful and super close to the Arc de Triomphe. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and lobby bar had amazing drinks. There’s also a subway station a short walk down the street so it’s easy to get around to different parts of town.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was excellent. Restaraunt food was great. The pate we ordered twice!. Close to shopping, food etc. would do again. Walking distance to Arc de Triomphe. Also shopping. Excellent service. Staff speaks English and helpful
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family of four and stayed in two connecting rooms. The rooms were a decent size, and each had a small balcony with a view of Paris rooftops (see photo). The service throughout our five-day stay was outstanding, from reception/check in/check out to the breakfast buffet we were treated well. As Marriot Platinum Elite members, we were given breakfast vouchers since the hotel has no lounge. The hotel is located between two metro stops, and within walking distance to many restaurants and shops.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I recently stayed here for three nights. Getting to the hotel from CDG was very easy and the hotel proactively sent directions for rail/metro one week before our arrival. Upon check in our room wasn’t ready but they did call us once it was. Hotels often say they will but then did not follow up, so kudos to them for this. We were also given a card for a welcome drink but they did not explain that it was for beer or wine only. Our cocktails that were ordered didn’t qualify. Strange that they wouldn’t mention this. We had a larger suite that we used confirmed suite night upgraded. When I say larger this is in European terms. Overall the suite was small. The decor on the the walls was heavy wood paneling. It gave the space a dated feel. The bathroom was large with a tub shower combo. However there wasn’t a shower curtain, rather a small glass partition that didn’t do nearly enough to keep the water in the tub when showering. As such most of the towels went to mop up duty. The best part of the room by far was the balcony. It had views of both the Arc and the Eiffel Tower. It also has a small table and two chairs. The only meal we ate at the hotel was breakfast and it let something to be desired. One morning the eggs were half cooked and runny. I get this is a thing in many parts of the world, but the next day they were way over cooked and brown. The fruit juices were fresh squeezed but had separated and would not flow thru the jars they were using. The breakfast meats were also over cooked. In the future I would suggest having breakfast outside of the hotel. I would return to the hotel but would adjust my expectations.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived at the Renaissance Paris hotel just after Christmas, and of course the hotel was decorated fantastically. Seriously what else would you expect ? The Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel is of course a very cool place like most of the Renaissance line. Upon walking in, the bell staff offered assistance, and helped us to the front desk. The Staff at the front desk were of course very cool and very professional staff. The Check-in couldn't have been smoother. We received our room keys and ventured up to the room. Upon entering the room.. this is where the wheels feel off of the great experience. We walked in and we thought the room was under renovation. There were a few boards laying on the floor. I called the front desk and they said they'd send maintenance up to look into it. The Maintenance guy looks at it, and says, "you need a new room", he indicated he could clean it up, but that we should really get a better room for having to deal with this. So far we hadn't really dealt with anything. So I went down to the front desk, explained what was going on. Immediately the front desk gal says... that's no good, let's see... and she says, yes, let's upgrade you to (insert room level that I can't remember now). I get the keys, we haul our luggage to our new room... oh ya... The room faces Wagram, and in the background above the buildings.. ya, the Eiffel Tower. So much better than our back alley view from the prior room. The room was very modern, very clean and a fantastic view. Even though the room faced the busy street, the noise was minimal. The Renaissance doesn't have a club lounge like other Marriott properties, but the front desk gave us vouchers for breakfast in the restaurant. Even though we were a party of 4, we had enough vouchers for all of us. The breakfast was a buffet, and definitely one of the better breakfasts buffets I've experienced. The restaurant staff were, just like the front desk staff, professional and very good. Overall, I REALLY like the Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel, and would absolutely go back when I go back to Paris again. The Renaissance, just like all of Paris, just knows how to class things up. The location of the Renaissance is fabulous as well. Very easy to walk to most everything or nearby metro stop.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed here for business. This is a great hotel with a location that can not get any better. Literally within steps of the Arc de Triomphe, it’s minutes from Champs-Elysees.The room is also pretty good with good amenities. The ladies at the Concierge were very helpful when I tried to locate where I could purchase something very particular.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: when i arrived in the afternoon I immediately spotted that this hotel was somehow different. Really ugly and spacy on the outside, inside i sa a lot of plants and flowers which gave the hotel a nice touch. the staff at reception was super-friendly and offered refreshment water. the rooms are nice and spacious, i think godd value, the bathrooms are ok and efficient. The bed was very good. there is a coffee-machine with nespressotabs and an ok minibar.the mainbar on the groundfloor is spacious and very bright.overall a nice place to stay
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights on a quick stay in Paris with my wife and two little girls (3 & 18 months). Decided to cash in on some suite night awards and was not disappointed. Some folks are saying they are having problems redeeming them but I couldn’t have been happier with my upgrade on this stay. Upgraded to the Arc De Triomphe/Eiffel Tower view suite and, holy crap, was it awesome! Really enjoyed the terrace and the views. Plenty of room for us and the kids. I was also really impressed with the staff, especially the restaurant staff! Mary was super helpful with breakfast and also had some great recommendations for Paris and Normandy, where we were headed next. Speaking of breakfast, I thought that was great as well. I’m always hesitant when going to a nice hotel with small kids but everyone went out of their way to make them feel welcomed as well. The restaurant staff brought them a cool little kids pack with a bunch of activities and stickers - this was most greatly appreciated. Before I set off on this trip to Switzerland and France I was on the fence about my loyalty to Marriott. After my experience at this hotel I couldn’t be more impressed!
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Near ‘Place de l’Etoile’ in Paris, the hotel is modern with good services and very professional staff. It has a very good fitness area and the rooms are spacious, clean and comfortables. It is a practical modern choice; so do not expect the typical Parisian/French charming spot, as it is not. However it is well located and the price is competitive.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you walk in off the street, your first reaction is fear because the lobby looks like a Residence Inn. However, once you are inside, the rooms, service and ambiance will all brighten your day. Overall, this is a very nice hotel in spite of it being close to the Yellow Vest protests. I will return again.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment I arrived to the moment I left, the staff was fantastic. I have been staying a lot of hotels lately, and this was by far the best staff I have come across. They are a true asset to the property. The decor of the lobby now a little underwhelming; however, who is there for the hotel lobby? My room was spacious, clean, and comfortable; the pillows were perfect. I did eat at the hotel bar a couple of nights, $17 USD for a shot of Makers is outrageous; next time I will bring my own. The food was good, and the conversation with bar tenders was great. Before I settle in to work, I wanted to see part of the city, so I set out walking. The Arc is right there, and it is an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower, and down the Seine toward Notre Dame, and back to the hotel. Paris turned out to be a lot different than I expected. My great time there started and ended with the hotel staff. -- J'espère que ça se passe bien dans mon français. Merci à tous pour votre gentillesse et votre aide.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: good location But the staff are not helpful enough and thé there is no concierge to help you u with your bags to your room u you have to pick them up alone The variety of the breakfast is very limited and options are not a five star standard
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Three night stay. Very clean and modern. Everyone at the front reception is very nice - especially Zoe who welcomed us after a long day. Our room was good sized for Europe with two full/queen sized beds. Bathroom was modern and clean. Came back after touring all day to a nice surprise of macaroons and juice from Zoe! Great location to the metro which we used throughout our stay. Would recommend!
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super convenient location as well as part of a lovely neighborhood. You are about 3 blocks to Metro Line 1 in one direction and about 2 blocks to Metro Line 2. Both of these lines serve Paris very well and allow you connect easily to other lines. And it is a great starting point for some wonderful walks through the city. Start your day with a big breakfast, grab your camera and go see the city!
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are in Paris for a vacation; then this hotel is what you are searching for. Very convenient in terms of Location, value for Money, room size , cleanliness level. A perfect city hotel as the book says !.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is excellently situated at the heart of Paris, right at the Arc de Triomphe, which makes it a few paces from the Champs Elysees and its famous boutiques, restaurants and cafes. The room was comfortable and spacious and so was the bathroom. What disappointed us was the fact that room service food trays of our next door visitors, were left outside doors in the corridor for more than 8 hours. Such a shame because this is unacceptable at a 4 star hotel.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my 4th stay at the hotel and I was very pleased. Rooms are clean and comfortable, with a desk working area. Bed is very comfortable and lighting is very good as well. The staff were very helpful. While this was a work trip, I ended up having some time to explore Paris and the conceirge arranged Louvre tickets and was very helpful in giving Metro directions (the hotel is very close to two Metro stations and Paris is very easy to see via Metro). I really like the location as it is near the Arc de Triomphe and , Champs-Elysées, but also pretty quiet. I was warmly greeted as I got back to the hotel each night by the front desk staff which was nice. I had breakfast at the hotel each morning and thought the selection of food was very good.All in all, a great stay and I will return.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Simply - they genuinely do not care. They do not recognize, care for, or value their guests including Diamond Elite members. They provide excuses for poor service and state things will be altered for future guests, but nothing does. If you plan on staying at an opulent location with solid guest service, do not select this property. I would recommend staying elsewhere. I would hate to see how a standard (non-SPG member) guest would be be treated here. I gave them the opportunity to recover, but all they provided were excuses. Bonne chance, if you do decide to stay here. Happy travels.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms oke, but very small shower, air conditioning and heating not good. Breakfast below average. Bar service good. Food good but not outstanding. Hotel is too expensive for the standard and service. Will not book again.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The interaction I had with everyone I came into contact with couldn't have been better.......very professional & personable.........including e-mail contacts I had prior to arrival; was very happy our room was ready upon arrival after a long & tiring overnight trip; we stayed in one of the sky suites on the 8th floor; great room with a great view of the Arc de Triomphe & Eiffel Tower (hint: try to get room 810 if possible, end closest to the Arc/Tower, best view); conceirge staff excellent in helping us with very good dinner choices; liked the fact that you had to use your key card to engage the lifts, a very good security measure; overall, a great property; I would stay here again, but probably pass on the sky suite...........thanks for a great experience
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Member of the Marriott reward program for many years now, I stayed in several of the hotels from this brand (Renaissance, JW Marriott, etc) and am satisfied with the overall quality of the service offered.This hotel is good as well but I am a bit surprised with the fact that it belongs to one of their highest categories (which means highest standards etc). Its location is great, located on avenue de Wagram, it is 5mins away from Champs d’Elysées. The staff members are welcoming, helpful, and a pleasure to interact with. However we encountered a few things which affected the experience there and I wouldn’t have expected in such a place. Among those, the sink in the bathroom was almost blocked and it was hard to evacuate even a small amount of water. There was also the lobby which had a weird smell (maybe due to an issue in the WC located their) and does not give a very good first impression of the place. A couple of other points are not up to a 5 star hotel: issues with the lifts ( one out of the two working only), soundproofing which could be improved, 20mins to bring the luggage to our room. The city view from the prestige room was limited, i expected more.In a nutshell, convenient hotel which could benefit from few refurbishments and improvements of the way things are operated for the maintenance of its parts to offer a great customer experience.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second visit to Paris and to the Renaissance Arc de Triomphe. Our first visit years ago was so charming and welcoming that we had to come again for our return visit. Though this second time didn't start as well with the lack of upgrades available at the time of check-in, they were able to eventually accommodate us with their best room on the top floor due to issues in the original room. We remembered the breakfast as amazing a few years ago and the quality seemed to have declined this time around. The housekeeping quality has definitely declined with missing refresh of toiletries and other lack of attention to detail. Beyond that, the hospitality is wonderful and the staff always welcoming and helpful. While we usually stay at higher end properties, this Renaissance's proximity to the Arc and the Champs is ideal. The metro station is a few steps away. The Rue Poncelot market is also within walking distance. Overall it's a great location for a home base and great value for the money spent.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The lobby staff are superb with special shout out to Lauren!The concierge staff, aka navigator, also incredible!The rooms beautiful and spacious, the gym fabulous, and wait....the restaurant fantastic!!We had dinner at famous restaurants we had booked way in advance but our best meal in Paris was here!!! We asked the chef to come out so we could say: "BRAVO!"Location is central and walkable to all sites and museums.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After visiting many parts of Europe and especially Paris, cute boutique hotels begin to lose their charm. At some point, I want a nice bed, good shower, elevator and comfortable bar in a great location - the Renaissance has that in spades. It does so without feeling "corporate" or losing the feel of being in Paris. Wonderful, comfortable stay for 10 days.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i have nothing negative to say about this hotel. The service was great, in all aspects, and the upgraded room had an awesome view of the courtyard. It's easily in walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, restaurants, bakeries, Arc de Triumph. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an unexpected day trip to Paris and stayed at the Renaissance in the terrace room with a view of the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe. Was a lovely hotel with a very helpful staff especially at the reception. Breakfast was okay nothing special but, I was a big fan of the location of the hotel. I was made to wait a bit for my room but it wasn't much of a problem for me. Staying there again this coming weekend so excited!
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just spent five nights at this hotel. The hotel itself is clean but very dated. The problem, I think, is that the owners are not willing to spend the money to update because of the poor neighborhood. We walked almost 50 miles in Paris and didn't see anywhere as bad as this. Bums were sprawled across the side walk at 8:30 in the morning and at 14:30 in the afternoon. All along the street are people sleeping or begging. This was enough to keep me away from this hotel, but I should also warn about the breakfast. We tried the 30 euro breakfast our first morning. The buffet had cold eggs, cold sausage and potatoes that were like cold chips of wood. You are not allowed to get your own coffee and I had to almost tackle a waiter to get served. The staff was nice enough, but I feel sure that there are many better alternatives in Paris.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from our trip to Paris and it was wonderful! What made everything so great was our stay at the Arc de Triomphe Renaissance hotel. It was a gorgeous hotel with  a fantastic location.  We were very close to the Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe,as well as the metro. The hotel was lovely, and Marie and her team were extremely helpful and very kind. They gave us great recommendations for restuarants and made our stay very pleasant. Also, the rooms were very nice and clean. And the croissants at breakfast were delicious. If you are traveling to Paris and are looking for a nice quiet place to stay with friendly staff and a great location,this hotel is for you.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good place to stay close to A de T Downside no lounge, small bar area with modern furniture not very relaxing.Good points nice modern rooms good service, good food, all staff speak English I see this as a good 4 star.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My three college girlfriends and I spent 10 nights at the Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel earlier this month. It has been many years since we graduated and we take a trip each year to celebrate our friendship....this year marked 46 years since we met. The hotel had asked in advance the purpose of our trip and I responded with information. They used the information to decorate our room and put friendship signs and balloons up. It was very welcoming and thoughtful. Laura Marucci, one of the hotel's guest experience managers, made sure our room was set up with robes, slippers, champagne glasses and a chilled bottle of champagne waiting for us. Each person we interacted with throughout our stay was extremely attentive and focused on customer service...the front desk staff, the breakfast staff, the bar staff, housekeeping...We could not have been more pleased and we made sure to leave handwritten notes to compliment the staff on their excellent service. Next year I'm planning to return to Paris with my husband and we will definitely be staying at Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel. C'était merveilleux!
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First trip to Paris and after much research settled on the Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe. Our room was spacious and overlooked the city, with a view that included the very top of the Eiffel Tower. Two metro lines (#2 and #6) are within a few blocks walk, enabling access to the entire city. If you are Rewards member, be advised there is no concierge lounge located at this property. But they do provide a free breakfast as compensation, or points. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. While not impacting the quality of the stay at all, the red and blue lights in the elevator are extremely odd!
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located a short walk from the Arch de Triumph and subway. Location is perfect. Rooms are large and modern. Staff is very knowledgeable and extremely professional. We had breakfast there for the four mornings that we were there. All was great except the eggs. On the expensive side but worth the extra if you are planning a once in a lifetime trip.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place has the feel of a boutique hotel yet offers all the stuff you need. We booked the Sky View Room and it was amazing. The rooms are compact but offer plenty of storage space. Housekeeping staff were so very nice. The front desk and bellmen were genuine. Our Concierge was amazing. The restaurant menu is limited. But, why eat there when in Paris? We did order chicken club sandwiches from room service on our last night and ate on the balcony with the Eiffel and Arch de Triomphe as our view. Couldn’t be better. The metro is in walking distance and there are plenty of terrific restaurants within walking distance. We loved it!
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed our stay here. Perfect location just 3 blocks from the Arc, same as the metro. Good part of the city, with many excellent restaurants in walking distance. Fantastic staff that go out of their way to assist and help you at all times, Beyond friendly and with wonderful English too. As a Platinum member with Marriott, we got to enjoy breakfast each morning in their café. Once again, great service and a very wide selection of food - hot, cold, for sure, with a superb selection of bread and of course, croissants and really, anything you could want to fuel up to start the day.Beds were very comfortable, shower was hot and we had not one complaint the entire time. Concierge was extremely helpful too and the hotel manager was always around and asking if we needed something. Hope to come back soon
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First off the hotel is located 5mins from the arc de triumph and with many good restaurants and bakeries near by. The front desk staff and concierge are all welcoming and very knowledgeable about the area. The rooms are large for European standard. Here is where it fell short for a five star hotel and the price you pay I would expect them to get this right. First off the room service forgot to give us toilet paper one day so we had to call for that, they forgot to replenish our “2 complimentary waters 2 days and forgot to give us mouth wash and shower caps. The shower also was a poor design. Water kept of leaking onto the floor so we had to put towels down to prevent water from getting all over. No door to slide, shut or anything to prevent water from going onto the floor. The breakfast buffet was ok but the hot items were only luke warm. I know this may be knit picking but for the price and it being a 5 star hotel those things shouldn’t be a issue.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel has nice courtyard for eating. Rooms were in backhalf near conference area. Only presented problem during conference registration. Close walk to lots of nice cafes, the Eiffel Tower, and other sights of paris. Good breakfast buffet.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 2 nights. This hotel oozes with good class and services. Rooms are clean and had a good sleep.Location is also a walking distance to the shopping area at arch de triomphe.There is a metro nearby which makes our visit convenient.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had no complaints at all about the hotel. The staff was wonderful from the moment we walked in. Check in was seamless and friendly, and we were greeted kindly every time we walked by. Housekeeping was also wonderful.The rooms were clean and well kept. Location was a great. We were close to the metro stations which took us to the main railroad station that gets you to Nice etc. Getting to Disneyland from the hotel is also seamless. To get to the Eiffel Tower or Louvre, a cab or Uber is easy to get.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Renaissance Arc de Triomphe is a well located hotel about three blocks off the Champs de'lesay and a short walk from the metro stop (two actually). The rooms are large and have amenities that you would expect of this quality hotel.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel is really nice !!! The rooms are spacy and very well appointed , clean and the service staff is excellent !! The location of the hotel is awesome just steps away from the Avenue Champs Elyse'es and awesome restaurants and shopping.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a great location and is a convenient stepping off point for all of Paris. The public area and rooms are very nice and tastefully decorated. Most of all, the staff was magnificent in helping us celebrate our 31st anniversary.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived with our bags we thought there was no bellman but there was and he just watched us take our 6 bags into the check in area. We had a nice lady who spoke perfect English who checked us into a room quickly and when we arrived at the room it smelled of cigar smoke. We tried to call front desk but there was no answer. We proceeded to front desk to be told it was a no smoking hotel and could not understand why we thought it smelled like smoke. The best they could do was downgrade our room or bring us a ozone machine for the room. Since we did not want to have to lug our luggage through hotel again we took the machine. Over the next 7 nights housekeeping forgot to clean our room twice and the ice makers never did work and to get ice we went downstairs to the bar as to get it sent up took 2 hours the first time. Our Included breakfast every morning was filled with poor quality generic foods and a coffee machine that only worked about half the time. It seemed the hotel was understaffed with good people as there seemed to be a lot of people working there but nobody doing there job. Maybe the boss was on vacation? You would think at such a high rating it would be so much better. Great location up the street from the Arch but would not ever stay there again.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After researching all the Marriott and SPG properties in Paris, we finally decided on the Renaissance Arc de Triomphe. We were glad we did for many reasons. First, their warm hospitality and superb customer service. Sara at the front desk was the first person we met upon arrival to Paris and she made us feel totally welcomed. Fouade, the bellman, went the extra mile to help us with uber, taxi, and directions. The entire staff, including the reception, concierge, belldesk, and breakfast staff were friendly and helpful. Secondly, their location is unparalleled. Only 5 minutes walk to Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe. Also 5 minutes walk to two metro lines. Many good restaurants within walking distance, including Le Hide and L’Atelier du Marche. Avoid pricey tourist traps on Champs Elysees.Thirdly, the rooms and bathrooms were modern and comfortable. Their beds were a tad harder than what we’re used to in the States but we slept well.Finally, their buffet breakfast (complimentary for SPG/Marriott gold) was a fabulous way to start the day. We enjoyed the fresh fruits, juices, fresh croissants, hot chocolate, almond milk, yogurts, and cheeses. We would stay there again in a heartbeat!
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had booked at the Marriott Champs Elysees about 8 months ago. I have been watching the reviews of that property slipping. I even reached out to the hotel with concerns and they didn’t adequately address them. A week before leaving home I was able to book this Renaissance and am glad I did. I have a family of 5. We needed two rooms. Despite needing to have a room change due to fact it had been smoked in, They were able to put us together/ side by side; not connecting. We had a tiny balcony with garden view. The rooms were bigger than I was expecting. ( not big but larger than I have had in NYC). Housekeeping was wonderful. We have nothing ill to say of the breakfast buffet and we stayed 5 nights As mentioned, the staff were all wonderful. Only bit of a surprise was that children under 18 are not included in room rate (apparently in Europe it is under 12 and under,thus we had to pay a supplement each night)
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is excellent. There are wonderful restaurants and shops in the area and you are right down the street from the Arc de Triomphe. The facility is lovely and the rooms are excellent. It is clean and safe a just a wonderful place to stay. The staff is just the best and extremely helpful. I know about 30 French words, most of them not so helpful, and they all knew enough English to help me out. The concierges (there were 2) were excellent. Patient and helpful beyond expectation. Believe me, I had a million questions and they were just the best. Unexpectedly we were there for the World Cup (Allez Les Bleu!) It got pretty crazy out there and the staff were very protective of us and managed to get us a cab to the airport early the next morning despite the craziness. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel or our stay. It was simply wonderful!
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really liked this hotel. The location is fantastic for site seeing, shopping and dining. This property is great for family and business. The hotel staff (front desk and restaurant) were very helpful and friendly. All spoke English well, which we appreciated because our French is not good! Our room was relatively spacious and very quiet. The internet connection was strong and fast. The beds were comfortable, even the rollaway bed for our son. The bathroom was also spacious and modern. Good water pressure too. The restaurant was decent but there are a lot of very good restaurants close by. We will definitely stay at this hotel again!
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just such an amazing hotel. The staff was excellent, you instantly feel at home. Our room was spacious and had Bulgari toiletries . Such a convienent location. Just wish I spent more time there. The breakfast buffet could have been better
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a few nights and wished we had given the city and the hotel more time. Very close to the Arc de Triomphe and the subway system. Hotel staff went above and beyond our expectations. Breakfast was excellent. Hotel was quiet and kept very clean. Workout room included a cycle bike which was similar to the ones in my local gym and not the cheap kind most hotels put in.
hotelName:
21    Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located right next to the Saint-Lazare railway hub this hotel is not quiet and not suitable for the summer. The hotel has no aircon and the dyson fan in the room is not a solution as it is only blowing hot air... Additionally, my room had no black out curtain, which for a room facing East is quite deplorable except if you want the sun rise to wake you up.Sadly, the previous comments made about the poor breakfast have not been useful to the management. Located in the basement, the narrow breakfast room was dirty, its buffet not refilled while two staff ladies were eating their own breakfast grabbing whatever was left... You literally had to go bother them to get something.I had requested a quiet room only to be positioned on the last floor right next to the elevator!The Staff does not take feedback with a proper attitude. It perhaps had too many similar feedback over the last days/weeks/years?This hotel is not up to the standard it claims it maintains.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got home from staying here from a 3 night / 4 day trip to Paris.Paris itself is very easy to navigate through the metro system. And you can buy a pass for €8.95 euros a day which allow you in zones 1-5 and on buses too! There are 2 stations within short walking distance to the hotel - these are Rome and Europe. Very handy and easy to find!There is a convenience shop at the end of the road from the hotel which is handy. As the breakfast is contenential - mostly bread , pastries and a little selection of hot food like sausages and scrambled egg but it didn’t look very nice. And one of our party members tried it and said it wasn’tvery nice. Can’t conplain for the price though! The beds were very comfy and the showers did what showers do. On top of the beds there are plugs for your phone which is handy - and little lamps. the Wardrobe space isn’t a lot but you get around 7 hangers which does the job. We were greeted at reception by a lovely man! Who was very helpful and friendly and we had no problems checking in or finding our rooms. The rooms also come with fans to cool down, and there is a hair dryer in the bathroom! Upon leaving the hotel we paid city tax which was about 11.50 per room which wasn’t too bad. Again, very friendly on reception even offered to get us a taxi to the airport but we had train tickets :) there is also a bar in reception and different seating areas. Overall, a comfortable stay with a very ideal location to central Paris, easy to navigate! Would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again :)
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited here as the reviews had said that it was a friendly area and can completely agree. It’s off the main road down a side street so benefits from being in a quiet location, but is near enough to a big main street with lots of restaurants bars and sites.The Moulin Rouge was a 15 minute walk and the hotel offered umbrellas as it was a rainy evening when we walked there from the hotel.We also picked this hotel as there is a Metro station less than a 5 minute walk which we used a lot to get around.
