It’s about 5 or 10 minutes (on the metro) to the Champ Elyse and Arc de Triumph.The room was spacious enough and had a fridge and all the other amenities you’d expect and the hotel staff spoke perfect english which was great as we only spoke a little french.Would consider again if we returned to Paris, but bear in mind that the hotel is outside of the centre of Paris so travel is needed with taxis or Metro if you wanted to go to the likes of the Eiffel Tower (if you didn’t fancy an hour walk!)
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Cervantes is big on value especially for its central location in Paris. I paid about an average for Euro67 a solo room, which is one of the more affordable rates that I can find in the area. The hotel is in middle two metro stations on Line 2: Rome and Liege and I was surprised to find out that it was just a 15-minute walk to the Opera shopping district: Paris Garnier Opera House, Galeries Layfette and Printemps department stores - with the help of Google Maps. However, one must be willing to overlook some parts. The hotel room is dated but decently furnished - there is even a fridge, safe, portable side table (perfect for eating by the bed while watching television) and stools. However, the room’s brown carpet can be a put-off as it is in a murky brown colour. Well, wearing your own in-room slippers should solve this problem. I love the extra perks of the hotel lobby, such as free tea and coffee and drinks and snack station in the cosy and beautifully decorated lobby.Service staff is also friendly and willing to help. I had problems accessing the hotel’s Wifi network on my mobile phone, and the staff went out of their way to make sure that I received wifi connection. Another bonus on the trip was that I was given a room that faces the quiet Rue De Berne, which seems to be a residential area and it comes with a mini balcony. Perfect for sitting and enjoying the view with my baguette tradition (bought from the two nearby boulangeries - Boulangerie Julien and another one in the Batignolles area). There is a Carrefour City supermarket three minutes away, which makes it easy to buy water and groceries. A good base for exploring Paris. And sometimes, you just feel like hanging out in this hotel for a relaxing retreat.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A warm welcome, free coffee and tea, room was fine. The big minus, maybe our fault: we requested a quiet room away from the street noise: we received a room on the back of the hotel in 6th floor - to find out that sleep was impossible after 5.30 am as the trains of Gare St Lazare were just 50 m away from you ....We stayed only 2 nights.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at hotel for 3 nights with 3 people in the room. The room had 2 bedrooms with plenty of space for us all. Room was spotlessly clean and staff were helpful and polite. We were 3 females and the area felt very safe with metro just a few minutes from the hotel to access main Paris sightseeing. Continental breakfast was very good. Shuttle service to and from the airport available. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely return.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would recommend this hotel. It might need some updating but the location is good and customer service is wonderful. Breakfast is ok. It is a decent hotel to sleep at after being out all day. They even helped us get our bag back when it was left in the shuttle service.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Partner booked this trip as a surprise for my birthday... on arrival we were a little concerned as it seemed to be just in the middle of a street but once through the doors pleasantly surprised... we were greeted by a lovely lady who checked us in very quickly and gave us our key to the room... I had read reviews with regards to their being no air conditioning but knew that we would be supplied with a fan.. our room was nice nothing fancy but perfect for a base to sleep and freshen up... the bathroom was on the small side but that’s about all I can find fault with.. we actually had two fans in our room which was even better as I keep the fan on 365 days of the year... our room backed onto the metro but that wasn’t even an issue at all.. we could open the window and not be worried about anyone looking in... we found the bed super comfy.. we were a little way from where we wanted to be but once we found a route it took about 1 hour to walk to the Eiffel Tower... we only wished we could have had another two nights here so that we could go the other way to explore more of what Paris had to offer... all in all we were more than happy with this hotel and would certainly stay here again.. obviously it may not be everyone’s cup of tea but for us it was just right.. all I would say is maybe a little bit of attention could be made to the decor as it was a bit damaged in places but again wasn’t a problem for us... thank you for a wonderful experience
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location with 2 subways near by and very easy to use the metro&train from the airport. Quiet location with a 10-15 minute walk to the moulin rouge area where there are plenty of restaurants and bars. Room quite warm and the air con didn't work very well we did have fans but too loud to have on when we were trying to sleep. Friendly, welcoming staff. Booked a premium room which was clean and tidy but could do with a re-vamp. Breakfast was a cold buffet selection which was fresh and tasty. Would stay here again but would make sure the room wasn't next to the lift as we are light sleepers and if the hotel was busy I'm sure it could disturb people lucky for us it wasn't that busy so didn't hear too much from it.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel from 22/07/18 for 5 nights. When we got there temperature was 30c when booking in asked about air conditioning was told it was not working, but you have a fan in room. Over the 5 days temperature went up to 37c, it was last sleeping in a sauna. I found out the air conditioning has not been working for over 3 months. Paid extra for breakfast which was advertised as hot and cold buffet. They stopped the hot part 2 months ago, and the cold part was disgusting for the money paid. I spoke to one of the hotel directors about the above who told me Jet2 were told about air conditioning problems. He said he would send me an email about the 2 issues, still waiting.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was quite and close to a metro stop, so that's a plus, however when we checked in they put us in the wrong sized room and the AC didn't work...at all. Which might have been fine if Paris hadn't been 35° C during our stay.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As I put in my tittle I don’t understand how this place has so good reviews besides that the staff is pretty friendly. Customer service and the front staff was pretty friendly all the time and tried to help but the facilities for a three star are a joke. First we checked in later in the night because our flight got delayed, when we get to our room the lock was not working, we had to go down and have the front desk guy open the door with the key because the card reader was not working, the next morning I went to have breakfast and I still needed the staff to open the door of my room everytime I had to goin and out of the hotel. 2nd the hotel DOES NOT HAVE AIR CONDITIONER, I specially look for hotels with air conditioner because I know in Europe a lot of places don’t have it. They promote trip advisor all over the hotel and trip advisor says they have air conditioner but they DO NOT HAVE. I spoke to the manager Hadrien who explained that they do not have air and they never had it, I asked for something to be done and he said he was going to talk to Claire [-------] about it and that she will determine if I could get a discount or refund and I am still waiting for her call. She was suppose to call me the day after because she was not working on that Monday. The front guy told us the previous night that at the time is not working that a technician is suppose to come to fix it (which was not true because they do nonot have have air conditioner) he brought a fan full of dust for us to use which was our salvation and sleeping spills every night. Third if there is no air conditioner you cannot open the windows because you can hear all the noise of the train, which I understood why they have earplugs in the room for use. 4th the bathroom was dirty, the tile walls had mold all over (see my pictures), I showed this to the manager who said he was going to talk to Claire which I am still waiting for the call. 5th we paid for the breakfast, first morning we went down around 9:30 (breakfast is 7-10am) there was barely anything left, I asked the lady for more croissant and she said they were no more left, asked for more yogurt and got the same answer. There was barely anything left. So I said well let’s go earlier the next day, we went around 8:30am and similar story. I have stayed all over the world and have never received a there is no more in any hotel you pay for breakfast. the breakfast room is very small, HOT and obviously feels crowded, we had to go to the outside to pay and eat because we barely got anything besides cereal. It is a continental very basic breakfast. Lastly carpets were disgusting dirty, chairs broken, pillows dirty,definitely this place needs improvement in terms of the facilities. I will NOT recommend it or ever go back to it. I booked it because of the reviews. Don’t be fooled by the good reviews.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very friendly staff, good breakfast, great location ( very quiet part of city), public transport ( 3 metro stations) nearby the hotel.Ideal for a night stay. overall positive experience, great value for money
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a week in April. Hotel is on on a quiet street close to three metro stations. So easy to get anywhere around Paris as they are all on different lines. Metro is easy to negotiate and really convenient. Walk towards Liege for lots of restaurants. We ate at L'affiche close to hotel and had a great meal.We had a superior room and couldn't fault it. Liked the green idea to opt out of having the room cleaned every day. Just hang out the card on the door. Breakfast was a continental buffet and more than adequate. Sometimes not as much choice if you went down later.The staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful. We used the hotel shuttle back to the airport to save taking cases on metro. Good service, bear in mind the taxi picks up at several hotels so allow time for this.To save queuing at attractions we bought tickets at tourist information near the Louvre. They said they charge a commission. We bought tickets for three attractions and train tickets to Versailles and the charge was under 2 euros.Would definitely recommend this hotel for a city break, loved it.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a long weekend here couldn’t fault the room. Had a room on the first floor, It was clean, quiet and Wifi was amazing and reaches to your room. Used the metro which is really close to get to and from site seeing and Disneyland. The shop at the bottom of the road was close also.Staff were really friendly and used the hotel shuttle for transfer back to the airport. Amazing weekend away and good value for money.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was good for 3 people. The staffs were very accomodating. Every greets you. Will definitely be back here and staying here again. Street is very quite. We felt safe. Thank you for making our stay here in Paris a memorable one.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed as part of a third party deal. We received a warm welcome and were able to leave our luggage securely prior to check in time and on departure and returned when it was time to travel home.The hotel is a short 3 minute walk from the Rome metro station. We were able to walk to several attractions such as the Sacre-Cour, Moulin Rouge and the Arc d Triumph. There were various restaurants nearby within easy walking distance for evening meals.The room was clean, generally well presented with hair drier fixed unit in bathroom, kettle and a safe. The bed was very comfortable. Our room was to the front of the hotel and was quiet. We were not aware of trains from the railway station behind.There was a coffee making machine in the foyer that hotel guests were free to use. Continental breakfast was provided between 07:00 and 10:00. The eating area was small and found downstairs in a basement area. It was perhaps a little cramped and could get quite busy. There were TVs broadcasting the breakfast news programmes. We enjoyed our stay and certainly would recommend as well return another time.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for a weekend in August 2017 on a last minute cheap deal as I had Eurostar tickets and a ticket to see PSG. I've stayed in a number of hotels in the 8th as it's close to our office.The Cervantes represents great value for money and is a worthy 3 star. I've stayed in worse 4 star. It's conveniently located for St Lazare, Europe, Rome and Place de Clichy metro stops and is well served by the bus. There are plenty of bars and restaurants and the area feels safe late at night considering it's proximity to the red light district.It's sits on a quiet street and my inward facing room meant that the train noise from didn't bother me.The room was clean and comfortable although the bathroom was tiny. Not that much of an issue. The aircon was good and quiet. Breakfast was fine and there was plenty of it. The Wifi was also good.The free Nespresso machine in the lobby was welcome and the staff were friendly.I'm actually booking a weekend in May here on the strength of my previous experience.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located at the 8th arr. , with many restaurants and brasseries 5-10 min walk. good location if you don't want the crowded over toured neighbourhoods. access is also great with 2 nearby metro staations (Rome, Europe). i had a mixed experience with the hotel. to start, the room is quite small (solo), also the shower with almost no space to move. but taking into account that this is paris, let's say OK. also LCD TV is quite large (27") with good HD quality and wide selection (too bad on movies in english - why do europeans so obsessed with dubbing movies - that i'll never understand). who's interested in hearing someone in a studio overdubbing the real actor (!?) Ok, not hotel's fault -:) but let guests have some native english movies, it is, after all the most spoken language in the western world isn't it? regarding the room- could be much better. carpet seems stained and old. soap dispenser in bath was not replenished after request , which is NOT OK. which is a pity because the only time it had soap in it was wonderful using it! the bed is quite big and comfortable but the pillows - soft, with no firm option. i hate soft pillows...are there guests with no neck at all?...-:). the lobby area is really charming with free espresso and tea. real welcoming. i must indicate that having said that all the staff guys (and girls) i ran into were great - helping, smiling and willing to help (minus the dispenser incident...)). for the price paid this place has great potential.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is in a quiet back road. On arrival there was a pleasant, small reception area and the staff were very friendly and welcoming - but that, unfortunately, is where the good bits end. We were given a room on 5th Floor and due to the main lift being out of action were offered use of a small service lift - barely large enough for two people. Corridors both on ground level and outside our room were cluttered with large bags of hotel linen and cleaning items - which remained in situ throughout our stay. Our room was extremely small and the bathroom even smaller!!! The bathroom offered minimal space and had cracked tiles and a broken shower. Our room was at the back of the hotel and was above the railway line and so there was rail noise until late at night and restarting in the early morning.There were coffee/tea making facilities in the room however the only cups for hot drinks were plastic and completely unsuitable. We chose not to take the option of breakfast during our stay preferring to eat out so am unable to comment on this. It was well placed for sight-seeing and plenty of places to eat within easy reach. I will definitely return to Paris but I will not be staying here again and would not recommend it to others.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is actually close to 3 metro stations, Rome, Leige and Europe. within a 5 minute walk to either station. Saint Lazare is around a 20 minute walk. Location is in a quiet street. Most museums and montmarte is within walking distance around 30 minutes + but you see a lot while getting there. or just take the metro.The staff is awesome! Luis Marcos, thank you for all the tips and directions and most important, thanks for helping me with my room safe! Everyone at the front desk speaks great english. and are always more than happy to answer any questions and help out however they can. the rooms are ok. quite comfortable but on the smaller side. our room was way at the back and behind us was a train station of some sort, its loud when the windows are open but once you close them, it gets pretty quiet. so no worries there. The bed is ok as long as you are not over 6 feet tall. The complimentary wifi is fast and stable. Our room came with breakfast and it was good and filling. Love their coffee and croissants. and the nespresso machine at the lobby is a big plus!I also found out that tap water is ok to drink. they have 2 bottles of water in the fridge that are not free so make sure you confirm before you drink! They also have a fix rate taxi and shuttle service to CDG airport which is a big plus! i definitely recommend it unless you want to pay more for Uber and regular taxis. if you want to take the trains from CDG its also possible RER B to Gare du Nord, then the #2 (blue)line to Rome station. we took the fix fare taxi on the way back because it was raining hard that day.I would definitely stay here again. Luis and Lamia, you are all awesome!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: love it. rooms are fancy , clean and nicely settle .quiet area . i will definitely stay there again. What i did not understand was that, even though i paid for my hotel before travelling there. once there they still ask for my credit card to make copy as well as your passport. So i left France white the hotel kept my credit card information and passport in photocopies and in their file. I did not like the fact that employees will have my credit card information.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights to celebrate my 60th birthdayWhat a lovely welcome the receptionist spoke very good EnglishThe room was spotless a bit on the small side but big enough for the time you spent in there. It also contained a safe which is very useful also a small fridge containing complementary water.The hotel has a nice area for smokers.The lounge area is very nice plenty of information, also free coffee which is a nice thought, and includes a small bar.Next door to the hotel is an Italian restaurant, lovely pizzas would recommend the regina.All of the staff we met were very nice and helpful we would definitely stay here again when we return to Paris as it is central positioned.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:- Couldn’t be closer to Rome and Europe metro stations- Cheap weekend break- Lovely reception/bar area- Helpful staff - Free safe in roomsCons:- Bathroom in much need of renovations and a good clean!!! manky shower curtain, cracked sink, dirty grout between tiles, hole in ceiling, broken shower, dirty toilet. 100% not as pictured - Bottled water in fridge NOT free - Room small and tired looking, could definitely do with a lick of paint and a new carpet - Dog poo all over the street outside and I mean EVERYWHEREOverall it is ok for a cheap weekend in Paris and fine if you are not planning to spend much time in the room, as we didn’t, but next time I would pay more for a nicer hotel as the state of the bathroom really did ruin it for me. Its a shame the rest of the hotel does not live up to the lobby area!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in the perfect location, very close to the metro station, from which you can go to every attraction. Very close to the hotel is also Moulin Rouge, a supermarket and a lot of bars and restaurants. The neighbourhood seemed very safe. The rooms were a bit small, but as you spend most of the time outside it doesn't really matter. The breakfast is very good (eggs, sausages, ham, cheese, cereals, jam, cofee, juice). The staff were very nice and helpfull, especially on the last day, we had a very early flight, so we left the hotel at 5.30 in the morning, and the nice guy at the reception made us breakfast earlier, eventought the breakfast normally starts at 7.00, which was very nice of him!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is very clean! The position is very good where I can go to the other famous places very easy. And also the staff is very enthusiastic! It is near subway station. Also the train station is nearby! The convenient transpotation!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice people and good service (some nice details as free coffee at the lobby any time , help in printing electronic tickets ) . Room and bathroom were very small (i.e. no place to open the luggage , getting out of the shower was really uncomfortable)
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in a room that slept 3 on our recent 3 night trip to paris. Great location, close to the metro and still within easy walking distance if you wanted to go to the main attractions. Staff were very friendly, able to leave our luggage with reception until check in. Very helpful with recommending great restaurants and clubs for our stay. Complimentary coffee and happy hour was a great perk. Our room was good, clean sheets and daily housekeeping. Some mild mould in the bathroom ceiling joins but this probably due to the age of the building. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at Cervantes by happy culture from 13 -18 July 17 . The hotel is very close to Rome metro station with direct access to Champs Elysee . Europe Metro Station is also walking distance . The location is very good as you can find a Carrefour super market 2 or less minutes walking from the hotel also alot of restaurants , Cafes around the Area .The room was clean small a little bit but that 's normal in Paris . The breakfast was good but in weekend the service from reception was so poor . They offering Happy hour which is so nice .Finally I would thank Louis from reception he book for us the return transfer and he was so friendly with us and he has a super postive attuide . Muchas Gracias Louis.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel is in a quiet and attractive street, there are 2 or 3 restaurants very nearby, there is a small supermarket at the top of the road and the metro is about a 3 minute walk, rooms are very small but staff are very attentive, happy and helpful, plenty of choice for breakfast, all in all a good place to stay for your Paris visit.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel in August, pleasant hotel with nice decor downstairs but rooms could do with a little bit of updating and just general maintenance. Rooms lovely and clean and nicely placed near Rome metro, staff were nice and helpful and spoke good English which I appreciate due to the British school system's inadequacy at teaching languages (thanks guys). Nice little touches of sweets and coffee machine. Our friends had a few issues with their room but ours was fine, and the staff did their best to make it up to us offering us all free breakfast for our final morning.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although the hotel is a little tired & there can be train noise in some rooms, these are more than made up for by the friendly, helpful staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them. The breakfast was great value with offerings of not only cold meats, cheeses & pastries but also a hot choice of scrambled eggs & sausages, this along with a choice of hot and cold beverages made for a good start to the day. The hotel is situated just a few hundred yards from Rome metro station, so 2 quick stops and you are at the Arc De Triomphe. Excellent staff, excellent location & excellent value for money.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location on a quiet street. Near a few supermarkets within 3 minutes. Nice staff always greeting you when you come in or leave the hotel. There is a coffee machine for free. We enjoyed our four nights in Paris.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Took my son to Paris for his birthday and stayed here, wonderful hotel with equally wonderful helpful staff, kingsize bed, tea/coffee in room and very clean. Free wifi, short walk away from 2 metro stations and small supermarket up the road. We would definitely stay here again as loved it and ideally placed for what we wanted.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Couldn't have picked a better hotel! Stayed here for my birthday for 4 nights. Perfect location just a 2 minute walk from Rome metro station which had easily travel routes to Paris attractions. Staff could not have been more friendly and helpful and suggested multiple restaurants and also the 3 day metro pass that would get us to everywhere we needed to go at a discounted price rather than buying return tickets. Breakfast was ideal with a choice of pastries, cheese, bread, meat and eggs sausage and toast. Perfect views from the room no matter whether you stay on the front or back and the hotel was beautiful. All in all a perfect 4 nights given to us by Hotel Cervantes! Will definitely be returning! Thank you so much for making my birthday week so amazing'
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent value. My husband and I stayed here for two nights - Thurs 6th July - Friday 8th July. The rooms are very compact but very clean and everything you need. It was nice to have the little soaps, shampoos, hairdryers etc. that some hotels of a similar price in the UK seem to be dispensing with. The staff are very kind and friendly - nothing is to much trouble. There is a good selection of food on offer at breakfast. We travelled on Eurotunnel - I had never thought I would ever travel on this - having done so, I cannot imagine why anyone would travel from Britain to Paris by any other means. The train journey from Kingscross to Paris is surprisingly short and you arrive in the centre of Paris - no tiresome journey from the airport, so on a short break, you can really take advantage of all the time you have. On the way back we left our luggage in the lock-up at Gare Du Nord - again, very good value, and well worth it if you want to make the most of a short break. As for Paris - can't wait to return!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have just returned back from a five nights stay at Hotel Cervantes by Happy Culture.. we booked a triple room so i believe that's the biggest room at the hotel, which had enough space for 2 adults, a 5 year old kid & a toddler to move around comfortably.The pro's:-- Very good location, just a couple of minutes away from Rome metro station, also pretty close to Europe & Leige stations, so ur actually very well connected to different metro lines & RER too. 4 stops away from Champs Elysees & only 3 stops from the Sacre Coeur.- The staff are super friendly, knowledgeable and helpful, very pleasant indeed (specially that one receptionist who comes from india who i unfortunately cant remember his name !)- They'll provide free umbrellas if its rainy, also free mineral water supply during happy hour at 6 pm i believe. Free lollipops and candies for the little kids which they were super happy with.- Clean, modern & just what you need for sleeping comfortably after a long exhausting day of sightseeing and shopping.- Carrefour just around the corner. - Trustworthy housekeeping (see con's to know why)Con's:-- Very poor wifi at the rooms (although pretty strong at the lobby area)- our safe box didn't work. We couldn't enter our password and it kept giving an error. We informed the reception and they promised to fix it next day. But Frankly speaking we were usually too excited in the mornings to get started with our program, and too exhausted at the end of the day to let someone inside to fix it. so we didn't bother to ask them for fixing it again. So cant really blame them for that. We left our passports and cash at the broken safebox, and i was super impressed with the honesty of the housekeeping.. thumbs up for choosing the right stuff.. but still it's not nice for a 4* hotel to leave safe boxes unmaintained. - I read on previous reviews that some rooms had A/C problems.. luckily our A/C worked perfectly for the first 5 days, and only broke on the day of checkout... we were already just packing and leaving, so again we didnt make a fuss.. but seems that A/C needs maintenance too IMPORTANT:- i read many reviews rating the hotel as noisy due to its location near Rome metro station, that some guests couldn't even sleep !!! I was a bit bothered with these reviews specially that i was traveling with my little daughters and i thought about changing the hotel at the last minute. But i am glad i didnt.. Please dont believe this.. the hotel is very quiet and we never heard railway noise (although our room faced the main street not the back) All in all, i would fully recommend this hotel to anyone.. i work as a honeymoon specialized travel agent in Cairo, Egypt. And i will certainly book this hotel for couples too who wants to stay on a limited budget but still enjoy a comfortable clean hotel
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for two nights, good thing we were able to check in early after all the standing time we had at CGD airport (Custom its a chaos); First room the AC was not working but the Front Desk Agent changed us to a bigger room with working AC and Fan. Breakfast was good, it's served on the lower level and it feels a little bit hot down there, Coffee was available all day through a machine, they also have a Social Hour from 6-8 with drinks and snacks.This hotel is close to the Rome station, after you come up on the street you have to walk back (South) and turn right on the first street and keep right all the way to the hotel, there is a grocery store at the corner and there are lots of restaurants around the area, we feel safe walking late at night; Please be aware that restaurants open at 7:00 pm for dinner, not before. Train system its easy and convenience to handle.The hotel has Wifi available and we also like the fact that they offer a router to carry on all day for just 1 euro daily, They might ask you for a deposit up front. All staff members were helpful, kind and speak English.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 6 nights with friends and could not really fault the hotel. We stayed in one of the premium rooms which was a lot bigger than expected as well as quite modern. While we did have the view of a brick wall this didn't make much difference as we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel. WiFi was a little on the slow side and we couldn't connect to the right WiFi network from our room, instead having to connect to the network for the above rooms. Location of the hotel is great and is a short walk from the train station. While we could hear trains passing from our room the noise wasn't noticeable or disturbing. Staff within the hotel are great as well - they're extremely helpful! I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially for the location and the staff.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently started our Europe trip in Paris and picked Hotel Cervantes for its location. It ended up being a great hotel for much more than that though. The location is indeed great. Just a short walk from the train station but without having to hear the trains running all the time.The room was great. It was modern, colourful and much bigger than we had expected after speaking to friends and reading about hotels online. The bed was comfortable, TV was a good size (though we were out every day) and the shower was warm. We didn't have a view from our room but you can't have everything. The Happy Hour is great!!!! Wine tasting, prosciutto, cheese, bread and jam for free every day from 6-8! Can't go wrong. The staff were great!!! So nice and helpful. They capped off the experience at this hotel. We wouldn't hesitate to stay again.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly. The hotel offers a mifi device for a € a day. Get this. Tether your mobiles and your unlimited Wi-Fi all over Paris. It was great and made sure seeing so much easier.Rooms. The pictures aren't edited. Our room looked like the pictures. Window onto the street. Air con works. Simple bathroom. Beds are ok. Clean enoughBreakfast.Not that bad actually. Average selection and all fresh. 3 days is ok. More would be repetitive.Location.Awesome. 3 minutes walk from Rome station. Can connect both ways to main lines. 15 mins west is arc de triumph 10 mins north east is Moulin rouge 10 mins more is sacre coure 20 mins south in the louvre and the riverWe walked every day.StaffSome better than others
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were drawn in by the price, but a bit disappointed by several things--our window leaked water, so there was an unfortunate mildew smell in our small, double room that dogged us the entire visit. Our safe was broken, the refrigerator never truly cooled off, the AC wasn't sufficient, the elevator was an oven, both the hot water in the shower and the wifi were spotty, and the "unlimited" coffee didn't actually include the good cappucino in the basement breakfast room--it was limited to the subpar espresso machine in the hotel lobby. They were also skimpy with the water bottles--they were supposed to put 2 in our fridge each day, but we actually had to go downstairs to request them, and they didn't always have them.So, yeah, we got a good price, but a good value? Not so much.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights and liked the informal atmosphere of the hotel. Reception staff very helpful. Very handy for Rome Metro at the end of the road. Good supermarket on the corner of Rue De Moscou. Room was small but clean and tidy with a useful fridge for beer and water ! Free room safe. At the back of the hotel the view was not great but nice sunset from balcony. Breakfast was a little cramped downstairs but food was sufficient. We were told we could use the facilities at other Happy Hotels in the city but we did not make it to them. Free refreshments in bar including wine in the evening. Would recommend this for location and friendliness.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were large and clean. The locations of the hotel was very good, there are 2 metro stations really close. The air conditioner was not working at all. The receptionist assured us that the AC would be checked by a technician the next day, but it wasn´t. The next day the other recepcionist told us that the AC would be fixed in a month. It seems like the AC was broken and thats the reason they put a fan in the room. They should not advertise AC rooms.The extractor in the bathroom was not working.The safe was not working.They would get 4 or even 5 stars if those problems were addressed correctly.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: my boyfriend surprised me for my birthday with a trip to paris, this hotel was brilliant couldn't of asked for more. hotel staff was so helpful and friendly and the rooms was lovely and modern. really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely come again
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was really nice experience, good communication and perfect attention with Luis from the reception, the experience was more easy thanks to him. Luis was prepared at all times to help us.10 points for the breakfast. I recommend this hotel to my family and friends.Thanks!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Cervantes is ideally situated for many of the sights to see in Paris. Staff member Luis helped to make our stay. All staff members were very courteous and helpful. The hotel does a good breakfast and has a Happy Bar between 18.00 and 20.00 hours when they serve complimentary cocktails and savoury nibbles. It is close to the Metro and is surrounded by good restaurants of all types. A most enjoyable stay.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel for a 70th birthday surprise. We paid for a flexible booking should they not be able to travel for some reason. this meant that payment should have been taken on leaving - rather than in advance. Instead, they immediately took the funds, and it was a battle to get it back. We also booked a premier room given that this was a celebration. Our parents suspected this isnt what they had been given, but were told it was while they were in the hotel. When they got back they checked online and it clearly was a standard room. Very disappointing lack of good faith all round, especially for them to have raised this and been misled in this way. Some money was later refunded, but that is not the point. Very unsatisfactory.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel, very friendly and helpful staff. Continental breakfast and access to coffee machine 24 hours. Ideally situated for all Paris attractions. Easy access to metro. Would happily stay here again.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Simply a brilliant place to stay. Near to several metro stations and surrounded by lovely restaurants, Our hotel room (premium) was very clean, comfortable and had all things needed. The staff were exceptional. Highly recommend this Hotel which being affordable makes it ideal for most people.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my partner spent a weekend at the hotel in March, which we booked through Last Minute. We could not complain at all! Hotel was clean, quiet and staff were friendly! We didn't opt in for breakfast so we couldn't comment on that. The hotel is just a couple of minutes walk from Rome underground station as well so hotel provides great access to the city.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a nice little hotel this is! Very close to Rome Metro station (about 5 minutes walk). Nice restaurant with friendly owner next door as well (but they're closed Saturday & Sunday). The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful too.The rooms aren't big, but plenty big enough for our purposes. Very clean and the shower/toilet was clean too.The croissants served at breakfast are GORGEOUS!I definitely recommend this hotel, as it's away from any main areas yet very close to the main attractions and Metro.I would also recommend that you get a Visit Paris ticket at CDG Airport for 1, 2 or 3 days - this ticket will get you into Paris and is unlimited Metro travel.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Cervantes is a great hotel if you have not visited Paris before. Excellent location as close to shops, bars and the metro. The staff at reception were particularly helpful and friendly so thankyou! The rooms were very clean and tidy, beds comfortable. You also receive free tea and coffee, the safe in the room is available to use, clean towels I would however take a hairdryer. Our room was at the back of the hotel, you could unfortunately hear the trains through the night (as the station is also close by) so if you are a light sleeper I would request a room at the front of the hotel. Overall a really really great stay at this hotel you will not be disappointed thankyou Hotel Cervantes!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just spent a week at Hotel Cervantes, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay!The room, although small was comfortable enough and was cleaned very well every day. It is very different from an American experience of a hotel but I absolutely loved it! The streets are all cobblestone and the hotel is situated on a side street between Paris apartments. The location was EXCELLENT! The Rome Metro station was only a block away from the hotel. So easy to get around the city using the Metro. The day we arrived after traveling overnight from the US the staff welcomed us and made us coffee while we waited for our hotel room to be ready as we were there early. The coffee was free and available daily. The staff was so welcoming and helpful daily through out our trip. Every day they helped us navigate the Metro to our desired locations. They would take out the Metro map and give us detailed instructions on how to get to our desired trip. They spoke excellent English as well as Spanish and French. Their helpfulness and kindness was so appreciated and in such a stark contrast to assumptions about travel in France. We miss all of you already. They also had a lot of great suggestions of things to do as well as places to eat that were close by. Thank you all so much for an amazing stay in Paris France! We will be back.Sue, Mark and Sophie
hotelName:
22    Hotel Cervantes by HappyCulture
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a 2 room apartment, not a hotel Kitchen was well stocked with untensils etc. A very comfortable bed and a quiet location, yet just off main streets. It was a perfect location for exploring Paris. The reception staff were also very helpful.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this hotel for two times.Among the expensive and or old and tired hotel choices in Paris, HM is a good option - it is much more reasonably priced, it is of modern design, clean and relatively newly renovated (I stayed in the ground floor room and loved it). It has a kitchen with full cooking utensils in great clean condition. Sizeable shower area and bathtub (unlike some hotel you can hardly move). Queen size bed. It is 10 min walk to La Marais one of my favourite shopping area with local designers shops, 4-5 Maje/Sandro and reasonable priced restaurants. Actually one of my favourite Michelin 3 stars L’Ambroise is also there.What I love most is also service. They served by couple of young ladies. Not traditional 24 hour conceige. They are not in the conceige all the time. But they are friendly, flexible, digitally savvy (young) and we make requests and they quickly responsed and met your need with flexibility. If you are relatively young and use to quick text and arrangement you will find it very friendly and agile. If one expect a traditional 24 hour conceige you may be horrified why no one is around.They went extra mile and help make my trip smooth and more enjoyable. Along a few things, I booked two different rooms for my last stay. they let me stayed in my original room as it is available so I don’t need to move although the second room is supposed to be cheaper. It is not obligated and therefore appreciated. Big hotel with “policy” will not have that human touch.It is a small boutique hotel in the alley. Not glamorous but ok and taxi was able to wait inside the alley.Already and would
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent New Year’s Eve here with family (2 doubles).The rooms are very comfortable, very chic and the hotel has a quiet location adjacent to the Marais. The staff were great: on hand whenever needed.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very, very pleasant 3 night stay in a “singles” room that was bigger than the standard Euro room size. This is perfect option for “independent” travelers that don’t need hand holding (smile) given that the desk is only manned at core hours by very pleasant attendants. It felt more like a cosy apartment - which was great.Located on a quiet part of the street which has interesting Chinese establishments and a Pho shop that seemed very popular based on the queue. A less than 10 minute walk to Big Falafel which has super tasty Lebanese fare; Naturalia (bio store) is a block away.Easy walking access to many parts of the Marais Metro and buses being with a block makes this a really good location overall, transportation-wise.Finally, must comment on how lovely the bed linens felt (very important)!No complaints whatsoever. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great quiet location. Terrific energetic staff. Room was comfortable , minimalistic, with kitchen. Our room had window on inner court with no natural light. Keep in mind, that there is no lounge or sitting area or bathroom until you are checked into your room. Front desk is staffed from 9 to 5 . Plan arrival accordingly. Staff is very accommodating and makes every effort to accommodate early arrivals. Neighborhood is full of restaurants and metro is less than 5 minutes away.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Honestly the most accommodating staff for a small hotel (basically an Airbnb with some hotel amenities). I had to go to Normandy for two days and the staff allowed me to leave my luggage and had my room ready for my late arrival. I booked the room not expecting much, and honestly I usually like large hotels versus micro hotels, but this place proved me wrong--i would stay here again in a heartbeat.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In April 2018, we booked both rooms on the 2nd floor for a 2 night stay that turned into 4. Thanks to Air France pilots striking, we were ‘stranded’ in Paris trying to get a connecting flight to South Africa. Pascaline, the owner, was so gracious in helping us deal with the airlines and accommodating us for the extra nights. We had 2 year old twin boys and an elderly in the party, and a central location walking distance to most sights was important for us. All boxes checked. The hotel was so well designed. It’s on a quiet street closed to vehicles, so Paris traffic did not interfere with the kids’ sleep. The rooms were so stylish and well stocked. It felt like we were at home. Nespresso coffee pods in the rooms and a grocery store conveniently located around the block. We will definitely stay here again when visiting from the US. Pascaline is a gem and so is her hotel.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved staying at the Hotel du Haut Marais - the location was fantastic, right in the heart of the Marais. Pasqualine was super friendly and helpful and apartment had everything we needed, it was perfect for our stay.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabulous location. Close to museums and shopping that is open on Sunday! Trendy neighborhood with good vegan restaurants (more than I could actually eat at in my 3 day stay!) Best of all, Pascaline, the concierge was knowledgeable, personable, friendly and extremely helpful. She was proactive in asking what I wanted to do in Paris and helping me figure out the best way to do it! I would definitely recommend staying here. When in Paris, I'll stay here again!
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location! Safe, clean, friendly, good mattress, great A/C, fun atmosphere, excellent restaurants, quick reach of a Metro, near Notre Dame, quaint staff, (no, amenities like ice, no showers only a tub and handheld shower, but hey, it's atmosphere!)
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent two weeks at this delightful home away from home. The owner makes you feel like a guest in her home, attentive to your every need. The hotel combines high tech, cutting edge contemporary design with the ancient charm and romance of the Marais. I saw a few of the rooms and each was uniquely stylish and welcoming; however I was privileged to spend my two weeks in the loft, a spacious and charming "home" with incredible views of Parisian rooftops that are the stuff of postcards and paintings. Hotel du Haut Marais is also perfectly located for everything, a very short Uber ride to all important Paris destinations and also a very quick walk to great little restaurants and the metro. There are also two wonderful little restaurants within a few steps of the hotel. I don't remember the names, one serving excellent north African cuisine and the other vegetarian. I hate vegetarian cuisine and never eat it, but this place works magic and i would go there weekly if I could. Ask the hotel owner for the name--it's just about next door. If you're going to be in Paris for a night, a weekend, a few days or more, do your best to book a room here. I can't imagine staying anywhere else when I visit Paris. By the way, if you need room service, there's an iPad in the room where you can use two food delivery apps to access dozens of wonderful restaurants who will deliver every kind of food imaginable to your room, usually in 20 minutes.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Paris for a conference but decided to stay 30 minutes from the meeting to enjoy the Marais district.Pascaline, the hotel manager, provided great service throughout our stay, and offered a large street level room or a room that faced the interior - we chose the quieter option - the hotel is beautiful and trendy (and new), rooms are small compared to American standards but on par for a metro Parisian hotel, but with excellent amenities, working A/C (a shortcoming of many places in Paris) and the service was attentive and welcoming.beds and linens were top notch.would definitely stay there again when back in Paris!
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: wow where to start i have been in this hotel 6 years ago and i can still remember the smell of the crossant its a wonderful hotel great location i can still remember the name of the owner Didier a wonderful man great host great cleaning serviceif i remembered this hotel for 6 years imagine what woll your experience be like..all the best didier fromyour israeli friend..
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Little hotel with nice, soberly decorated rooms at the very center of Paris. The room has a Nesspresso machine, a detail that I appreciate when traveling for business and need a cafeine shot early in the morning. Customers are excellently attended by Pascaline, who is reliable and always responsive.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel du Haut Marais is tucked away in a small street in a wonderful areas in Paris. Its small and cosy, but big on hospitality. The rooms were very comfortable with lovely linen and soft beds, the bathrooms have great toiletries, and there were more than enough plugs to charge devices. The windows are double glazed so there is no noise from outside. But best of all was Pascaline who manages the hotel who was great on giving advice, making dinner bookings and even helping me return some shoes I bought. I can highly recommend HDM.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A friend recommended this hotel for my stay last March and it did not disappoint! It was my first time in Paris, and I had heard that hotel rooms are pretty small so that's what I expected. However this one really exceeded my expectations! It was more like a 1 bedroom efficiency apartment than a hotel room. The main room had a sitting bench along with a little eating table with two chairs. There was a small counter with a sink, mini fridge, stovetop (utensils, glasses and plates in the cabinets) and a coffee machine. The bedroom was separate, and the bed was super comfy. There's no bar or restaurant on site but the hotel is in Le Marais which is an amazing neighborhood, so you should be out exploring anyway. Even though the metro was close to the hotel, I just ended up walking everywhere. I was travelling solo on this trip and at no time did I feel unsafe - just apply common sense.I would definitely recommend this hotell! Pascaline is wonderful and so helpful! Can't wait to get back there again!
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a beautiful boutique hotel very near Arts et Metiers metro. We stayed in the loft on the top floor as we needed some extra space, travelling with a toddler. We loved the room, with a lot of character and everything we needed, including a kitchenette. The manager Pascaline was delightful with plenty of tips for our stay. Very happy with our choice and hope to be back!
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, staff is great and makes you feel comfortable at the hotel. Easy to check in/out would definitely recommend anyone to stay here. Room was small but it worked fine for me staying by myself.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one night in the Hotel du haut Marais. The location is excellent, much shopping to do and many restaurants (we recommend Season for lunch, Soma or Okomusu for a Japanese dinner, Little Red Door for cocktails). The rooms are cosy, modern with a well equipped kitchen (microwave, etc). Very convenient if you want to eat in the room. But you must absolutely try the sauna! Ask Pascaline and enjoy the whole vaulted cellar for yourself for an hour. 5-star quality there, our best sauna experience by far. Thanks Pascaline for everything.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are small but remember this is Europe but very cozy. The art appeal is very nice in the rooms. The hotel is close to the underground train and in a neighborhood that has some cute shops. It is worth the stay.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the hotel for 2 nights, and everything was perfect. The room is spacious and decorated with taste. The owner is kind and helpfull. We will be back soon for our next trip in Paris. :) .P.O.N.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was extremely clean, organized, aesthetically pleasing and well designed. The front desk staff was very communicative and helpful. The bed, linens, bathroom, tub, etc were brand new and cleanliness are top-notch. There is also a very lovely single-use sauna in the basement which was such an amazing amenity within the hotel! Overall, this hotel is one of the best places to stay in the Marais. Its centrally located and even on a pedestrian-only street which makes its pretty quiet and a hidden gem! Would love to stay here on for every trip to Paris! Best hotel I've stayed at in Paris by far!!!
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has recently changed hands and has been fully refurbished in a contemporary style. The hotel offers good value for money accommodation in the apartment/hotel model where you can decide to eat out or bring in. The location remains excellent for the Marais and surrounding quarters of Paris in the 4th, 3rd.....area. New owners are really friendly and helpful and live closeby.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has just been fully redecorated with a new contemporary style. It is stylish and modern. Nicely done.We stayed in La Suite. The room was spacious (a good thing in Paris!). It even had a little kitchen fully equipped if you fancy having a night-in (including a dishwasher and a Nespresso coffee machine) and a good sofa to relax after a long day in Paris.I heard they were adding a Spa in the vaulted basement. We could not see it but we are looking forward to trying it at our next visit!The hotel is located in a charming quiet cobbled street right in the Marais - one of the best neighbourhoods in Paris. It is very easy to move around by foot, metro or taxi. There are plenty of good restaurants around too.
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the hotel to celebrate our 10 years anniversary so we wanted a cosy place in the heart of Paris to visit places just by walking. The hotel is very well located but in a pedestrian street so it's very quiet. The owner explained us that the hotel has just been totally redesigned and it's is very striking how each details has been chosen with a lot of taste. The appartement are comfortable and quiet, we felt at home. We were lucky to see the owner that made everything possible so that we have a good time in her hotel. Definitely a very good address in Paris, we will come back to try the sauna once it's finished!
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a lovely place in the very center of Paris!The hotel looks amazing, very modern yet so cosy: it immediately feels "like home".The new owners are lovely and full of great tips to enjoy the neighborhoods.Our studio was perfect: confortable and well equiped. We only stayed for one night, but if you are there longer, the little kitchen is perfect for a home-meal after a relaxing bath!I highly recommend it and will surely stay again if I can!
hotelName:
23    Hotel du Haut Marais
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quite a way out from the city centre; this makes it cheaper, but if you can get your head around the metro system, there are trains running almost constantly and Riquet station is a two minutes walk away. Right by side of canal so a nice view if on that side of hotel. Room was nice and clean and breakfast was okay except for the eggs!The local area seems a bit run down in places and the rancid smell of pee is too prevalent around some of the streets. However, sitting by the canal in the evening is pleasant and the people are friendly. I would use this hotel again.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good facilities, close to underground to get into Paris. Restaurants and shops close by. Friendly, helpful staff. Room a decent size. Located on the canal, nice walks along the waterway. All in all good value for money.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is one hotel which you will love only for its location. It is bang next to the canal and from the room windows or from the open deck, you can find many sailboats. Try to choose a lower floor room, which will give you an early morning feel that you are lying on the water level of the canal.There is not much else to write about the room or the bathroom, both of which are small. There were not enough power sockets in the room and I had to charge the batteries from the bathroom. Having toiletries of "standard" brand was an added change.Breakfast was complementary, good, but became a bore within our 4 nights stay. It would be nice if the cook learns to make scrambled eggs which are less watery.In a nutshell. the family just loved it and would be happy to stay there again :-)
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently planned my Himachal Pradesh holidays with the help of Veena World tour packages and I must say that it helped us a lot in our entire trip. I heard some great reviews of Veena World through a friend of mine and was willing to give it a try. Since it was our annual family trip, I decided to keep things simple. With their customization options, we were able to filter results according to our preferences. And since they had different tour packages available, it was extremely easy to choose the package that was not only affordable, but delightful as well.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel! Happy I didn’t listen to the negative reviews. Super easy to catch metro to major attractions. Additionally have to give Elvis and Faudele major applause, they went way above and beyond with assistance.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at this hotel 4 or 5 times now and have always thought it to be a hidden gem. The rooms are large by Paris standards and well priced and it's on the side of the Saint-Martin Canal at the Bassin de la Villette.The hotel is well maintained and offers a really good breakfast with quality items and a wide variety of choice. Staff are generally friendly and efficient and speak many languages - English being the main one after French.Usually, I would give the hotel a 5-star rating, but it's much less as I feel their professionalism left a lot to be desired on my last visit.After checking out I asked for a taxi only to be told that they were on strike. This was the first I knew of this as no signs had been posted in the elevators or foyer. When I asked the woman at the desk what we could do she said to take the Metro. This to a person with 2 suitcases of around 25 kgs each and a handicapped wife who can't walk too far. After I pressed her for a solution she said she'd see what her manager had to say and went into the office behind the desk. The manager had such high concern for our situation that he didn't even bother to come out to us. When the clerk returned she said she would try and get a taxi and used the computer to make a booking. I asked how long the taxi might be and she said she didn't know. All through our conversation, she showed little if any empathy for our plight.Thank goodness for phone apps as I was able to get a car from Kapten which got us to the airport in good time for our plane.As I said this is a good hotel. But I have given it a poor rating because of the low level of professionalism and customer service when it was needed most. Also, because I received an email with a half-apology from the manager saying that staff would be counseled, but that there were signs in the lift - there were not. And that another client had got a taxi earlier after waiting 45 minutes and it took 2 hours to the airport. What relevance this has to our situation escapes me, but I find it passing strange that the manager knows how long a cab took to get to the airport. I actually believe he's not telling the truth, but who cares?A professional manager would have arranged for signs to be in elevators, all foyers, and the breakfast room. They would also arrange some form of bookable transport to be available. They would talk with their customers and not hide in their office.So stay at this great hotel by all means, but be mindful that when you may need it most their customer service might evaporate.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first trip to France so it was surprising that there was no AC in the hotel, just a FAN! I don't know if this is a French custom (the LOUVRE didn't have AC!) but heading to the hotel, the Uber driver didn't use AC either, just the windows were open. Luckily it's Spring with cool nights and the windows were able to open.Second complaint is that at breakfast, even at 9:30am (they close at 10) was pretty full. Since I was by myself, they wouldn't seat me as they only had tables for four. The ones for two were all used. So they suggested I get my food and take it to the bar across the way.Other than that, this is a fairly nice hotel. The room was clean and a decent size. The bed was comfortable and desk was functional. It's located in a safe area, even the police station is minutes walk away!Hommie was great! Even though she's at the front desk, she was willing to help out at the bar when no one was there!
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy to get to if you don't use the Parishuttle. A very nice quiet location on the river next to a very interesting mechanical bridge with nice views. You can watch the brilliant game of 'Bouls' well in to the evening which they used to play in the city on the banks of the Seine. Very handy for the Metro in to the city (of which only 5% of the stations have escalators). There are grocery shops for daily supplies and romantic inexpensive corner restaurants/bars to get the flavour of Parisians. The hotel rooms are modern and clean but NO SAFE so you will have to drag your belongings around with you or leave then in reception. Coffee and Tea making facilities are good. Hanging area for clothes but no drawers, otherwise ok.The staff are brilliant, polite and communicative with lots of advice if needed. (Good maps too!) .Breakfast is a hot buffet and just what you need to start the days touring. Tour operators will pickup from this hotel too! All in all a very good base for visiting Paris and the surrounding area. Holiday in is always good quality, value for money and has continuity.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was super tidy and looked very modern and nice. Our room was comfortable and surprisingly big. We loved the double door in the bathroom which either closes the complete bathroom or just the area of the toilet. The shower doors are a bit unusual to use but are working.The breakfast was good too! So we were very happy and had very nice days here.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was pleasantly surprised by this property. The location is almost prefect. It next to the seine .. you actually get the view from your hotel window. There is a place to walk on the edge. The hotel is between two train stations. The breakfast is quite good, Internet and rooms are spacious. The front office were quite helpful. I would stay here again and again ..
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel was a surprise. A few stops on the metro from the Gare du Nord. Local amenities a short distance from hotel. Situated right by the canal. Pleasant walkway along both sides of the canal. There is also an interesting pont levis next to the building. Room was pleasant. Breakfast plentiful. Staff accomodating and couteous.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice location by small Canal. Hotel nice and clean. Great staff. Peaceful area with good restaurants. Didn't do metro. Only in town 2 days. Caught cabs. Cab into central area 10 to 15 minutes. Great breakfast. Bacon type sausage and eggs were tasty. Plenty of good places to eat with short walk. Highly recommend
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything you wouid expect from a Holiday Inn Express - kettle , coffee , breakfast , clean, efficient, good beds and good hot showers - but what sets this apart is the location right on the Quai De La Seine, overlooking the canal. Our room on the 6 th floor had this great view from the large balcony and we enjoyed watching the runners , cyclists and dog walkers going about their business in this eclectic , safe and bustling neighborhood . Good little French cafes across the road , close to the Metro, and a good walking trail along the canal towards the city center.Wouid recommend !
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here very recently with my husband for a short break during Valentine's. Location was really good and good parking space. Staff at front desk were great at their customer service skills and as the brand is quite relaxed so we could feel that while interacting with the team members. Special thanks to Marc for helping us order our food, Paul was very friendly and the lady that did the checkout for us was very polite and professional(sorry didn't get her name). Sadly I didn't get a chance to meet Perrick but he was very helpful during booking process. All the best and keep doing the great job
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Classic Holiday İnn standarts are also available here.Staff is very kind and hepfullBreakfast is very good.My room was overlooking the canal.l liked the hotel very much.Strongly recommended to stay for any reason.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location- loved it. Off the beaten path for first time Paris visitors but nice to walk around in a more residential area. Lots of little restaurants and bars and very close to subway line.Room- I wish we had asked to be moved on first day of our 7 day trip. Had a top floor room. Size was nice with one large bed and a sofabed. Two major problems- Worst stained carpet I've seen and odors (two totally different types). When we walked in room and saw stains on carpet I thought they had just shampooed since it was very discolored in most places. I never thought a Holiday Inn would put someone in a room with that carpeting. Also since it was raining out I thought maybe the previous guest or housekeeper tracked water in from the balcony. We unpacked and went out for the day. The next morning it was evident that this was just a terribly stained carpet. If this room was acceptable to them then the others were probably the same I thought.The room also had either a VERY strong cleaning smell or on the last 2-3 days was a terrible sewer smell from the bathroom. We had to keep bathroom door shut so we could tolerate it in the bedroom. Neighbors had the same odor issue.The restaurant breakfast was decent. No changes throughout our 7 days but didn't bother us too much.Front desk nice enough. Never said hello or any acknowledgment when we walked by the desk a few times a day. It would have been nice.Will we return? Probably not. I expect better quality of the room.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My niece and I enjoyed our 2 night weekend stay at this hotel. Great location, near two Metro lines, (7 - Riquet) (5- Laumière).....so easy to get around and easy access to central Paris.The room was very good size and relatively modern; big bathroom. With toiletries...very clean. The bed was big and very comfortable. TV had English channels/ English language programmes/news. The breakfast was included, and was good. Included eggs and sausage, breads, fresh jams, cheese, tea, coffee, fruit juice, fresh fruit, yogurt. The croissants were amazing, freshly baked on site , nice and flaky , tender and delicious. Loved the fresh strawberry jam.The staff were friendly.My only negative was that the WiFi was not free as advertised on website. I used my phone as normal because of EU regulations.I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The quality of the room, its amenities and hotel service all exceeded my expectations. The room was clean and comfortable, fitted with other amenities such as a study table and a television. The view of the canal was lovely, and it would be a very pleasant route for joggers in the summer. The heater functioned well. However, the room was not very well-lit, which was more inconvenient than uncomfortable. The breakfast provided (for free by the way!) was also a pleasant surprise - while the eggs and sausages were not fantastic, the wide variety of breads, spreads and cereal was very satisfying and all delicious. The location of the hotel is further from the main attractions of Paris than most hotels, and you need to take a 20/30min metro ride to most attractions. However, this provided a quieter and safer neighborhood to return to each night, and also allowed us to find restaurants that are locals’ favorites. Given the price of this hotel, I find my stay there exceeding my expectations. I highly recommend it for people with a tighter budget, who wouldn’t mind waking earlier and walking further.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its a cozy and nice hotel, staff is very friendly. It has a nice view of the river and park, it is near in the metro. It is highly recommended for the whole family, friends and specially for lovely couple like us.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I always stay here on business. it is close to the train station, quiet and the breakfast is not bad. Rooms are clean and relatively modern. Only knock is there is no fitness center whatsoever so , it is what it is
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: as we found to go anywhere in Paris you need to be near a metro to get around so hotel location is not an issue ,this hotel is perfect for that in lovely neighborhood with the hotel and surrounding bistros and shops ideal . with direct metro link into the centre of town ie the Louvre ,champs Elysee ,would recommend it
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was functional rather than luxury as you would expect with this brand. I had a clean room on the top floor with a balcony that provided a view of the canal. Not a location for someone who wanted to see the tourist view of Paris but very practical with several metro stops nearby. There were 2 cinemas on the canal side and some local restaurants and shops.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the location at the Canal, one of the few quiet and open spaces in Paris. Loads of restaurants all around. With metro line 7 one is in about 15 min in the center of Paris, or one can walk down the canal for 40 min and then up the Seine and be at Notre Dame in a little over an hour. Rooms are clean & modern and the upper floor rooms have a nice view over the rooftops. Staff was friendly, except for a grumpy breakfast staff member checking your room number. Breakfast was ok, continental, nothing special. Will stay there again, a beautiful part to come back to after exploring Paris.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice safe area. 3 min walk from Metro Riquette. Nice little church next door. Small street with restaurants and Carrefour. Clean and well maintained hotel. Excellent Housekeeping. Breakfast Bar is pretty good, only i recommend to add Eggs to the menu (boiled eggs would be sufficient). Young sweet lady working at reception was very helpful she tried to get us in on early check in but was unable to until 1pm.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel look is very beautiful. Many floor are available in this hotel. Many big hotel in this area. Many people are service in this hotel & all service men is very honestly. Hall is very big and clean.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After lot of research I managed to zero down on this place since it looked central and near canal view appeared good.After staying here for 4 nights, I was extremely happy about the overall experience of this hotel. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with all basic amenities.Wifi around the hotel is speedy and works well most of the times. The room lighting though needs a bit of attention though. It’s mostly dim and not so well distributed. The LED lamp at writing desk becomes too bright otherwise.Above apart is a minor feedback though.
