Breakfast menu is a standard stuff without much variety, but sufficient enough to start the day.Special mention to the front desk staff who are extremely warm and courteous, provided great guidance on maps and travel around. They were also hospitable in providing any small things like usual room supplies, lending large hotel umbrellas for stepping out due to rains.There are a few restaurants & takeaways within walkable distances to have good lunch or dinners since Holiday Inn Express doesn’t have meal options.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first trip to Paris. Staff was very friendly. Hotel is very quiet. Carpets were dirty and paint was showing on the carpet in the hallways. Otherwise, it was pretty clean. Breakfast was good. It is a short walk to the subway, where you can take it to the Eiffel Tower. Cab fare is about 20E to get there, train about 4. My trip advisor resevation said complimentary shuttle, to and from the airport. I found out that qas not the case. The driver charged me 60E, and I had no idea, as there wasn’t any sort of notification like a taxi had.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for two nights as part of a longer stay in Paris. We liked having a room with a canal view. There were nearby restaurants and two metro stops. The Paris Plage was going on while we were there (July-August) along the Bassin which was fun to explore. The breakfast was adequate and if you are Holiday Inn group you can get a free cooked egg selection with the buffet. Be sure to go to the top floor to see their active city bee hives if you are interested.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 6 nights so we could do the sights of Paris. Hotel is close to metro lines, which makes it easy to get around. Champs Elysees back to hotel in 35 minutes by metro. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Usual continental breakfast. Eateries and some fast food reasonably close by. Room size was adequate. Does the job.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On arrival we were greeted by friendly staff. Who even said Happy Birthday. The gave me a large room over looking the canal. The room was big and clean but very basic. Also the room had a large patio window that didn’t open. The other window opened a few millimetres. Although it looked out onto the canal there were steel strips that enclosed the whole building so it was not a great view.The breakfast was disappointing and a limited choice.The staff were lovely and very friendly.The hotel was a bit far from Paris centre, but it was only a short walk to station.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 1 night at this hotel. Our room although functional was clean and spacious. If you are looking for a basic no trimmings clean hotel then consider this hotel. Breakfast was continental and basic. The location is right next to a large recreational area on the Villette Canal which has some dodgy areas which are away from the hotel. There was security around and we felt safe. The hotel staff were helpful and for a 1 night stay it was adequate. If your budget doesn't stretch to a 4 or 5 star hotel in Paris, then we would recommend this one be considered.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My only regret with this hotel was that I only booked it for our last night in Paris. I wish we had stayed here the whole time. The location is fantastic, right next to the Seine with an easy walk to restaurants and nightlife, and just a short walk to the Metro. Clean rooms, nice staff. No complaints.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there for two nights in August with two teenagers. The hotel is ideally located to visit Paris, the area safe, pleasant and one street away from local shops and metro.The hotel itself is spacious and clean, with good facilities and the staff provide great customer service (though some don’t speak English).The bedroom was unexpectedly spacious, clean and had a most delightful view of the canal. An added bonus was the secured underground car park where we left our car (as the hotel is only two kms away from the périphérique, it’s very easy to access). Highly recommended.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice hotel with an excellent location. one block from a main shopping area with food, cafes, grocery stores and all other stores. Hairdressers and more. this is next to the canal so lots of foot traffic in the area. Underground Parking available with direct access to the hotel. This hotel price varies, we booked months inadvance and got a VIP room for 160 euro a night prepaid for 2 weeks. excellent value.the room has a real "queen" size bed and a sofa bed. the balcony has a coffee table and chair.the room has a coffee table, desk and chair along with sofa bed.The TV has the option to change the audio language on some shows, very useful.No refrigerator or microwave, but you can get limited ice at the front desk.I just bought a bowl and ice from the grocery store so we had cool drinks when we returned every day.this is a win win hotel.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel last month and had a really good time. The hotel is in a beautiful area of paris full of families and little cafes. It is just a minute or two away from Riquet station which gives you access into the city centre very quickly and it is very cheap too. The rooms were nice, but nothing spectacular. They were imaculately clean as usual and were nice and modern. The canal views were an extra bonus too. For once the TV in the hotel had a really good selection of TV channels which a lot of holiday inns neglect. The bathroom was also nice too and spotless. The breakfast selection was good but not great with a very large continental selection and some very basic hot food. The rest of the food let us down greatly, here's why. The night we arrived there were three members of staff working, 2 receptionists and someone on the bar. At the bar you can order a limited selection of hot food. As it was the night of the world cup semi-final with France vs Belgium the bar was quite busy as they were showing the football. The poor staff were run off their feet. Our pizzas were burned to a crisp and were very poor quality. I ordered a pizza with chicken and bacon on it and I expected that cheese would already be on it. Nope, it was just base with a drizzle of tomato sauce and bacon, no chicken and no cheese. the other meal my Mum had which was a stew like thing was cold and not very nice. But i sympathise with the staff as it was only three people to cook the food, work at reception, work at the bar, clean up the plates and make cocktails. Other than those issues the staff seemed incredibly nice and the hotel was lovely.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:-Staff members are nice. I accidentally dropped my driver’s license and debit card. They return it back to me and they’re very honest. Thank you very much! They also speak English and very friendly. (If you’re a tourist coming from the U.S just ask for tips and direction around Paris. They’re available to help)-The reception area smells good and it’s clean- Breakfast is average. They have baguette, good croissants. I would suggest to add eggs.-Hotel is clean only at the reception area, hallways, elevators, and breakfast area, but not in the actual rooms.Cons;-Rooms have lots of stains. I suggest they should start to pay attention to this. The rooms need some extra level of cleaning because it’s getting old.- Aircon is not working properly- Hard to reach the receptionist. We tried reaching the front desk fasking for a towel, but there’s no clear information how. I suggest they should place a clear post or information to reach the front deskOverall, our stay is okay. Nice place with a canal view. Close to a Metro station. I hope they do some improvement with the Aircon and cleanliness and breakfast menu. Also, water fountain would helpHere’s some photos from our stay 7/22/2018-7/25/2018
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2 nights and the accommodations were very nice. Close to the Metro (Riquet station) made it convenient for us to travel from the airport and around the city. Enjoyed having breakfast, air conditioning, and a lift—not typical in Paris hotels.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Holiday Inn NEVER disappoints. When choosing my hotel for our trip to Paris, I had some specific needs. I needed to park a car (hard to find in Paris). I needed to be close to a metro. I needed a room to accommodate 3. I needed free breakfast. Check. Check. Check. And check! This hotel met all my needs and for an amazing price. The rooms are roomy and clean. The hotel well maintained. The staff super friendly and accommodating. I felt extremely safe, even for a city.The hotel is right on the canal and you can walk along and do water activities, eat, relax, people watch and more. So much to do without even leaving the area!I know there are thousands of choices of where to stay in Paris. I opted for the Holiday Inn brand reputation and was not disappointed. They live up to their name.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very good location hotel. There is a canal nearby. Metro station is also very nearby. The hotel is very good and staff is also cordial. The charges are reasonable as per city of Paris. This is a beautiful location. Breakfast is average.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights during our stay in paris in August-2017.Its located 10 mins walk to a metro station from where whole of Paris can be accessed. We were given a room facing the canal. Wonderful room- Clean , spacious with all amenities. Breakfast was included in the price and was really good.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights for a weekend in the hotel. You get their by subway to the Riquet station with line number 7. It takes about 20 min from the Opera. The station does not have any escalator, thus you need to climb. The walk to the hotel is 5-10min. The surroundings with the canal and open is really nice. The hotel itself has standard rooms which are quite small. Breakfast was good with a selection of hot and cold dishes. Service was ok.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent a good time there, the hosts were very nice snd helpful with each of my demand. The room was nice and clean with view on the canal. With breakfast included a perfect option. Although there is no restaurant in the hotel you have a lot of possibilities close-by. You can also take a walk along the canal and enjoy the sight in the neighborhood.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was really surprised of the bad level of service of this hotel.I came in and they provide me a room that was already occupated by another person.So, no control.I got another room in the first floor that was too noise in the night due partys close to the hotel, la vilette area.Location was nice and breakfeast esa basic.Next time i will choice another hotel un París.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not so far from the city center, near to the metro (around 5 minutes by foot) in a quite and nice place. On the weekend there are a lot of young people enjoying the canal with small boats. Nice and professional staff clean and spacious rooms and a very good breakfast.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated on a short stroll from metro and within a bunch of eateries places. Ask for river view. Very friendly and helpful reception though some had very serious faces. Room was nice and clean . Good shower . Like most hotel it lacks a mini fridge. Breakfast was a good option.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room 203 during our stay a corner room with a view down the canal with the afternoon sun reflecting off the water and ripples projected on our rooms ceiling. Life goes by outside the window with rental boats and people all up and down the canal often late into the night but sound proofing in room was good so no disturbance. Paris is a subway ride away on line 7 about 30 minutes total to the Louvre. Free breakfast was crowded but staff worked really hard to assure food was constantly fresh and replenished. Seating of people seems a bit haphazard but a little patience will see you thru. Staff were helpful in providing power adaptors and travel advice. All in all a very good stay
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 days before returning home. Hubby chose place because it’s cheap, convenient location and free breakfast. Bed is comfy. Only thing I didn’t like is the M7 is crowded most times. But M5 is the other station which is only one stop to Gare d Nord which takes you to CDG airport.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a delightful hotel. Rooms are so spacious particularly for Paris. Position is outstanding on the canal. We were lucky to be on the 6th floor with a wrap around balcony enabling us to view the canal both ways. The waterway is just a thrive a activity with boats people dining on the banks, we spent hours sitting on our balcony taking in the views. Breakfast is more than adequate, and the staff attentive. Reception staff have been outstanding even advising us of restaurants to eat at. Yes you need to use the metro to get around, but that is half the fun and if we can master anyone can. Would I recommend this hotel most definitely. We have thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We leave tomorrow but will be back at the end of the week for another night. The only thing I find missing from the rooms are perhaps a wardrobe and definitely a fridge.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Holiday Inn Express Paris has two hotels. The airport shuttle was a 45 minute wait. Once on the shuttle, I became aware that there were two Holiday Inn Express locations and two different shuttles. As it goes when travel far and beyond, I was on the wrong shuttle. The front desk said they couldn’t help me get to the other Holiday Inn Express. My option was to wait for the shuttle again to take me back to the airport, then again wait for the other shuttle OR hire myself a taxi. It made for a very long night.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at this Holiday Inn last July 2017 and what a great place to stay. Not far from a couple Metro stops, local bars and cafe's. A great local brewery across the canal. Staff was very friendly and helpful for us lost Americans. The only disadvantage is that you are far from the center of Paris, so if you are riding the metro be prepared because the French obviously do not shower every day.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just stayed at this hotel on business trip. The location is good with easy access to metro to get around Paris. The hotel is very clean and stylish. Food at the hotel is limited in the evenings but fine for a couple.of nights. Portion sizes are.good.and staff don't mind making any changes you want. See photo of Grande Charcuterie., very good indeed, would recommend.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decent Holiday Inn Express - much as you would expect: standard, clean, free breakfast, short on frills, shower but no bath.We booked 2 rooms and got connecting ones, 2 singles in one and a double with sofa bed in the other. Only 4 sets of towels... seems odd that this happens so often with a booking for 5, but quickly remedied with a call to reception. Looks like the bathrooms may have had baths once, but have been replaced by large showers. The double door on the shower is just ok, and the single door that doubles as a bathroom door swinging one way and then also a toilet door swinging the other way doesn't work well at all.Some shelf space, a desk, hangers, reasonably comfortable bed. Good value.A bit of a distance from all the tourist attractions - requires a metro or taxi.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a chain hotel, so is clean and well appointed with helpful staff and comfortable rooms.What makes it interesting is its location on the canal, close to some good inexpensive bars, cafes, restaurants and local shops in a lively area frequented mainly by locals. Great walks along the canal.It is not a touristy area, but you won't stand out as a tourist and I found the area friendly and welcoming, with no concerns about safety even walking back from the metro after midnight with my 14 year old son.It is an easy walk from two metro stations: either Riquet (Line 7) or Laumiere (Line 5).
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel during our trip to Paris, nice hotel, location is great as it is close to the metro train, very convenient to stay as it is walking distance at the same time on a small convenience store, the only comment I have is that we were given a room for disabled as the toilet is too high from the floor, otherwise, we have a view of the canal from our room and the room is very clean and comfortable, breakfast is delicious and good choices in the buffet, like scrambled eggs and bacon, tasty breads and croissant. We booked last minute for a ticket going to the Louvre, there Chef de rèception is very helpful, Pierrick Dhennin, very professional and assisted us to get our tickets fast, as it was our last day in Paris and flying early the next day. Will definitely go back to this hotel when we visit again Paris.
hotelName:
24    Holiday Inn Express Paris-Canal de la Villette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights during the recent heatwave with temperatures in the mid-90’s. The rooms were all nicely appointed, and very cool! The rooms are truly French— not a lot of extra space, but nicely appointed, with stocked mini fridge. Beautiful, modern , but small bathroom. Large windows look out onto the very Parisian street views below. There is an elevator— but it’s quite tiny and works better as a luggage lift. It stops halfway between floors, so hauling luggage a few steps up or down a tiny winding staircase is inevitable. Still, with its great location and close proximity to wonderful restaurants, I give it high marks! Would recommend to anyone traveling to Paris to sightsee! Buffet breakfast is available daily in the basement for 13 Euros. Another plus is the shuttle to the airport for 70 Euros. Prompt service and very reasonably priced—Uber would’ve cost our group 140 Euros. Arrange by speaking to the Front Desk a day or so ahead.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very quaint hotel a stones throw from Notre-Dame. It had a very nice and clean room with soft beds and plenty of hot water. The hotel staff were very accommodating and had great helpful hints to explore in Paris. There were many wonderful little cafés in the area to enjoy the French culture. Easy access to Metro. Would return!!
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a fantastic hotel. Rooms good size very modern fit out very comfortable beds hot water +++ management and staff very friendly helpful and informative and very tolerant of non French speakers continental breakfast ample Best part though is staying on Îles St Louis in Paris 2 years ago stayed self contained on the island and decided we would only go back to Paris if we could stay in same area. No traffic good restaurants Great bakery Cheese shop wine merchant etc our favorite cafe St Regis food wine hot chocolate coffee fun staff. Also look out for coolest shirt shop on planet
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The main appeal to this hotel is that it is so centrally located on the quaint Isle St. Louis that so much, including the Metro is easily reached within walking distance. Restaurants nearby are good.The obvious charm is that it is a small boutique experience in a busy city. Yes, the rooms are small which is expected in an old, city hotel. The rooms are clean. Comfort of the bed pillows and bedding is medium and could be upgraded as would the quality of the offerings for breakfast. I could see how getting the correct temp of the room would be challenging. It was either too hot or too cold in a mild December. Most of the Staff did their best to be accommodating. WiFi was spotty which sometimes does not matter but it was an unfortunately crucial time for us to remain connected to our home.Noise can be heard from elsewhere in the hotel, revelers from the avenue and neighbors down the street so you must be used to sleeping in city. It was no fault on the part of the hotel but there was a party (champagne popping, loud music, dancing and signing) directly across the street that went until 3 in the morning on a Midweek night. Other than those issues, we had a wonderful week and would consider staying here again.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel staff (especially Dennis) were very helpful in our logistics needs and advising on area eateries. Good value for money spent. Plenty of hot water for showers. European room size small by US norms, but adequate. Great location for tourists in proximity to attractions and transportation.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small charming hotel located in an old house on the Ile Saint- Louis, on the river Seine- the very heart of old Paris. Fantastic location, in a tourist area. 5 minutes away from Notre Dame. 5 minutes from the Marais/Hotel de Ville, 5 minutes away from the Left Bank and Saint Germaine de Prés. Really excellent for exploring, while being in a romantic, unique setting. The hotel is tiny, as are the rooms. But this is normal for Paris. The bed and pillows were not very much to my liking. Otherwise very clean. Small breakfast offered for 13 euro. Excellent car service offered by hotel for airport transport. Super organized, quick and easy. Reception staff was nice and helpful.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Whenever we travel to Paris we stay at the Hotel Saint-Louis en L'Isle and each time we walk in the front door for the first time, we feel like we're home. During this trip we stayed in one of the top floor dormered rooms. I'll let other reviewers describe the elevator that stops on landings between floors, or the absolutely perfect location on the Ile Saint Louis, or the slope of the dormers on the fifth floor that mean anyone over about 5'5 needs to "adjust" in the shower, or the wonderful balconies on the higher floors that allow you to soak up the ile atmosphere. My love of Saint-Louis en L'Isle is the mix of class and charm, of old and new, and the perfect ease I feel when we're there.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had four wonderful nights at the hotel a couple weeks ago.Fantastic location, it's quiet and you can walk to pretty much everything. Lots of cafe's, restaurants on the I'sle.Rooms are a reasonable size for Paris, a place where rooms and bathrooms can be very small. Bedding was cozy, big shower with lots pressure and hot water.Front desk was a great help, the airport transfers are a big bonus.Recommend and will be returning.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent one night in this hotel having started our trip in Paris at another hotel before leaving to visit Normandy. We then returned to spend one last night in Paris at this lovely hotel. It's in a great location with lots of great restaurants and close to all major sites. It's quieter at night than the hotel we initially stayed at by the Notre Dame which was quite noisy until late at night. The room was on the smaller side but was nicely decorated in soft neutral colours with a comfortable bed. One big bonus was that they also had an elevator which a lot of the smaller boutique hotels don't have. They have a buffet breakfast as well that we didn't get a chance to try. What really made this hotel a pleasure to stay at was the charming gentleman at the front desk. He was so nice and helpful with anything we asked and always greeted us with a smile and a friendly word as we were coming and going. We wished we could have stayed longer. We will definitely return.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I returned to the Hotel Saint-Louis, where we stayed on our honeymoon, for a milestone anniversary and we had a wonderful time. The staff is very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and the bathrooms are very nice. The breakfast is a buffet with nice meats, cheese, boiled eggs, fruit, cereal and bread. The coffee is quite good. You can also order eggs. The neighborhood is lovely and conveniently located to the Marais, the Latin Quarter, Saint German and the metro. The best ice cream shop in Paris is around the corner. I hope to return again for another anniversary.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm astonished at Explore425797's review. I found all of the staff to be extremely helpful and polite during our week-long stay. They helped us find terrific restaurants, navigate the metro, and dealt with my dietary restrictions deftly and kindly. The rooms are really nice and the Isle is a quiet oasis in the evenings. The rooms are not all the same size, we were lucky and got a big one (for Paris), but you might ask when you book. We reserved three months in advance. The location is amazing -- literally in the heart of Paris with metro stops close by. We will return!
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my first review on trip advisor and I had to write one because I am still in shock at the rudeness my husband and I experienced. We walked into the hotel lobby a few days ago and we were unsure we were in the right hotel. When an older white haired man approached I said hello and asked if we were in the right hotel. His response was, "Can you read?" I was shocked. I did not know if he was joking or not. I found out he was not joking when he proceeded to barrage us and tell us that we needed to ask him the question again and phrased how he wanted it asked. What?? Then he continued by stating, "In France education comes first, not like in America". Never will I stay here.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed are stay at Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle. We booked direct so all of our correspondence was with someone at the hotel. They were extremely responsive to our questions. When we checked in the the staff was friendly and helpful; they really made us feel welcome. The room was very nice and most important the air conditioning worked as expected; it was a hot couple of days. The location is perfect; not terribly crowded outside the hotel and you are right next to Notre Dame. And easy access to a couple of Metro stations. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a great location to get to many places throughout the city. The staff got us into our rooms early and were very courteous about making us wait a limited amount of time. AC worked very well and shower was amazing. Checkout was easy and smooth, no issues with that process at all.The downsides we experienced:Toilet didn’t even half enough room for me to sit down with my legs straight and I am barely 5’11”, so beware anyone taller they may be squeezing in. This is somewhat made okay considering the size of the shower, however, which was very large.They require you leave the key at the front desk which seems charming and quaint at first, but we had to wait 5 minutes once as there was no one at the desk and we had to make loud noises in order to make clear our presence in the lobby, so clearly not that secure or safe for the keys to our room if we could have just grabbed the key and went up with no validation or human interaction.The first morning we had someone knock on our door while we were sleeping-in to “check the minibar”, which the housekeeping could easily accomplish while cleaning the room. It somehow took over 4 minutes to accomplish even though I informed her that we had only drank a bottle of water, but she still came in while my wife was in bed, and she did not do anything while in the room that we dubbed worthy of invading our privacy. She then asked if we had received a do not disturb sign, which we had not, and she promptly got us one. Despite this, on our second day we had her knocking on the door by 10:30am, then 11am again, all the while the sign we were given by her saying to clearly leave the room alone for now. My wife was woken up from her nap twice before our flight out that evening. I had to say we were in the room both times, the second time they started unlocking the door (clearly moving the “privacy please” sign aside to access the key hole) before I called out. I understand wanting to clean the room and keep the minibar stocked, but continuously knocking on your guests door and entering their room uninvited to do menial tasks lost the 5th star from us. There is a certain level of privacy that maybe only Americans expect in a hotel, and this was vastly different from experiences we have had at any hotel in our lives. All in all a lovely hotel with extremely friendly and helpful staff, but a few things could be changed a little in order to make this a Five Star hotel, in my opinion. No issues in cleanliness, friendliness, helpfulness, location, amenities, etc. It is simply an execution of daily room maintenance that needs to be toned down or addressed.I highly recommend you stay here.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family of 3.We booked one double and one superior room.The superior room was at street level next to the reception.The street noise was unbearable and started at 7.00am with the waste collection vehicles.We could not open the curtains because the people walking by, could see us inside the room.Both rooms are the smallest we have ever been.The only good thing was the location but I am sure that you can find something much better than this with the same price.Very disappointing:-(((
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're looking for a boutique hotel in Paris the Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle is an excellent choice. It is less than a 15-minute walk to Notre Dame, on a quiet one-way street with virtually no noise at night. There are many restaurants in the area. Breakfast was excellent without being lavish. Rooms were a bit snug but OK. They have an elevator, though depending on where you are you might still have to walk up or down half a floor. I would guess that they have about twelve rooms, perhaps a few more. Staff was very helpful. They own three vans they use for airport pick-ups and other local transport (we also used them to go to Versailles), and the two drivers we used were careful drivers and nice to talk to. I would go to that hotel again.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel Saint-Louis en l"isle is in the center of Paris. It's a ten-minute walk to Notre Dame Cathedral and another five minutes to the Sainte Chapelle, A few minutes walk in another direction and you're at a Métro station. The hotel is clean, the beds are comfortable, the breakfast (not included) is a good value. The bathrooms are small, and storage for clothes is minimal. The staff is very helpful. One terrific service provided is a shuttle from airports and train stations to the hotel. In June 2018 it was 80€ from CDG, and the drivers are very helpful.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed six nights at Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle and could not have been more pleased with the level of service, comfort and convenience. Everything from the communication regarding reservations to check out was handled with promptness and efficiency. The friendly staff were so helpful and patient with us - we are non-French speaking guests and were very appreciative of their assistance in everything from transportation to restaurant suggestions. The hotel arranged for transportation from the airport and this was prompt, convenient and reasonably priced. This location can not be beat. We were literally minutes away from Notre Dame, a short walk from the Louvre, and the Isle is picturesque, quaint and surprisingly quiet in the evening. We were close to the metro and train, and restaurants in the immediate area were quite good and surprisingly reasonable price-wise. The hotel itself is four floors of rooms with four rooms on our floor. There is a breakfast room in the cellar (not free, but reasonably priced with coffee, fruit, yogurt, pastry, boiled eggs - an easy and convenient start to the day). Breakfast is serve-yourself style, so don't be surprised when you are not waited upon. Our room was on the first floor up from reception, and it was comfortably appointed with large windows. All Paris hotel rooms are small, but we were pleasantly surprised to find that we had enough room to unpack and stow suitcases out of sight. We had a nice view of the corner and draperies were sufficient to black out room at night. There was very little street noise after 9pm. The only "noise" we heard was when other guests were directly outside our door in the small vestibule - doors opening or closing and conversation. On one occasion when guests got a little loud in this area, staff were quick to come up stairs and ask them to be quiet. Linens are good quality, beds are firm and comfortable, and the shower was awesome! The room was clean and maid service was prompt and thorough. Toiletries were very nice - shampoo, body wash and lotion, so if you use hair conditioner you might want to bring your own as it's not provided. There is a small safe in the closet. If I had one suggestion, it would be that they could put a hook or bar on the door to hang towels. We didn't need to use the heater, but there was one in main room and in bath.We loved our stay here and can't say enough great things about this experience. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris and we are already talking about returning. Thank you to everyone at Hotel Saint Louis en l'Isle for making our stay so perfect.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we returned as we love this hotel and the location. Last visit was 2014 and nothing has changed - the standards are the same. Hotel is charming and the location can't be beat. We stayed in room 203 all room face out to the Rue St Louis -Rooms are small but functional - we kept our windows open as the weather permitted .However there are times during the night and the morning that noise does enter.Still I would recommend this place and I love to come back.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice old small hotel on a short historic Island street. Comfortable and quiet. Good restaurants and food shopping down the block. Centrally located in the middle of the Seine river. The famous Bernard at reception can be abrupt at times but let's call that local color. It all comes together as a good experience.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having travelled extensively and used many online apps for booking in the last few years, we were astonished by the Receptionist and his rude manner! He took that little rude man almost 30 min to give us the key to our room. We were the only guests waiting.1- I speak French fluently 2nd mother tongue so there is no way he could understand me and made me as2- He could not find the online booking despite our evidences - eventually he managed it - clearly he is in the wrong job and did not give a good impression of the hotel.3- He was on shift on 04.03.18 in the afternoon should the Direction decide to train him on 'Les Bonnes Mannieres' Other than that, the rooms are small but OK. I had stayed in other hotels and can say I will never go back to this one!
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an exceptional stay at this hotel and highly appreciated the attention to our 89 year old mother. Bernard and the rest of the staff made our stay enjoyable and comfortable. This is a small, quaint and fantastic hotel, in a great location, that I'd highly recommend.Bernard helped us with so much. His work there is invaluable.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It a quaint little hotel that really has the Paris feel. The island that it is on is a great location. It is located just behind the cathedral. It is in walking distant to many of the sites in Paris. The shops and restaurants are great. A hidden jewel!!
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice hotel in a GREAT location but beware do not expect AC to work. We were told it would be fixed the next day...and then the next day and so on. The rooms are tight and there is a tiny elevator and some steep spiral stairs. Also not super welcoming to families, the man at the desk often told us to quiet down after we were trying to get all of us in our room (2 rooms, party of 6). But all that aside the location is really unbeatable, close to Notre Dame and the Ile de la Cite metro stop is really close by too. Nightlife on Ile de Saint Louis is just around the corner, but not too loud.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We initially chose this hotel because of its location. But we just had our second visit because the hotel is beautiful, clean and welcoming. We love the location, the delicious breakfast, and the ability to secure their vehicle for the drive to the airport. It has a very nice, handicapped accessible room which we stayed in the first time (although we did not need it). The rooms are nicely appointed and quiet, even on the street side.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We returned to the Hotel for our second visit this year. We were warmly greeted by Bernard who helped us by bringing our luggage up to our room. We were in room 401 which has a wonderful balcony with views of The Seine and the Rue St. Louis en L'Ile. The room is small but very comfortable and spotlessly clean. The bed is very comfortable. It is very quiet at night. Wonderful cafe's are a short walk away along with a great variety of shopping. We found everyone on the I'lle St. Louis to be warm and welcoming. The Metro and the Batoboat are a short walk away. I felt very safe in this area. Highly recommend this hotel for an amazing Paris experience.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a terrific hotel in the center of Paris. Often, there are entertainers on Pont Saint-Louis that are fun to watch. On the Quay Hotel de Ville, just over the bridge on the Right Bank, there is dancing on the weekends. The hotel has are a variety of accommodations, so there is something for everyone. Very friendly and helpful staff always on duty. Would love to go back.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first time to Paris and we wouldn't do it differently! This place is amazing, from the friendly and helpful staff to the comfortable room and amazing location! Our room was on the second floor, small, but plenty of room to move around and comfortable for sleeping....we slept with our window open for some fresh air, but the room was super comfortable (air conditioner was great!) Quiet at night. Perfect location for sightseeing and spending some evenings down at the corner cafes for dinner or a drink after an evening out. Highly recommend! We will be back!!
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is not our first visit to the Saint-Louis, and we will return for our next visit. The hotel is quintessential Paris - charming and quaint. The rooms are smallish, but that is not unusual for authentic Paris, and the lift/stair situation may be challenging for some (curvy stairs and the elevator opens between floors to the curved stairs). Be prepared for the daily 8 am trash pick up, and the possibility of some late night revelry on the weekends, also not atypical in Paris. Bernard and Denis, who have both been there for many, many years, add to the charm of the Saint-Louis in many ways, and while I do not know the names of the other reception gentleman, they were also very nice and helpful. Our room was lovely, and the location is fantastic.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, lovely staff and small but well appointed roomsI have stayed there many times and will continue to return there every time I am in ParisThe Staff are "regulars" and welcome you whenever you return
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and returned for another night before returning home. The rooms are small but well appointed. The beds are very comfortable. Bathrooms clean with spacious showers. The 24 hour reception is great with everyone very helpful to all needs. The breakfast is adequate and tasty. There is a bar just up the road so rooms facing the street can be noisy. Not a problem for us. The location is perfect with multiple metro stations within a 5 to 10 minute walk. The RER line is close for easy transfers from CDG airport (pack light for this). Also a bus stop close by. Many fabulous restaurants both pricy and reasonable within easy walking distance. There is a lift but lands between floors, heavy bags may be hard to maneuver but the gentleman at reception carried our bags. I highly recommend this hotel. Will definitely stay again
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for a week and it was great. The staff was very kind and were happy to suggest restaurants and recommend spots to visit as we went to different parts of Paris. The location was fantastic and we loved being close to the river and Notre Dame. The room was very clean and comfortable. We had booked the shuttle to and from the airport but our arriving flight was delayed so the shuttle driver was not there to meet us. It would have been nice if we got an e mail to let us know. When I called the hotel they told us to take a cab and how much it would cost. The return trip to the airport was early to meet us and we got to the airport on plenty of time.The location is the best and we enjoyed eating dinner at the cafes around the corner and walking around the city from this location. Highly recommend! We will stay at this hotel again and had a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon arriving via a very wonderful and efficient shuttle, we were greeted by a very odd person called Bernard. We were tired and wanted to get settled. Bernard proceeds to take about 30 minutes to get us checked in !!! He makes fun of guests as they walked through the lobby - very strange and scary person. Our room was on the first floor and according to the listing we responded to , was suppose to have air-conditioning. We were shown the air-conditioner controls and we assumed that it worked. The room was very warm when we entered but we assumed it was because it had been closed up. We unpacked and set out to explore Paris. Upon returning we tried to cool down the room to no avail. We could not leave the windows open as we were ground floor and anyone could climb over a 3 foot plexiglass guard on the window. Needless to say - we did not sleep well at all. The next morning I informed Bernard about the air conditioning not working. He stood up - made a dramatic performance of walking to the lobby air conditioner control - slapped the control a few times and said, " I know nothing about fixing air conditioners!" I asked him if he could call to have someone fix it and he said he would. Four hours later he still had not called and obviously he never did! Upon returning to the USA we discovered other people had complained about no air a month before we arrived! They knew it was not working when we checked in and did absolutely nothing to remedy the situation. I am 72 years old and have never been treated so badly by any hotel in my life! Because of the situation I had what we call "prickly heat" all over my body. I actually dreaded returning to our room each evening because it was hotter inside our room than outside. Deplorable condition! Ruined my vacation but stuck it out because this trip was for my daughter and granddaughter. I will never stay there again because of the terrible PR shown to us. If you advertise having "air" and it breaks down - then at least inform us of the situation so we have a choice of staying or leaving. Not being told the truth I cannot abide. Now for the plus side of our stay. Location was fantastic with restaurants and sights so close. The shuttle service was on time both ways and the drivers were awesome. Shower in our room was wonderful but using it made our room hotter. The Parisians were so friendly and helpful everywhere we went outside the hotel. Love Paris but have bad taste in my mouth from the stay here.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: THis is a very Quaint hotel in an historic building. One of the most unique configurations I have ever seen, but definitely not for anyone with a handicap, as the elevator stops between floors. You have several steps to go up or down from the elevator to the rooms. No doubt the elevator (which will only fit two people) was added in long after the hotel was built. The rooms were very nice and comfortable (but small by modern standards). The rooms were very clean and we found the bed very comfortable (on the firm side). I noticed a previous review complained about being hot, but there was a thermostat in out room that ran an air conditioner making the room temperature perfect for our desires. The staff were friendly and accommodating and booked tours for us. We had friends who recommended this hotel to us and I am sure glad they did. The location is perfect, in a quaint neighborhood and just a short walk to Notre Dame.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location can't be beat. Easy access to everything you want to see, in a charming neighborhood with lots of great restaurants and shops, creperies, Berthillion ice cream, boulangeries, grocery, you name it, it is steps from your door. I loved this neighborhood and can't imagine ever staying elsewhere now. There is always free entertainment on the Pont Saint Louis, and it's just an amazing neighborhood. Rooms are very clean, and the shower is great! Great water pressure and plenty of hot water...wonderful after a day of walking all over Paris. Hotel staff, with the exception of one individual, was very kind and helpful. The hotel's shuttle service to and from the airport was very convenient. Yes, you can get a cab for cheaper but you can't beat the convenience. Our drivers were both right on time and very accommodating.Besides the great location, I chose this hotel because it had air conditioning. It's purely a matter of comfort for me, but for my 72 year old mother it is really an essential thing. However, during our visit, the air conditioning in our room did not work. When we informed the front desk person, he really didn't care. He was sort of an odd duck who seemed to enjoy annoying guests of the hotel He put on a big dramatic show of saying he would get it fixed, but he was obviously insincere and it was never fixed during the 8 days we were there. It would not have been bad if we could have kept our window open, because the temps were cool in the evening, but we had a ground level room that faced the street and only a 3 ft high or so plexiglass barrier at the bottom of the window so we could not keep it open while we slept. Anyone walking on the street would see right into our room and could easily hop over the plexiglass to get into the room. As a result, it was stifling hot in the room at night. After the first evening my mom asked for a fan, which they gave her, which at least circulated the air in the room, but it was still very hot. It really put a damper on an otherwise nice stay, and because of this I would select another hotel on the island the next time I visit. After checking reviews on another site, I saw that several reviewers complained about the air not working at least a month before our stay, and they obviously never bothered to fix it. Really blew me away to see that since when we stayed they acted like it was was a recent occurrence. Rooms are very small but that was not unexpected. There is really not room for large luggage..you basically have 2 or three feet on either side of your bed. This wasn't a big deal to us but if you are expecting an American sized hotel room you will be very disappointed.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a small, quirky hotel located at the north end of Isle Saint-Louis and close to Notre Dame Cathedral. The rooms a clean, well equipped 9wifi, TV, AC) and well maintained. There are only a few rooms (about 20) in the entire hotel. Step out of the door and you are only a few steps away from wonderful, small restaurants, creperie and boulangerie. At the end of the island there were several open air cafes. Since we had such wonderful weather, we chose to get our coffee and pastries across the street and eat while sitting on the wall about the Seine River or in the park behind Notre Dame. You have access to several Metro stations nearby. The Left bank is just across the bridge. However, don't plan to bring your car. There is no extra parking on Isle Saint-Louis, but then again everyone if Paris walks.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a sweet small hotel in the heart of the action. Full of restaurants and close to most attractions. We walked to everything from this location and found the staff delightful.All around great choice.and steps from Notre Dame..
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want convenience to the sites its really good for that, but don't expect to sleep in, in the morning as trash lorries arrive very early to take everything away as there are many restaurants in the area. Cleanliness is really good and rooms are tiny but that Paris!!
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stayed here before and we'll stay again. It is a lovely hotel in the center of the universe. We always ask for a high floor room facing the street. Open the windows in the morning and watch the children walking to school up the block, here the church bells ring, smell the croissants baking at the Boulangerie (well, maybe you just imagine that!). We love this small hotel with Parisian charm and personal service. We never want to stay anywhere else
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stopped for 2 nights in this delightful hotel. Location is fantastic, and our first floor room (104) was small buy clean and beautifully furnished. The shower is a revelation, and the water pressure is capable of stripping paint (absolute perfect after a long day walking around Paris). Hotel staff are friendly and exceedingly helpful. We left my wife's GHD straighteners in the room and the maid put them in the safe and the hotel returned them safely. Very enjoyable stay, would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing area directly on this Seine Island in the heart of Paris! The room for 2 cost us 205 Euro (220 USD), was spotless and there was a bathtub. In spite of the many great restaurants the room was perfectly quite and I have not had better value for money here in Paris.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed three lovely nights at this comfortable, beautifully furnished hotel! Our host Denis was very friendly and accommodating - ensuring all our needs were met. The shopping and restaurants near the hotel are exquisite! We enjoyed several lovely French meals very close to our hotel. The location combined with the comfort and affordability make this a perfect choice for your stay in Paris! I highly recommend this fine hotel.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel on the Island of St Louis on the Seine River in 2015. On our return to Paris 2017, we knew this was the place to stay for us. The location is great-- cozy and away from the rush of "big Paris" but close to sites and transportation. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed the restaurants on the island and the small town feel of the neighborhood.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second stay at this hotel on the beautiful Ile Saint Louis. Last time we had the largest room on the top floor, but found that due to the sloping roof we were unable to stand upright in the shower. We downgraded to the fourth floor and a superior room which was fairly small but at least we could stand up in the shower.Sadly, I noticed a fair bit of wear and tear in the hotel – loose door knobs etc. The worst problem was when we wanted to use the iron and ironing board to press some clothes it turned out that the only ironing board was broken. They promised to replace it but we stayed four days and it was always unavailable. Fortunately, we had a travel iron, but ironing on the floor is not terribly successful. This is not a particularly cheap hotel so it was disappointing that they couldn’t replace this item.We did not eat breakfast in the hotel. While it was no doubt much cheaper than outside cafes, it is served in a depressing cavelike room in the basement with no view. With the amazing Café St Regis just over the road with magnificent eggs and croissants and people watching it was a no brainer to eat there each day instead.The location of the hotel is perfect. You can cross the bridges to the Marais or the Left Bank and easily access the metro or the RER. The main street of the Ile has cute shops, together with wonderful fromageries and bakeries as well as a Nicholas wine shop.On our next trip to Paris we will probably stay elsewhere, not that the hotel is bad, but it is quite expensive for what it is and it would be good to experience staying in another part of Paris.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great central location for our site seeing. Very cozy and comfortable hotel with many nice shops and restaurants close by. Notre Dame just across the bridge. Just a few minutes walk to metro. Staff were all very welcoming and helpful. They arranged for a shuttle from/to the airport which was very convenient. We would stay here again!
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very nice room on the front of the hotel. It was quiet. In summer with crowds, it may be noisy. Breakfast was not as good as I would have hoped. Service was good. Rooms in the middle of the hotel do not have windows, but are cozy. Breakfast is adequate and is in an nice room below.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On a previous trip to Paris, we enjoyed our visit to Ile St-Louis and knew that when we returned, we would stay on the Ile. Our Internet search and all the reviews helped us pick Hotel Saint-Louis en I'lsle. Thank you Trip Advisor and all you contributors.The Hotel was just as all the favorable reviews indicate. We stayed on the top floor, Room 502, which is one of the larger rooms (Triple Room "Top Floor"). No complaints on the room and would stay in 502 again. All of the staff were very friendly. Prior to arrival, I had several email correspondences with Denis who promptly would return them with questions/concerns answered (consider the 8 hour time difference if you send an email). About a week before our arrival, I asked Denis if he could make a dinner reservation and he sent back our confirmation. The Hotel has someone at the lobby desk 24/7.First timers to Paris, the rooms are small so please do not complain. The buildings are old, very old, please do not complain.We did use the car service to and from the CDG. It's pricey if you compare it to the train, but we enjoyed this personal service and would do it again. So staying here is nice if you like a quiet respite. Depending if you turn right or left, a short, leisure walk (10 to 15 minutes) can put you into the bustle and noise of the lower Marais, St Germain, or the Latin Quarter. Less than a 10 minute walk can get you to Pont Marie, Line 7 Metro, and then be at the Opera House in 15 minutes. Change trains at Chatelet and you can be at the Arc de Triomphe in less than 20 minutes. The Ile offers decent shops and good restaurants. Hotel Saint-Louis offers you a quiet, friendly, and very nice stay on the Ile. It's Paris, it's ALL good.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Third time we've stayed at this hotel and will go back on next trip to Paris. Our room was on the top floor (5th European, 6th American floor). Room was small with slanted ceilings as would be expected under eves. WiFi could be better (slow and got bounced off). If it matters to you, only two English language channels (BBC $ CNNi).
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is charming, cozy, comfortable. Every person on staff was so professional, friendly and helpful. We were very happy with our accommodations.We got wonderful tips on dining and surviving the metro from Denis at the front desk. We also took advantage of airport transportation to and from CDG which was very reliable. This Isle is a charming little community with quaint dining, shops, and streets that are narrow and quiet.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we travel to Paris, we always stay on Saint Louis Island. The location cannot be beat. I mistakenly booked Hotel Saint-Louis en I'lsle, instead of our usual hotel, but we liked this hotel even better. We had room 501, which was on the top floor and found the room to be very quiet, roomy and comfortable. Denis from the front desk was especially helpful and quite personable. The service was top notch. We will definitely stay at this hotel on our next trip to Paris.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: lovely little hotel, with fantastic service, great location on the beautiful Saint Louis Island on the river Seine. not much room in the room or bathroom, but we got a lovely balcony with fantastic views of all going on up and down the street. small lift or stairs.ok breakfast in the basement, different but nice.only complaint was a constant slamming of the door in the room next to us!
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came here for the location, and it was the right choice to make.ADVANTAGES:--5 minutes to Notre Dame, maybe 10 to Sainte Chapelle, and to all that the Ile de la Cite has to offer--45 minute walk takes you through Luxembourg Gardens and on to Bon Marche and Hermes and the fun of the left bank--another 45 or so, not sure because we kept stopping along the Seine to shoot photos, takes you to Orsay or the Louvre, or the L'Oranerie**if you like to walk, this is a perfect locationBut, if you're tired or it's raining, the Pont Marie metro is just 10 minutes away--advantages also include a strikingly cordial management and staff, with a manager willing to give us a 40 Euro discount for the inconvenience of their hot water system hitting a snag, condemning us to icy showers one morning and a delayed departure another.DISADVANTAGES:--tiny double room, with no more than 3 feet clearance on each side of the bed (where we had to put our bags) and no more than 4 at the foot, where the bathroom door dominated access. French hotel rooms are know for being tiny, but be prepared. --a sofa in the lobby by the manager's desk, but no real place where one might sit a while, except, of course, one of the many cafes along the Ile.--a limited breakfast in a basement room that surely once was the "cave" of the place, but, again, the location of the hotel places you within 50 feet of three creperies if you can wait for a late start.When we come back, we might go to HomeAway to look for an apartment and have more space, but it would be hard to do better than this location and these incredibly nice people.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This small hotel is wonderfully located on Ille St. Louis which is an affluent, urban island in the Seine River in the heart of Paris. Our room was of reasonable size given Parisian standards and nicely appointed. The price was good given the primo location. Convenient stores and good restaurants are on the same street. The staff was very helpful. Hope to return.
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow! What a nice hotel (boutique-style) with well-decorated rooms (though naturally small) in the none-better location of the Isle Saint Louis in the heart of Paris. For only 225E (in Paris!) our room was nice, with a comfortable bed. Staff was friendly and helpful, and we were 5 minutes walk from Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter, St. Germain, the Marais, multiple Metro lines. Loved it!
hotelName:
25    Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small hotel in the 8th arrondissement of Paris.I stayed on the 1st floor but due to repairs that needed to be done I was moved to the 6th floor the next day, in a room with a double bed!Rooms are bright and clean.Breakfast was basic but ok.Staff was kind and friendly.All in all a very good experience. I would definitely visit again.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Haussmann Saint Augustin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: conveniently located and extremely helpful Romanian staff. We had the roof window with opens into the sky. Rooms were clean and sufficient. Only one issue i had was that house-keeping ignored my Do Not Disturb sign. Makes a dent on a positive stay.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Haussmann Saint Augustin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I were stay at this hotel for 4 nights.I love my room very cozy and clean and the bed is very comfortable.The size of the room is good enough for 2. The location is excellent But from the first night we arrived there the internet was not working at all.after 5 days it was still not . we complain a a lot to the reception also the owner of the hotel. But nothing happen. they offer us the next hotel internet to use at lobby.I think this is very bad point for a hotel and make our trip tough.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Haussmann Saint Augustin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a good location like 10mins walk to champs-elysees, new inside, eco friendly.. rooms are stylish clean and you are in the square like 3min walk with brasseries, also around some bars. Like it!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Haussmann Saint Augustin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Haussmann for 3 nights and I couldn't fault it. Great spacious room that was kept very clean. Hotel is within walking distance of a couple of metro stops and it was very easy to get around Paris from. I would certainly stay here again!
hotelName:
26    Hotel Haussmann Saint Augustin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Normally I‘d give five stars for service, room, staff and breakfast. But unfortunately the last day of my stay 100€ in Cash disappeared from my room. I do not want to make wrong accusions, I just suggest to be careful where to store worthy things.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Haussmann Saint Augustin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great neatly appointed room, lots of plug sockets, a tempur pillow amongst others, a direct usb charging port, lovely lighting and mirrors and a comfy bed. There is aircon so you can adjust the temperature as you wish. I was on a higher floor so the street noise was barely there and the blinds very effective in keeping out daylight. The shower room was beautifully tiled and styled. The breakfast spot on: cold meats and cheeses, freshly squeezed orange, fancy loose teas and lovely confiture options. The lady who runs with breakfast clearly takes pride in it. I would get it included in the room price though as it is €15 on its own. Simple, stylish and straightforward
hotelName:
26    Hotel Haussmann Saint Augustin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed out stay, we arrived after midnight and had no issue checking in. All of the staff were very friendly. The room was very nicely decorated, I believe the hotel has recently been renovated. The room was bigger than I expected with a spacious bathroom. Hairdryer in the room was very good and there was soap and a nuxe hair and body wash. There was a mini bar in the room and a Nespresso machine. Breakfast was good, nothing too fancy but it was perfect for us. A selection of cold foods, fruit, cheeses, cereal, bread etc and there was also was also sausages and scrambled eggs. The location was excellent, very nice neighbourhood walking distance to the champes elysees. 30 mins to both the louvre and the Eiffel tower, although we used uber and the metro to get around both very affordable. I hope to stay in this hotel again.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Haussmann Saint Augustin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was booked as part of a package and proved to be the best hotel I've stayed in whilst in Paris over a number of years. It was in a quiet location and yet had easy access to two nearby Metro stops and restaurants which were frequented by locals as opposed to those simply geared to the tourist trade.The reception staff were, without exception, so pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was a typical continental spread: juices, cereals, fruit, cheese, ham, coffee and an assortment of teas.Our room was surprisingly big for a city centre hotel with plenty of wardrobe space, power points and a large television. The only slight issue we encountered was the shower screen was not a good fit and water leaked out onto the floor. The wifi was free and reasonably reliable. I have already recommended this hotel to a friend who is looking for Parisian accommodation next Easter.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Haussmann Saint Augustin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really nice welcome by the staff, an upgrade helped !Funky room, quiet, slept well. Lolly treats too, All good. I work nearby but the hotel is closed to Opera, shops and restaurants so good for tourism as well.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Haussmann Saint Augustin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a 3-star hotel but its hardware, the room and amenities, easily surpass most 4-star establishments. Safe deposit box, large TV, minibar, real coffee machine plus separate kettle, state-of-art shower, very good Internet, are all there in a very modern and well-decorated spacious room. The lobby even serve coffee and croissant free.The location is in a good area but not the most convenient, about 12 minutes walk to Opera and 8 to St Lazare. One of Paris's best choice depending on the actual rate.In Paris I have used nearly 100 hotels from 3-star to Mandarin Oriental and Park Hyatt. This hotel ranks very high on my return list
hotelName:
26    Hotel Haussmann Saint Augustin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where to begin with this awful place...the walls are paper thin between rooms, I heard every word of conversation each night from my neighbors, and they weren't talking at an unreasonable level. I reserved two rooms for me and my friend, we both had our 'do not disturb' placards on our doors, we were travelling abroad and didnt want someone in our rooms with access to our things - the hotel ignored the signs and cleaned the rooms anyways, and hid the dnd placards. When I called the front desk to ask why they ignored their own signs, she stated they checked to see if we were sleeping first and they didnt see the problem since we werent there, I then read them the language that is on their dnd door signs which states 'i do not want my room cleaned' - she said sorry and hung up. Then there's the 'room service' - after decades of travel, I've never seen anything so awful. I ordered a beef dish with potato salad and a soda, which costed about $40 US - what I received was some rolled up cold lunch meat and potato salad so vinegary it was inedible, it was in a plastic container as if they got the meal from a convenience store take out, this was bad food for the US, let alone Paris, maybe the worst food I've ever had anywhere, and for an outrageous price. The a/c in my room would shut off for no reason intermittenly and the unit made some horrendous noises as if it was leaking water. While the location is great, this was my worst hotel stay of all time, stay somewhere else, anywhere else.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Haussmann Saint Augustin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very happy to stay here for a couple of days. The personnel helped us a lot, the rooms were clean (this is an important thing in Paris). It is very well located, a walking distance to several important attraction points. I would recommend it to anyone.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Haussmann Saint Augustin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed last month for one night with most of my team(11 people)for a sales meeting. Hotel was perfectly located for the office's location,in a nice central area with plenty of bars and shops around. The hotel is recently refurbished and the rooms are very nicely decorated.Bed and pillows were great,I had a wonderful night's sleep,even after a late night! Tea/coffee platter was a godsend.Very clean bathroom and good shower but my shower gel dispenser was empty, good that I had brought my own.Strong wifi,good enough for streaming.The smoke detectors are VERY sensitive as we were awoken by it at 6.45 AM the next morning.Safety First I agree but apparently it happened before. The lift needs an upgrade.Breakfast the next day was plentiful and with good quality products.The staff was efficient and friendly but the lady at reception has no knowledge of the area and could not recommend any bar around the hotel. Overall it was a very good experience and probably our hotel of choice for our next meeting.
hotelName:
26    Hotel Haussmann Saint Augustin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two nights at the start of our trip and two more at the end. The staff we so helpful, gave us tips on how to get around and where to find what we needed. Rooms were all we needed. We got two single beds that were pushed together. We slept really well. Breakfast was really nice. This is where we will stay whenever we return. Thank you Madjid and Julia.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is quaint, charming, clean and comfortable. The staff are warm and friendly, very efficient and responsive. For the price, it is a real find. Wonderful, full buffet breakfast, and convenient to the Sorbonne and Notre Dame. I appreciated that there's an elevator! A joy to stay at this family-run hotel.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed at this hotel three times in the past five years--for my 25th and 30th wedding anniversary, and once in between. I just love it. The location on a quiet street in an area teeming with history is perfect, yet it's just a hop, skip and a jump to all the bustling activity around Notre Dame cathedral and surrounding neighborhoods, full of restaurants and stores, modern and ancient buildings, and also right off Boulevard Saint Germain, which is a fantastic street for markets and stores. The rooms are well-decorated and updated, and every bit of space is well-utilized. Comfortable sized bathrooms and good showers as well. Wish I was there right now. The hotel itself is historic and I love the spiral staircase and timber-framing in various parts of the building. They even sent me birthday e-mails! It will always be my hotel of choice in Paris.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was perfect for my trip! The room was quaint, clean, and cozy. The location could not have been any better. Right in the heart of St. Germain, it was not noisy, yet so close to all of the best bars, restaurants, and historical sites in the area. Plus, the staff was extremely accommodating and helpful. Would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly and helpful staff. Very clean quaint facility. Location on the left bank is great for walkers to all must see locations. Easy connections to the Metro. 24- hour concierge service knowledgeable about the City. Easy access to all major universities.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hotel in Paris on the recommendation of two of my staff who had stayed there in recent years. I knew Paris a bit, so a hotel in the Latin Quarter was a good fit. I must say that my partner (Michelle) and I could not have been happier with this pick.I like that it is a small hotel on a quiet street. I knew this before arriving. The bonus was the wonderful helpful staff and the charm of the hotel. And our room may have been the best in the place - Number 54 - with a large balcony which got good use. And it did not hurt that the price was very reasonable for Paris.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here about 6 years ago and were eager to enjoy this hotel again. We liked it’s quiet location on the left bank, about a block from Boulevard Saint-Germain and a short walk to the Seine. There is a tiny elevator which we really appreciated at the end of a long day and when checking in and out. The lobby and breakfast areas are somewhat elegant yet inviting. Our room had two large windows that brought in a lot of light and air. As well, the lighting in the room and bathroom were exceptional. It may be the first hotel where I didn’t wish I’d brought a light bulb. The closest was very large with built-in shelves and a safe. Bed, pillows and bedding were very good. Plenty of convenient outlets. There is no AC but there was a ceiling fan and a vertical floor fan. Room also had a desk, two chairs, a built in shelf for your suitcase and several hooks on the wall near the door— a nice amenity for jackets and hats. Bathroom was spacious with a good tub/shower with quick and plentiful hot water. There were enough towels and towel bars and a built in shelf to store your toiletries. The only thing I would change in the room would be the carpeting. We had breakfast three times—price was extremely reasonable and the dining area felt like we were in a fine restaurant. The hostess was very pleasant and brought a pot of coffee and hot milk to our table. Three types of cold meats, two or three kinds of cheese, jams, baguettes, croissants, chocolate croissants, cereal, yogurt, cut up fresh fruit and whole fresh fruit were available. Three mornings we only wanted coffee and my husband went down and picked up a tray of coffee and hot milk. The front desk is staffed 24 hours per day, and without exception the staff were friendly and helpful. I frequently saw them helping other guests and they kindly made taxi reservations for us. Definitely the hotel for us when we next visit Paris!
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is homely and charming. The rooms are very clean and its location is exceptional! Right in the center of the Latin Quarter, a 10-minute walk from Notre Dame and 10 minutes from the bar area. The hotel staff were all very nice and helped us far beyond what we expected. warmly recommended.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
