review_body: We stayed at this hotel for one night with nice experience. it is very clean, neat, cosy and with very friendly staff.Location is quite conveniet, short walking distance to Metro station. parking garage nearby. but, I think walking from hotel to the near tourist spots is no problem. I will definately recommand this hotel.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As other people here have pointed out, this is a truly excellent base to visit Paris at an affordable price. It is in the heart of the Quartier Latin, only minutes away from the Sorbonne, the Pantheon, Bvd St Germain and Notre Dame, but is situated in a quiet street. Staff are exceptionally cordial and supportive. Our room was very warm and nice, not large but cleverly arranged so as to make maximum use of space, and impeccably clean. Two large windows let a lot of light in. Good breakfast. We will definitely come back.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for three nights before heading to Luxemburg to visit our daughter. The room was comfortable, clean and decent size for Paris. The staff were friendly and helpful. The cost was moderately priced. The location in the Latin Quarter was ideal, plenty of restaurants and sights to see. Metro was nearby, five minutes walk. Be aware elevator is very small. The breakfast was good.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This has become my "go to" hotel for Paris stays. It is clean, modest and cozy and offers a reasonable moderate rate. I love the location in the Latin Quarter by the Cluny Museum, two metro stops, many bus lines. lots of restaurants, movie theatres, a variety of shops and the list goes on. As the name signifies, it is close to the College of France as well as other institutions of higher learning, such as the Sorbonne. I find it an easy walk from here to many attractions, including the Cathedral of Notre Dame, Seine, Hotel de Ville, Pantheon and Luxembourg Gardens. Our one-week December stay was my third in 2018 and we experienced no drawbacks. The staff, without exception, are friendly, professional, extremely helpful and gracious. Our room on the second floor, though small, had everything that we wanted, from a firm, comfortable bed to outstanding lighting and plenty of power points. It overlooked a courtyard so was absolutely quiet. Housekeeping kept the space immaculate. The mirrored closet offered plenty of space for our clothes with sufficient hangers and shelves. We enjoyed having a bit of desk space and two chairs. We opted to eat breakfast here three mornings. At 10 E (about $11.40 U.S.), I considered the small buffet to be good value with offerings such as a hot drink, bread, rolls, pastries, cheese, fruit salad, juice, water, sliced meats, eggsand cereals available.I look forward to another stay here in the spring. And, as always, I expect to find the best rate on the hotel's website.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice, friendly and helpful staff, good location close to many major attractions, the room was perfect for 2 persons. It was everything that we hoped for, thank you for a nice stay. Breakfast was good, they cleaned the room every day and reception always available.BR Nicolai & Cecilie.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights in November. The staff were very helpful and the room was very comfortable and clean.OK it is quite small but this is the centre of Paris. It represents good value for money and it is nice to stay in a more friendly and personal hotel (as opposed to corporate).We were on the 5th floor which was really nice and the location could not have been better.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff that speaks english, great balcony room! Very close to Notre Dame. I loved the location because it was easy to reach from the airport (if you follow the instructions on the website) and a wonderful starting point for the day's adventures. The bed was comfortable and the wifi was reliable. I would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, although not as cheap as it once was it is still a good deal for. The rooms are clean, well kept and the staff is exemplary. The location is quiet. Only 2 blocks to a metro , most basic stores and (somedays) fresh market. a few (5) minutes to Notre Dame, Luxembourg, the Pantheon and St Michelle.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A boutique hotel in a convenient location. Five minutes walk to Norte Dame.great restaurants and shops. Good continental breakfast.friendly and helpful staff.have used this hotel four years ago. Not far from the Pantheon and Luxembourg gardens. Small elevator but good for 2-3 people.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very well maintained small private hotel in a good location. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Good continental breakfast available.Comfortable lounge to wait in if you need to come early or rest after check out time. Exceeded our expectations.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Waking distance of Notre-Dame and the lively Left Bank and Latin Quarter, but nice and quiet. We left the windows open all night and didn’t hear a thing! Very helpful desk... they spoke English and called taxis and gave recommendations for places to eat.Beds were very comfortable. Roomy rooms... could even see the top of the Eiffel Tower. Bathroom was a good size with tub and shower head.Clean an neat... service cleaned while we were out. There’s a little breakfast room downstairs serving a light breakfast in the morning for a bit extra. There are cold drinks sold at front desk.Free internet— password given at check-in. Small elevator (one person at a time with luggage), but to be expected. I would definitely recommend!
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A little gem - not too expensive, a few minutes walk from a metro station - we paid a little more to have a room with a balcony which was lovely. The room was small (it is Paris after all!) but had everything we needed.Main reception areas are a little dated but we only spent a few minutes there so it wasn't an issue. We will probably stay again if we head back to Paris, recommend!
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are so happy with this hotel, we stayed for a week and everything was perfect, they helped us with everything we needed. The location is as central as it gets, we walked practically anywhere (bot there are a lot of transport options nearby). The street itself was very quiet and we could sleep comfortably with the windows open. We booked a room with a balcony and it really made our stay. The wifi works without any problems.I also like to note that the elevator broke one evening, but Sebastian called a service and it was fixed in less than an hour and that's really great service! Also my partner got sick, and they really helped us with medical tips and directions for the nearest and best hospitals.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found location to be very convenient, an easy walk to many sites and restaurants. Yet was on a quiet street, whichallowed for peaceful sleep. Big opening windows to brighten the small room. Room was cleaned well each day, hotel was kept well maintained. Staff was friendly and helpful. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just finished 3 days in beautiful Paris and was very pleased with the hotel. It is very close to the metro and was close to tons of bars and restaurants. They ask to leave the key when you leave which was no problem for us. We were in room 32 and had floor to ceiling windows that opened to a standing balcony. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was clean and had hot water.I cannot wait to go back to Paris and would happily stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Simple amenities, but clean, has an elevator and air conditioning! HIGHLY recommended if you'd rather spend your money on paris sites and food, but still want a decent hotel. great proximity to Notre Dame, Latin Quarter, Luxembourg gardens, etc.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was very kind, always trying to help. The room is cleaned every day and it's tidy. The breakfast is not so various, it's one and the same every day but despite that it's good. The location is great - you have a metro station with RER access very near - about 5 mins walking. The Pantheon, Luxembourg gardens and Notre Dam are 5-15 mins walking.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I hate to review this gem of a hotel near the Sorbonne since I want it all to myself. It had a very nice room with a double balcony that overlooked the streets of the left bank. We had twin beds that were very comfortable and a full marble bath with shower and bidet. It is a true Parisian experience staying there and just walking out this charming small hotel to the streets of Paris. The metro was close by as was Norte Dame. The breakfast was E 10 and more of a continental offering. There is no AC but the ceiling fan was powerful and the breezes cool from the double balcony
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This August was warm, so the room was warm.Breakfast was 10 Euros unless included in package and wasn't worth it. We walked down the block to LuLu's and had a great cappucino and warm breakfast.Photos on their website are misleading outdated as is the photos on Tripadvisor.Plastic cup in bathroom was so cheap in cracked as i held it.Taxi fare from Degaulle airport is a flat 55 Euros to the hotel no matter if its one or four persons. Don't use a private service arranged by the hotel. Great location!!
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the 2nd time we’ve stayed here & again, were very happy with our stay at Hotel du College de France. The receptionists (Stephanie & Magid) were very helpful and accommodating. The breakfast was a good deal for all you get. The location is very desirable as it’s close to most sites you’d want to visit including the metro station, bus and the RER. We will certainly be returning to this hotel when we visit again and would recommend it to all friends & family too.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very close to Notre Dame on a quiet street. There is no AC but the fans that are in the room are fine and that's all that you need even in August weather. My boyfriend and I stayed here for four nights. Sebastian, the evening receptionist was very helpful in assisting with calling Air France to update the address on where our luggage needed to be delivered and communicated it. He was very nice and apologetic understanding how difficult it was to be on a vacation for 9 days and not have our clothes show up until day 8. I highly enjoyed my stay here it is very quiet and the staff do really care about trying to help you. The sheets were clean and everything was working properly.I would definitely stay here again on my next trip. Also I recommend restaurant Lou Lou for breakfast right around the corner on St. Germain st.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed twice: at the beginning of our trip and at the end of our trip. We used Paris to launch and land for the TMB. Hotel was recommended by a friend and it was all that she said it would be. A sweet find in a great location. I will book again with this hotel. Nice views and a cozy room. Thanks to the staff for helping us have a great stay. Looking forward to the next time. ❤️
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed one night, but would love to go back. The rooms were clean and spacious (by local standards). There were big windows and a ceiling fan, which were perfect for the heatwave at the time. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. There is a safe in the room, as well as a microwave. The location cannot be beat - Latin Quarter close to everything, yet on a quiet street. We would definitely go back.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first trip to Paris, and after extensive research I ended up booking 3 nights at the Hotel du College de France. The hotel was so charming- very "old world" feeling. The staff was friendly. The room was small but clean and comfortable- we loved the large windows that we could open onto the street. There was no air conditioning, but there was a powerful ceiling fan. The bathroom looked newly updated. We ate the hotel breakfast, which was simple but good. The location was outstanding- we explored the city on foot, and were able to easily visit Notre Dame, the Louvre, and many small attractions of the 5th area. I would go back in a heartbeat!
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed again at this excellent little hotel - always such helpful staff, nothing is a bother. Spotlessly clean facilities, great bed and quiet surroundings for sleep! So close to everything including Latin Quarter shopping and restaurants, Notre Dame, the Seine and hop on hop off tourist buses. Good reasonably priced breakfast. Thanks Marc for another perfect stay and we will return next year.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This boutique hotel in the Latin Quarter has easy access to a lot of cafes, a market, the metro and Notre Dame. So many cafes in that area that we never did try their €10 continental breakfast. Our room #523 was teeny tiny with just enough space to walk around the queen bed. The bathroom was also very small with a funny configuration and awkward with a step up into the shower. My husband (6’3”) and I (5’4”) could barely squeeze into the shower. Our daughter’s room #23 was slightly larger with a better toilet/sink configuration and tub/shower. In hindsight we should have switched rooms since we booked six nights. Paris was experiencing a heat wave the week we there and this hotel does not have air conditioning. The rooms are equipped with a ceiling and oscillating floor fan but it was so hot we had to open the windows and doors to get cool night air. Since both rooms faced the street, barking dogs, cars, trucks, motor cycles, and people partying made sleeping difficult. The double pane windows would have kept street noises to a minimum but without air conditioning, our room became a sauna as soon as we closed them. Our rooms were clean, the bed was comfortable and the staff are very helpful. Our daughter was scheduled to fly from Paris to Amsterdam the next day but at 14:00 hours Sunday afternoon she was notified that her flight on Monday was cancelled. As a result she had to depart immediately and the hotel did not charge her for the last night for which she was very grateful.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In St Germain touristy area, the hotel is nicely laid out and the staff very friendly.Fortunately, their English is better than my French.We were upgraded to room 62 which had a little balcony from which you could see the Eiffel Tower!!Room was small but clean and comfy bed. No a/c but fans were sufficient.Enjoyed our stay and would stay again.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located conveniently on the Left Bank and near many of Paris’ major attractions and lots of restaurants, this hotel has recently been renovated. The staff can provide a list of local restaurants. Room sizes, as usual in Europe, are based on price. We had a small room on the 5th floor; it had a good bed and was efficiently and comfortably appointed and arranged. No air-conditioning, but a good, quiet ceiling fan over the bed. The bathroom was very small and had a hairdryer. Our room looked into an interior court so was very quiet. We didn’t have a car, but I believe the hotel does not have parking. Who would want a car in Paris anyway? The staff is quite helpful and speaks English. Our room price included breakfast, but frankly the breakfast was poor, and next time, we would book without breakfast and head out to a café. There is a tiny elevator for all floors except level 6. You can’t beat the hotel’s location, and the room price is a very good value for a big city like Paris. This was our second stay here, and we would stay here again.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a room with a balcony and we did have our own bathroom. Be prepared for very small rooms, without AC, but they do provide fans. There is an elevator, but it barely fits a person with a suitcase, may not even be big enough for a wheel chair. No mini fridge. Breakfast is offered, but it's $10 euros a person and they don't provide many options. There are lots of cafes that are within a couple blocks of the hotel. Great location for getting around and seeing the sites.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from 4 nights at this lovely hotel. Fantastic location. Lovely staff. Rooms small but everything you need. Spotlessly clean. In answer to a recent review about the beds being uncomfortable we found the beds excellent and slept well. They are fantastic Expeda mattresses. Maybe the previous reviewer doesn't like a firmish mattress? Good continental breakfast. We will be returning as soon as possible.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is typically small (for Paris), but well organized and brilliantly located. The difference is the helpfulness of the counter staff, who were always available and always courteous. If you're not the stair-climbing sort you might ask for a lower floor, but there is a small lift. We'd stay here again very happily. Merci!
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super friendly staff, great location, reasonable prices. Not super-posh, but our rm had everything we needed, including a lovely balcony with table, chairs, and a view of the Eiffel Tower. Definitely would go back, in a heartbeat.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friends who have stayed here for years recommended well-situated (on western edge of Latin Quartier) Hotel du College de France as having nice rooms, friendly staff, and a "can-do" attitude for their guests. We experienced all of this and more...and, we're already planning a return. Highly-recommended!
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed two nights in Paris. Great location and reasonably priced. Room was clean and staff were very accommodating. Opted for buffet breakfast and it was a good decision. Lots of food choices close by to hotel. Latin Quarter had a lot to offer. Also convenient to metro and RER.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros about this hotel: location and great service. The hotel is clean and the balcony option is appreciated if the weather permits.Cons: the bed is more than uncomfortable. It is the worst bed in my entire travel experience. The hotel is outdated and there is no AC. You can find better option with the same budget in this area.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In a quietish side street not far from the Sorbonne. Small but well presented rooms with everything you need. The breakfast buffet is very good value for money. Good attention to detail and friendly, helpful staff.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small Parisian hotel centrally located. Rooms are small (as expected in Paris), but clean. Like others have noted the towels are rough and the lack of ac could be a problem on warm days. Given that it is so close to bars and restaurants it can be loud on the streets at night. If you are looking for an affordable hotel with clean and well maintained rooms and helpful staff this is your place.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Full marks again. This was our 5th stay at this hotel. Clean, comfortable, friendly and only 5 minutes from Notre Dame. We will be back for our 6th visit. The rooms are quite small but facilities are clean and modern. A French atmosphere with charm. Fantastic!
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After having our flight cancelled by Air France we needed to find a hotel for the night. Having stayed here before we knew it was a safe bet so booked it quickly before someone else did! Both rooms were clean and spacious. One room had a street view which was really nice. How can you not like watching Paris go by. The second room unfortunately had a view of a vent pipe and interior rooftop. It was private but it could be made to look much nicer. Having said that it was very quiet. The staff at the hotel were polite and friendly at all times and kept our luggage so we could spend our last day without taking it with us.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We always enjoy our stay at Hôtel du College de France! The hotel is on a quiet street between Boulevard Saint-Germain and Rue des Écoles near the College of France and Place de la Sorbonne with easy access to metro stations for visiting all the sites of Paris. Finally, we most appreciate the welcoming, helpful and very kind hotel staff!
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel all over the world for business staying at great hotels and the Hotel du College is certainly going to be a favorite on my list. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The location is fantastic. The rooms are spacious and warm that I enjoyed arriving back from work each night to relax in my room. I will be recommending your hotel to all my friends and am already looking forward to returning in the next few months
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and me stayed at this for 4 days. All the positive feedbacks about this place are 100% true!The hotel location is perfect. Very close to subway stations and many sights.We had a small but clean room, equipped with everything necessary and comfortable for 2 persons for overnights.Also there is a small elevator which is very important!Wi-Fi worked properly. The breakfast was really good enough, including some choices of cheese, ham and fresh orange juice!The hotel managers were extremely polite and helpful! It was very good experience of staying in this hotel for a short visit to Paris!
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel in an excellent location. Enjoyed and will be glad to return. Parking nearby in a municipal parking lot for 36 euro per 24 hrs. Will be glad to return. Only 2 stars but provide all you need
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Collège de France is a charming small hotel that has resisted the outrage of time. It is well located in the Quartier Latin, within walking distance to the RER and major historic sights. The street is quiet so no problem for sleeping. The reception was warm. The front desk staff was always welcoming and very helpful . The rooms are small according to North American standards, but well designed. They are also well kept. Beds and linen are comfortable. The breakfast room is small and cosy and food of high quality. Happy to recommend this hotel for a stay in Paris.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in December for 3-nights. The Hotel Du College is perfect. It is close to the major tourist sights in the Latin Quarter, within walking distance to the River Seine, the Church of the Notre Dame, Pantheon, good restaurants, stores, bakeries, and everything you need. The rooms are well equiped and clean. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, all of them. The only complaint was the breakfast did not have much food left on the one day we tried it, but we arrived a little late. It was cheaper than a restaurant but not much selection of food. Other than that I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good hotel at a good price.
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a lovely time we had here for four nights. Everyone was so friendly from the reception staff to the lady who cleaned our room. Not what I was expecting at all. Very pleasantly surprised. I think it's the staff who really make this hotel work. Well done to you all!! The rooms are not big. We had one with a small balcony which was great to look over Paris and listen to Notre Dame's Bells, but very clean and large French windows. Maybe two English channels on tv. Safe in room. Small foyer where breakfast is served. Ten euros. Quiet street near the metro and hundreds of restaurants!!! Ten minutes Notre Dame. Eiffel Tower 30 minute walk. I particularly liked the Latin Quarter where the hotel is located. Rue mouffetard worth a look. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I hope to return to this little oasis of serenity very soon!
hotelName:
27    Hotel du College de France
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lady at the front desk was lovely, spoke good English and was very helpful. Good facilities and location, close to the Metro. Really enjoyed our stay . Would stay here again if we return to Paris in the future.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This summer my son and I had the opportunity to spend a few days in Paris before heading south to meet my sister and niece by the Mediterranean. As it was the first trip to Europe for both of us, I wanted to be sure that every detail of this experience was special, including even the name of our hotel in Paris, reflective of my son’s name. Not only did Jack’s Hotel live up to each and every expectation, reflected on their website, but was essentially what made our stay in Paris one of the best of our lives. From the moment we were greeted with such a warm welcome upon our arrival which continued throughout our stay (even the late conversations while awaiting our Uber Eats), to walking into our room and opening the window to inhale the beauty of Paris, there isn’t any doubt in my mind why my son declared Jack’s Hotel to be the absolute favorite one we have ever stayed in.I say, please don’t change a thing and keep it as quaint and amazing as it is right now!
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay and everybody was great, so friendly and so helpful, they really made us feel at home! It was a great pleasure to stay there! The breakfast is very nice, good cheese, croissants and coffee, the staff is very welcoming and ready to help, there are lots of places to eat around, close to the public transport, very comfy room (despite being small, it was very clean and homey). We were delighted! Thank you!
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great boutique hotel, very quiet, very clean and a comfy bed! The staff were all very friendly and helpful! Breakfast served makes it nice and easy. Location is a few minutes from the metro which made exploring so easy!
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location - short walk to the Metro, shops, restaurants & cafes. Our room was compact, clean & warm. Had a lovely balcony with nice views. Breakfast was good with choices of cereal, fruit, yoghurts, eggs, croissants, pastries & toast.  Hope to go back in the future.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Jacks Hotel is very closed to the metro with restaurant and market in the area. Street very quiet. employes awareness with smiles. smell the croissant on th emorning it help to wake up with good feeling !
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loads of budget hotels. I chose this on because of price, value and quiet street near metro.Unexpected bonus was electric shutters to block all light from outside. Everything in room was modern and worked, even the heating/air adjusted room temp quickly. Bathroom was clean with adjustable hose in shower. Staff were pleasant. Only complaint is emails start arriving before we even arrive and as soon as we check in. Unsubscribe. Full points on service.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for three nights on November 2018. Everything was very good: the location, the staff in the front desk, the breakfast (good and plentiful), the room (nice and cosy). Even though the bathroom was the smallest one we have ever seen, it was very well equipped. A big plus for cleanliness. We recommend this hotel and we will definitely come back sometime. Thank you for the hospitality.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, economic, staff very nice through 24 hours, close to underground Campoformio, close to minimarket and in a quiet part of the city. Rooms are small, but full with all you need. In Suite you can find tea and coffee.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Jacks hotel. Down a quiet road but everything you need is near. Metro just a short walk which takes you to all destinations, Eiffel tour, Notre Dame etc. Definitely will recommend to friends and family, we plan to come back next year !
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good experience: the room was clean, confortable. Good position, near underground station. The staff was professional and very helpful; I received a good reception. Breakfast was modest in choice but of quality.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i found nice and efficient people at the reception. the hotel is located in a silent street. the room was clean and comfortable. a double door to the corridor protected from sounds arriving from the adjacent breakfast room.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is very good and everywhere is reachable from a walkable distance metro station 'Place d'italie'Staff is very kind and helpfulRooms are small but that's Paris standard, apart from that they are modern and well kept.Cleanliness: rooms and the overall hotel are always kept very clean.Breakfast: had a wide variety of pastries, boiled eggs, fresh baguettes, slice toast bread, juice, hot beverages machine, juice and water, milk, cereals, yoghurts.... overall it was very good.Overall the hotel is very good value for money!Also, I would like to thank Valeska the receptionist for her kind and helpful approach especially on the last day!
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff very kind and helpful. Small room but really cozy, quiet, clean, and equipped with everything you need. It could be useful a fridge bar that was missing. Good breakfast. Underground 5-minute walk away
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s a small little hotel but in a very central area (Place d’Italie), so good value for the price. Staff was nice and friendly. The reception is open 24/7 so I was able to roam around Paris freely at night. Some areas were a little small, like the lift and the breakfast area, but it’s well kept.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breakfast was very goodThe room was tidy, the heating was fast , and there was everything needed + there was the possibility to do by yourself tea/coffee directly in our private room (!)The two girls at the reception were very gentle and nice, NOT nice the old man though.(at the reception).
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a very nice surprise for me. The staff are very helpful and kind. The location couldn't be better. In our secoud night we had a few leaking problem in our bathroom and at the same time they changed us for a better room. If you choose this hotel I advice you to travel to orly airport. It's closer.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I went to Paris on July for a night. This hotel was perfect. Just 5 min walk to the metro station, Wifi,AC (believe it or not, not all the hotels in Paris offer AC), very modern look/feel and the receptionist was simply amazing!! 5 stars to Alicia, who was very helpful and friendly.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a few days while visiting Paris, before heading to Bordeaux. The hotel is well-situated on a quiet street near a metro that easily gets you everywhere you want to go for sight-seeing without being in a busy area of the city. The room size was exactly what we expected for Paris standards and was perfectly clean. Bed was very comfortable as well. The large opening windows were a nice treat. We didn't have the hotel's breakfast, though we did have the Room Service one morning which included pastries, bread, juice and coffee. Plenty for two. The staff at Jack's hotel are absolutely wonderful! We arrived early and they stored our luggage for us while we roamed around and until we could check in to our room. The ladies at the desk were always helpful and ready to assist. Merci, mesdames! We would absolutely recommend this hotel for being in a quiet area with easy access to everything you want to see. Also highly recommend the bakery around the corner (fantastic quiches!)
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very clean, that is an absolute plus, but the room was very small. The website stated that the rooms weer noise cancelling, but one night I could hear the neighbours having very much fun together loud and clearly. The beds were very hard, which resulted in back aches during the weekend. There is a 24-hour reception, but because of the small size of the hotel we had to wait 15 minutes for the receptionist to open the door for us, since there had to be someone present at the reception to open the door. The receptionist at our arrival was very kind and she spoke English very well, but when we wanted to book breakfast for the next day, there was another receptionist who didn't understand what we were saying, even though the website stated that the hotel employees spoke English. We sent the hotel our arrival time when we booked in August, yet we had to wait almost 2 hours before our room was ready. Overall, our stay was okay, but we wouldn't stay here again.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent for couples. Room was spotless. Staff couldnt do enough to make our stay enjoyable.champagne and flowers in our room was a nice idea and scored me extra brownie points ha. Highly recommend. And would stay again. Thanx to everyone at hotel.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is just 5 minutes walk from the metro, and if you plan to take a bus trip bus is just 3minutes walk. The room is okey, a bit small, but compare to other hotel in Paris this is much better, wifi connection is very fast, and i cant say anything about the AC, it was working fine and i haven't had any problem about it.housekeeping is good also, they cleaned my room very well. Receptionist is accommodating. and the only problem is they only have a small variety of breakfast, and its fine i sooo love the croissant (chocolate).
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 2 days, and it was very cute. Small room but it was okay. The service was Good. The breakfast was not so much but just right enough. The hotel was close to the subay. There is also a shopping centre nearby
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location 5 min walk to major metro stop. Cafes, bank, stores close by. Very small room but modern amenities. Nice continental breakfast with croissants rolls meet cheese feral fruit yogurt. Good free WiFi. Friendly helpful staff.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close to metro and mall/carrefour. Good breakfast with quality products. The room is small but the bed was very comfortable. The staff was very helpful especially the lady at the kitchen. Overall the hotel was clean and as expected.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My experience was all good since the beginning of placing my booking online all through the end until my check out. Best value for the rate paid. Recepción staff was outstanding, great attitude and eager to help on any request.Room was clean and nice decor,bedding and appliances. Location iş within center of Paris in a very tranquil and quite area which made it excellent to accomplish one of my goals during my stay which was having enough reşt. Definitely I will come back and refer it to friends and family when visiting the French capital.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Jacks Hotel is a very comfortable hotel for a quick stay near Paris Center. It is walking distance from the Metro that can take you anywhere you need. The hotel looks a bit old and the elevator is SMALL but the rooms are comfy and clean. The Receptionist Alicia is amazing, she speaks French, Spanish and English.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, helpfull and friendly personel. But our room and for sure our bathroom was TO small. Never i saw this before. breakfast room to was so small. Don't go there with little children. Everything was very clean though.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent one night last week in July. My room was very comfortable on 7th floor, equipped with air conditioning. The view was very nice. Close to Place d'Italie. Very nice breakfast and helpful reception. I walked to Gare to Lyon the morning after.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I arranged this trip to Paris for my girlfriends 25th. The hotel was absolutely amazing! Perfect welcome, cleanliness and service through out. The breakfast was excellent which helped for the sightseeing! Staff are all lovely! The room was great! I can’t say enough good things! I would highly recommend to anyone visiting Paris!!
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was quite short to give a review. However, what we liked about the hotel is that it was close to the subway station : Place d'Italie. We were able to move around easily in the city. The service was good and the staff were friendly and helpful by giving information on which things to visit around Paris. The room was small but it was clean and had the necessary tools to have a nice stay. We liked our stay there.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good welcome at our arrival. Check in was fast and easy.Room cleaned and pleasantLocation and quiet place to stay in Paris XIII near to Art et Metiers. Metropolitan get an easy access to Paris and the suburb
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel gives you a cosy feeling. It is located in a great area next to metro & bus stations, a shopping mall and lots of cafes and restaurants.HOWEVER, the room is EXTREMELY small. And when I say that I really mean it. On the sides of the bed and at the end of it there's a space of no more than 40 cm. And guess what? The bathroom is even smaller. If you're a bit taller there's not enough room for your feet when sitting on the toilet. I think it's a 1x1 m space.The elevator is a nightmare. Two people with their luggage can barely fit.The breakfast is almost a joke. If you want to eat after 9 AM you can barely find anything left. The kitchen staff doesn't refill the trays. We heard them yelling when we went to the reception to complain about this and the receptionist asked them for clarifications. Very rude. We paid for 4 breakfasts: in the first day we ate a croissant with a slice of ham and drank a coffee and a juice, the 2nd and 3rd day we got some extra cheese and some bread and on the 4th one we left very early and were not even offered a coffee or something. So don't pay for breakfast if you're not an early bird.Wouldn't pay them another visit.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was very good.The breakfast and the service was excellent.There are a couple Metro stations in direct Surroundings.Our room was very clean and comfortable.We had a lovley stay in Jack's Hotel.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel in a good location, well communicated, quiet and clean,very nice polite service that speaks English wellin the neighborhood there are many restaurants and pastry shopsI would highly recommend
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean room Value for money Very Good Breakfast Very polite and helpfully staff (We Love Alice!!) Near metro Smart TV Shutters are automatically shut off and you are sleeping without light!!Small rooms.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed a week in Jack's hotel. It is a very nice hotel and the staff is very friendly.We had a small room en because we wanted to stay a whole week, we asked for a bigger room. Valeska arranged it for us. It was not the first time we stayed in the hotel. As are were very satisfied with the service, we return to it every now and than.It's a nice neighborhood as well. The Rue Mouffetard is not that far away.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Services are precise and the cleaning of the room is daily. Small room and bath but all in all comfortable. Towels are changed daily. Quiet area and well connected position with the city. Staff is kindly and helpful. Good breakfast and services.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In all the major/capital cities in Europe & North America you are never going to get something for nothing when it comes to hotels. It is easy to be picky and compare prices with provincial towns. For Paris, this hotel is pretty good. I was pleased with the price I paid via one of the large internet hotel booking sites. The room was spotless and we did not experience much noise from the adjoining rooms unlike on other occasions at other hotels in this city. The bed was comfortable. I will concede that the room was small, however given the amount of time we spent in it, when asleep it could have been huge and I wouldn't have been aware. The en-suite bathroom area was tight, but again spotless and the shower was good. Breakfast was buffet style consisting of the usual pastries, ham, salami, boiled egg, toast etc, but the room was narrow and a tight squeeze getting past tables, but hey, if that is the only real negative... All the staff were friendly and helpful with Metro directions etc. The hotel is literally only 5 minutes walk from the Campo Formio Metro station on Line No 5 between the Gare d'Austerlitz and the Place d'Italie, 5 minutes to the south. Whilst there is no restaurant at this hotel, near the Place d'Italie is the old Butte aux Cailles street which has good value bars, bistros and restaurants. The hotel staff will point you in the right direction. Next time we are in Paris for a fix of rugby we will definitely look to staying here again.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First things first, the staff is very friendly and helpfull, but that is pretty much the only good side. Oh, and the place is on the green line - direct line to Bir-Hakim (Eiffel) and Trocadero POI, at just a few minutes walk to the station. The rooms are very small. And by that I mean there is no place for two skinny people to cross paths in front of the bed. Very clean, but really small room.The worst part was that cold air was coming from under the windows (we had to put pillows and T-shirts to stop it). We ask the front desk for a solution, but nothing was changed. Having our trip in february, it was quite an irritating situation.Next thing is the really loud elevator. In the middle of the night, lound metallic noises were coming from what I belive was the lift’s counterweight. If you are a light sleep type of person, you are in for quite a challenge. I will not go into details on the shower doors and other poorly installed items because I know this is not JW Marriot, and I am aware of the price I’ve paid. Still, the hotel is advertised as a 3* establishment and I find it to be far from that 8.1 satisfaction score (how did they get that high!). I am sorry, but all in all, make your reservations early and find something better.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very nice and cozy, with very kind employees and clean rooms. It is situated close to metro station and some restaurants. You have everything you need in your room but it's much smaller than it looks in the pictures, however it was a nice staying.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was excellent, clean ,near 2 metro station and bus station ,surrounded by many supermarkets ,bakery,shopping mall and restaurants .the stuff are very helpful and friendly.the breakfast is good also u can find a good variety Sure i will go back to this hotel
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would like to listen music in the back, while eating breakfast or waiting my friends in your lobby! Another tips would be about chatting with your employees because I had the feeling that I interacted with a kind of nice robots. Socializing means human connection.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent place,very comfortable, staff very helpful and kind. Room clean Very easy to move in different places by metro or by bus. Beautiful thinks to do and places to see near to the hotel.everything o.k.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in a quiet location with three subway stations nearby. A word of caution, i think those stations dont have elevators so if you have heavy luggage you are in trouble. (I think only major stations in Paris have elevators) A boulangerie, a grocery store and couple of restaurants are within walking distance.The room is a bit small but very clean and the staff are very courteous. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everithing was good. I only would like to suggest to improve breakfast ( being a 3 star hotel I would expect a better breakfast) and to keep attention to small things in the room that make differences (for example, we remeaing wihout toilet paper and room service didn't provide. But, let me say: good experience to repeat.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location - a neighborhood setting. Quiet And charming. Rooms are clean and quiet as well. I had a great view of the city and could watch the Eiffel Tower light shows from my room - with a slight obstacle - an unexpected surprise! Breakfast simple with delicious croissants and rolls. Coffee in room, as well as a safe. All nice touches for a very easy going short time in Paris. Metro Place d'Italie is a four minute walk where lines 5 and 6 meet. OrlyBus is also an easy connection 4 stops away. I had an 8am flight and had no problem making it when starting at 530am on the Metro. This is a wonderful choice for those looking for a solid 2/3 star hotel. I would stay here again in the future.CTThomas
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Moi, je suis American et j'avait rester dans l'hotel Jack trois fois. I first visited Jack's back in 1988 before Jack's remade itself into the excellent hotel it is today. But even then Jack's was a quiet hotel with very friendly staff and a place where a stranger to Paris could feel safe. Today Jack's remains a hotel with very helpful and friendly staff and a great value hotel in a great location near Place D'Italy. I should mention that the mall at Place D'Italy also underwent a tremendous remake into a four star shopping centre. The rooms at Jack's will not be huge by American Standards (no, I am not putting America First....) but they are very clean, proper and up to date including WiFi and Digital Television. With Paris at your feet, Jack's is an excellent choice those travelers who want to be faithful to a budget but feel safe, secure and convenient. Each day I went out into the Great City of Paris with the help and directions provided by the staff and felt my belongings were in good hands.Thank you Jack's for being my home in Paris. (Yea, I know it sounds kinda corny but if I were to tell you of some of the other hotels I have stayed in in Paris, you would appreciate the good notes I give them.Good Travels, Bon Voyage!Eddie
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is very small (if the suitcase are open near to the bed - it is all over the place of the room), the room is very very cold and very wet! We tried spending as little time there as possible. We havn't a toothpaste in the bathroom. It was the day of our wedding, but we havn't any gift or kind words from the staff, although he wrote about it beforehand.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very petit which makes it so cosy. The furniture is modern and very nice. The place is clean and the staff amazingly friendly and helpful. Public transport is super close and Bercy is close if you travel by flixbus. The hotel is in a side alley so it's nice and quiet at night. I would recommend this place for couples or if you are on a short trip with your best friend or mum
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location in a quiet area! The hotel is good if you want just a bed... I mean it's not a romantic place but it's nice located - 5 minutes walking distance to the metro (underground). The breakfast could be better... Despite having fresh pastry it doesn't have fresh fruit or scrambled eggs either! The stuff is very nice and they speak a few languages!
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have chided this hotel at last moment, and what I really like about it it's cozyness and calmness. Nice, comfort street facing the entrance. Room is not spacious but enough for 2. Another important thing is that it was warm. We were not expecting 18C in the evening time in August, especially after Italian hot season. But we been lucky with hotel- warm nice and neat. I'm coming back in November and I already know were I will stay.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Jack's Hotel in July and grateful for a working air conditioner, The rooms are not very big but our room was adequate for our week stay. Our room was clean and nicely decorated. It was at the front on the third floor. The electric window shutter blocked out both the light and any extraneous noise during the eveining. Great location - close to two metro stations (lines 6 & 7) for easy access to sights. The staff were friendly and helpful with someone on duty at reception all the time. We ate at the Verdi Restaurant twice but there are other restaurants close by also. There are two supermarkets - Leader Price and Carrefour, and a pharmacy within walking distance.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back from lovely time in Paris with friends celebrating a 70th Birthday. Jacks hotel was great. Brilliant location,excellent service,very clean rooms and good buffet breakfast what more could one ask.
hotelName:
28    Jack's Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a really good one night stay here. It's only a few minutes walk from Arc de Triomphe and around the corner from a host of wonderful local restaurants, bars and a fabulous boulangerie. The room was a good size, well equipped with a large shower room which cleverly designed with two doors between the bedroom and shower room (great for sharers!)
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A well-presented small hotel, close to Charles de Gaulle-Etoile and the Avenue des Champs-Élysées.. Basic facilities, clean and with pleasant, helpful staff. Decent value in an excellent neighbourhood.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice and clean hotell with very serviceminded personal. The location is in a nice area with some restaurants and local shops as bakerys, butcher, cheese shop and so in. Not very touristic, more residential area.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pleasant hotel with a friendly staff and a good location near Charles de Gaulle Etoile station. Quiet place, good value for money. The breakfast is not bountiful but is reasonable. There is spa area and a small pool but did not get a chance to use.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is OK depending on its price. I had to pay almost €150 per night which is not worth the stay. Rooms are decent and clean, but very cramped. Also the chairs in the breakfast room feel like they were made for midgets. The elevator can only fit 1 person with a bag. On the good side: whole hotel is very clean and personnel is really friendly!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed. Since you enter the reception they cannot be bothered to recommend you any restaurant or even to show you on the map. This suppose to be 4*, but should be 2*. An awful bathroom, dirty floor, horrible service. Just worst hotel I ever visited. Do not waste your money.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it was very great stay, team is very friendly , the room is clean and comfortable, the location is very good , complete breakfast ,nice swimming pool , specaial thanks for the team , in the future i would like to repeat this experience.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was booked as a surprise by my fiance. We were upgraded to a superior double rooms which had a balcony. Nothing like having your morning coffee on the balcony in central Paris. It's 10min walk to Arc de Thriomph. The only problem we had was shower leaking quite badly onto the floor.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went to this hotel end of July for 3 nights booked through Eurostar as a 4 star hotel. Eurostar need to actually check the hotel plunge pool not a available until last day. The room was very small which you would expect in Paris for 2 or 3 star. But the worst bit was the gap between the shower and wall to get to the toilet was 7inches, had to turn sideways , absolutely ridiculous. Breakfast was not good. We changed rooms from standard to superior which we found was worst than the standard. We have been to many hotels around the world but this place was rubbish. Feel for the staff who work here. How they get good reviews beats me.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rated as 4 stars but is worst than what I expected. No water provided, mini bar was empty. During this hot summer, air conditioning wasn’t working properly, sweat the whole night.The room next to the lift was not a good room. You can hear the noise of the lift and people talking load.The only advantage is there is a sauna and mini pool at -0 floor.I would not recommend this hotel if you want a good night sleep.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights while on our recent trip to Paris. Our room was located on the 1st floor so we did not need to take the elevator (which was fine with us as we love to climb stairs). The room was comfortable, with a king sized bed and mini bar fridge. Lots of closet space as well as good-sized bathroom (with shower and tub). The staff were always courteous and knowledgable and went out of their way to answer any question we had about the city of Paris, as well as about the hotel itself. The hotel does offer a reasonable breakfast option, but we chose not to go that route as there are many places to eat in the vicinity of the hotel. It is Paris afterall, and there are cafe's on every street corner! :-) The only thing that caught us off guard when looking over the final bill was the city tax (or tourism tax), which is an additional 10% on top of the hotel price (this was not made clear when initially booking the hotel)...but I suppose that is to be expected when travelling to a city such as Paris.....Overall, a very good hotel, so highly recommend staying here when coming to Paris.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This short break was a surprise, I had no idea what was going on or what to expect. Me and partner had planning a Paris get away but I had no idea he had booked everything and we were doing with a few days. The hotel is small, but just what we needed. The staff were polite and very helpful. We had a late Eurostar back to St Pancras and the staff were kind enough to look after our luggage whilst we were to explore more or Paris.The hotel is used more by business people so it pretty quiet and not many people around which was a bonus for us as we had the swimming pool and sauna to ourselves. We didn’t have breakfast but I read there was a nice Patisserie down the road but I could not find this, but when in a city like Paris food isn’t a problem, you’re only a short distance from somewhere to eat.The hotel is 10 minute walk from Arc de Triomphe. Which was lovely... and a short distance for everything else. My partner absolutely loved the little iPhone pod speakers, you just plug your iPhone in an have music whatever you want to listen to on.Lovely hotel and lovely city! Definitely will be staying here again
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights, location was perfect for sightseeing. We had a room on the 6th floor which was extremely quiet. The room and bathroom was pretty small but that is to be expected in such a central location. Linen, toileteries etc were good quality. Breakfast was perfect, the cook was very attentive and took pride in setting out the food etc. This stood out after our two previous hotels in Barcelona and Porto. Staff were friendly.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Actually the best thing about the hotel is the location , many Restaurants and cafe are near it Very close to arc de tromphe Rooms we clean Lift was very smallThe breakfast area was very small also the variety of the breakfast was not much Staff were good
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband was running in the Paris marathon, I decided on this hotel as it has a small pool and thought that he might benefit from it after his long run (which he did). On arrival at the hotel our room wasn't quite ready as we'd left the UK very early, the receptionist was very apologetic, we were offered refreshments and use of facilities and perfectly happy to wait. The room was perfect, the chamber person (whose name we didn't get) showed us the room and he gave info on how to use the heating etc. He got my husband and extra duvet as requested. The staff at reception were lovely, giving us advice on directions as needed. Maddy the night clerk was extremely helpful and went out of his way to find restaurants and bars within walking distance for us. He was very cheery and friendly. We were leaving on the last Eurostar of the day, our luggage was kept safe, so we were free to sight see for the rest of the day. I love Paris and wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel again. A big thank you to everyone for making us feel so welcome.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I liked the hotel, their staff especially the lady at the reception is really nice and helpful. The hotel was pretty clean but our room was super super small (located in the left hand side of the elevator at 7th floor). Everything is in walking distance. Overall I do recommend this hotel and would be back for sure.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent one night at the Westside Arc de Triomphe before attending an education fair close by the following day.I booked this hotel because it was in short walking distance to the exhibition hall, but I was a little concerned by some of the negative comments I saw on here. My experience though was nothing but positive. I received such a warm welcome on arrival. My French is terrible, but I will always try to speak it. However, the friendly receptionist switched to English with no problem and was friendly throughout the check-in process. I was then shown to my room by a young man originally from Bangladesh. During the short ride in the lift to the 7th floor, we managed to discuss various locations in the south of England as well as our favourite dishes at Bengali restaurants in the UK. It is a small hotel in a small Parisian street and so of course the rooms will not be too big, but mine was clean, comfortable and had all the amenities I needed. At breakfast the next morning I was greeted like an old friend and I found the food plentiful and delicious. Check-out was again easy and with a friendly smile. I would not hesitate to stay here again and would recommend it to anybody wanting a more cosy environment than the bigger hotels offer.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bad luck that day- Room close to elevator, noise in the street in the morning. Wifi preformed in the toilets. Someone reported as smoking stuff in the lobby/desk.Reception number not indicated on phone then insecure. That number is a liability for "no assistance to endangered person". Get it right; the stubborn Frenchies need to have a number indicated close to or on the phone for emergency!!! Not in the papers or behind the door; you dead before you find the number or your unloaded/no battery phone.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe. Breakfast is the only meal served although you can have room service (we did not use this option). Breakfast costs 15 Euros and is buffet style including an English breakfast and also a Continental breakfast. Our room had a balcony and had a king sized bed. The room was well appointed and was very modern. The room had a safe, hair dryer, an ironing board, coffee maker, flat screen TV, and toiletries were provided. Wi-Fi worked well in the room. The hotel has a small swimming pool and a sauna ( no extra charge). We had a nice swim and a sauna on are own - towels are provided.There are lots of restaurants just outside the door of the hotel and there is a Metro station at the Arc de Triomphe that will take you to all the attractions.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Westside Arc de Triompheis in a great location close to the Arc de Triomphe is walking distance to the Eiffel Tower with plenty eating and dining options close by. The metro station is close by so if your confident there is no need to catch a cab. Rooms are good size and are quite. Enjoyable stay would stay again.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are ok. Don't expect much. Starred hotels facilities are not available. Pool is like bath tub. Sauna is only for 2 persons. Centrally located so better option. Breakfast is expensive. Nearby is good Thai and Indian restaurants and Domino's.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything is very small but the hotel, staff, location and quality is the best. Especially breakfast was the best we have had. Room with a great terrace and view. Charming and well managed. We will be back
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have spent 5 days in this hotel. The stuff is lovely and the atmosphere is good. The area is nice.But, the room is very small. It contains all the accesories (coffe,towels, slippers,safe) all what you need and not need.But it is small room, and the feeling is like a equiped dunegeon.For this price you can find something better.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of April for a long weekend seeing the sights of Paris with my parents. This hotel is in a good location, close to restaurants and the metro station. The rooms were small (as people have said) but we hardly spent any time in them as we were out and about every day! Bed was comfortable and room kept nice and clean. I really enjoyed the macaroons on arrival! :-) The Reception staff were really friendly and always on hand if you needed any advice on how to get to places. We only ate breakfast in the hotel once as this was not included in the price, it was a good breakfast with enough choice. We got breakfast one day from the local patisserie down the road, the pastries were delicious! All in all a good hotel at a reasonable price that I would recommend to friends and family.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PROSThe location of the hotel was the only bright spot in our stay. The lady manning the reception during the mornings was very professional and very friendly. Also the second lady we met during our stay whose name eludes me was quite friendly too. CONSWe checked in to Westside on the 6th evening. The lady who checked us in was professional and courteous. The lady in the morning every day was also very professional and courteous. But there was a gentleman we dealt with in the evening every time who was eternally grumpy and seemed to react like we were an interruption to what he was doing. The Hotel rooms were very small for a 4 star hotel and not what we expected. The breakfast was one table with bread and croissants and few other knick knacks. You would definitely expect more from a 4 Star hotel. On our second day we ordered room service and I ordered Lentil Soup, Lebanese Platter and French Fries. We waited for more than 90 minutes and after multiple follow ups, I got Lentil Soup, a plate of cheese and no French fries. I did not have dinner that night. Apparently this hotel does not have " Room Service" in house. They just order from a nearby restaurant and so there is a lot lost in translation. My Sister's family who were staying with us could not get water delivered either. Overall it was a very disappointing stay especially after travelling through Italy, Switzerland and getting some amazing service from similar sized and similar category hotels. As mentioned, the plus points were the location and the friendly lady receptionists who were professional and courteous. The remaining staff were quite unfriendly and we felt quite unwelcome (including the ladies at the breakfast who were very curt). I provide this feedback as a constructive feedback so the hotel can view the service from the perspective of the recipient of such services and look at ways to enhance the same.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had to pay the breakfast charge that was about 40Euro before checking out. However, the lady from the reception desk wanted to charge me 300Euro and she gave me an attitude that she thought I didn't speak English before I was even going to ask her any question. I was confused and told her that I had paid everything through Hotel.com and I asked her what 300Euro was coming from. She told me it was "government tax" and did not bother explaining anything further. She went on and had my credit card wiped and made me sign the bill. This is my first time to France and I had a flight to catch so I did not want to start a fight with her that might ruin my day and I did really act like a gentleman. Fortunately, at the end, she somehow realized she made a mistake by herself and returned my money. However, this is a very unpleasant experience.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited from 23/01/2017 to 26/01/2017. Had an enjoyable stay. Didn't spend much time in the hotel itself as there is so much to explore in Paris. The room was made up everyday with fresh towels etc. Fulfilled all requirements and expectations but nothing was out of the ordinary, which can be expected on a budget. The pool and sauna facilities are nice after a long day on your feet. The location is ideal for tourists. Would recommend to travellers on a budget.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in room 206, small but with everything you needed.Metro station 10 minute walk away. Arc de triomphe, about 15 minutes, breakfast was plentiful but charged at 14 euros pp.Lots of nice shops within a short walk from hotel
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For the price we paid we can't fault it. Comfortable bed and a room with everything you needed. The toilet was in an awkward position to use so I kept banging my kneese. Nice breakfast, friendly staff and tried to use the pool but it was freezing cold.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was wonderful! The staff was friendly, helpful and truly made us feel welcome.Great location, very comfortable and clean rooms. This was an adult family trip and a delightful experience introducing Paris to my mother.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For the third year we visited Paris for the "Journées du Patrimoine". and live in the same hotel Hotel Westside Arc De Triomphe, where we are very satisfied. The hotel is easily accessible from the airport and metro practically in the center of Paris. The hotel is clean, the staff very friendly. Hotel breakfasts are always fresh and tasty. This year I lived in room overlooking the main quiet street. Room was large enough and comfortable. For the first time, we also used the swimming pool and sauna, which thanks to bad weather, was very pleasant.If we go back to Paris next year we will certainly choose this hotel.Tomas Sosna, MD, PhD
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here last week 30thAugust - 1st September for 2 nights and found it to be a very nice hotel. As people have already mentioned the lift was very small, it says it takes 4 people we had a job with 2 of us and hubby had to bring the case up separately. The room was clean but could have done with decorating, the corner of the ceiling had had a leak from above, I would think, because it was brown and flaking. The view was terrible, right outside our window was an iron spiral fire escape and we looked onto the rooms opposite, but the room was clean and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom was good with everything you would need including a hairdryer, and the bath had a shower over it,which my husband had to struggle to help me into to have my shower. Breakfast was continental or if you preferred there was scrambled eggs bacon and sausage. The young lady on breakfast duty was very polite and made sure there was hot food all the time. The front of house staff were very friendly and welcoming. There are plenty of eateries within walking distance, and the Arc De Triomphe and the Champs-Elysee were within walking distance if you feel so inclined, but because I am disabled i am not able to walk very far so we took a bus ride, and people were so kind, as soon as they saw my sticks they were offering me their seats. We got to the Arc De Triomphe only to find that the lift was not working, they said 4pm so we went and had lunch in a little pub just across from the 'Arc' called the 'Beer Station' which is on Bis Avenue and opposite 'The Lateral' and had the best French onion soup I have ever tasted. We went back to the 'Arc' and the lift was still not working so I told hubby one of us had to go to the top so he had to go. OMG I didn't realise there were so many steps poor man, there were over 300 of them!! but he did it and brought me a lovely present from the top. Buses to and from the 'Arc' are very frequent every 5 minutes. One thing I want to warn people about is the parking, there is none at the hotel and if you arrive at night it's not the easiest place to find, so look out for two small potted conifer trees these are each side of the doorway. The parking is in the multistory car park about 5-10 minutes walk from the car park back to the hotel but there are plenty of eateries on the walk back. The price was approx 32.50 Euros a night which seems quite steep to me. All in all a very nice hotel.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great place slightly away from the tourist traps, a small, little hotel-yes! But crammed with so much.Directly opposite a velib station, Los of banks, pharmacies, shops and cute little eateries within walking distance.A lift, although small to get you to your room, pool, sauna, all mod cons-WiFi, Bluetooth speaker, great range of free toiletries, tea, coffees, in terms of what you get for your money- you can't go wrong.Rooms were clean and tidy, and the quality of sleep was fantastic, even if there was a little road noise.Walking distance to the arc de triomphe, some great little bars etc nearby, a small little hotel.Staff are friendly and accommodating, and nothing seems to much hassle for them.I would definitely recommend it for a place to stay on a budget away from the usual tourist traps.Ask for a high floor with a balcony
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my girlfriend for 3 nights last week. Hotel is very central, about 10 minute walk to Arc. Surrounded by lovely cafe, bars and restaurants. It took 10 minutes to walk from the bus station for the the Beauvais airport shuttle. The metro 10 mins from the hotel is a direct route to Disneyland. Staff were very friendly. The pool and sauna is great for relaxing after walking and exploring the city, it stays open until 10pm. Honestly the bed was unreal, very comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting. Great value for money!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second visit to Paris and upon arrival at our hotel I was pleased to find it was sort of out of the tourist centre. This seems odd because it is very centrally located to the Arc de Triomphe (an easy, though up hill walk) and this is right on the tourist heart but in the streets surrounding the hotel you really only see locals, lots of business people who reside there. Especially of an evening there are suits in all the surrounding restaurants and cafes. This gave a much welcome respite from the crazy tourist areas. We really enjoyed arriving back here each evening and having the flexibility to head for the tourist buses if we wanted. The only downside to this is that due to the proximity of all the professionals each morning, early, you could hear plumbing and elevators start going while (being on holiday) we tried to sleep in. My partner slept through but I'd be awake from about 6am-7am before the rush subsided and I fell back asleep for a bit longer. But this is to be expected from old buildings I guess.The hotel itself is very quaint and of a nice size. The staff were always very pleasant and very helpful and were fluent in English which helped us a lot as our French is pretty poor.We had a private balcony looking over the street and we loved this, it seems private balcony's might be rare in this hotel so if we were to go back we'd probably pay the extra to ensure we had one (I may be wrong here, this is just what it seemed).We liked this hotel, especially its location and we'd stay here again
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Westside for three nights . A warm welcome in the pouring rain .Umbrella's are provided by the hotel. About a 10 minute walk to the Arc du Triomphe. Lots of eating places near buy. A quiet area at night away from the hustle and bustle of the Champs Elysees. The room was adequate with a balcony but one thing that cant be faulted was the hot water. The best Hotel I have stayed in for getting hot water in Europe.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a weekend. We arrived at night. The nights we were there, a guy called Maddy was working at the reception. He is really friendly!
