Not only the check-in was quick and easy, he also provided helpfull tips what we can see and do (and eat) in Paris and the neighbourhood of the hotel.The room was ok. Clean. Not that big. The bathroom was a bit small. Also, the tv is on the left of the bed, so it is not that comfortable to watch tv.The breakfast was included. The quality was pretty good. The options you had was a little limited, but we enjoyed it.The location is pretty good. You can walk to a metro in 5 minutes. Arc de Triophe and Avenue des Champs-Elysees is at about 10 minutes walking distance.The price was ok too.Overall I would say that the hotel is at least above average. Average would be a bit too low, so that is why I rated it very good.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stopped at the Westside for three nights over Easter. We were met with a warm welcome which lasted throughout our stay. The room was not the largest but was more than adequate. We would recommend the breakfast as there was a great choice to suit all. We used Google Earth to plan a route from the hotel up to the Arc de Triomph, this took about 20 minutes to walk at the most and was worth the preparation. We did have some rain showers and the hotel provides courtesy umbrellas, so thankyou for a lovely visit.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are unfamiliar with the economics of travel to Paris, i can sum it up in one word: expensive.We were very fortunate to find Hotel Westside as our home base for two nights in Paris as part of a longer vacation that continued to Barcelona.Communication with the hotel in advance of our stay was easy and prompt.Logisitics to finding the hotel were simple, especially coming from CDG in the early am. Simple take the RER B from CDG to Chatelet Les Halles metro station and transfer to the M1, getting off at Etoile Charles De Gaulles metro station(which is also the Arc de Triomphe. From there it was maybe an easy 15 minute stroll ... and you get to see the Arc de Triomphe every time you need to get on the metro.We arrived many hours ahead of checkin, and staff were friendly and welcoming and very accomodating to my limited French. In fact their English was great. They stored our bags for us, and we took off for a day of sightseeing.Rooms are compact, but conveniently appointed, as you will find with most boutique hotels in Europe.Staff provided many suggestions for activities, dining etc.Around the corner from the hotel there is an excellent boulangerie that is incredibly inexpensive with amazing pain au chocolat, pain au lait, macarons, etc.Lots of diining options near the hotel.Would definitley stay again and would definitely recommend this hotel to others looking for a comfortable base near the Champs Elysee.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed here for one night sunday 6th march as we'd been at disneyland prior. We did have a bit of difficulty finding it becaue of my own stupidity (there are 3 hotels with similar names so make sure you know its westside) anyway once we got there there was another couple there but the man behind reception and the consierge greeted us straight away. The man behind the desk (we later found out his name is tibo) was extremely pleasant and very informative! made sure we knew all details of the room, breakfast and spa facilities. We also got upgraded (no idea why) to the top floor with a tower view and lovely balcony, i think they upgraded us by around £200 as we only payed for a £64 room. Everything was lovely in the room, you get slippers, dressing gowns, posh toiletries and tea/bar stuff in your room. overall everything was amazing!! staff/ hotel/ view, wish we could stop longer but i know that when we do come back to paris we will definately be stopping in hotel westside arc de triumph!!!!!!!!!!!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I entered the room I was kind of surprised by the small room. In the bathroom there is really little space. If you are a tall person, you cannot sit on the toilet because your knees will hit the wall.Clean and well maintained, but I prefer something more spacious.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second stay at this hotel in the 17th. The hotel is located near Terne and only a 10 minutes walk away from Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. As Charl De Gaul metro station is located just near Arc de Triomphe it is a good starting point for a city trip.I have room 503 currently which is for Paris standard quite big, modern, with a good and clean bathroom. The reception is friendly and informs you well about the hotel facilities. There is a small swimming pool as well as a sauna area. Quite unique I would say, seen where the hotel is located. The fees of the hotel vary from day to day. So you could easily pay more the one day than the other. My night rate is 91 EUR excluding breakfast. Seen location, facilities and overall state of the hotel a good deal.It will not be my last stay at this hotel, for sure.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It has Arc de Triomphe in its name but it is actually several blocks away. The best way to get out is via bus which is just behind the hotel. The Metro is a long walk. In any case it is in a good neighborhood with nice restaurants and convenience stores.The lobby looked okay but the overall ambiance (carpets, doors, corridors) was quite old for a four star hotel. The elevator is also small and scary because some of the buttons do not light up. We appreciated the macarons as welcome treat!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Personal and friendly welcome, free coffee available in the lounge on arrival.Some nice restaurants very near by ( < 300 m).Terrnes Metro was ideal for visiting most of the key sites in Paris.Gala Hotels Website - 7 characters to go to make it > 200 characters ...should be happy with less if the information is constructive and positive !!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly hotel. Funny, tiny elevator and great views from the balcony. Very good location close to arc de triomphe and lots of restaurants/cafes in the area. Would recommend :-) comfy beds! We stayed for a few nights for touristy purposes and the hotel was very convenient for this.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms in this hotel need a bit of love and attention. They are quite basic and I didn't find the bed too comfy. Also, there are no irons in the room and these have to be brought separately from reception. The best part about the hotel was the staff on the reception desk - they were very friendly and gave us a great recommendation of a French restaurant for dinner.There's no bar as such in the hotel but there is a drinks menu and the receptionist will happily take an order and disappear to find the drinks and reappear with drinks and some peanuts.Location great - 15 mins walk max to the Arc de Triomphe.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited as was attending a conference about 1km away. There was no hot water so after 2 nights was very please to get home for a hot bath!I called reception and I was told to run the water for a long time, after 30 minutes there was still no hot water :-(On the second day I was allowed to use the shower in the pool area. Not great at 7am when you need to go from the 6th floor to -1.Breakfast is not worth €17, there are plenty of other options in the local area to get a coffee and pastry.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good size room in this price range - and best of all with a bath with fantastically hot water! Staff were wonderfully friendly and lovely breakfast. Lovely pool which we lay by the day we had to leave - although we couldn't check out late as the hotel was full, we got to use all of the facilities until our taxi arrived at 6. Also a wonderful family run restaurant just 50m up the road...
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For the second time we stay this hotel. The hotel is easily accessible from both Paris airports, and is located practically in the heart of Paris, and at the same in a quiet street. Nearby is a very lively market. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but very clean and efficiently furnished. Breakfast are is rich, almost American-style, but we missed vegetables. The hotel pool is small pleasant and clean. The only problem is small and still overloaded elevator.The hotel can highly recommend it and next year we would like to come back again.Associate Professor, MD. Tomas Sosna PhD.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location in the lovely, bustling 17th. Lots of real French people going about their days looking effortlessly cool with their fresh baked bread and elegant shoes. Hotel staff are lovely and didn't laugh at my French. Good breakfast and even better coffee. Trendy bathroom and lovely robes. Knocked a star off for the weird convex mirror in our room which was no good to man nor beast. Would recommend if you like to escape the hordes of tourists but still be near to good transport.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely hotel close to Arc de Triomphe and at the quieter end of town. It is a little bit of a walk down the a Av des Champs Élysées to all the sights but this is not too bad. The other option is to catch a train on the under ground Metro. This is relatively easy and there is a station close to the hotel. Our room was good with a small balcony. WiFi was good and reliable. Breakfast was alright with a reasonable range of choices. Reasonably priced good restaurants close by. Enjoyed our stay at the hotel.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its location in a quiet street in one of the best areas of Paris gives this hotel a cozy atmosphere. The decor is simple and classy. Staff were friendly. I did not use the swimming pool and sauna, but it was nice to know it was available and for free. I liked that I could walk to many of the lovely restaurants in the area.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel in great location close to buses , metro lines , some fantastic restaurants,mini mart and laundry.Stayed there for a week and it was excellent.Great staff especially night staff member Madey whose service standard is way above expectation.Rooms were a bit small but we were only there to sleep.Would be good if they could organise for a little close line in the bathroom.Apart from the couple of points previously mentioned I do rate this hotel.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The space- Very small rooms as expected in Paris. Paper thin walls! Expect to hear the TV, blow dryer and conversations of adjacent rooms.The service- make sure to get your room keys if you check in early. We had reserved and confirmed to rooms on the same floor as we are travelling with our teen girls. Arrived at 11:30 and confirmed. Upon returning to the hotel at 3 to collect our keys the room numbers had been changed to different floors and different rooms ( no street view as earlier committed.) When asked why, we were told we could try a different hotel.Terrible service and attitude. Air BnB in Paris is the only way!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Westside Arc de Triomphe
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
